(1) Но люди не могут существовать без пр: (1) But people cannot exist without nature, so there were reinforced concrete benches in the park — wooden ones were instantly broken. (2) Children ran around in the park, there were punks who were entertained by playing cards, drinking, fighting, "sometimes to the death". (3) "They've got girls here too..." (4) Artemka-soap, with a foaming white head, was the leader of the punks. (5) No matter how much Lyudochka tried to tame the rags on Artemka's wild head, she could not do anything. (6) His "curls, which from a distance resembled soap suds, turned out to be like sticky cones from the station dining room — they were boiled, thrown in a lump into an empty plate, so they stuck together, and lay unbearably heavy. (7) And not for the sake of a hairstyle the guy came to Lyudochka. (8) As soon as her hands became occupied with scissors and a comb, Artemka began to grab her in different places. (9) Lyudochka at first dodged Artemka's grasping hands, and when it didn't help, she hit him on the head with a typewriter and punched him until he bled, so she had to pour iodine on the head of the "pushy man". (10) Artemka hooted and whistled for air. (11)since then," he stopped his hooligan harassment, " moreover, the punks ordered lyudochka not to touch.
(1)Образы природы сопровождают людей с с: (1) images of nature have accompanied people since ancient times. (2)the ancient people left us hunting scenes as a legacy on the walls of caves, on the stones in the form of stingy scratches depicting moose, wild boars, tours. (3)the current technique makes it possible to see animals and birds in natural colors and settings. (4)we see episodes of their lives, and a warm feeling appears in the soul. (5)They are somewhere, these animals, they still run, growl, hide or show, like us, people, curiosity... (6) Wanting to experience this warm feeling, on the city floors we keep cats, dogs, parrots, squirrels, fish in the aquarium. (7)doctors say that stroking a cat or feeding a chickadee from the palm of your hand is healing for the human psyche. (8) A hare encountered in the park corrected my mood. (9)And how many cases where a person with a life share only a thread of communication with the dog, common sparrows or crows! (10)Former employee of our amended from time to time on the phone tells me about the life of a crow in the yard that they like to eat, as unmistakably recognize it in the mass of people. (11) and the old lady in our yard carries crumbs to the sparrows every morning. (12) and i see the joy on the woman's face as she watches the fussy birds pick up the scattered food. (13)Sometimes it seems to me: the sparrows will not fly to her exit from the entrance, and the old woman will die from the break of the last thread connecting her with life. (14)Once we talked to her, and she admitted that she had never seen cranes fly and cry in her life. (15)I told her how the cranes danced in pairs in the spring, and shouted so that their voices merged into one triumphant sound of love. (16)The old woman listened attentively and, saying goodbye, said three words: "How happy you are... "(17)The sage of Yasnaya Polyana was saying the same thing in the diaries: "Happiness is to be with nature, to see her, speak with her." (By V. M. Peskov)
(1) Стояло жаркое лето, столько работы в: (1) It was a hot summer, so much work around! (2) The squirrel worked from morning to night, tirelessly. (3) She didn't even have time to eat, and all she did was drag the cones into her hollow. (4) But there was not much room left in the hollow, because the whole hollow was littered with supplies from previous years. (7) The squirrel went to the woodpecker and began to ask him to expand her hollow. (8) - Well, please, dear woodpecker, hollow out a bigger hole for me, because I have a small one, nothing fits in it! (9) The woodpecker was kind, so he agreed. (10) He climbed up to the squirrel in the hollow, looks, and the hollow is huge! (11) And food in it is visible-invisible. (12) Enough to feed the whole forest for several years to come! (13) A woodpecker hollowed out a hollow for a squirrel and said: - Why do you drive away hungry animals from yourself? (14) You have enough food for everyone! (15) You would not be greedy, squirrel, look, everything will turn out for you! (16)-And you fly out of here, a persistent bird! (17) It's not your business! (18) - the squirrel screamed.

\"(1) Председатель Следственного комитет: "(1) Chairman of the Investigative Committee under the Prosecutor's Office of the Russian Federation Alexander Bastrykin ordered to open a criminal case against policemen who did not ensure the safety of participants and visitors of the rock festival" Tornado " in Miass. (1) На следующее утро белочка проснулась: (1) the next morning, the squirrel woke up to some quiet squeaking. (2) Below, under a tree, she saw a small mouse scurrying about and piling some twigs by the tree. (3) The squirrel came down to him and asked him what he was doing. (4) - How is it, what do I do? - the mouse was surprised, - i'm helping you! (5) Your new hollow will need to be insulated, because winter is coming soon! (6) Here I am carrying twigs! (7) Then the squirrel remembered that last winter this mouse came to her to ask for seeds, and she drove him away. (8) - why do you help me, because i did not help you in a difficult moment? (9) - Yes, because I help because I know how hard it is when trouble has come, and there is no one to help, - said the mouse. (10) Then a woodpecker flew in, smiled at the squirrel, and said, " God be with you, we have talked here with the beasts of the forest, we are no longer angry with you. (11) But you also remember this lesson, " he said, and hollowed out a small but cozy hollow for the squirrel.
(1) Песнь вторая начинается с гимна цвет: (1) the second canto begins with a hymn to the blooming beauty of belinda, whose brilliance surpasses even the radiance of a flaring summer day. (2) The beauty goes for a walk along the Thames, riveting the eyes of all comers. (3) Everything about her is perfect, but the crown of beauty is the two dark curls that adorn the marble of her neck. (4) An admirer of Belinda Baron was eager to take away these luxurious strands — as a love trophy. (5) that morning at dawn he burned the gloves and garters of his former lovers, and at this sacrificial fire he asked heaven for only one treasure — belinda's curl. (6) The faithful Ariel, sensing danger, gathered all the good spirits under his command and appealed to them to protect and protect the beauty. (7) He reminds the sylphs, sylphids, elves and fairies how important and responsible their work is and how many dangers are hidden every moment. (8) "Whether innocence is touched by shame, whether porcelain is cracked, honor is damaged or brocade, suddenly the nymph loses a bracelet or a heart at a ball..." (9) Ariel entrusts each spirit with the care of one item of Belinda's toilet — earrings, fan, watch, curls. (10) He himself undertakes to keep an eye on the beautiful dog named Shock. (11) Fifty sylphs are attached to the skirt — this "silver border" of purity — at once. (12) At the end of Ariel's speech, she threatens that the spirit, caught in neglect, will be imprisoned in a bottle and pierced with pins. (13) The Air invisible retinue faithfully closes around Belinda and waits in fear for the vicissitudes of fate.

\"(1) На земле было неуютно и страшно, т: "(1) On the ground it was uncomfortable and scary, there was a cold fog that enveloped the icy embrace and threatened to freeze to death. (4) She sat for a long time, unable to calm her pounding heart. (5) After a while, the Panda got hungry, and the tree had very tasty leaves. (15) When the bear climbed into the branches, enough, satisfied, and satisfying humming, dozing off at the top of the fork, the tree gently stroked it with his branch, carefully covered from the bright sun and wind. (16) It is also happy."

\"(1) Активиста азербайджанской оппозици: "(1) Jabbar Savalan, an activist of the Azerbaijani opposition Popular Front party (PFP), was sentenced to 2.5 years in prison, the website reports Contact.az. (2) The Sumgait City Court found him guilty of illegal drug possession under article 234.1 of the Criminal Code of Azerbaijan. (3) in his last speech, the opposition leader said that he chose freedom, not bread. (4 )" Now many people in Azerbaijan are faced with a choice: freedom or bread. (5) Those who choose bread soon lose their freedom. (6) I chose freedom, despite being thrown into prison. (7) It will not break my will," Savalan said. (8) Savalan's supporters began shouting "Shame on the court" and "Freedom for Savalan"after the verdict was announced. (9) The police detained opposition figures, including the leader of the PNF, Abulfaz Gurbanli, and also seized a camera from a Radio Liberty correspondent. (10) Savalan was arrested on February 5 in Sumgait, and 0.17 grams of opium were seized from him. (11) The prosecutor requested that Savalan be sentenced to 3 years. (12) According to Savalan's lawyer, Anar Gasimov, the court's decision was "another example of arbitrariness and the absence of an independent court in Azerbaijan." (13) According to him, the verdict actually repeated the text of the indictment. (14) The detained leader of the youth branch of the PNF Gurbanli stated that Savalan was detained for active participation in the march of oppositionists on January 20 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of the entry of Soviet Army units into Baku in order to suppress the national democratic movement."
\"(1) Лидер сборной России по хоккею Але: "(1) The leader of the Russian national ice hockey team, Alexander Radulov, will not be able to participate in the 2010 World Championship due to an injury. (1) Прошло два года. (2) Умер отец Христ: (1) Two years have passed. (2) Christian's father died, and Lizaveta's parents also went to the grave. (3) A young widow remarried, unable to manage a huge household alone and unsuccessfully resist the inevitable ruin. (4)Despite her hard work, only a few sheep and one cow remained of her former possessions. (5) One day, when Lizaveta was sitting at work in the meadow, she saw a strange figure approaching from a distance; it was a man in a completely torn dress. (6) He was carrying something heavy over his shoulders in a tightly tied bag. (7)Coming closer, the eccentric ragamuffin greeted the discouraged woman and introduced himself to her as a long-disappeared Christian who had found untold riches. (8) In confirmation of his words, he untied and shook out a bag filled with ordinary stones, grabbed two flints, struck each other, striking sparks and fervently asserting the fire hidden in their hearts. (9) Lizaveta did not know what to do, out of fright and pity. (10) But the madman turned away, went to the forest, where the terrible forest woman was waiting for him, and disappeared from sight. (11) Since then, the unfortunate man has not been seen again.
\"(1) Razer запустит в производство игро: "(1) razer will launch a gaming tablet, codenamed project fiona, " writes anandtech, citing razer ceo min-liang tan. (2) A special feature of the tablet is two "handles" on the sides with keys for controlling games. (3) The tablet was announced in January 2012 at CES. (4) Then Razer promised that the device will go on sale in the second half of 2012. (5) Almost nothing was known about the fate of Fiona until October 3 — on this day, Ming-Liang Tan posted an image of the tablet on his Facebook page and wrote that if the picture gets 10 thousand "likes" in seven days, Razer will release the device. (6) As of the time of publication of the note, the tablet was "laked" by more than 11 thousand people, and Ming-Liang Tan confirmed on Twitter that Razer will start production of the tablet. (7) When Fiona will go on sale and how much it will cost, he did not specify. (8) The prototype tablet shown at CES used an Intel Core i7 processor and ran Windows. (9) The device had a 10.1-inch screen with a resolution of 1280 by 800 pixels. (10) Each of the handles had a "stick" and four game buttons. (11) Project Fiona is not the only tablet designed for gamers. (12) Archos and Wikipad have such devices, for example. (13) Both of them work on Android. (14) The Archos device has game buttons located on the front panel on the sides of the screen, and the Wikipad is equipped with a removable gamepad."

(1) Вилли в ресторане ждет потенциальных: (1) Willie is in the restaurant waiting for potential wives, and Marianne comes to the meeting in advance. \"(1) Президент Сбербанка Герман Греф пр: "(1) The President of Sberbank German Gref offered to become his adviser to the former CEO of the Italian bank UniCredit Alessandro Profumo, the newspaper"Vedomosti" reports. (2) However, a final decision on this issue has not yet been made. (3) The interlocutors of the publication explained Gref's interest by the fact that Profumo has a lot of experience in acquiring banks. (4) Sberbank is currently planning foreign expansion: in particular, it is negotiating the purchase of the Kazakh "BTA Bank". (5) Profumo began his career in 1987 at McKinsey & Co, where he was responsible for projects for financial companies. (6) Later, he was Deputy Governor of the bank Credito Italiano, and in 1997, after its merger with UniCredit, he headed the banking group. (7) In 13 years, UniCredit's assets have grown from $ 161 billion to $ 1.34 trillion. (8) In 2004-2007 alone, UniCredit spent $ 60 billion on acquisitions in Europe. (9) UniCredit currently has branches in 22 countries, including Russia. (10) During the crisis, UniCredit managed without the help of the state, but attracted third-party investors. (11) As a result, the board's dissatisfaction with the fact that the largest shareholder of UniCredit was Libya led to Profumo's resignation. (12) Previously, Gref's adviser was already a well-known financier: Goldman Sachs board member, former McKinsey Managing Director Rajat Gupta. (13) In 2008, he became an independent director of the state bank. (14) In 2010, American prosecutors suspected him of disclosing insider information, after which he left the council, becoming an adviser to Gref. (15) The bank has now terminated its cooperation with Gupta."
(1) В любви король Людовик начал со свое: (1) In love, King Louis began with his coachman, then felt a "penchant for the dogman," but he was particularly passionate about de Luigne. (2) The Cardinal was afraid that the king might be called Louis the Stutterer, and he was "delighted when the opportunity came to call him Louis the Just." (3) Louis sometimes reasoned quite intelligently and even "prevailed" over the cardinal. (4) But most likely, he just gave him this little pleasure. (5) For some time the king was in love with the queen's lady-in-waiting, Madame d'autfort, which, however, did not prevent him from using the fire tongs to get a note from behind the lady's bodice, as he was afraid to touch her breast with his hand. (6) The king's love affairs were generally "strange," for jealousy was the most characteristic of all his feelings. (7) He was terribly jealous of Madame d'autfort for d'Aiguillon-Vassay, although she assured him that he was her relative. (8) And only when the genealogist d'ozier, knowing what was going on, confirmed the words of the court beauty, the king believed her. (9) With Madame d'autfort, Louis often talked "about horses, dogs, birds, and other similar subjects." (10) And it must be said that the king was very fond of hunting. (11) In addition to hunting, he "knew how to make leather trousers, snares, nets, arquebuses, mint coins," grew early green peas, made window frames, shaved perfectly, and was also a good confectioner and gardener.
(1) Lada 4X4 получит дизайн, соответству: (1) Lada 4X4 will receive a design that corresponds to the "new genetics" of AVTOVAZ products. (6) According to him, the car will receive an X-shaped design, combining the new model line of the plant. (7) However, the artists will try to keep the Lada 4X4 recognizable features of the classic model. (8) " But it won't be a nostalgic project. (10) Mattin also noted that in the process of changes, the SUV will not turn into an urban crossover: (11) "We know the strengths of this car, what is its uniqueness. (1) Правоохранительные органы установили: (1) Law enforcement agencies have identified two victims of the collapse of the entrance of a five-story building in Mezhdurechensk. (2) On Wednesday, June 1, RIA Novosti reports, citing a source in the Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia in the Kemerovo region. (3) " This is a man and a woman. (4) The man is a resident of the house, the woman is not registered there. (5) three more people were hospitalized with various injuries," the source said. (6) According to Life, it was previously established that the victims were Zinnur Alkhatshin, born in 1957, and Lidia Shcherbakova, born in 1932. (7) It is specified that the procedure of identification by relatives has not yet been carried out. (8) Search and rescue operations at the entrance collapse site have been completed. (9)" They lasted 12 hours — this is very fast with such a volume of work, " said Irina Butenko, head of the press service of the Siberian Regional Center of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Russia. (10) In total, 504 people and 84 units of equipment take part in the analysis of the rubble, according to the center's website. (11) On Tuesday, rescuers found two dead people under the rubble. (12) The bodies of an elderly woman and a man were recovered. (13) The entrance to a five-story house in Mezhdurechensk collapsed on May 31. (14) According to the updated information, 16 apartments in which 26 people lived were damaged. (15) the Alleged cause of the incident could be the building and reconstruction works, which were conducted in the shop on the ground floor of the building. (16) In fact the incident a criminal case under part 1 of article 216 of the criminal code of Russian Federation ("Infringement of safety rules at conducting civil work").
\"(1) На проходящем в Мюнхене процессе н: "(1) At the ongoing trial in Munich of two teenagers who beat to death a passenger of an electric train, 50-year-old Dominik Brunner, the testimony of some eyewitnesses was presented, according to which Brunner first started the fight, reports Spiegel. (3) Brunner stood up for the children and offered to go with him to the platform. (4) At the stop, Brunner called the train driver on the intercom, stating: "You're in trouble here." (5) After that, he threw his fists at the hooligans and, according to witnesses, struck one of them in the face. (6) According to Spiegel, Dominik Brunner took boxing lessons for about a year, but Markus Sh. And Sebastian L. managed to beat him, they knocked him to the ground - Brunner hit the platform fence as he fell-and continued to kick. (7) Brunner died from his injuries. (8) The incident caused a loud response throughout the country. (9) German President Horst Koehler posthumously awarded him one of the highest awards - the Federal Cross of Merit, First class - for his civic courage. (10) To Markus S. and Sebastian L. was charged with murder. (11) It is noted that they had already been detained several times for various offenses. (12) At the time of the crime, both were drunk."

(1) Едва дитя появилось на свет, Франвал: (1) As soon as the child is born, Franval begins to carry out his nefarious plan. (1) Мэр Калининграда Александр Ярошук в: (1) The Mayor of Kaliningrad, Alexander Yaroshuk, in a live broadcast of the program "Good Morning, Yaroshuk!" made a remark to journalists who were guessing at one of the works of the German philosopher Immanuel Kant. (2) On Thursday, December 8, reports kp.ru (3) " It is necessary to open the Gospel, not Kant! (4) (...) page so-and-so, verse so-and-so. (5) We read and discuss," the mayor said. (6) According to the publication, one of the presenters tried to argue that divination on the holy book can be taken by listeners as blasphemy. (7) "but it's not a bad idea. (8) Can you imagine how much wiser Kaliningrad residents will become?" the official responded, adding that it is necessary to read the Gospel in the morning. (9) In the autumn of last year, Yaroshuk, speaking at an operational meeting on housing and communal services, predicted a difficult winter for citizens and utilities and called on his subordinates to pray. (10)" Winter will be terrible, "he said after representatives of the municipal Municipal Unitary Enterprise" Chistota " told about problems with equipment, the wear of which reached 100 percent. (11) The program "Good morning, Yaroshuk!" is broadcast on the radio station" Komsomolskaya Pravda in Kaliningrad " on weekdays from 8 to 9 am. (12) The first edition of the program took place on November 10. (13) Divination on books became widespread in the Middle Ages. (14) For this purpose, Virgil's Aeneid was often used, from which the expression "Virgilian lots" later came. (15) The diviner opened a random page and read the first lines that came to hand, which was considered an accurate prediction of fate.
(1) Кристоф встречается с Грацией. (2) К: (1) Christophe meets Grace. (2) Once, as a very young girl, Grazia took music lessons from Christophe and fell in love with him. (3) The calm, bright love of Grace awakens an answering feeling in Christophe's soul. (4) They become friends, dream of getting married. (5) The son of Grace is jealous of the musician's mother and tries to prevent their happiness with all his might. (6) a spoiled, sickly boy fakes nervous fits and coughing fits and eventually becomes really seriously ill and dies. (7) After him dies and Grace, who considers herself the culprit of the death of her son. (8) Having lost his beloved, Christophe feels the thread that connects him to this life being torn. (9) And yet it is at this time that he creates his most profound works, including tragic ballads based on Spanish folk songs, among them "a dark love funeral song, like ominous flashes of flame." (10) Christophe also wants to have time to connect the daughter of a departed lover with the son of Olivier, in whom Christophe seems to have resurrected a lost friend. (11) The young people have fallen in love, and Christophe tries to arrange their wedding. (12) He has been ill for a long time, but hides it, not wanting to spoil the joyous day for the newlyweds.
\"(1) Бывшего мэра Новочебоксарска Валер: "(1) The former mayor of Novocheboksarsk, Valery Andreev, was sentenced to six years in a general regime colony, as well as to pay compensation to two victims in the amount of 500 thousand and 200 thousand rubles. (3) andreev was found guilty of fraud, abuse of authority and taking a bribe. (4) it is established that in 2004 the mayor received 500 thousand rubles from the director of the company, promising to allow the use of land for the construction of residential buildings. (5) however, the official did not fulfill his promise. (6) In 2005, Andreev took 200 thousand rubles from an entrepreneur for providing land for the construction of a store. (7)In 2007, the mayor received a furniture set from the head of the municipal enterprise for granting permission to pledge the company's real estate. (8) Andreev held a post of the mayor of Novocheboksarsk in 2002-2008. (9) Shortly after his resignation, several criminal cases were initiated against the former official. (10) In addition to the above-mentioned episodes, the media mentioned the illegal sale of apartments at low prices. (11) The investigators considered that as a result, the budget suffered damage in the amount of more than two million rubles. (12) However, as it became known to the newspaper "Komsomolskaya Pravda", the episode with the apartments was considered unproven by the jury. (13) In addition, the jury decided that the former mayor deserved leniency."
(1) Как-то раз погожим осенним деньком Т: (1) One fine autumn day, Tyap-Lyap and Tip-Top were walking through the forest and came across a large, spreading apple tree, and under it a whole bunch of ripe apples. (2) The hedgehogs were happy, fussed, ran around, and began to collect these apples. (3) Tyap-Lyap deftly piled on his back all the apples that came in his way, and, quickly, quickly turning over his paws, dragged them to his burrow. (4) All he thought about was how to pile more apples on his back, and quickly drag them all home to himself. (5) Tip-Top also wasted no time, but he worked much slower. (6) He would choose an apple for himself, examine it carefully, and when he was sure that it was all right, he would place it carefully on his back. (7) If the apple was crushed, broken, or even slightly damaged, he threw it away.
(1) На другой день он пошёл к древнему м: (1) The next day he went to the ancient mausoleum. (2) He regretted that there were no archaeologists, but he also liked this solitude. (3) And he liked the silence of the desert, because at that time he remembered his parents. (4) But then it would disappear like a broken dream: neither forget nor remember. (5) Did he long for them? (6) No, why should he be sad if he did not know them, did not remember them. (7) Only sometimes he thought with sadness and a strange irritation: "Why was I born in this city, when there are thousands of other cities where people never die from their land?" (8) The boy wanted to go up to the dome, to the tangle of gray structures frozen in the semi-darkness. (9) And he climbed up deftly, quickly, calmly. (10) He thought: "Maybe go down? (11)" It's time to go back, "he said to himself," I'll still crash like a fool. " (12) Suddenly he heard a slight rustling below, a car came up. (13) A man came out of it, small, walking angrily, quickly... (14) This figure was familiar to the boy almost as if it were the figure of his father. (15) The boy's stomach ached with the desire to be noticed by the professor, to be noticed not for a second, but for a long time, maybe forever. (16) the Boy recoiled from the edge of the dome, he was afraid this discontent, he suddenly thought that now the Professor would not let him in to the archaeologists that this was all folly, that he did not see the Professor because of his stupid idea (17) Then, again, he clearly heard the voice of the Professor: (18) — Just don't crash! (19) — Just wait a few more minutes wait, and everything will be fine, everything will be okay... (By V. Imlincomb)
\"(1) Петербургский совет по сохранению: "(1) The St. Petersburg Council for the Preservation of Cultural Heritage on Thursday, February 3, did not allow draping the exhibition hall "Manege" with a black cloth, which was planned to be done during the summer exhibition of contemporary art. (2) This is reported by the agency "Rosbalt". (3) The management of" Manezh " explained that it is categorically against any manipulation of the facade. (4) The authors of the plan wanted the building to echo the painting "Black Square" by Kazimir Malevich, from which, according to them, "all modern artists came out." (5) The building, designed by the architect Quarenghi, was planned to be surrounded by forests, and a cloth was stretched over them. (6) The cost of these works, according to Kommersant, was estimated at one million dollars. (7) Vera Dementieva, Chairman of the Committee for State Control, Use and Protection of Historical and Cultural Monuments, considered the project of "packaging" the building as an artistic provocation. (8) Having been rejected, the authors of the idea promised to come up with a more shocking version of the decoration of the building. (9) The exhibition, which will be held in the "Manege" from June 24 to July 16, will be called "Geniuses and Masterpieces". (10) The center of the exhibition will be the work "Quadromarket", which is a three-dimensional interpretation of the "Black Square". (11) It will also feature works by Yuri Cooper, Oleg Yakhnin, Vyacheslav Mikhailov and other graphic artists, artists and sculptors. (12) The organizers promise that the Colombian writer Gabriel Garcia Marquez will come to the opening of the exhibition."
\"(1) Налоговые поступления с прибылей б: "(1) Tax revenues from the profits of British banks will increase this year. (2) This was stated by British Finance Minister George Osborne, Sky News reports. (3) In the current year, the budget will receive 800 million pounds sterling (about a billion euros) from bankers due to the adoption of new tax measures. (4) In the future, taxes will attract about 2.5 billion pounds more from the financial sector. (5) Osborne said that the government will be able to negotiate with the banks on income taxes, since the growth of lending should allow bankers to accumulate the necessary amounts. (6) At the same time, the Minister noted that the Government of the country provided full-scale assistance to banks during the financial crisis of 2008-2009. (7) Some credit institutions have even been nationalized. (8) "We should have demanded something from the banks in return for this support. (9) Unfortunately, I was not a minister then, " Osborne said. (10) The UK is raising bank taxes in order to reduce the budget deficit, which has regularly set records in recent years. (11) The national debt is rapidly growing in size, which threatens the financial stability of the country in the foreseeable future. (12) The opposition rebuked Osborne and David Cameron's cabinet for half-measures. (13) In Labour's view, the bonus tax introduced the year before last should have been extended. (14) Without it, taxes on banks actually fell."
\"(1) Харрисону Форду предложили роль в: "(1) Harrison Ford has been offered a role in the sequel to Ridley Scott's fantasy film Blade Runner, according to the Twitch Film website. (1) Я возвращался с охоты и шел по аллее: (1) I was returning from hunting and walking along the garden alley. (2) The dog ran ahead of me. (3) Suddenly she reduced her steps and began to creep, as if scenting game before her. (4) I looked along the alley and saw a young sparrow with yellow around its beak and down on its head. (5) he fell out of his nest (the wind was shaking the birches of the alley violently) and sat motionless, his barely sprouting wings spread out helplessly. (6) my dog was slowly approaching him, when suddenly, falling from a nearby tree, an old black – breasted sparrow fell like a stone right in front of its muzzle-and, all disheveled, distorted, with a desperate and pathetic squeak, jumped twice in the direction of the toothy open mouth. (7) He rushed to save, he hid his child behind him… but his whole little body trembled with terror, his voice grew wild and hoarse, he was dying, he was sacrificing himself! (8) What a huge monster the dog must have seemed to him! (9) And yet he could not sit on his high, safe branch... (10) A force stronger than his will threw him from there. (11) My Trezor stopped, backed away... (12) It was obvious that he recognized this power. (13) I hastened to call the confused dog back – and left, awed. (14) Yes; don't laugh. (15) I was in awe of that little heroic bird, of its love-making. (16) Love, I thought, is stronger than death and the fear of death. (17) Only by it, only by love, does life hold and move.
(1)Судьбу поколения не случайно сравнива: (1)The fate of a generation is not accidentally compared to a white sheet on which special marks are made in invisible ink, and the paper itself is covered with "watermarks"that are invisible to a cursory glance. (2)Children grow up, run to school, fight and make up, go to technical clubs and dances, fall in love and make plans, not suspecting that Fate brings lines to their general biography year after year. (3) The time comes, their hour comes – and suddenly unknown forces are discovered in the whole generation, capable of resisting any tests, enduring inhuman loads and defeating any enemy. (4)Life is the way. (5)For those who want to pass it to please themselves, it is dark and unknown, unreliable, like a toy in the hands of reckless fortune. (6) But for those who see life in the service of their Homeland, this path is filled with a special meaning, incomprehensible to others. (7)Russia itself is leading him to a common goal. (8)her living soul will become a faithful counselor in doubt, a reliable companion in long journeys, a gentle comforter in grief, a hardworking helper in deeds, a courageous companion in struggle and battle. (9) The fate of the great sons of Russia has always been open and clear, because it is vitally connected with the fate of the people, and the biography of each hero always coincides with the biography of his country. (10)life itself is prepared for them to live the same fate, to share with the country its joy and sorrow. (11)Together to win and, if necessary, without bargaining, to give his life for her victory. (12)"I am a patriot, and dirt will not stick to patriots," repeated Nikolai Kuznetsov, a legendary intelligence officer, hero of the Soviet Union, the son of the "dispossessed", who more than drank "from the excesses" in the party's politics. (13)The Russian hero did not remember the insults inflicted and did not present accounts. (14)He laid down his life to serve his country, defending the country from the fascists, and his "Feat of intelligence" will remain with us forever. (15)The Russian land itself gives birth and hardens its defenders, giving them special conscientiousness and honor, so that they will stand before the whole people, carrying through the centuries a model of service to the Motherland. (16)The untrained and untrained boys of the summer of 1941 will perform feats and perform miracles of heroism not for the sake of a career and awards, not for the sake of high-sounding slogans and political doctrines. (17)They will stand to the death for their children's yards, where they played football, for the attics of houses where pigeons huddled together, for the bank of the river and the summer holidays spent in the pioneer camp, for their school, where day after day they learned "what is good and what is bad", for the girls with whom they kissed in the squares after the prom ... (18)therefore, they will be stronger than any enemy "dead heads" and become invincible. (19)so the children of the civil war will become heroes of the great patriotic war... (20)The war will teach them to take responsibility for themselves, not to be afraid of hard work, not to doubt the correctness of the chosen cause-it will make a generation of winners out of ordinary people. (By M. S. Stroganov)
(1) Блинову поручают ответственное задан: (1) Blinov is assigned a responsible task: taking a company, find a small sapper shovel in the grove, missing from a stolen car. (1) Глава Microsoft Стив Балмер лишился: (1) microsoft ceo steve ballmer lost half of the annual bonus due to the company's failures in the smartphone market, reuters reports, citing a microsoft report submitted to the securities and exchange commission (sec). (2) In total, for the last fiscal year ended June 30, 2010, Ballmer received a bonus of $ 670,000. (3) The same amount was Ballmer's salary for the year. (4) It is noted that the maximum amount of Ballmer's bonus is 200 percent of his salary. (5) The report notes that the reason for not paying Ballmer the maximum premium was the unsuccessful launch of Microsoft Kin smartphones. (6) Recall that Microsoft introduced these smartphones in April 2010. (7) However, at the end of June, it became known that Microsoft will curtail the development of Kin. (8) It turned out that less than 10 thousand smartphones were sold in the United States in a month and a half from the start of sales, which is a very low figure. (9) Ballmer was also blamed for the fall in the share of the Windows Mobile platform in the smartphone market. (10) Note that Microsoft is the fifth most popular mobile platform in the world, behind Symbian, as well as BlackBerry, Google Android and iPhone smartphones. (11) In the second quarter of 2010, they accounted for 5 percent of sales. (12) At the same time, their share fell by 9.3 percentage points over the year. (13) However, if you do not take into account the mobile division, the last financial year was a successful one for Microsoft. (14) So, the company recorded a record revenue figure - having received revenue of $ 62.5 billion.
\"(1) Лидер незарегистрированной партии: "(1) The leader of the unregistered party "Other Russia" Eduard Limonov appealed to the Constitutional Court of the Russian Federation with a complaint about the new law on rallies. (2) This was reported on October 9 by the Interfax news agency. (3) "i have a faint hope. (4) The law on rallies contradicts the Constitution," Limonov said. (5) In his opinion, among the unconstitutional provisions of the law is a ban on organizing rallies by people who have been brought to administrative responsibility more than twice for violating the rules of election campaigning, disobeying the police, hooliganism, blocking traffic or producing extremist materials. (6) The Law on Rallies was applied personally against Limonov. (7) He was fined 12 thousand rubles for the action on Triumfalnaya Square on July 31. (8) The Federal Law "On Meetings, Rallies, Demonstrations, Marches and Picketing" entered into force on 9 June 2012. (9) The Duma factions of Just Russia and the Communist Party of the Russian Federation announced their intention to challenge the law in the Constitutional Court almost immediately. (10) As a result, only social revolutionaries sent a request to the Constitutional Court. (11) Faction leader Sergei Mironov announced a "division of responsibilities" between the SR and the Communist Party. (12) "We are already de facto in a long-term alliance with the Communists. (13) Take, for example, our requests to the Constitutional Court: we - under the law on rallies, they - under the law on the election of governors," he explained. (14) The court's response to the request has not yet been reported."

(1) Говорят: «нашёл своё счастье», «добы: (1) They say: "I found my happiness", "I got happiness", "I achieved happiness" and even "I stole someone else's happiness". (2)Language requires action: he has found, caught, obtained, achieved, snatched his happiness from fate, every man is the smith of his happiness. (3)one should strive for happiness. (4)an indomitable, irrepressible, burning desire for happiness... (5)Happiness is not a thing, and not a warehouse of things, and not a position, and not a monetary state, but a state of mind that arises when you achieve a strongly desired one. (6)happiness is a blessed state, grace. (7) What, however, did the woman on the train tell me about him? (8)Later it turned out that she was a researcher, a specialist in the field of protein chemistry. (9)After thinking about my question for a long time, she said: – I can't define happiness. (10)Here's a scientist! (11)The scientist is not the one who knows everything, but the one who knows exactly what he does not know. (12) But maybe so? (13)A Person has spiritual aspirations: when they are satisfied, he feels happy. (14)does that sound like it? (By S. L. Soloveitchik)
(1) Вадим участвовал в разгроме гитлеров: (1) Vadim participated in the defeat of the Nazis at Korsun and in the August offensive at Iasi. (2) The rapid march to Bucharest and then across the Transylvanian Alps to Hungary, the battle of Budapest and the bloody battles at Lake Balaton, the capture of Vienna and the liberation of Prague − this is the path that Vadim and his tank went through Europe. (3) After the victory over Germany, the tank regiment in which Vadim served was transferred to the Far East. (4) The war with Japan began − the most difficult march through the arid, sun-scorched desert and the Khingan Mountains, battles with samurai gangs in Manchuria and, finally, Port Arthur. (5) On the edge of the continent, in the city of Russian glory, the Soviet Army completed its victorious path. (6) Two years of war hardened Vadim, taught him to understand people, taught him courage − to be stronger than his fear. (7) They showed him what he, Vadim Belov, was capable of. (8) In the war, he learned many things that were necessary not only for war, but also for life. (9) In the war, he saw his people, recognized their aspirations and character, and realized that it was his own character, his own aspirations. (By Yu. V. Trifonov)
\"(1) Актриса Джиллиан Андерсон получила: "(1) Actress Gillian Anderson has won the Evening Standard's annual British Theatre Award for Best Actress, " The Guardian reports. (6) This year, the London Evening Standard Award for Outstanding Acting and Successful Productions was awarded for the 60th time. (7) Gillian Anderson is best known for The X-Files, where she played FBI Agent Dana Scully. (8) for this work, the actress received the golden globe and emmy awards in 1997. (9) "The Desire Streetcar "is a play by Tennessee Williams, first published in 1947. (10) The American playwright won a Pulitzer Prize for it and was nominated for an Oscar for adapting the play for the film of the same name with Vivien Leigh and Marlon Brando in the lead roles. "Of the tape.ru"), has been awarded since 1955. (14) It is the second-lowest-budget British theatre award after Oliviers."

\"(1) Футболист сборной Уругвая Луис Суа: "(1) Uruguay's Luis Suarez, who became the main hero of the match of the 1/4 final of the World Cup with Ghana, called himself the new" hand of God", reports AFP. (2) In the last minute of extra time, Suarez's hand stopped the ball flying into the goal of his team, was removed from the field, but in the end the Uruguayans won in a penalty shootout. (3) The episode involving Suarez occurred at the score of 1:1. (4) The Chief referee Olegario Benkerenza of Portugal awarded a penalty to the Uruguayans, but the forward of the national team of Ghana Asamoah Gyan struck the crossbar. (5) immediately after, the final whistle sounded. (6) In a penalty shootout, Uruguay won 4-2. (7) Commenting on the game with his hand in the last minute of overtime, Suarez said that he had no other choice, as the match was coming to an end. (8)The Uruguayan declared that "the hand of God" should now be called. (9) Since 1986, the phrase has been associated with the Argentine Diego Maradona in the football world. (10) In the match of the 1/4 final of the 1986 World Cup against England (2:1), Maradona scored the first goal of his team with his hand. (11) The ball was counted, and after the game the Argentine declared that it was "the hand of God". (12) Uruguay head coach Oscar Tabares excused Suarez, noting that his hand movement was instinctive. (13) Suarez will now miss the 2010 World Cup semi-final against the Netherlands on July 6 in Cape Town."
(1) In the dark, there were louder voices. (2) One of the dead lived on an island within which a fire was enclosed. (3) He loved a girl named Juditta, and she loved him too. (4) One day they went to the mountains and met there an old woman with one eye — with this eye the old woman saw only the true. (5) The old woman predicted to Judith that she would die in childbirth. (6) and although the narrator decided not to touch the beloved, so that she would live, she forced him to master himself and married him, she was a very earthly woman. (7) and when judith gave birth to a child and died, and the narrator came out of the hut with the newborn in his arms, he saw his tribe singing a hymn in honor of the symbol of fertility — the phallus, and just at that moment the fire burst out of the ground on the mountains, and everyone stood and waited for it, not trying to escape, because it was impossible to escape, and sang a hymn in honor of the fertility of life. (8) At this point, the narrator understood the meaning of being. (9) Life is only important to life in general. (10) It needs trees, people, and flowers, but they are not dear to it individually — having manifested itself in them, life easily destroys them.
(1) Детство братья провели на воле, в им: (1) The brothers spent their childhood in the wild, on the estate of their father, who was himself a cantonist, but served as an officer and left the children a hereditary nobility. (2) After the death of their father, the estate was sued for debts. (3) From the age of nineteen, Nicholas sat in the state chamber, but he was terribly sad there and kept dreaming of buying himself a small manor house. (4) Ivan Ivanych himself never sympathized with his brother's desire to "lock himself up for life in his own estate." (5) Nicholas could think of nothing else. (6)He was always imagining a future estate where gooseberries were bound to grow. (7) Nicholas saved money, was malnourished, married without love to an ugly but rich widow. (8) He kept his wife half-starved, and put her money in his name in the bank. (9) The wife could not bear such a life and soon died, and Nicholas, not repenting in the least, bought himself an estate, wrote out twenty gooseberry bushes, planted them and lived as a landowner. (10) When Ivan Ivanych came to visit his brother, he was unpleasantly struck by how he had sunk, grown old and flabby. (11) He became a real gentleman, ate a lot, sued the neighboring factories and spoke in the tone of a minister phrases like: "education is necessary, but for the people it is premature." (12) Nikolai regaled his brother with gooseberries, and it was clear from him that he was satisfied with his fate and himself.

(1) Едва он кладёт трубку, как в дверь р: (1) As soon as he hangs up the phone, there is a knock on the door. \"(1) Премьер-министр РФ Владимир Путин: "(1) Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said that he could not ban the show of the TV series "School" on Channel One. (2) According to the Head of Government, it is necessary to work together to ensure that Russian viewers lose interest in such topics. (3) putin said this at a forum of the united russia party in novosibirsk, interfax reports. (4) According to the Prime Minister, the series "School" is a commercial project. (5) Putin noted that " sharp, sharp things attract attention." (6) At the same time, the head of government admitted that he himself had never seen this TV series. (7)" It is necessary that people feel the priorities of the development of the country, society, and not be guided only by ratings, behind which there are corresponding advertising bonuses, " Vladimir Putin stressed. (8) He noted that this understanding could not be achieved by directive methods. (9) "This is one of the elements of the general culture of those who make products of this kind," the Prime Minister added. (10) The series "School" directed by Valeria Guy Germanica appeared on the evening broadcast of Channel One on January 11, 2010. (11) Various officials and State Duma deputies opposed its broadcast. (12) At the same time, Patriarch Kirill of Moscow and All Russia and Minister of Education and Science Andrey Fursenko expressed their support for the series. (13) In their opinion, "School" raises acute questions about the difficult situation in Russian school education."
(1) «Клянусь Зевсом, выгодно бы я устрои: (1) "By Zeus, I would have made a good living if I still had to pay for the dead!" exclaims the messenger of the gods. (2) And to the reproaches of Charon, that he is the only one who sailed into the realm of the dead for nothing, Menippus calmly replies: no, not for nothing. (3) For he drew water from a leaky boat, helped to row, and was the only one who did not cry. (4) But Charon is not satisfied. (5) And Menippus suggests: "Then take me back to life! "(6)" So that Aeacus will beat me for this?! " — Charon is horrified. (7) And when he asked who it was that was sitting in his boat, Hermes said, "He has brought a man who is boundlessly free, who does not care about anyone or anything!" (8) This is Menippus! (9) Protesilaus, the first of the Greeks to die at Troy, begs Pluto to let him go to earth only for one day: even the waters of Lethe did not help him forget his beautiful wife. (10) And for the same reason Eurydice was given to Orpheus, and Alcestis was also released out of mercy to Hercules. (11) And besides, Protesilaus hopes to persuade his wife to leave the world of the living and go down with her husband to the underworld: then Pluto will have two dead instead of one!
(1) В конце апреля Ромашов получает от А: (1) At the end of April, Romashov receives a note from Alexandra Petrovna reminding him of their common name-day. (1) Рэпер Кирилл Толмацкий, известный по: (1) Rapper Kirill Tolmatsky, known under the pseudonym Decl, told how he will spend 50 thousand rubles of compensation that he will receive from the performer Vasily Vakulenko (Basta). (10) Tolmatsky's lawyer Roman Lalayan asked to recover a million rubles from Basta for insulting honor and dignity and to remove the defamatory record from the performer's Twitter account. \"(1) Российский центровой клуба НБА \"Д: "(1) The Russian center of the NBA club "Denver Nuggets" Timofey Mozgov played the assistant coach of his team Melvin Hunt. \"(1) Губернатор Ярославской области Сер: "(1) The Governor of the Yaroslavl region, Sergei Vakhrukov, declared three days of mourning in the region in connection with the Yak-42 crash, RIA Novosti reports. (2) The mourning period will last from 9 to 11 September. (3) Vakhrukov also added that compensation will be paid to the families of the victims: the city and regional authorities will allocate in the amount of 450 thousand rubles, the airline - 2 million rubles. (4) The Yak-42, which was flying the Lokomotiv hockey team, crashed near the Yaroslavl Tunoshna airport at about 16:00 on September 7. (5) shortly after takeoff, the plane crashed on the bank of the volga - the tail was on land, and the main part of the fuselage, with passengers and crew, was in the water. (6) there were 45 people on board, including 8 crew members and 37 lokomotiv hockey players and coaches. (7) Only two survived-hockey player Alexander Galimov and flight attendant Alexander Sizov. (8) both are in serious condition. (9) As reported by the press service of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, as of 9:00 on September 8, the bodies of all those killed in the plane crash were found. (10) According to the portal of the Yaroslavl region, 150 people are involved in the operation to eliminate the consequences of the disaster. (11) Russian President Dmitry Medvedev is expected to visit the crash site later on September 8. (12) The cause of the crash is currently unknown. (13) According to sources of the Interfax news agency, two main versions are being considered - the failure of one of the engines and a pilot error. (14) The technical investigation of the crash will be handled by the commission of the Interstate Aviation Committee headed by Leonid Kashirsky."
\"(1) В московском ОВД \"Дорогомилово\": "(1) In Moscow OVD "Dorogomilovo" a criminal case on hooliganism in fact the brawl at the Mall "European", the recording of which was posted on the Internet. (1) Пресненский районный суд Москвы санк: (1) The Presnensky District Court of Moscow has authorized the arrest of businessman Pavel Sopot, accused of inciting an attack on Novaya Gazeta journalist Igor Domnikov. (2) this is reported by rapsi. (3) Novaya Gazeta specifies that Sopot will be detained for two months, until July 7. (4) The businessman denies his guilt in incitement. (5) he asked the court to choose a non-custodial measure for him, including bail for any amount. (6) sopot stressed that he had previously regularly attended interrogations and testified, and now he did not understand why the investigation suspected him of being able to escape. (7) Pavel Sopot was detained by employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs on May 8. (8) According to the investigation, in 2000, the businessman asked the head of the murderers ' gang, Eduard Tagiryanov, to beat Domnikov so that he would definitely go to the hospital. (9) On May 12 of the same year, gang member Albert Huzin struck a journalist 10 times on the head with a hammer. (10) Domnikov was hospitalized and died two months later without regaining consciousness. (11) Khuzin was sentenced to 25 years in prison on the combined charges, while Tagiryanov was sentenced to life in prison. (12) Other gang members also received long sentences. (13) In 2009, the investigation into Domnikov's death was resumed. (14) The editorial board of Novaya Gazeta has repeatedly suggested that Sopot and former Vice-Governor of the Lipetsk Region Dmitry Sorovsky were the perpetrators of the journalist's murder. (15) After the businessman's arrest, the editorial board stated that he was simply an intermediary between Sorovsky and Tagiryanov.

(1) Певец и лидер рок-группы «Машина вре: (1) Singer and leader of the rock band "Time Machine" Andrey Makarevich did not consider offensive words that Russians disrespect nature and have a habit of shitting. (2) On the air of the radio station "Moscow Speaks", the musician stressed that he did not want to offend anyone with his statement. (3) "I didn't mean anything offensive by saying that. (4) These are just certain traits that have developed historically and are historically inherited," Makarevich explained. (5) In his opinion, when "the tribe moves all the time, it makes no sense for them to clean up after themselves, since they will have a new clean place tomorrow." (6) At the same time, Doctor of Historical Sciences Lev Domeshek noted on the radio station that nomadic peoples have always had an exceptionally respectful attitude to nature and the earth. (7) Earlier, Makarevich told in an interview how Belarusians differ from Russians. (8) The text was published on March 3 by the website "Budzma Belarusami" ("Let's be Belarusians"), which is dedicated to the patriotic campaign of the same name. (9) In particular, the musician explained that Belarusians adhere to the European position in relation to nature, while Russians have distorted this perception since the time of the Tatar-Mongol yoke. (10) " there is a difference, of course. (11) Even in relation to nature. (12) you have a european attitude, but we have one that is spoiled by nomads. (13) nomads are used to shitting because they don't sit still: they're going on tomorrow. (14) you don't have to worry about cleanliness. (15) I suspect that the Russians have this left over from the time of the Tatar yoke, " he said.
(1) Чуть позже Генрих покидает Турингию,: (1) A little later, Henry leaves Thuringia, his father's home, and goes with his mother to Augsburg, her homeland. (2) They travel in the company of merchants also bound for Southern Germany. (3) henry, who is destined to become a great poet, listens with trepidation to the stories of his fellow travelers about poets and their power over the souls of all living beings. (4) The merchants introduce him to two legends. (5) One of them tells how once, in distant times, a famous poet and singer was threatened with death at the hands of the owners of the ship on which he sailed on the sea, greedy for his treasures. (6) However, his songs so shocked the sea animals that they saved his life and returned the treasures taken from him. (7) Another legend refers to the court of an enlightened, poetry-patronizing king and his daughter, who once left her parents ' home and spent a whole year hiding from her father, living in the forest with a loved one. (8) A year later, her lover, with his songs and playing the lute, so captured the heart of her father that he granted them both forgiveness and took them and his newborn grandson into his arms. (9) a few days later, the travelers stop at the old warrior's castle and witness the preparations for a new crusade. (10) In his own domain, Henry meets a young prisoner brought from the East, Zuleima. (11) She languishes away from her homeland and laments her bleak fate.
(1) Царь Иван Васильевич в преотличнейше: (1) tsar ivan vasilyevich is in the Most excellent mood. (2) well, what is not a reason to turn an everyday meal into a small holiday for your own people? (4) He himself keeps a sharp eye on how his faithful servants drink, because wine drinking is also a test of loyalty. (5) However, the brave fighters are not bast: they drink as it should be, they drink-they praise the king, sweet wine flows on their lips. (7) Recognizing in the violator of palace etiquette his favorite Kiribeyevich, he scolds him menacingly: (8) " It is indecent for you, Kiribeyevich,/ to abhor the Royal joy;/ And you are from the Skuratovs ' family,/ And you are fed by Malyutina!." (9) Kiribeyevich, crafty and clever as a demon, plays a heartwarming scene before the tsar, for him personally. (10) Because, they say, I do not drink — in a gilded bucket, not the urine of my moustache — that I fell in love with a beautiful woman to the point of passion, and she turns away from me, unworthy as from a non-Christian, and closes her striped veil. (11) Having learned that the sweetheart of his nominee is only a merchant's daughter, Ivan Vasilyevich laughs: they say, take my yakhontov ring, buy a pearl necklace and send precious gifts to your Alyona Dmitrievna. (12) When you finish the job, call me to the wedding, but first bow to the matchmaker...
(1) А ещё у Пигмалиона был то ли правнук: (1) And Pygmalion had either a great-grandson or a great-granddaughter, named either Kenida or Kenei. (2) She was born a girl, the sea Poseidon fell in love with her, took possession of her and said: "Ask me for anything. (3) She replied: "So that no one else can dishonor me like you — I want to be a man!" (4) Began these words in a woman's voice, ended in a man's. (5) And in addition, rejoicing in this desire of Kenida, God gave her male body invulnerability from wounds. (6)at this time, the king of the lapithi tribe, a friend of theseus, was celebrating a crowded wedding. (7) The guests at the wedding were centaurs, half-men, half-horses from the neighboring mountains, wild and violent. (8) Unaccustomed to wine, they became intoxicated and attacked the women, the Lapiths began to defend their wives, and the famous battle of the Lapiths with the centaurs, which the Greek sculptors loved to depict, began. (9) First in the wedding palace, then in the open air, first they threw cast bowls and altar brands at each other, then torn pines and blocks of rocks. (10) Then Kenei showed himself — nothing took him, stones bounced off him like hail from a roof, spears and swords broke like granite. (11) Then the centaurs began to throw tree trunks at him: "Let the wounds be replaced by a load!" - a whole mountain of trunks grew over his body and at first wavered as in an earthquake, and then subsided. (12) And when the battle was over and the trunks were dismantled, the dead girl Kenida lay under them.
(1) Джим не может не видеть страшной зак: (1) Jim can't help but see the girl's terrible insecurities. \"(1) Новым главным тренером испанского: "(1) The new head coach of Spanish football club Sevilla will be Jose Miguel Gonzalez, known as Michel. (2) This is reported by the official website of Sevilla. (3) The parties have already agreed on the terms of the future agreement, and the coach has only to sign a contract with the club. (4) Michele will replace Marcelino Garcia Toral as Sevilla coach. (5)This specialist was dismissed on February 6 after a seven-match winless streak in the Spanish League. (6) In these meetings, Sevilla scored only two points. (7) In addition, Sevilla have already been eliminated from the Europa League and the Spanish Cup. (8) The 48-year-old Michel played for Real Madrid and the Spanish national team for many years as a player. (9) From 2009 to 2011, Michel coached Getafe and in the 2009/10 season he finished sixth in the national championship with this team, showing the best result in the history of the club. (10) At the end of the 2010-11 season, in which Getafe finished in 16th place in the standings, Michel retired. (11) Michel will make his debut as head coach of Sevilla on February 13. (12) On this day, Sevilla will play a Spanish League match with Real Sociedad. (13) After 21 matches in the Spanish League, Michel's new team with 26 points takes 11th place."
(1) Утром выясняется, что поезд останови: (1) In the morning, it turns out that the train has stopped. (2) They were caught in a band of drifts, and now it is not known when the journey will continue. (3) at noon poirot is summoned to the train master's compartment. (4) We need the help of a famous detective-Mr. Ratchett was found stabbed to death in a compartment. (5) Seeing that the passenger did not get out and did not answer the knock, the conductor decided to open the door with his key, but it was locked from the inside and locked with a chain. (6) When he entered the compartment, he saw that the window was open, and the passenger had been killed by a dozen stab wounds. (7) After examining the corpse, the doctor came to the conclusion that the blows were not delivered by a professional. (8) Some were made with the left hand, some with the right, some were made when Mr. Ratchett was already dead. (9) Because of the heavy snowfall, no one could leave the car, so the killer is on the train. (10) Poirot is talking to his secretary, Mr. McQueen. (11) The young man worked for the murdered man for about a year. (12) He cannot give any information about his master, only that someone has recently sent him threatening letters.
(1)Для меня ясно одно: главные участники: (1) One thing is clear to me: the main actors in history are People and Time. (2) Not to forget Time means not to forget People, not to forget People means not to forget Time. (3)The number of divisions that participated in a particular battle is calculated with scrupulous accuracy by historians. (4) However, they will not be able to eavesdrop on the conversation in the trench before the tank attack, to see the suffering and tears in the eyes of an eighteen-year-old girl-saninstructor, dying in the semi-darkness of a dilapidated dugout, around which the German tanks are buzzing, to feel the crackle of machine-gun fire, killing life. (5) We were then twenty years old. (6) We dreamed of returning to that sunny pre — war world, where the sun seemed to us like a holiday sun, rising above the earth day after day according to its immutable regularity; the grass was grass meant to grow; the lanterns were meant to illuminate the dry April sidewalk, the evening crowd of strollers, in which you, eighteen years old, tanned, strong, walk. (7)All the showers passed merrily over your head, and you were mischievously glad to see the lightning flash and the cannon thunder; all the smiles in that time were meant for you, all the deaths and tears were strangers... (8) The whole world, transparent and radiant, lay at your feet in the early blue April, warming with kindness, joy, expectation of love. (9) There was no fierce intransigence back there, everywhere there was a greenish-light watercolor in the air; and there were no harsh black colors. (10)3a the long four years of war, feeling the fiery breath of death near our shoulders, passing silently by the fresh mounds with chemical pencil inscriptions on the tablets, we did not lose the former world of youth, but we grew up for twenty years and, it seemed, lived them so thoroughly, so richly, that these years would have sufficed for two generations. (11)we have learned that the World is both stable and unstable. (12)We have learned that the sun may not rise in the morning, because its brilliance, its warmth, can be destroyed by bombing, when the horizon is drowned in a black and purple veil of smoke. (13)Sometimes we hated the sun-it promised flying weather and, therefore, shoals of Junkers diving into the trenches. (14)We learned that the sun can gently warm not only in summer, but also in the most severe January frosts, at the same time indifferently and mercilessly expose with its light in all details the recent picture of the battle, the bodies of the dead that you called by name a moment ago. (15)We learned the world together with human courage and suffering. (16)Time has touched the memory has faded the details, half-forgotten faces of the dead, not so acutely felt in the memories of the smells of the ruined shells of the trenches, you don't instinctively bend down in the street, at the distant sound of a jackhammer, reminiscent of battle heavy machine gun. (17)When holiday rockets flash over the roofs of houses, an involuntary cry of "Lie down!" does not burst from the throat (18)It is no longer customary to look for a place on the corner, near a pharmacy or a department store (a place for a firing position with a wide sector of fire), and accidentally heard at dusk the cry of a child does not evoke the black outlines of broken villages, the furnace fumes of smoking ruins, charred gardens, crying in the dark. (19)The long-awaited world (we went to it for four years) has firmly entered the consciousness — a world with the shine of the morning sun on the pavements, with the rustle of crowded trolleybuses in the evenings and the cozy romp of pigeons on the eaves at dawn. (by Yu. bondarev*)
(1) Руджьер — сын от тайного брака христ: (1) Ruggier is the son of a Christian knight's secret marriage to a Saracen princess. (2) He is raised in Africa by the wizard and warlock Atlantean. (3) The Atlantean knows that his pet will be baptized, give birth to glorious descendants, but then perish, and therefore tries not to let his pet go to Christians at all. (4) He has a castle full of ghosts in the mountains: when a knight rides up to the castle, the Atlantean shows him the ghost of his beloved, who rushes through the gate to meet her and remains a prisoner for a long time, searching in vain for his lady in empty rooms and passages. (5) But Bradamante have a magic ring, and the spell it does not work. (6) Then the Atlantean puts Ruggier on his winged hippogriff horse, and he takes him to the other end of the world, to another sorceress — warlock-Alcina. (7) She meets him in the guise of a young beauty, and Ruggier falls into temptation: for many months he lives on her wonder island in luxury and bliss, enjoying her love, and only the intervention of a wise fairy, who cares about the future of the Este family, returns him to the path of virtue. (8) The spell is broken, the beautiful Alcina appears in the true image of vice, vile and ugly, and the repentant Ruggier on the same hippogriff flies back to the west. (9) In vain, here again he is waylaid by the loving Atlantean and gets into his ghostly castle. (10) And the captive Ruggier rushes through its halls in search of Bradamanta, and next to the captive Bradamanta rushes through the same halls in search of Ruggier, but they do not see each other.
(1) Предварительные выборы депутатов Мос: (1) Preliminary elections of deputies of the Moscow City Duma are held on Sunday, June 8, in the Russian capital. (2) Residents of the city from 8: 00 to 20: 00 at the address of their registration, upon presentation of their passport, can vote for the candidate they like. (3) This is reported by Interfax. (4) 1033 candidates were registered for 45 seats. (5) In total, about 10 percent of the ballots from the number of voters in the capital (more than 700 thousand) were printed. (6) 500 voting places are organized in the primaries. (7) The first results of the elections will be published on the night of Monday, June 9. (8) The final results will be announced early next week. (9) 19 current deputies, including Duma Chairman Vladimir Platonov, are taking part in the primaries. (10) Among the candidates are actor Leonid Yarmolnik, director of the center for combating traffic jams Alexander Shumsky, People's Artist of Russia Nadezhda Babkina, director of the Social Assistance and Support Fund "Social Request" Maria Gaidar, former First Deputy Mayor of Moscow Oleg Tolkachev and others. (11) More information about the participants can be found on the website moskva2014.rf. (12) The elections to the Moscow City Duma will be held on a single voting day on September 14, 2014. (13) The term of office of deputies is five years.
(1) Самолет МЧС с эвакуированными сотруд: (1) A plane of the Ministry of Emergency Situations with evacuated employees of the Russian Embassy in Libya landed at Domodedovo Airport. (2) This was reported on October 4 by RIA Novosti. (3) Flight RF9702 Tunis-Moscow landed at 10:37. (4) According to the Interfax news agency, there are 51 Russian citizens on board. (5) On October 3, Russian diplomats and their families were taken from the Libyan capital Tripoli to neighboring Tunisia, and a plane of the Ministry of Emergency Situations arrived there to pick them up. (6) at the same time, some diplomats remained in tunisia to continue negotiations with the libyan side. (7) On October 2, a protest was held outside the Russian diplomatic mission in Tripoli. (8) The reason for the action was the murder of an Air Force officer of the Libyan army, in which, according to some reports, a citizen of the Russian Federation Ekaterina Ustyuzhaninova may be involved. (9) She is under arrest. (10) Protesters smashed the gates of the diplomatic mission and set fire to a car parked nearby. (11) The guards opened fire on the attackers, but some of them managed to break into the building. (12) One attacker was killed. (13) The diplomats took refuge in protected areas. (14) Libyan Foreign Minister Mohammed Abdel-Aziz told Russian Ambassador Ivan Molotkov that he could not guarantee the security of diplomats. (15) After that, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov demanded that Abdel-Aziz resolve the situation as soon as possible.
(1) Происходят перемены и в жизни Клауса: (1) Changes are also taking place in the life of Klaus Tangen. (2) Klaus's wife, Anna, gradually suggests to her husband the way to achieve his cherished goal: to create a novel in the Gorky tradition. (3) Klaus decides to give up translations and return to the craft of bricklaying, which provides good earnings — this will allow him to save money so that he can then start his favorite work. (4) in a moment of despair, a strange woman comes to the aid of andreas düring. (5) This meeting changes everything in his life. (6) A disillusioned cynic, he suddenly discovers in himself the ability and need to love, sacrifice, live. (7) Helga's husband, Eric Faye, is also a member of the Resistance, but the war took away his hope of happiness: torture in the Gestapo dungeons turned him into a cripple. (8) Eric is doomed, and he knows it; he feels his enforced loneliness hard, but he endures the suffering with fortitude. (9) Fate took away his hope for the future, but he managed to remain true to the ideals of his youth, to preserve what his more fortunate comrades had almost lost. (10) His dying words sound like a testament to the living: "The truly great things in human life are always simple. (11) To see and perform it requires only strength, courage, and a willingness to sacrifice."
\"(1) О фронтмене британской группы Moto: "(1) A documentary was made about the frontman of the British band Motorhead, Lemmy Kilmister. (2) The premiere of the film, which tells about the life and work of the legendary musician, is scheduled for March 2010. (3) The film will be presented to audiences in Austin, Texas, as part of the SXSW Film and Music Festival. (4) This is reported on the official website of the feed. (5) Working on a film called "Lemmy: The Movie" (Lemmy: Film), lasted three years - the creators of the film accompanied the musician on tour in the United States, Scandinavia and Russia, talked with him on various topics, and also talked with Lemmy's colleagues from other groups, who talked about the importance of the personality of the vocalist Motorhead for modern music. (6) In " Lemmy: The Movie "includes snippets of interviews with Alice Cooper, Ozzy Osbourne, ex-Guns' N Roses guitarist and current Velvet Revolver member Slash, former Nirvana drummer and current Foo Fighters vocalist Dave Grohl, Metallica musicians and many other Lemmy collaborators. (7) Commenting on the release of a documentary about himself, the 64-year-old bassist and vocalist of Motorhead promised that all viewers "Lemmy: The Movie "is waiting for " an incredible sight". (8) " This is awesome! (8) You'll be able to see Lemmy breathing! (9) You will witness how Lemmy moves his fingers on his own! (1) В наше время чтение художественной л: (1) In our time, reading fiction is essentially a privilege. (2) This occupation takes up too much time. (3) a Lack of time. (4) Yes, and reading is also work, and first of all – on yourself. (5) even if it is inconspicuous, not so burdensome, but a person who has spent a day solving problems that require physical or intellectual and spiritual return, sometimes simply does not have the strength to ask about new literature. (6) this does not excuse anyone, but the reasons are obvious, and unfortunately not everyone has developed a strong habit of serious reading. (7) For the majority of adults and elderly people today, television replaces reading, and if they get acquainted with the novelties of the book market, it is with rare exceptions in the primitive television presentation. (8) Young people are increasingly learning the world of the word through headphones and Internet resources, smartphones and tablets, which are always at hand. (9) Perhaps I am exaggerating and someone will be able to paint a more optimistic picture, but in my opinion, the realities of the time are just that. (10) I manage to read and write. (11) I have released my fourth collection of poems. (12) I do not stop there, the folders of manuscripts and drafts are replenished, although flights, trips and night wakefulness are all the writer's resource that I have left. (13) Reading is even more difficult, pauses are rare. (14) If you try to describe everything that I have selected and recently read, the first thing that comes to mind is: it was written by individuals! (15) People who made themselves. (16) You believe them. (17) But it is very important to believe the author, no matter what we read: scientific literature, a novel or a memoir. (18) Stanislavsky's famous "I Don't Believe It!" now permeates all genres and types of art. (19) And if in the cinema the dynamics of the frame and the dashing plot can distract the viewer's attention from inconsistencies and outright falsehood, then the printed word immediately pushes all lies to the surface, everything that is written for the sake of a red word is sucked out of the finger. (20)For me, the main measure was and remains the result: to be believed. (by a. n. sobolev*)
\"(1) Издательство Capcom объявило дату: "(1) Capcom has announced the release date for the demo version of dmc: Devil May Cry. (2) According to Zavvi, it will be available at the end of November. \"(1) В Москве скончался мультипликатор: "(1) Animator Fyodor Khitruk has died in Moscow, RIA Novosti reports with reference to the Association of Animated Films. (2) He was 95 years old. (3) Among the director's works of Khitruk - three cartoons about Winnie the Pooh (1969, 1971-1972)," Boniface's Vacation "(1965)," Film, film, film! "(1968)," Island "(1973)," Icarus and the Wise Men "(1976)," Olympioniki "(1982)," Lion and Bull " (1983). (4) As an animator, he created about 200 characters in 102 films, among them - Ole Lukoye, the Snow Queen, Little Red Riding Hood. (5) Fyodor Savelevich Khitruk was born in Tver, and soon his family moved to Moscow. (6) The future director became interested in animation after seeing Disney's works for the first time. (7) For three years in a row, he could not enter Soyuzmultfilm - this was only possible in 1938. (8) For innovation, the first director's work of Khitruk, the cartoon "The Story of a Crime" (1962), was already appreciated - for example, at the San Francisco Festival it was awarded the Golden Gate Prize. (9) Subsequently, Hitruk's cartoons won numerous awards at international festivals. (10) So, for " Toptyzhku "(1964) in Venice, he was awarded the "Bronze Lion". (11) The director was a People's Artist of the USSR, winner of two State Awards, holder of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, III degree. (12) In 2006, his contribution to animation was awarded the Nika Award."
(1)Надобно сказать, что у нас на Руси ес: (1) It must be said that in Russia, if we have not yet caught up with foreigners in something else, we have far surpassed them in the ability to address them. (2) It is impossible to count all the nuances and subtleties of our treatment. (3)A Frenchman or a German will never understand and understand all its peculiarities and differences; he will speak with almost the same voice and language to a millionaire and a small tobacco merchant, although, of course, in his heart he will be moderately different from the first. (4) It is not so with us: we have such wise men who will speak to a landowner who has two hundred souls quite differently from one who has three hundred, and with one who has three hundred, they will speak again not as with one who has five hundred, but with one who has five hundred, again not as with one who has eight hundred. (5)Suppose, for example, there is a chancery, not here, but in a far-off state, and in the chancery, suppose there is a ruler of the chancery. (6)I ask you to look at him when he is sitting among his subordinates — but you can't even utter a word out of fear!(7)Looks out like an eagle, performs smoothly, evenly. (8) The same eagle, as soon as he has left the room and approaches the office of his superior, is in such a hurry with papers under his arm that there is no urine. (9)In society and at a party, if everyone were of a small rank, Prometheus would remain Prometheus, and a little higher than him, Prometheus would become a transformation that even Ovid would not invent: a fly, smaller even than a fly, was destroyed into a grain of sand. (10) "It's not Ivan Petrovich," you say, looking at him."Ivan Petrovich is taller, and this one is both short and thin; he speaks loudly, basses and never laughs, but this one is the devil knows what: he squeaks like a bird and keeps laughing." (11)You come closer, you look-just like Ivan Petrovich!(12) "Eh-heh!" you think to yourself...
(1) Видеохостинг YouTube заблокировал ви: (1) The video hosting service YouTube has blocked a video of Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott with a report on the work of the government led by him.
