(1) В давние времена лев, который был ко: (1) In ancient times, the lion, who was king of three thousand forests, took a fox as his wife. (2) Soon they had a son, but such that he did not look like a fox, and he could not be called a lion. (3) he looked like a lion, but instead of roaring like a lion, he barked like a fox. (4) When the son was growing up, father Leo called him to himself and said, " My son! (5) You are great and strong in body, but you have received a despicable voice from your mother fox. (6) There is no majesty in your voice, and it is not befitting my royal offspring. (7) If the animals hear you barking like a fox, they will not consider you. (8) Therefore, it is better to keep absolutely silent and do not give voice. (9) Then I can grant you a thousand forests. (10) The son remembered the instructions of Leo. (11) But one day it happened that he broke them. (12) One day, when a lot of animals were gathered, the son of the lion really wanted to give a voice. (13) He could not stand it and, forgetting his father's order, barked loudly in fox. (14) There was laughter among the beasts when they heard the high-pitched, fox-like bark of such a large and powerful beast. (15) And then father Leo said to him, "If you had kept silent, my son, as I told you, you would have received a thousand forests." (16) But now I see that you are not worthy of these forests, since you could not stop your talkativeness. (17) So the son of the lion did not receive a thousand forests, and people have since begun to say, "Silence is worth a thousand."
\"(1) В тринадцать лет я впервые прочел: "(1) At the age of thirteen, I read Anna Karenina for the first time. (2) The war has come to Tuapse itself. (3) Sukhumi was carelessly bombed several times, and my mother and sister and I moved to the village of Atary, where my mother's sister lived. (4) We rented a room from a straw widow, and we were given land for a vegetable garden, where we grew pumpkins, melons, tomatoes, and other vegetables that were no less amazing at that time. (5) In this house I accidentally discovered Tolstoy's book and read it while sitting under a laurel tree in a green courtyard. (6) Of course, I hardly understood many of the features of this novel at the time, but I did understand the main thing. (7) This is evident from the fact that I was shocked in a way that I had never been before or since reading this book. (8) For three days I walked around like a drunk and mumbled some savage requiem about the death of the heroine. (9) Already not inclined to work hard with a shovel and hoe, these days I did not even respond when my mother and sister called me to the garden. (10) Sing stupid pumpkins when the world together with Anna Karenina is crushed under the wheels of a steam locomotive?! (11) I walked through the village, and the funeral train of the requiem fluttered behind me. (12) Unfortunately, this masterpiece was lost forever because of my musical illiteracy, as well as my lack of musical memory. (13) However, perhaps I will remember it when I start to fall into childhood, from which I still can not fall out. (By Fazil Iskander)"

(1)Наукой заниматься трудно. (2)Это хоро: (1) Science is difficult to do. (2)This is well known to those who have dedicated their lives to it. (3) The scientific vocation is always associated with a high degree of risk and courage, since the scientist takes on a notoriously difficult burden and is obliged to show truly sophisticated patience in his work, not to mention the daily drama of his personal struggle with intellectual darkness in the name of achieving clarity. (4)Scientific thought is remarkable in that it is one of the organizing principles of the human psyche and is aimed at preserving, constantly updating, correcting, and reviewing the results of its activities. (5) That is why it presupposes courage, constancy, perseverance, which gives the everyday work of a scientist a genuine drama. (6) science is not only difficult to do. (7) it is necessary to engage in science. (8)Research activity — a wise teacher — educates the individual, develops memory and observation, accuracy and subtlety of thinking. (9) in my opinion, the more people get research skills, the better society is. (10)With the help of the mind, a person can not only know the world, but can change the environment by his will, create a new quality that did not exist before in nature. (11)Science is not only necessary. (12)It's nice to do science. (13)First, because the overcome difficulty brings a small, but strong enough, bright happiness, causes a desire to repeat your own feat and again experience the sweetness of victory. (14)Secondly, because research activity gives meaning to everyday life. (15)Third, because a real scientist gets pleasure from the most rough, personally performed work. (16)The subject of knowledge is inexhaustible not only for the mind, but also for our love, our feelings. (17)" Why do you spend your whole life dealing with worms? " one scientist was asked. (18) "The worm is so long, and life is so short," he replied. (19)These words have been spoken for a long time, and recently a Worm Museum was opened in one of the towns of Australia, where visitors are offered to feel like a worm, crawl through the maze, stay "inside" the worm. (20)But it all started with the love of single researchers for their research subjects. (According To V. Harchenko)
(1) Живущий в Великобритании диссидент и: (1) Dissident and writer Vladimir Bukovsky, who lives in the UK, denied charges of production and possession of child pornography at the Royal Court of Cambridge, RIA Novosti reports. (2) In April 2015, the Crown Prosecution Service brought charges against Bukovsky on 11 counts falling under three criminal articles. (3) The court sessions were repeatedly postponed due to the state of health of Bukovsky, who underwent heart surgery. (4) Appearing before the court, Bukovsky stated that for many years he had had no contact with children at all and the charges against him were groundless. (5) 72-year — old Vladimir Bukovsky is one of the most famous Soviet dissidents. (6) was arrested four times. (7) He was accused of anti-Soviet agitation and propaganda. (8) Was subjected to compulsory treatment in psychiatric hospitals, served his sentence in camps. (9) In 1976, he left the USSR and was exchanged for the Chilean political prisoner Luis Corvalan. (10) In the 1990s, he was returned to Russian citizenship. (11) In 2014, after an audit, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, however, recognized that Vladimir Bukovsky could not be considered a citizen of the Russian Federation.
(1) Мальчишка разбил стекло. – (2)Кто эт: (1) The boy broke the glass – - (2)Who did this?  the teacher asks. (3) the boy is silent. (4)he is not afraid to ski down the most dizzying mountain. (5)he is not afraid to swim across an unfamiliar river full of treacherous craters. (6) But he is afraid to say, " I broke the glass." (7) What is he afraid of? (8)After all, flying down the mountain, he can break his neck. (9)swimming across the river, can drown. (10)The words "I did it" do not threaten him with death. (11)Why is he afraid to say them? (12) I heard a very brave man who had gone through the war say once, "It was terrible, very terrible." (13)He spoke the truth: he was afraid. (14) But he knew how to overcome his fear and did what his duty told him: he fought. (15)In a peaceful life, of course, it can also be scary. (16) I will tell the truth, and I will be expelled from school for this... (17)I will tell the truth – I will be fired from my job... (18)I would rather keep silent. (19)There are many proverbs in the world that justify silence, and perhaps the most expressive: "My hut is on the edge." (20)But there are no huts that would be on the edge: we are all responsible for what is being done around us. (For The F. A. Vigdorova*)

(1) Чтобы узнать о судьбе заложенных у у: (1) In order to learn about the fate of the things pawned by the murdered woman, and in fact — to dispel the suspicions of some acquaintances, Rodion himself asks for a meeting with Porfiry Petrovich, an investigator in the case of the murder of an old interest-bearing woman. (1) Ведущая британского телемагазина Gem: (1) The presenter of the British TV shop Gems TV Charlie Vernon (Charlie Vernon), previously dismissed by the management for showing the middle finger on the air, will receive compensation in the amount of 3250 pounds. (2) This was reported on December 9 by The Daily Mail. (3) Monetary compensation will be paid to the presenter not for the dismissal (the court confirmed its legality), but for what was the true cause of the incident with the middle finger. (4) As it turned out, the obscene gesture was shown to Vernon after one of the Gems TV operators called her a "****** fat whore" and a "bitch". (5) After hearing these words in the earpiece during the broadcast, the journalist could not restrain herself and showed an indecent gesture to the colleague who insulted her. (6) "I was shocked and hurt. (7) Operators often make fun of us during commercial breaks, but usually they are friendly and innocent jokes. (8) I did not expect to be subjected to such a cruel insult," Vernon said, commenting on the court's decision. (9) Prior to her dismissal, Charlie Vernon advertised jewelry on Gems TV. (10) in total, the presenter worked in the tv store for more than two years. (11) During the review of the case, Gems TV representatives claimed that Vernon had never actually been on the staff, but had worked for the company as a freelancer. (12) In addition, the management of the TV store tried to prove that two weeks before the incident, the girl was already on the verge of dismissal due to misconduct. (13) However, it was later revealed that Vernon was still on the staff and the threat of her dismissal had not previously existed.
\"(1) В Германии 7 июля был установлен п: "(1) In Germany, on July 7, the country's first monument to the Russian Empress Catherine II was erected, ITAR-TASS reports. (2) The monument was erected in the city of Zerbst in eastern Germany. (3) the monument erected in front of the zerbst city administration building is a 4.7-meter-high bronze statue. (4) The author of the project was a member of the Russian Academy of Arts, sculptor Mikhail Pereyaslavets. (5) The monument was cast in 2009 and donated to the city of Zerbst in June 2010. (6) the grand opening of the monument will take place on july 9. (7) The idea of erecting a monument to the Russian Empress appeared in 1996. (8) The initiators were the International Historical Society "Catherine II" operating in Zerbst and the Russian Noble Society. (9) All costs for the installation of the monument were borne by the Russian side. (10) Catherine the Great, born Sophia Frederica Augusta, Princess of Anhalt-Zerbst, was born in 1729 in Stettin. (11) The ancestral castle of the princess's ancestors is preserved in Zerbst. (12) At the age of 16, she was married to the Russian Grand Duke and future Emperor Peter III. (13) In 1762, as a result of a coup, she succeeded her husband on the Russian throne and ruled the Russian Empire until her death in 1796."

\"(1) Режиссёр Брюс Бересфорд займётся п: "(1) Director Bruce Beresford will direct the biographical film "Taliesin", which tells about the life of American architect Frank Lloyd Wright, reports The Hollywood Reporter. (2) Wright is considered one of the creators of the so-called organic architecture. (3) In buildings built according to the precepts of this direction, the natural properties of materials are revealed, in addition, the structures ideally fit seamlessly into the surrounding landscape. (4) Wright's own mansion, called Taliesin, was designed on the same principles. (5) It was in this mansion that Wright's mistress was murdered in 1914. (6) The crime was committed by the architect's servant. (7) He also set fire to the Taliesin . (8) The residential part of the house is almost completely burned down. (9) Wright later restored it and named the renovated mansion "Taliesin II". (10) Other notable structures designed by Wright are the Solomon Guggenheim Museum in New York City and a house called Fallingwater in Pennsylvania. (11) The screenplay for the film about Frank Lloyd Wright was written by Nicholas Meyer ("Somersby", "The Prince of Egypt"). (12) Beresford praised Meyer's work. (13) "It is not about the whole life of Wright, but only about a small period. (14) And the screenwriter is not trying to turn the hero into a saint, " the director said. (15) Bruce Beresford himself previously worked on the films "Tender Mercy", "Black Cassock" and "Miss Daisy's Chauffeur". (16) The last of these films in 1989 claimed nine Oscars and won four of them (including in the main category "Best Film")."
(1) Однажды Тэсс случайно подслушивает р: (1) One day Tess accidentally overhears the conversation of her companions — Marion, Ratty and Izz. (2) The girls confess their love for young Mr. Clare, and complain that he does not even want to look at any of them, because he does not take his eyes off Tess Durbeyfield. (3) After this, Tess begins to torment herself with the question — does she have a right to Angel Clare's heart? (4) However, life decides everything: Claire falls in love with her, and she falls in love with him. (1) Недавно прочитал в интервью городско: (1) I recently read in an interview with a city official: "The St. Petersburg Concert Philharmonic should become a production center, a kind of" star factory "... (2) A more unfortunate combination of words — "star factory" — is hard to imagine in the mouth of the chairman of the Committee on Culture. (3) After all, what television shows us under this name is, if not a factory, then not stars, but rather stamped meteor dust, which disappears in a fraction of a second in the life — giving atmosphere of culture. (4) Our poor country! (5) Among other innumerable ailments, it is simply infected with the "star disease". (6) and we need masters! (7) It is clear that the education of an actor, singer and musician requires not only incredible work, abilities and patience, but also time. (8) It is not for nothing that even a very secondary education requires at least three years of study. (9) And in half a year, immature young people, even promising ones, can only be trained by teaching a few acting cliches that are suitable for the needs of an unassuming crowd. (10) in the words of the great poet, we "sow the rational, the good, the eternal." (11) Both in the school classroom and in the beautiful hall on Fontanka, I see the inquisitive gleam of understanding and empathy in the eyes of high school students as they listen to Dostoevsky, Chekhov, Pushkin, Galich, Okudzhava, as deep thoughts and feelings expressed in the fabulously beautiful Russian language, difficult to translate into other languages, find their way to their minds and hearts. (12) And their remarks after the concert — " cool!" — are no less a reward than loud applause or tense, conscious silence during performances. (13) It is only necessary to make this "bird" teenage slang melt in their minds into a beautiful Russian speech. (14) And what to say about the great classical music, which without words — directly — from time immemorial affected the feelings of people!(15) It is a hell of a task to try to convey to the audience (especially the young ones — after all, we will miss!) the precious words and music of our great predecessors, for whose works we are respected and loved all over the world. (16) And show business does not need the help of the state. (According to L. Mozgovoy*)
\"(1) Кандидат в президенты Украины, быв: "(1) The candidate for President of Ukraine, the former head of the Ministry of Defense Anatoly Gritsenko denied information that he is negotiating with President Viktor Yushchenko on the creation of an electoral alliance. \"(1) Я слушал и чувствовал, что краснею: "(1) i listened and felt myself blushing. (2) " well, well! (3) so, then, i am "gray"?" (4) at first, of course, i was offended. \"(1) Канцлер Германии Ангела Меркель и: "(1) German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Spanish Prime Minister Jose Luis Rodriguez Zapatero opened CeBIT 2010. (12) This year, 4157 companies from 68 countries will participate in CeBIT. (13) Last year, 4292 companies were represented at the exhibition. (14) In 2001, a record year for the exhibition, more than eight thousand exhibitors participated in it."
\"(1) Глава ЦИКа Владимир Чуров во вторн: "(1) The head of the CEC Vladimir Churov on Tuesday, May 8, handed Vladimir Putin a certificate of the President of the Russian Federation, Interfax reports. (1) Вечером Сид начинает воровать куски: (1) In the evening, Sid starts stealing lumps of sugar from the sugar bowl and breaks it, but gets caught by Tom. (2) He gives himself up completely to his resentment and is not even happy with Sister Mary, who lives in the village and comes home only on weekends. (3) sunday comes. (4) Mary washes Tom, makes him put on a tight suit and shoes, and sends him to Sunday school. (10) The boy shows the astonished teacher the tickets that give the right to the Bible. (11) The teacher feels a trick, but can not refuse, and Tom is at the top of the glory. (1) Проблематикой абсурда пронизано всё: (1) The problems of the absurd permeate all of Dostoevsky's work. (2) In his novels, the worldview of an absurd person is vividly outlined. (3) The writer managed to show "all the torture of the absurd world", but the Russian genius could not find a way out of the absurd impasse. (4) In appealing to God, Dostoevsky only raises the problem of the absurd, but does not solve it. (5) He tries to give an answer, but "an absurd work, on the contrary, does not give an answer." (6) Absurd creativity is "rebellion, freedom, and diversity." (7) The book concludes with a study of the most striking absurd rebel in the history of mankind. (8) This is Sisyphus, who "the gods have condemned to lift a huge stone to the top of the mountain, from which this block has always rolled down." (9) The hero of the myth is punished for his earthly passions and love of life. (10) It is known that "there is no punishment more terrible than useless and hopeless work," but the hero despises the lot that has fallen to him. (11) His life is filled with a new meaning, in which consciousness conquers fate, turning suffering into joy. (12) The torment Sisyphus experiences under the weight of a stone is a rebellion against the absurd world.
(1) Иван Вересов с рождения воспитывался: (1) ivan veresov was brought up from birth by major spica, not knowing the parental affection, although his father, who lived in the neighborhood, visited him. (2) Mordenko arranged for him to attend a theater school, from which Ivan was released as incapable of wordless roles. (3) he also earned his bread by modeling plaster figures for street vendors. (4) Ivan lived separately from Mordenko, who did not help his son in any way. (5) Since his expulsion from the house of Shadursky, Mordenko had possessed a single secret passion: to avenge the prince's slap in the face, and the princess's contempt. (6) To build up capital, he began to lend money on loan; his first pawnbroker was Princess Anna Chechevinskaya, who took off her cross. (7) Gradually Mordenko began to buy up the overdue bills of the profligate Shadurskys, waiting for the day when he could finally ruin his enemies. (8) Absorbed in this idea, Mordenko became so suspicious that he accused his own son of aiding and abetting the robbers who had come to kill the pawnbroker. (9) Ivan was arrested, fell into the society of murderers and bandits, and survived in prison only thanks to the intercession of one of them, Ramzi. (10) Released into the wild, Ivan had neither housing nor funds, because of which he was forced to spend the night in a barge. (11) his Way with Mary Povedenou soon separated, but they were destined to meet again.
(1) Йорику случайно попадается лист бума: (1) yorick happens upon a piece of paper with a text in old french from the time of rabelais, and possibly written in his own hand. (2) Yorick spends the whole day parsing hard-to-read text and translating it into English. (3) It tells of a certain notary who, having quarrelled with his wife, went for a walk to the New Bridge, where the wind blew off his hat. (4) As he was walking down a dark alley, complaining about his fate, he heard a voice call out to the girl and tell her to run for the nearest notary. (5) When he entered this house, he saw an old nobleman who said that he was poor and could not pay for his work, but the payment would be the will itself — it would describe the whole story of his life. (6) This is such an extraordinary story that it should be read by all mankind, and its publication will bring the notary a large income. (7) Yorick had only one sheet, and he could not find out what followed. (8) When La Fleur returned, it turned out that there were only three leaves, but in two of them the servant wrapped the bouquet, which he presented to the maid. (9) The master sends it to the house of Count B—, but it so happens that the girl gave a bouquet to one of the footmen, the footman to a young seamstress, and the seamstress to a violinist. (10) Both the master and the servant are upset. (11) One by the loss of the manuscript, the other by the frivolity of the beloved.
(1) Дрезину они нашли под насыпью у разъ: (1)They found the trolley under the embankment at the exit. (2)The soldiers and nurses left to pick it up and put it on the rails. (3)Romashov and I were left alone in a small, wet birch grove. (4) It is difficult for me to talk about what this day was like. (5)We waited and waited without end. (6)The nurse shoved her shoulder bag under my head as she left. (7)Obviously, there were crackers in the bag: something crunched when I knocked the bag higher with my fist. (8)Romashov began to whine that he was dying of hunger, but I shouted at him, and he fell silent – - (9)They won't come back, " he said nervously.)They abandoned us. (11)I was probably in a bad mood, because I pulled out my gun and told Romashov that I would kill him if he didn't stop whining. (12)He paused and seemed to have difficulty keeping from crying. (13)It was bad business! (14)Already the first twilight began to creep stealthily into the grove, and the girls did not return. (15)Of course, I did not even think that they could have left on the trolley without us, as Romashov viciously suggested. (16)It was better not to think that they wouldn't come back yet. (By V. A. Kaverin)
(1)О несправедливости говорят и пишут с: (1)Injustice has been talked about and written about since ancient times — perhaps since mankind learned to speak and write at all. (2) What is injustice is still not clear. (3)It is very difficult to come to an agreement on this issue, since in this case the dispute is conducted with a sufficient share of interest. (4)Everyone wants to be treated "fairly" and complains about "injustice", but tries to interpret the situation in such a way that the injustice towards them becomes immediately obvious. (5)And everyone has enough self-conceit to judge "fairly" about the attitude towards other people, and does not notice at all that others are outraged by his alleged "justice". (6) Thus the problem is distorted by passions and shrouded in prejudice. (7)Whole generations are stuck in these prejudices, and sometimes you notice how the very word "justice" causes a sarcastic smile. (8)From previous generations, humanity has inherited the belief that people are born equal and therefore should be treated equally. (9) however, the essence of justice consists precisely in treating different people differently. (10) If people were truly equal, life would be extremely simple and justice would be extremely easy to find. (11)It would only be necessary to say: the same people — the same share or all equally. (12)then justice could be proved arithmetically and created mechanically; and everyone would be satisfied, because people would become nothing more than identical atoms, a kind of mechanical balls rolling everywhere, which would be similar in appearance and have the same mental structure inwardly. (13)How naive, how simple, how shallow!(14)In fact, people are not equal in body, soul, or spirit. (15)They will be born as beings of different sexes, with different health and strength, with completely different dispositions, gifts, instincts and desires, they belong to different spiritual levels, and with them (by virtue of justice!)(16) This is the basis and main difficulty of justice: there are an infinite number of people; they are all different; how can everyone receive according to justice?(17) If people are not the same, then it is necessary to treat them every time according to their living originality — otherwise there is injustice. (18)Thus, justice means inequality: to protect the child, help the weak, to condescend to tired to look after the sick; to be more rigor to limp, more confidence honest, more caution to the talker; character render honors. (19)Justice, therefore, is the art of inequality, and it belongs only to noble souls. (20) It has a keen sense of reality; it proceeds from a good heart and a lively observation, it rejects the mechanical approach to people, tries to catch in a person his essence and originality and treat him accordingly. (According To I. Ilyin*)
(1) Утром 8 апреля на заседании Верховно: (1) On the morning of April 8, a fight occurred at a meeting of the Verkhovna Rada, UNIAN reports. (2) According to RBC-Ukraine, it was attended by deputies from the Communist Party of Ukraine and the nationalist Svoboda party. (3) The reason for the fight was the speech of the Communist leader Pyotr Simonenko, who made accusations against the representatives of the current government. (4) Simonenko said that they contribute to the division of Ukraine and the destruction of its independence. (5) " Today you threw armed men at those who peacefully defended their interests. (6) You intimidate people and arrest them," the Communist leader reproached the Ukrainian leadership, commenting on the latest events in the east of the country. (7) The speech caused dissatisfaction of deputies from the now ruling Svoboda party. (8) They ran up to the podium and pushed Simonenko out of it. (9) One of the nationalists, as reported by NBN, tore off the microphone. (9) After that, deputies from the Communist Party and the Party of Regions came running to the podium. (10) A scuffle ensued. (11) The Speaker of the Verkhovna Rada, Oleksandr Turchynov, announced a break in connection with the fight. (12) After the brawl stopped, the Communists and part of the Party of Regions faction, according to ligabisinesinform, left the meeting room.
\"(1) Верховный суд РФ признал законным: "(1) The Supreme Court of the Russian Federation has upheld the verdict of the Moscow Regional Court, according to which the former deputy head of the Ruzsky district of the Moscow region Maxim Miroshkin will spend nine years in prison. (6) It is established that in 2005-2006 Miroshkin and the head of the Department of the district administration for Land Use and Subsoil Novozhilov extorted bribes from citizens and businessmen applying for land ownership or lease. (8) subsequently, criminals spent money on personal needs. (9) Suslov, Miroshkin and Novozhilov were arrested in 2008. (10) Initially, their prosecution was linked to the "case of Ruz Switzerland", but then it was separated into a separate production. (11) the investigators found that the total amount of illegally received donations exceeded three million rubles. \"(1) Бранислав Младич (Branislav Mladic: "(1) Branislav Mladic, a cousin of Colonel-General Ratko Mladic, admitted to hiding him in his home in northern Serbia for five years. (2) This is reported by the Serbian newspaper Vespers News. (3) "Ratko Mladic is a member of our family, and I refuse to disown him," Branislav Mladic said in an interview. (4) branislav mladic faces one year in prison and three years of probation. (5) The final verdict of the court is due on 8 August. (6) Ratko Mladic, former Chief of the General Staff of the armed forces of the Republika Srpska, is accused of the massacre that took place in the Bosnian enclave of Srebrenica in 1995 after the capture of that city by Serbian troops under Mladic's command. (7) In the course of the military operation, about eight thousand people were killed - from infants to the elderly. (8) In July 1995, the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia charged Mladic with war crimes, crimes against humanity and genocide. (9) However, for 16 years the general was a fugitive from justice. (10) Mladic was arrested in May 2011 at the home of his cousin Branislav Mladic, where he was hiding under the name Milorad Komadic. (11) On 3 June 2011, the General appeared before the Hague Tribunal for the first time. (12) The trial, suspended in May 2012, resumed in July. (13) Mladic pleads not guilty. (14) If the general is found guilty, he will face life imprisonment."

(1) Создатели документальной ленты Heave: (1) The creators of the documentary Heaven Adores You ("Heaven adores you") about the American composer and author-performer Elliott Smith said that during the filming they discovered an unknown song by the musician, which he wrote at the age of 14 and never published. (2) The composition Ocean was introduced by Smith's friend Kevin Moyer when talking about the film at the Portland Radio Project studio. (3) It was not included in the film's soundtrack, according to NME. (4) " This is one of the first songs for which Elliott wrote both the music and lyrics. (5) It features keyboards, guitar and Smith's voice," Moyer said. (6) He also added that the track was created by the musician in 1984 with his Texas friends before moving to Portland from Amherst. (7) Most often Elliott Smith used the guitar in his work, but also played well on the piano, clarinet, bass guitar, harmonica and drums. (8) for some time he performed in the rock band heatmiser, and in 1995 began a solo career. (9) Smith gained fame in 1998, when his composition Miss Misery, written for the film "Good Will Hunting", was nominated for an Academy Award in the category "Best Song". (10) The musician also created a cover version of The Beatles ' song Because for the film "American Beauty". (11) In 34 years, Smith managed to release seven albums. (12) Died under unclear circumstances, there is a version that the musician committed suicide.
\"(1) Американский певец Бек Хансен анон: "(1) American singer Beck Hansen has announced the release of a new, experimental album. (2) The record, called "Beck Hansen's Song Reader", will be published only on paper, in the form of a collection of sheet music. (3) According to the musician's website, "Song Reader" will be released in December 2012 by McSweeney's American publishing house. (4) The collection will include notes of 20 new compositions by Beck, two of them will be instrumental. (5) It is noted that all songs have never been released or recorded before. (6) So to hear Beck's new songs, fans will have to play them themselves. (7) Among others, the album will feature the tracks " Do We? (7) We Do" and "Don't Act Like Your Heart Isn't Hard". (8) Along with the sheet music, the 108-page collection will include illustrations for songs by artists Marcel Dzam, Lynn Shapton, Josh Cochran, Jessica Hirsch, an abstract by The New York Times journalist Jody Rosen, and a foreword by Beck himself. (9) The best musical performances of Beck's new songs will be published on McSweeney's website. (10) Whether the author's audio version of the collection "Beck Hansen's Song Reader" will be released is unknown. (11) "Beck Hansen's Song Reader" will be Beck's 12th number-one album. (12) his previous album "modern guilt" was released in july 2008. (13) Earlier in 2012, Beck released a joint single with Jack White, "I Just Started Hating Some People Today"."

(1) Шаталов растопил печку, сам уселся н: (1) Shatalov lit the stove, sat astride a chair himself, and lit a cigarette. (2) The pain in his bones increased, monotonous, tedious... (3) All the trouble began at the same time that he got this damned rheumocarditis. (4) It is surprisingly stupid sometimes: a small, ordinary case becomes the watershed of a whole fate. (5) Shatalov — at that time a senior lieutenant, navigator of a hydrographic vessel — launched the reporting documentation and did not get out of the cabin for a week, dealing with combat training logs, acts for writing off skipper and navigator property, notes of classes with personnel. (6) From the endless "sections", "subsections", "paragraphs" and "notes" already rippled in the eyes and for some reason itched behind the collar. (7) The deadline for submitting documentation was approaching inexorably, the ship's commander frowned at the meeting, and the end of the work was still not in sight. (8) And suddenly the order to go to sea: somewhere on the island, the automatic beacon went bad, and it was necessary to change the burner. (9) The autumn Baltic was stormy, but the navigator rejoiced. (10) He was young. (11) He jumped like a goat from the compass to the map, from the radio direction finder to the echo sounder: after all, no one could now drive him into the cabin and make him write the acts of the inventory commission — he led the ship through a stormy sea! (12) The island was closed in a ring of surf, but the navigator volunteered to go there in a whaleboat. (13) he assured the commander that he had already landed here several times, that he knew the passages in the coastal stones. (14) He had never been anywhere near here, and knew no passageways. (15) But he was well aware that the deadline for submitting documentation would be extended if the lighthouse could be set up without waiting for the storm wind to weaken. (16) No, this was not a completely desperate adventure. (17) Shatalov was a good sailor and felt the tiller of the whaleboat not only with the palm of his hand, but with his whole being. (18) Just fate changed... (19) He lost his bearings among the waves, breakers, curtains of spray... (20) Forever remembered the slippery shine for a moment exposed stone under the side of the whaleboat, the impact, the crack of breaking oars, the distorted mouths on the sailors ' faces and the roar of the wind... (According To V. Konetsky)
\"(1) Кирсти Стэнвэй, работавшая в качес: "(1) Kirsty Stanway, who worked as a make-up artist on a number of television and film films, simulated injuries from beatings allegedly inflicted on her by her husband. (2) In this way, the woman tried to take revenge on her cheating husband, reports The Daily Mail. (3) kirsty claimed that her husband hit her twice in the stomach, and also pushed her so hard that she hit her head on the door jamb. (4) As evidence, she showed bruises and a bump. (5) in may 2010, the court found kirsty's husband, michael gwilliam, guilty of battery. (6) The man was sentenced to six months of probation. (7) however, gwilliam's lawyer appealed. (8) The lawyer claimed that Kirstie had faked the injuries, and that they looked natural because of the skills she had acquired while working on the films. (9) At the same time, Michael did not deny that he had cheated on his wife. (10) But according to his version, Kirsty herself attacked him with her fists when she found out about the betrayal. (11) As a result, a retrial was held on Monday, November 8, which resulted in all charges against Gwilliam being dropped. (1) Банк Snoras, национализированный пра: (1) Snoras Bank, which was nationalized by the Lithuanian Government in November, will pay insured deposits to individuals and organizations for five years. (2) This was stated by the country's Finance Minister Ingrid Shimonite, DELFI reports. (3) According to her, the Deposit Insurance Fund for the payment of compensation will receive a government loan of 3.3 billion litas. (4) This is significantly more than previously planned. (5) The total amount of compensation should be about LTL 4.1 billion. (6) The fund itself has 1.7 billion. (7) The government expected to lend the organization the missing 2.4 billion, but revised this amount upwards: the country's leadership does not want to rush to sell the securities on the fund's balance sheet in order to avoid losses. (8) The specific need for funds will depend on how quickly people will return the funds invested in the bank. (9) In order to avoid hype, the period for issuing compensation was made as long as possible. (10) Snoras was nationalized on November 16. (11) The authorities suspected the shareholders, Vladimir Antonov, a Russian entrepreneur, and Raimondas Baranauskas, a Lithuanian, of illegally withdrawing funds. (12) The owners were abroad at the time. (13) Later it became known that Antonov and Baranauskas had handed over their passports to the London authorities and were not going to leave England. (14) The bankers were detained on November 25, but then released on bail.

(1) Фонд героев имени Карнеги (Carnegie: (1) The Carnegie Hero Fund awarded medals to 20 individuals. (2) The annual ceremony was held on April 7 in Pittsburgh, USA, according to the Associated Press. (3) As indicated in the press release on the website dedicated to the winners, this year the Foundation awarded one of the medals posthumously. (4) In 2007, Carmen Digrigorio, a former New Jersey state trooper, rescued Chateauroux Jenkins-Thomas, who had been attacked by her lover. (5) Christopher Robinson tried to push the girl into the trunk of the car, but Digrigorio intervened in time, and she managed to escape. (6) after that, robinson chased digrigorio in a car, hit him and fled. (7) doctors failed to save the former police officer. (8) He died in hospital two days after the incident. (9) Robinson was soon arrested and sentenced to 30 years in prison for attempted kidnapping and murder. (10) In addition to Digrigorio, 19 other people from the United States and Canada won medals this year. (11) They include a truck driver, a university student, a delivery worker, a police officer, and others who risked their lives to save others. (12) The Carnegie Heroes Foundation was founded in 1904 by the famous English industrialist and philanthropist Andrew Carnegie. (13) This year, along with the medal, the winners were given a check for $ 5,000. (14) A total of 9432 people were awarded medals during the foundation's existence.
(1)Тогда у нас ещё был только один ребён: (1) Then we still had only one child – the eldest son. (2) We were remarkably poor. (3) Ate fried cabbage and buckwheat. (4)New Year's gifts to the child began to buy for six months, not later, because they knew for sure that on the eve of the New Year, the money for all the surprises ordered by him from Santa Claus would not be enough. (5)So we lived, buying one gift a month: it sometimes took a third of my simple salary. (6)The elder believed in Santa Claus for a very long time, almost up to the age of eight. (7) At least I remember exactly that in the first grade, he reacted to classmates who shouted that there was no Santa Claus, as if they were fools. (8) Every year he made lists of what he wanted for the feast. (9)We performed everything according to the list, sometimes adding something from ourselves. (10) And now, I remember, another New Year happened. (11)My wife and I put a huge bag of presents under the Christmas tree deep into the night. (12)Went to bed in anticipation – there is no greater joy than to see the happiness of your child. (13)In the morning, at 9 o'clock, we look – he crawls out of his room. (14)The look is concentrated, the forehead is frowned: maybe Santa Claus forgot to come in. (15)I noticed the bag, sat down next to it and let's lay out everything. (16)There was an airplane on a string. (17)There was a steamer on a stand. (18)soldiers of three armies in terrifying enemy ammunition. (19)A book with gorgeous pictures. (20) When he unloaded all this, we could not see our child from the bed. (By Z. Prilepin*)
\"(1) Глава Чечни Рамзан Кадыров заявил,: "(1) The head of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, said that shooting at weddings is prohibited in his republic. (2) In an interview with the program "Vesti on Saturday with Sergey Brilev" on October 6, as quoted by Interfax, the politician said that earlier in Chechnya, often shot during the movement of wedding columns, while most of the shooters were employees of various structures. (3) "I told them: if we are law enforcement officers, we should not break the law," Kadyrov said. (4) - Weddings happen on Saturdays, but in a month or more, there may be some one-shot event. (5) in the old days, shots were fired to signal that a bride was being taken. (6) now you can do it on your mobile phone, send an sms." (7) Kadyrov stressed that the custom of shooting at a wedding is not a custom of the Chechen people. (8) He also noted that the custom of bride abduction is prohibited in Chechnya. (9) kadyrov's comment is related to a high-profile shooting incident in moscow during the celebration of a dagestan wedding. (10) On September 30, the wedding cortege, moving along Leningradsky Prospekt towards Tverskaya Street, began shooting into the air and other cars. (11) The police blocked violators of order in the Mokhovaya district, detaining 15 people. (12) At first, the wedding guests were released with a fine, but later materials on six participants in the incident were sent to the courts. (13) Two of them have already been arrested for 15 and 5 days for hooliganism and disobedience to police officers."
(1) В это время в их деревню приезжает и: (1) At this time, Mitka Polyakov, Katerina's brother, comes to their village from Murmansk without a penny of money. (2) In less than a week, he gave the whole village a drink, barked at the authorities, married Dashka Putanka to Mishka, and provided the cow with hay. (3) And all as if casually. (6) Mishka in response almost throws the tractor Dashka, washing in the bath, along with the bath directly into the river. (7) As a result, the tractor was damaged, and illegally mown hay was found in the attic of the bathhouse. (8) At the same time, everyone in the village starts looking for hay, and Ivan Afrikanovich gets his turn. (9) Business as usual. (10) Mitka is called to the police, to the district (for complicity in the damage of the tractor and for hay), but by mistake they give fifteen days not to him, but to another Polyakov, also from Sosnovka (there is half a village of Polyakov). (11) mishka, on the other hand, spends his fifteen days right in his village, on the job, getting drunk in the evenings with the sergeant assigned to him.
(1) На пятый день хирург осматривал Прок: (1) On the fifth day, the surgeon examined Prokopy Ivanovich before Praskovya Andreyevna arrived. (1) Загадка кажется неразрешимой, но тут: (1) the riddle seems unsolvable, but then fate sends count von zelten to jean. (2) Jean once loved Celten as much as he loved Germany. (3) Now this country does not exist for him, but sometimes he feels the bitterness of loss. (4) At one time, Zelten came up with a fun game, offering to share disputed territories in the highest moments of friendship and love. (5) As a result, Zelten gave his friend the whole of Alsace, but Jean held firm and tore away from France only one insignificant district at a time when Zelten was especially like a naive, good-natured German. (6) When meeting Zelten, it is known that he fought for four years in order to return his gift. (7) There is a deep scar on his arm — Jean has never seen the healed mark of a French bullet before. (8) Zelten was still alive — perhaps some grain of love for Germany is still able to revive. After listening to Jean's story about the mysterious plagiarist, Zelten promises to find out everything and soon reports from Munich that Z. F. K. may be none other than Forestier. (9) At the very beginning of the war, a naked soldier was picked up on the battlefield in a feverish delirium — he had to be re-taught to eat, drink and speak German. (10) He was given the name Siegfried von Kleist in honor of Germany's greatest hero and most soulful of its poets.
(1) Тщетны увещевания матери, Виви полна: (1) Her mother's remonstrances are futile, and Vivi is determined to reject the capital she has made in this way. (2) She cannot understand why her mother will not give up her trade now that she is no longer dependent on it. (3) Mrs. Warren excuses herself as best she can: to die of boredom, that's what she's afraid of, because she's not fit for any other life. (4) And then it's profitable, and she likes to make money. (5) She agrees to everything, she promises not to bother her daughter, because constant traveling will not allow them to be together for a long time. (6) And when she dies, the daughter will finally get rid of the annoying mother. (7) However, despite all Mrs. Warren's tears, Vivi is adamant that she has a different job and a different road. (8) Her mother's argument that she also wanted to be a decent girl and mother, but circumstances did not allow her, has the opposite effect — now Vivi accuses her mother of hypocrisy: she herself would only lead the life that she considers right. (9) She may be cruel, but no one has the right to appeal to her daughter or any other duty. (10) She refuses her mother and her money. (11) She gives up on Frank, on her entire past life.
(1) Немецкий актер Готфрид Йон, известны: (1) German actor Gottfried Jon, known for his roles as General Urumov in the Bond film "Golden Eye" and Caesar in the film "Asterix and Obelix against Caesar", has died at the age of 73. \"(1) Компании \"Ростелеком\" и \"Скарте: "(1) Rostelecom and Skartel, operating under the Yota brand, will be able to deploy LTE networks on the frequencies previously allocated for WiMAX. (2) This statement was made by the head of Roskomnadzor Sergey Sitnikov, writes "RBC daily". (3) According to Sitnikov, the introduction of LTE will have to be carried out using the equipment specified earlier in the tender documentation for the allocation of frequencies for WiMAX. (4) The official stressed that the introduction of LTE is "hypothetically" possible. (5) One of the possible methods of re-equipment for LTE Sitnikov called it "flashing". (6) Skartel's plans to switch to the more promising LTE standard were announced in May 2010. (7) At the time, it was reported that the company intends to invest up to two billion dollars in this project. (8) At the same time, by the end of 2010, the first LTE networks should appear in five cities of Russia. (9) At the end of May, Deputy head of Roskomnadzor Alexander Katulevsky said that license holders for frequencies allocated for "fourth generation" communication networks will not be able to deploy LTE networks on their allocated bands instead of WiMAX. (10) However, earlier it was reported that the competitions are technologically neutral and do not require the deployment of WiMAX networks. (11) LTE technology allows data transfer at speeds of hundreds of megabits per second. (12) This is several times the maximum data transfer rate in WiMAX networks. (13) So far, LTE networks are deployed only in Oslo and Stockholm. (14) Similar networks are expected to appear in the United States and Europe by the end of the year."
\"(1) Правительство Донецкой народной ре: "(1) The Government of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) will create its own Republican Guard to protect order in the territory of the self-proclaimed state, RIA Novosti reports with reference to the head of the Committee on Prisoners of War and Refugees Leonid Baranov. (1) На ежегодном чемпионате по скорости: (1) At the annual Hot Dog Eating Speed Championship held in New York City on July 4, a new winner was determined. (2) They became 23-year-old Matthew Stonie (Matthew Stonie), who for the test 10 minutes swallowed 62 rolls with sausage, reports CNN. (3) Stoney is known among competitors by his nickname "Mega-toad" (Megatoad). (4) The record holder replaced on the podium his predecessor Joey Chestnut, who held the lead in this competition for the last eight years. (5) This year, Chestnut came in second with a score of 60 hot dogs eaten. (6) Last year, Stoney himself came in second, eating 56 sausage rolls. (7) This year, he improved his achievement by six points. (8) "I trained for this. (9) I can't say that I came confident, but I came ready," said the winner. (10) Nevertheless, the absolute record of 69 hot dogs eaten, set by Chestnut back in 2013, remained unsurpassed. (11) Miki Sudo wins the women's event for the second year in a row. (12) This time, in the same 10 minutes, a woman swallowed 38 hot dogs, last year 34 were enough to win. (13) Runner-up Sonya Thomas continues to hold the absolute record among women in 45 hot dog buns. (14) The competition for the speed of eating hot dogs among men has been held in New York annually since 1972. (15) In 2011, the Women's Eater Championship was added to the competition. (16) Other cities in the United States also hold their own competitions in the same discipline.

(1) Джо встречается с двумя полицейскими: (1) Joe meets with two police officers who inform him that there was a robbery in the neighborhood of his house last night. \"(1) Избирательная комиссия Ярославля п: "(1) The Election Commission of Yaroslavl recognized the election of the mayor of the city, which was won by the opposition leader Yevgeny Urlashov, as valid and held. \"(1) В США в понедельник, 9 августа, на: "(1) In the United States on Monday, August 9, the trial of the youngest prisoner of the American prison at Guantanamo begins. (2) According to AFP, the defendant will appear before a military commission, and this trial will be the first such trial during the presidency of Barack Obama. (3) Omar Khadr, a 23-year-old Canadian citizen, was detained in Afghanistan in 2002. (4) He was 15 years old at the time. (5) Khadr is accused of killing an American serviceman-a teenager threw a grenade at Sergeant Christopher Speer. (6) According to the Voice of America, if Khadr is found guilty, he faces life in prison. (7) Preliminary hearings in the case of Omar Khadr are scheduled for August 9, and the trial will take place on the 10th. (8) The 23-year-old Canadian will be tried by a panel of 15 jurors, which will consist of at least one-third of the military personnel. (9) Khadr's trial will be the first U.S. trial of a teenage gunman. (10) According to AFP, four Guantanamo prisoners have been convicted by military courts since 2001. (11) At the same time, the US federal courts have already sentenced about 200 terrorist suspects during this period. (12) Omar Khadr had previously appeared in court, but his trial was suspended at the request of the prosecution, filed at the request of Barack Obama. (13) Shortly after the inauguration, the President recommended that the cases of Guantanamo detainees be suspended. (14) During his election campaign, he also promised to close the prison."

(2) This is reported by Armenia Today. (3) The arrests were made as part of an investigation into a murder committed near the home of the head of the regional administration. (1) Реклама британского мобильного опера: (1) An ad by British mobile operator Three featuring a dancing Shetland pony became a YouTube hit, gaining more than 3.2 million views in a week. (2) The video was posted on February 28. (3) In the video, a pony named Sox dances in a meadow where his relatives graze, and, in particular, depicts the "moonwalk" of Michael Jackson. (4)The soundtrack in the video is the song "Everywhere" by Fleetwood Mac. (5) The video ends with the phrase: (6) " Stupid things are also important. (7) Keep surfing the Internet." (8) To promote the video, the hashtag #danceponydance and The Pony Mixer YouTube page were also invented, where you can come up with your own version of the video with ponies-in the style of hard rock, hip — hop, boy band, funk and others. (9) According to The Daily Mail, the ad was shot in the Shetland Islands. (10) The ponies were provided by a local breeder named Mary Williamson. (11) Williamson said that, despite the great success of the video, she was not going to sell Sox. (12) According to The Daily Mail, the pony was trained to "moonwalk" with a carrot in two weeks. (13) Several parodies have already been invented for the video, including the meme song "Harlem Shake" and the Michael Jackson song "Billie Jean". (14) Previously, photos of Shetland ponies in colored cardigans were distributed on the Internet. (15) The photo shoot was taken as part of the Visit Scotland travel advertising campaign.
\"(1) Главный тренер футбольного клуба Ц: "(1) The head coach of the CSKA football club Leonid Slutsky recognized the illogical victory of his team over Spartak Moscow (2:1) in the match of the 15th round of the Russian championship. (2) According to Slutsky, the logical result of the meeting would be a draw, writes the publication "Sport-Express". (3)" However, we were lucky, and we are very happy about it, " the mentor added. (4) The coach of the Army team said that his team deliberately gave the initiative to Spartak, as many newcomers came on the field. (5) However, when Spartak opened the scoring in the 72nd minute, CSKA moved "to the game number one". (6) Slutsky noted that the players ' performance was affected in the end of the match, but admitted that Wagner Love's winning goal was luck. (7) Spartak head coach Valery Karpin said that the whole team made a mistake in the third added minute (when the decisive goal was scored). (8) The mentor called his work unsatisfactory, but stressed that he was not afraid of personnel changes. (9) Note that Karpin also holds the post of General Director of Spartak. (10) In the match against CSKA, Spartak opened the scoring in the 72nd minute, when the ball was sent to their own goal by the Armenian Vasily Berezutsky. (11) In the 82nd minute, Sergei Ignashevich scored the return goal, and in the 93rd minute, the victory of CSKA was brought by Wagner Love. (12) After 15 rounds, the Army team with 30 points are in second place. (13) Spartak, which scored 20 points, shares seventh-eighth place with Terek Grozny."
(1) Саудовская Аравия отказалась принима: (1) Saudi Arabia refused to accept four dwarf igrunok (a type of small monkey) from the Swedish zoo because of political differences between the two countries. (2) This is reported by BBC News. (3) The primates were supposed to go to the Riyadh Zoo. (4) Jonas Wallstrom, director of the menagerie, which is located in the Skaansen ethnographic complex in Stockholm, criticized the Saudi decision. (5) " Because of the political situation, they don't need monkeys anymore. (6) it's pretty funny. (7) Now I can only wait for Swedish businessmen to need visas again. (8)Maybe they will be introduced for monkeys, " said Wallstrom. (9) On March 11, It was announced that saudi arabia had recalled the Ambassador From stockholm. (10) on march 10, Sweden Refused To extend the military agreement with the middle eastern kingdom. (11) This happened after Riyadh disrupted a speech planned for March 9 by Swedish Foreign Minister Margot Wallstrom to the foreign ministers of the Arab League member countries in Cairo. (12) The reason for this was Stockholm's criticism of Riyadh because of the human rights situation in Saudi Arabia, where the comments of Swedish officials are perceived as interference in the internal affairs of the state. (13) The pygmy igrunka is one of the smallest members of the entire order of primates. (14) They are between 11 and 15 centimeters in size and weigh between 100 and 150 grams. (15) These monkeys are common in Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia and Brazil.
(1) В 1812 г. французская армия двигаетс: (1) In 1812, the French army moves on Russia. (2) Austria, being an ally of Napoleon, also participates in this campaign with a thirty-thousandth corps under the command of Prince Schwarzenberg. (3) However, Von Paulich, to Daville's amazement, acts as if he wants to show the vizier and everyone around him that this war is entirely a French idea. (4) By the end of September, the capture of Moscow becomes known, but von Paulich, with impudent calmness, claims that he has no news of military operations, and avoids talking to Davil. (5) Ibrahim Pasha is surprised that Napoleon is moving north on the eve of winter, and tells Davil that it is dangerous. (6) Davil is tormented by painful forebodings. (7) Therefore, he is not surprised when he learns of the complete defeat of the French army in Russia. (8) A bitter winter is raging in Travnik, the people are suffering from hunger and cold, and for several months the consul is cut off from the outside world and receives no news. (9) In March, Davil learns that Ibrahim Pasha has been deposed. (10) For Davil, this is a heavy blow and an irreparable loss. (11) Ibrahim Pasha bids a cordial farewell to Davil, with whom he has become close over the years.
(1) Сотрудник полиции погиб в результате: (1) A police officer was killed in a shootout between law enforcement officers and the alleged owners of a drug den in Detroit, the Associated Press reported on May 4. (2) This is the first death of a police officer in the line of duty within the city limits in the last six years. (3) Four other police officers received injuries of varying severity. (4) It is reported that a police squad arrived at the building where the incident occurred early in the morning, after neighbors reported shots being fired in the house. (5) 42-year-old Brian Huff and his partner entered the building first, leaving less experienced colleagues at the entrance. (6) Two minutes later, Huff was killed. (7) The murder suspect tried to escape and was arrested. (8) According to unconfirmed reports, this is 25-year-old Jason Gibson, also known as James Everett. (9) He came to the attention of the police many times, including in connection with assaults on police officers, possession of cocaine and illegal acquisition of weapons. (10) He was convicted at least twice and violated the probation conditions. (11) Residents of neighboring houses told reporters that the house, apparently, was a drug den. (12) So, a woman living in the neighborhood several times offered to buy drugs when she passed by. (13) according to police officers, the deceased Brian huff was on night duty. (14) The call to the drug den came at the end of his shift. (15) the policeman left a wife and a ten-year-old child.
\"(1) Хоккеист московского ЦСКА Максим Г: "(1) CSKA Moscow hockey player Maxim Goncharov has signed a contract with the Phoenix Coyotes of the NHL, according to the official website of Phoenix. (2) Goncharov, who turns 21 on June 15, was selected by the Coyotes in the fifth round of the 2007 Rookie Draft with the 123rd overall pick. (3) The terms of the defender's contract with Phoenix are not disclosed. (4) Goncharov is considered one of the most promising Russian defenders. (5) In 2007, he won the World Junior Championship, and in 2009, he won the bronze medal of the World Youth Championship. (6) In addition, Goncharov has experience playing for the Russian first team in Euro Tour matches. (7) Goncharov made his debut for CSKA in the 2006-07 season and soon became one of the team's leaders. (8) In the 2009-10 regular season, he played 51 games, scored 17 points (four goals and 13 assists) and earned a+5 utility rating. (9) In three playoff games, the defender scored one goal. (10) The Phoenix Coyotes reached the NHL playoffs last season, but lost to the Detroit Red Wings in the 1/8 finals, losing the series with a score of 3:4. (11) Goncharov will become the second Russian in Phoenix. (12) The main goalkeeper of the team is Ilya Bryzgalov."
\"(1) В Екатеринбурге задержан участник: "(1) In Yekaterinburg detained a member of an extremist movement "Taliban" Asliddin Nurov, told TASS head of the press service of the main Department of the MIA in Sverdlovsk region Valery Burnt. (2) The issue of extradition of a citizen of Tajikistan to his homeland is currently being resolved. (3) during the search of the rented apartment, the security forces found and seized about ten books in a foreign language. (4) They are submitted for examination. (5) According to the police, Nurov is suspected of participating in illegal armed groups in Tajikistan. (6) "since 2010, he participated in combat operations on the side of the taliban on the border of afghanistan and pakistan," gorelykh said. (7) He added that in 2009, in the Pakistani city of Peshawar, the suspect mastered the eastern martial art. (8) In the period from 2005 to 2008, Nurov was trained in the norms of Islam in a religious institution in Iran. (9) The Taliban is a radical Islamist movement that originated in the Pashtun part of Afghanistan in the early 1990s. (10) During the civil war, it defeated the coalition forces of the Mujahideen. (11) By 1997, the Taliban had taken control of the entire territory of the country, with the exception of the Panjshir areas controlled by the Tajiks of the Northern Alliance. (12) The Taliban de facto ruled Afghanistan until 2001, when the United States launched an operation against them after the Al-Qaeda attack on the World Trade Center in New York. (13) The UN Security Council recognized the movement as a terrorist organization in 2003. (14) Al-Qaeda and the Taliban are banned in Russia."
(1) В Вашингтоне мужчина совершил попытк: (1) In Washington, a man attempted to self-immolate near the Capitol, Agence France-Presse reported on October 4. (2) The incident occurred on the territory of the National Park, near the Capitol. (3) A man (according to eyewitnesses — an African-American) poured a can of gasoline on his head, then set himself on fire. (4) The motives for his action have not yet been established. (5) Police and rescue workers arrived at the scene and extinguished the fire. (6) According to the witnesses, the victim thanked them for this. (7) The man was then taken by helicopter to the hospital. (8) According to The Washington Post, his injuries pose a threat to his life. (9) The day before, on October 3, 34-year-old Miriam Carey was shot dead near the Capitol, after she rammed through the White House fence and knocked down a US Secret Service officer. (10) After the woman tried to escape in her car and drove towards the Capitol, police opened fire. (11) Carey's one-year-old daughter was also in the car. (12) The girl was not injured in the pursuit. (13) Carey's motives are unknown. (14) According to law enforcement agencies, the woman had a mental disorder: she suffered from depression and believed that she was being persecuted by US President Barack Obama.
\"(1) Фронтмен группы Foo Fighters Дэйв: "(1) Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl will serve as the producer of a comedy television series that will be shown on the FX channel. (2) This is reported by Rolling Stone. (3) The project will be written by comedian Dana Gould, who for seven years participated in the creation of the animated series "The Simpsons". \"(1) В Ставропольском крае возбуждено д: "(1) In the Stavropol Territory, a case of fraud was initiated, from which a deputy of the State Duma of the Russian Federation suffered. (2) this is reported on the website of the investigative committee on november 1. (3) The IC does not name the victim, but based on the archival materials of the newspaper "Stavropol Pravda", we are talking about Andrei Murga. (4) The defendant in the case was Yevgeny Bondarenko. (5) on march 30, 2012, the stavropol chamber of commerce and industry, headed by murga, unexpectedly announced presidential elections. (6) Murga's term of office was due to expire in three years, but his opponents said that after being elected to the State Duma, he would not have enough time to manage the CCI. (7) Bondarenko became the new head of the CCI. (8) Murga did not agree with this. (9) On 25 August, the court reinstated him as President of the Chamber. (10) Now the Investigative Committee has learned that on August 22, Bondarenko demanded 1 million rubles from Murga. (11) In exchange, he promised to resign from the chamber himself and dismiss four other employees. (12) Bondarenko also promised to give a receipt for non-disclosure of defamatory information about the deputy. (13) murga appealed to law enforcement agencies. (14) bondarenko was detained while receiving a fake money and writing a receipt. (15) his actions are considered as an attempt at fraud."
(1) Дервиль, симпатизирующий влюблённым,: (1) derville, sympathetic to the lovers, intervenes in the conversation, wanting to explain to the viscountess the true state of affairs. (2) He begins from afar: in his student years he had to live in a cheap boarding house — there he met Gobseck. (3) Even then he was a very old man of very remarkable appearance — with a "moon face", yellow eyes like a ferret, a sharp long nose and thin lips. (4) His victims sometimes lost their temper, wept or threatened, but the usurer himself always kept his cool — it was a "man-bill", "golden idol". (5) Of all his neighbors, he maintained relations only with Derville, to whom he once revealed the mechanism of his power over people — the world is ruled by gold, and gold is owned by a usurer. (6) For edification, he tells how he collected a debt from a noble lady — fearing exposure, this countess did not hesitate to hand him a diamond, because the money on her bill was received by her lover. (7) gobseck guessed the future of the countess from the face of the fair-haired handsome man — this dandy, moth and gambler is capable of ruining the whole family. (8) after completing his law course, derville was appointed senior clerk in a solicitor's office. (9) in the winter of 1818/19, he was forced to sell his patent — and asked for one hundred and fifty thousand francs for it. (10) gobseck lent the young neighbor money, taking from him "out of friendship" only thirteen percent — usually he took at least fifty. (11) At the cost of hard work, Derville managed to pay off the debt in five years.
(1) Тик-так, тик-так! (2) Ночью в тишин: (1) Tick-tock, tick-tock! (2) At night, in silence and solitude, it is eerie to listen to the impassive eloquence of the pendulum of the clock: the sounds are monotonous and mathematically correct, monotonously marking always the same thing — the relentless movement of life. (3) Darkness and sleep envelop the earth, everything is silent — only the clock coldly and loudly marks the disappearance of seconds... (4) The pendulum knocks, and with each sound life is shortened by a second, by a tiny fraction of the time given to each of us, for a second that will not return to us. (5) Where do the seconds come from, and where do they disappear to? (6) No one will answer this... (7) And there are still many questions that are not answered, there are other, more important questions, and our happiness depends on their resolution. (8) How to live in order to realize that you are necessary for life, how to live without losing faith and desire, how to live so that not a single second disappears without disturbing the soul and mind? (9) will the clock, whose movement has no end, ever answer all this — what will the clock say to this? (10) tick-tock, tick-tock! (11) There is nothing in the world more dispassionate than a clock: they knock equally correctly at the moment of your birth, and at the time when you greedily pluck the flowers of the dreams of youth. (12) From the day of his birth, every day a person becomes closer to death. (13) And when you are wheezing in agony, the clock will count its seconds dryly and calmly. (14) In their cold account — listen — there is something all — knowing and tired of this knowledge. (15) Nothing ever excites them and is not dear to them. (16) They are indifferent, and if we want to live, we need to create for ourselves other hours full of sensations and thoughts, full of actions, in order to replace these boring, monotonous, soul-killing, reproachful and cold-sounding hours. (17) In the relentless movement of the clock, there is no fixed point — what do we call the present? (18) In one born second, a second is born and pushes the first into the abyss of the unknown... (19) Tick-tock! – and you're happy." (20) tick-tock! "and now the burning poison of grief is poured into your heart, and it can remain with us for the rest of your life, for all the hours of your life, if you do not try to fill every second of your life with something new and alive. (according to m. gorky).
(1) Федеральная прокуратура в Карлсруэ о: (1) The Federal Prosecutor's Office in Karlsruhe has officially filed charges of violating the international arms embargo on Iran against two men: 52-year-old Iranian Mohsen A. and 49-year-old engineer, a German citizen of Iranian origin Behzad Z. (Behzad S.), reports AFP. (2) It is reported that both defendants are to appear before the Supreme Land Court in Dusseldorf. (3) According to the prosecutor's office, for 850 thousand euros, they bought a vacuum furnace from a German company and sent it to Iran, which can be used to make heat-resistant nuclear missile warheads and guidance systems. (4) The purchase was initiated by one of the major Iranian officials responsible for the weapons development program. (5) The German Prosecutor's Office believes that the defendants were aware that the vacuum furnace they bought would be used to develop Iran's military program. (6) At the same time, Mohsen A. went to the deception, saying to the German seller that they themselves are the final buyers. (7) The furnace was delivered to Iran in March 2008, after which employees of the German company began to install it. (8) The work, however, was soon stopped, as there were suspicions that Mohsen A. was working for the Iranian government. (9) He was detained by German law enforcement authorities in October of the same year and has been in pre-trial detention in Germany ever since. (10) His accomplice Behzad Z. was left at large.
(1) Представители Движения сопротивления: (1) Representatives of the Afrikaner Resistance Movement (AWB) have refused to avenge their leader Eugene Terreblanche, who was killed last week in South Africa. (2) This is reported by BBC News with reference to a statement made by the representative of the organization Peter Steyn (Pieter Steyn). (3) According to him, none of the AWB members are going to resort to violence. (4) The organization issued this statement after representatives of the ruling party called the African National Congress (ANC) offered their condolences to the Terblanche family. (5) The leader of the party, President of the Republic of South Africa Jacob Zuma, also called on the population to remain calm. (6) Eugene Terblanche was found dead on his farm in north-west South Africa. (7) According to police, a sleeping 69-year-old politician was beaten to death by workers who were not paid for their work. (8) A 21-year-old man and a 15-year-old boy have already been arrested in this case. (9) The suspects are charged with murder. (10) Afrikaner Resistance activists opposed the negotiations that preceded the establishment of democracy in South Africa. (11) In the run-up to the 1994 election, they organized several terrorist attacks. (12) Eugene Terblanche himself, who fought for a white state, was sentenced to five years in prison for assaulting a gas station employee and attempting to kill a black security guard. (13) After his early release in 2004, he was not active in politics.
(1) Актёр Сергей Безруков назначен худож: (1) Actor Sergei Bezrukov has been appointed Artistic director of two theaters in the Moscow Region — the Moscow Regional Chamber Theater and the Ostrovsky Moscow Regional Drama Theater. (2) This was reported on Saturday by Interfax with reference to the press service of the regional governor's administration. (3) At the same time, RIA Novosti reports that Bezrukov has become the artistic director of the Moscow Regional House of Arts "Kuzminki", under the roof of which there are three theaters: the above-mentioned and the theater "Russian Ballet". (4) However, according to the information on the website of the latter, the artistic director of this theater is the People's Artist of the USSR V. M. Gordeev. (5) As the acting Governor Andrey Vorobyov noted, introducing the new artistic director to the cast, thanks to such a well-known cultural figure as Bezrukov, the prestige, artistic level and popularity of the House of Arts will rise. (6) In response, Bezrukov said that he would combine the work of the artistic director of the House of Arts and the actor of "Snuffbox", where he works now. (7) The new artistic director did not disclose his creative plans. (8) 39-year-old Sergey Bezrukov is a People's Artist of Russia. (9) He received this title in 2008. (10) In 2001, he became an Honored Artist of the Russian Federation. (11) Is a laureate of the State Prize of the Russian Federation, the "Chaika", "Idol" awards and others. (12) Bezrukov's most famous roles are in the cinema ("Pushkin. The Last Duel", "Irony of Fate 2") and on television ("Brigade", "Master and Margarita", "Plot", "Yesenin").
(1) Константин Павлович Карновский родил: (1) Konstantin Pavlovich Karnovsky was born in Kazan, in a large middle-class poor family. (2) Both under the father and after his death, the children lived in constant humiliation. (3) But Kostya managed to defend his independence: he studied hard, went to university and began to provide for the whole family. (4) Even when Kostya was preparing to enter the gymnasium, an internal "countdown" began for him: not a minute could be lost in vain. (5) But the established order of his life was turned upside down every time he met Lisa. (6) Her "grace, sincerity, and carelessness" spoke of the existence of "some immutable truth that was stronger than all his mathematics and did not require any proof." (7) In St. Petersburg, Lisa listens to lectures, goes to theaters and museums. (8) In one of her letters, she tells about a trip to her aunt in Moscow — here, at a dispute about painting, she suddenly really wanted to be like the artist Goncharova. (9) Lisa is waiting for a date with Kostya: it seems to her that only with him can she share her doubts, hopes and desires. (10) after all, karnovsky "lives consciously, does not rush from side to side", as she did. (11) But a short visit to Kazan on the way to Yalta, where Liza is going to treat her lungs, does not give her satisfaction: she doubts karnovsky, his love.
\"(1) Бразильский футбольный тренер Луис: "(1) brazilian football coach luiz felipe scolari said that he will not be able to lead his national team after the world cup in south africa. (2) On July 4, Dunga resigned as coach of the Brazilian team, and Scolari was named as one of his possible successors. (3) however, the coach ruled out the possibility of his appointment, according to the associated press. (4) shortly before the start of the 2010 world cup, scolari took charge of brazilian club palmeiras, signing a two-year contract. (5) According to the mentor, he will not consider any proposals until 2012. (6) At the same time, Scolari admitted that he would like to finish his career as head coach of the Brazilian national team, especially since the 2014 World Cup will be held in his homeland. (7) Scolari already managed the Brazilian national team in 2001-2002 and led his team to World Cup victories in Japan and South Korea. (8) He then worked with the Portuguese national team for six years. (9) Before taking over at Palmeiras, Scolari coached Uzbekistan's Bunyodkor. (10) Dunga took charge of the Brazilian national team in the summer of 2006, immediately after the World Cup in Germany. (11) Under his leadership, the team won the 2007 Copa America and took first place in the 2010 World Cup qualifying tournament in South America. (12) However, at the World Championship in South Africa, the Brazilians finished the fight at the 1/4 final stage, losing to the Netherlands (1: 2). (13) In addition to Scolari, Leonardo is called a candidate for the post of the new head coach of the Brazilian national team. (14) He coached AC Milan last season, but was sacked in May."
\"(1) Проект нового федерального закона: "(1) The draft of the new federal law "On Education" will be posted on the Internet for public discussion on December 1, as previously happened with the law "On Police". (2) This was stated by the Minister of Education and Science of Russia Andrey Fursenko on October 3 at a plenary session in the Public Chamber. (3) His words are reported by Interfax. (4) The Agency also names the address of the website that the Minister has named - zakonoproekt.ru (the police law, we recall, was discussed on the website zakonoproekt2010.ru (5) However, the specified Internet address is for sale. (6) The estimated date of sale is the end of January 2011. (7)" A strong request: please be realistic when offering your price, " the site's sellers wrote. (8) Fursenko stated that a ready-made document will be put up for discussion, and not the materials for it. (9) He noted that the document has already been edited, " repeated sentences have been removed." (10)" i believe that now the position has been clarified, the project has been worked out, " the minister said. (11) the initiative of the national discussion of the law on education in early october was made by russian president dmitry medvedev (previously, according to his idea, the police law was also discussed on the internet). (12) "Education is no less important than law enforcement," the head of State said. (13) A special commission will be created to organize the hearings of the draft law, and Medvedev proposed that his adviser Veniamin Yakovlev head it."
(1) Сотрудники испанских правоохранитель: (1) Spanish law enforcement officers detained a 41-year-old US citizen who threatened to kill physicist Stephen Hawking. (2) He arrived in Tenerife to participate in the Starmus-2016 science Festival, The Local reported on Friday, July 1. (1) Однажды Архимед сел в ванну и вдруг: (1) One day Archimedes sat down in the bath and suddenly felt as if he had become lighter. (2) He had taken a bath before, and many before him had done the same. (3) But until this historical event, it never occurred to anyone that a body immersed in a liquid loses in its weight as much as the liquid displaced by the body weighs. (4) Archimedes was surprised. (5)When he was surprised, he thought. (6) And when he thought, he discovered the great secret of nature. (7) Maybe it didn't happen like that. (8) But the fact remains that Archimedes ' law exists, and those who receive "twos" for not knowing it can confirm it. (9) It seems to me that all discoveries come from the fact that people are not indifferent. (10) That they know how to be surprised. (11) Let's say Newton was sitting in the garden. (12) Looks – an apple fell. (13) Well, it fell and fell. (14) Go up and eat it. (15) No one was ever surprised by this. (16) And Newton was surprised: "Why did it fall?" (17) Was surprised, pondered and discovered the law of universal gravitation. (18) Of course, all this is much more complicated. (19) all this required a lot of work, a lot of knowledge. (20) I tell you this so easily because you probably know it, and I only want to say that if you do not know how to be surprised, if you are indifferent, you will be bored in the world. (By l. i. likhodeev)
