(1) Телемак рассказывает о Египте, где ц: (1) Telemachus tells of Egypt, where Sesostris reigns, a wise prince who loves the people as his children. (10) because of avarice, he is distrustful, suspicious and bloodthirsty, drives the rich, fears the poor, everyone hates him. (11) violent death threatens him both in his "impenetrable halls" and in the midst of all his bodyguards. (12) "The good Sesostris, on the contrary,"says Telemachus," was safe in the midst of an innumerable people, like a father in a house in the circle of an amiable family."

(1)Осень в этом году стояла вся напролёт: (1)autumn this year was dry and warm All day long. (2)Birch groves did not turn yellow for a long time. (3) The grass did not wither for a long time. (4) only a bluish haze covered the reaches of the oka and the distant forests. (5) I was sailing down the river in a boat, and suddenly I heard someone in the sky begin to carefully pour water from a ringing glass vessel into another similar vessel. (6)The water gurgled, tinkled, and gurgled. (7) These sounds filled the whole space between the river and the firmament. (8)It was the cranes that were purring. (9) I raised my head. (10)Large schools of cranes stretched one after another straight to the south. (11)They walked steadily and steadily to the south, where the sun played with fluttering gold in the backwaters of the Oka, flew to a warm country. (12) I threw down the oars and looked at the cranes for a long time. (13)a few days before this meeting with the cranes, a magazine asked me to write an article about what a "masterpiece" is and talk about some literary masterpiece. (14)In other words, about a perfect and immaculate work. (15)I chose Lermontov's poems. (16)now on the river, i thought that masterpieces exist not only in art, but also in nature. (17)Is it not a masterpiece of this clique of cranes and their majestic flight along the airways that have been unchanged for many millennia? (18)What can I say! (19)Each autumn leaf was a masterpiece, the finest ingot of gold and bronze, sprinkled with cinnabar and black. (20)Each leaf was a perfect creation of nature, a work of her mysterious art, inaccessible to us, people. (By K. G. Paustovsky*)
\"(1) Группа Dream Theater нашла себе но: "(1) dream theater has found a new drummer. (2) As reported on the official website of the band, it was Mike Mangini. (1)Хотя лейтенанта Володина тошнило и го: (1)Although Lieutenant Volodin was sick and his head was like lead, although he felt terribly weak, his legs were weak and his hands were like strangers, he was now walking to his platoon, to the village, to the positions where the battle was still thundering. (2) Went to perform a soldier's duty. (3) Behind the dust raised by artillery shells, the extreme Solomkin huts were barely visible. (4)The bursts darted across the field, flared up to the right and left along the highway, and between the bursts, tacking, two "Willis"made their way. (5)at last the willis came out of the fire, and suddenly they were so close that he could see clearly even the faces of those sitting behind the windscreen. (6)He immediately recognized the lieutenant-General, a member of the Military Council of the Voronezh Front, who yesterday, together with the commander, inspected the defensive structures in Solomki. (7)Volodin caught himself, wanted to move to the side of the road, but it was too late, the front "Willis", creaking brakes, stopped right in front of him. - (8)Injured?  The general asked, not waiting for Volodin to report who he was, why he was standing on the highway, what he was doing, and what he was going to do. "(9)No, Comrade General, "Volodin replied in embarrassment, noticing how the general was looking intently at his face and clothes, and thought:" It's going to fly in! " (10)But a member of the Military Council of the front suddenly turned to the colonel sitting behind him and said – - This is the same lieutenant...- (11)From machine gun nests? - (12)Well ... (13)The general and the colonel sitting behind him knew many details of the battle of Solomkin, they also knew about Volodin, how he was sent to the machine-gun nests, how he was hit by a tank and how the soldier risked his life to save him, his commander. – (14)in There? – (15)Yes, to the company, Comrade General!- (16)Released? (17)Discharged? – (18)He left himself – " Volodin added, and thought that lying under the bombs was much easier than standing in front of the general. (19)Although he was worried, he was still satisfied that he had told the truth. (By A. A. Ananyev)
(1) Немец Михаэль Х. (Michael H.) выигра: (1) German Michael H. (Michael H.) won the case against the bank Comdirect, which mistakenly transferred 200 million euros to his account, writes Hamburger Abendblatt. (2) The representatives of the bank claimed that their client carried out transactions with money that did not actually belong to him, so he should pay compensation. (3) However, the court sided with Michael H. (4) The Bank is going to appeal against this decision. (5) The incident that gave rise to the current trial occurred in April 2011. (6) Michael H. sold the shares for 20 thousand euros, and the bank Comdirect, through which the operation was carried out, mistakenly deposited 200 million euros in his account. (7) After seeing this amount of money, the German immediately transferred 10 million euros to an account in another bank. (8) As a result, Comdirect recovered all 200 million euros. (9) However, due to the weekend, the bank was able to receive ten million euros, which ended up in another bank, only three days later. (10) For this delay, Comdirect decided to charge the German 14.4 percent for the overdraft of the account, or 12 thousand euros. (11) Michael H. sued, claiming that the bank had not had time to suffer such losses. (12) He was willing to pay one thousand euros, Comdirect agreed to reduce the amount of interest only to six thousand euros. (13) The reason for the bank error, as it turned out, was a computer failure, due to which the comma in the amount was put in the wrong place.
\"(1) По делу о попытке теракта на Таймс: "(1) In the case of the attempted terrorist attack on Times Square in New York, the first suspect was arrested, reports AFP. \"(1) Татарская транспортная прокуратура: "(1) The Tatar Transport Prosecutor's Office will conduct an inspection in connection with the delay of the flight of the airline" Tatarstan "from Kazan to Moscow on September 30, Interfax reports. (1) Природа — зеркало нас. (2) Видящий в: (1) Nature is a mirror of us. (2) He who sees in it the mill of death sees enemies everywhere. (11) A friend tells him a fairy tale-a parable about a beautiful young man Hyacinth, whom the girl Roseflower fell in love with. \"(1) Глава Чечни Рамзан Кадыров рассказ: "(1) The head of Chechnya Ramzan Kadyrov spoke about plans to create tourist bases in the mountainous regions. (1) Родилась она под Киевом, в тихом име: (1) She was born near Kiev, in the quiet estate of her father, the hero of the war with Napoleon, General Raevsky. (2) Masha was the favorite of the family, learned everything that a young noblewoman needed, and after school she sang carelessly in the garden. (3) The old General Raevsky wrote memoirs, read magazines, and gave balls to which his former comrades-in-arms gathered. (4) The queen of the ball was always Masha — a blue-eyed, black-haired beauty with a thick blush and a proud step. (5) The girl easily captured the hearts of the Hussars and uhlans who stood with regiments near the Raevsky estate, but none of them touched her heart. (6) As soon as Masha was eighteen years old, her father found her a fiance — a hero of the war of 1812, wounded at Leipzig, beloved by the sovereign General Sergei Volkonsky. (7) The girl was confused by the fact that the groom was much older than her and she did not know him at all. (8) but the father said sternly: "You'll be happy with him!" and she didn't dare protest. (9) The wedding took place two weeks later. (10) Masha did not often see her husband after the wedding: he was constantly on official trips, and even from Odessa, where he finally went to rest with his pregnant wife, Prince Volkonsky suddenly had to take Masha to his father. (11) The departure was alarming: the Volkonskys left at night, burning some papers before doing so. (12) Volkonsky was no longer able to see his wife and first-born son under his own roof...
(1) Заключённые подняли бунт в колонии №: (1) Prisoners rioted in colony No. 6 in the Kirovohrad region of Ukraine. (2) on friday, june 3, the former head of the state penitentiary service, sergei starenky, wrote about this on his facebook page. (6)In addition, the former civil servant believes that the unrest may spread to other places of detention. (7) According to him, the prisoners of the correctional colony No. 49 and the Pre-trial Detention Center of the Kirovograd region are ready to support the riots. \"(1) Бывшего офицера МЧС Юрия Жидкова п: "(1) Former EMERCOM officer Yuri Zhidkov was sentenced to 11 years in prison for the murder of former participant of the show" Dom-2 " Andrey Kadetov. (1) Андрей собирается на работу, когда е: (1) Andrey is going to work when an offended Masha calls him and, crying into the phone, again threatens to commit suicide. \"(1) Британский фотограф-любитель Марк: "(1) British amateur photographer Mark Bridger captured an owl living in a small brick barn. (1) Martin decides to write for a living. (2) He rents a tiny room from the Portuguese Maria Silva. (3) His powerful health allows him to sleep for five hours a day. (4) The rest of the time he works: he writes, learns unfamiliar words, analyzes the literary techniques of various writers, searches for "the principles underlying the phenomenon." (5) It doesn't bother him too much that not a single line of his has been printed yet. (6) "For him, writing was the final link in a complex mental process, the last knot that connected individual disparate thoughts, the summation of accumulated facts and propositions." (7) But the bad luck streak continues, Martin's money runs out, he pawns his coat, then his watch, then his bicycle. (8) He starves, eating only potatoes and occasionally dining with his sister or Ruth. (9) Suddenly — almost unexpectedly-Martin receives a letter from a thick magazine. (10) The journal wants to publish his manuscript, but is going to pay five dollars, although, according to the most conservative estimates, it should have paid a hundred. (11) The weakened Martin falls ill with a severe flu. (12) And then the wheel of fortune turns — one by one, the checks from the magazines begin to arrive.
\"(1) Президентом Латвии избран Андрис Б: "(1) Andris Berzins has been elected President of Latvia. (2) This is reported by the Telegraph on June 2.Berzins, a former banker, was elected head of state by deputies of the Latvian Sejm (Latvia is a parliamentary republic, and the president is chosen by deputies). (3) In the second round of voting, he received 53 votes in his favor. (4) To win, the candidate had to get at least 51 votes out of 100. (5) Berzins ' opponent in the election was the current President of Latvia, Valdis Zatlers. (6) His candidacy was supported by 41 parliamentarians; 56 opposed. (7) As Interfax adds, three parliamentarians spoke out against both candidates. (8) Two ballots were declared invalid. (9) A second round of voting was required because none of the candidates received the required minimum number of votes in the first round. (10) In particular, Berzins won the support of 50 deputies of the Sejm in the first round. (11) Five lawmakers voted against both candidates in the first round.Zatlers ' term expires on July 7, 2011. (12) He became the first President of Latvia not to be re-elected for a second term. (13) As noted, Zatlers ' position was shaken by his recent speech, in which he harshly criticized the deputies and announced the beginning of the procedure for dissolving the Seimas."
(1) Начались осенние ливни и бури, по но: (1) Autumn showers and storms began, and at night the poplar creaked, groaned, and beat its branches against the wall, as if asking for protection from the weather. (2) Gradually the leaves were flown from its branches, first from the upper, then from the lower. (3) The leaves streamed down in streams, covering the balcony, and some stuck to the glass and looked in horror into the room, waiting for something. (4)And now not a single leaf was left on the poplar, it stood naked, black, as if burned, and against the blue sky every black twig, every vein was visible, it was solemnly quiet and sad in nature, the sun was not warming in summer. (5) And, as always, I remembered my childhood and thought: Who are you? (6) What is the meaning of life? (7) Then again it was spring, and everything was over again, and life seemed endless. (8) But one morning I heard a sound under the window, as if my poplar was screeching. (9) I rushed to the window. (10) Below, there were scrapers and road rollers that were breaking through a new street, and a worker was felling a poplar tree in the middle of the road with an electric saw. (11) And from above I saw a tremor pass through his whole green body, he staggered, thought for a moment, and fell into the new street, blocking it to its full width with a rustling green avalanche of leaves. (12) and the red-brick, dull, bare wall of the house on the other side of the street was revealed to me, and since then i have seen only it and a piece of the sky. (13) i often think of my poplar tree. (14) And it still seems that it has not disappeared from the earth, but is growing somewhere in the forest, in a clearing, making a noise with all its leaves. (According to B. Yampolsky)
(1) Король Иордании Абдалла II проедет п: (1) King Abdullah II of Jordan will ride through Russia on a motorcycle, RIA Novosti reports. \"(1) Редкий сингл группы The White Stri: "(1) a rare single by the white stripes was sold at auction for $ 12,700, according to new musical express. (2) the auction took place a few days ago. (1)Многие считают понятие чести устарелы: (1)Many consider the concept of honor outdated, out of date, in the sense that it is not applicable today — not those conditions. (2) For some, this is due to actions such as a duel: they say, how else can you protect your honor from insults?(3)Others believe that honor is now replaced by a higher concept — integrity. (4)Instead of a man of honor — a man of principles ... (5)How can a sense of honor, a sense of self-esteem, a purely personal moral sense become obsolete?(6)How can the concept of honor, which is given to a person once, along with a name, and which can neither be replaced nor corrected, which can only be preserved, become obsolete?(7)I remember a case connected with the name of A. P. Chekhov. (8) In 1902, the tsarist government annulled the election of Maxim Gorky as an honorary academician. (9)in protest, korolenko and chekhov refused the title of academicians. (10)For Chekhov, this was not only a public act, but also a personal one. (11)He wrote in a statement that when Gorky was elected, he saw him and was the first to congratulate him. (12) and now that the academy of sciences has announced that the elections are invalid, it turns out that he, chekhov, as an academician, recognizes this. (13)"i congratulated cordially, and i recognize the elections as invalid — such a contradiction does not fit in my mind, i could not reconcile my conscience with it," he wrote to the academy of sciences.— And after much thought, I could only come to one decision... on resigning from me the title of honorary academician". (14) but such were the circumstances, seemingly independent of chekhov, and he could find an excuse for himself. (15)beliefs, of course, are a necessary thing. (16)But there is such a simpler, more concrete concept as a word given by a person. (17)it is not confirmed by any document or reference. (18)just a word. (According to D. Granin)
\"(1) В Санкт-Петербурге к 15 годам лише: "(1) In St. Petersburg, Vladimir Stepanov, nicknamed Blondin, who was found guilty of a series of rapes of minors, was sentenced to 15 years in prison. (2) This was reported on June 7 on the website of the city administration of the UPC of the Russian Federation. (3) The 26-year-old defendant was found guilty under article 132 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation ("violent acts of a sexual nature"), as well as 162 ("robbery"). (4) It is established that Stepanov committed seven attacks, which affected 12 boys aged 9-12 years. (5) Three boys were robbed of their cell phones by a pedophile. (6) Rumors about a blond maniac began to spread in St. Petersburg in 2007. (7) In October 2008, investigators reached out to Stepanov and tried to detain him. (8) However, he jumped out of the window of his apartment and disappeared. (9) The suspect was put on the wanted list. (10) He was detained in January 2009. (11) According to the newspaper "Komsomolskaya Pravda", in court Stepanov said that he admits guilt and is disgusted by his own actions. (12) The pedophile said that he will regularly go to church if he ever gets released. (13) If this does not help to get rid of the attraction to boys, then he intends to castrate himself."
(1)С чьей-то лёгкой руки природу русског: (1)With someone's light hand, the nature of the Russian North is described by journalists as low-key, dim and modest. (2) Meanwhile, nowhere in the country are there such bright, expressive, very contrasting and multi-voiced colors as in the North of Russia. (3)The beauty of these places is not only due to the variety of landscapes, combining low mountains, hills, valleys, ravines, lakes and rivers, framed by forests, meadows, shrubs; it is also due to the diverse, constantly changing landscape moods. (4) This change sometimes takes place in a matter of seconds, not to mention the changes associated with the four seasons. (5) A forest lake from a deep blue can instantly transform into a silvery-lilac one, if you blow a light comic breeze from the forest. (6)Rye field and birch forest, river bosom and meadow grass change their colors depending on the strength and direction of the wind. (7) But besides the wind, there is also the sun and the sky, the time of day and night, the new moon and the full moon, heat and cold. (8)The innumerable changes of states and combinations of all this are immediately reflected in the landscape, accompanied by the peculiarity of smells, sounds, and even absolute silence, such as occurs in the pre-dawn period of a white windless night, or in a winter night, also completely windless and not cold. (9)Recall the short, almost black-and-white winter days, accompanied by seemingly one graphic: white fields, black forests and hedges, gray houses and buildings. (10)Even at this time, the snow has its own shades, and what to say about a sunny morning and a frosty evening dawn!(11)A person does not yet have such colors, and there are no names for many color states of the sunset or morning sky. (12)To say that the dawn is scarlet (or crimson, or purple), means almost nothing to say: the dawn changes its colors and shades every minute, the colors on the horizon are one, a little higher are completely different, and the very border between the dawn and the sky does not exist. (13)And what color do you call the winter crust, which is brightly blinding with the sun's brilliance, bluish-translucent in the shade and silvery, as if melting under direct rays?(14)the frosty sun gives rise to the same richness of color tones as, for example, warm in spring. (15)But even in dense clouds, especially before the beginning of spring, the winter landscape is heterogeneous, the snow is bluish, with faint yellowing forest on a little smoky purple with almost bluish brown over the middle willows, grey alder, clear pine greens salad and subtle color of the aspens. (16)Such a pre-spring state is associated with a peaceful silence, with the smells of snow, wood flesh, hay, and stove smoke. (17) And how many states of the night's deep purple sky with clusters of stars going into perspective and infinity!(18)The spring and summer sky changes its colors just as quickly, does not skimp on shades and colors, its generosity in colors is boundless, the green colors of the forest and the color of the water surface in lakes and rivers are constantly changing. (19)The water is light, steely, then blue, then blue to inky density, then suddenly, especially in the silence of the first autumn cold, it becomes greenish. (20)You have to be deaf and blind or painfully absorbed in something detached-your own, not to notice these endlessly changing pictures of the world. (By V. Belov*)
(1)От нашего класса у меня остались восп: (1) From our class, I still have memories and one photo. (2)Group portrait with the class teacher in the center, girls around and boys around the edges. (3) The photo has faded, the edges that were blurred when shooting are now completely blurred; sometimes it seems to me that they have blurred because the boys of our class have long since passed into eternity, never having had time to grow up, and their features have been dissolved by time. (4) Of the forty-five people who once completed 7 "B", nineteen survived to gray hair. (5) For some reason, I don't want to remember now how we ran away from school, made a crush in the locker room, just for a moment to touch the one we loved so secretly that we didn't admit it to ourselves. (6) And since childhood, we have played with what we lived ourselves. (7)Classes competed not for grades or percentages, but for the honor of writing a letter to Papanin or being called "Chkalovsky", for the right to attend the opening of a new plant shop or to allocate a delegation to meet Spanish children. (8) And I also remember how I grieved that I would not be able to help the Chelyuskinites, because my plane made an emergency landing somewhere in Yakutia, never reaching the ice camp. (9)The real landing: I got "bad" without learning the poem. (10)Then I learned it: "yes, there were people in our time..." (11) and the fact was that on the wall of the classroom hung a huge homemade map and each student had his own plane. (12)an excellent grade gave five hundred kilometers, but i got a "bad", and my plane was taken off the flight. (13) "bad" was not just in the school magazine: it was bad for me and a little bit! - chelyuskintsam, which I so failed. (14) I spend hours looking at the faded photo, on the already blurred faces of those who are not on this earth: I want to understand. (15)After all, no one wanted to die, right? (16) And we did not know that there was a war on duty outside our classroom. (17)we were young, and the ignorance of youth is made up for by the belief in our own immortality. (18)But of all the boys who look at me from the photo, there are only four left alive. (According to B. L. Vasiliev*)
(1) Берг взял краски, бумагу и пошёл на: (1) Berg took paints and paper and went to the lake. (2) He was in a hurry. (3)He wanted to give all the power of colors, all the skill of his hands and sharp eyes, all that trembled somewhere in his heart, to this paper, so that at least in a hundredth part he could depict the splendor of these forests, dying majestically and simply. (4)Berg worked like a man possessed. (5) No one has ever seen him like this! (6)When Berg returned to the city, he found a notice about the exhibition. (7) He was asked to indicate how many of his belongings he would display. (8)Berg sat down at the table and wrote quickly: "I exhibit only one sketch in watercolor, made by me this summer – my first landscape." (9)it was midnight. (10)Shaggy snow was falling on the windowsill outside. (11)In the next apartment, someone was playing a Grieg sonata on the piano. (12)Berg wanted to trace the subtle ways in which he had developed a clear and joyful sense of home. (13)It matured for years, but the last push was given by the forest edge, autumn, the cries of cranes... (14)Why? (15)Berg couldn't find an answer, even though he knew it was. (16)berg knew that he was now connected with his country not only with his mind, but with his whole heart, as an artist, and that his love of his country had made his intelligent but dry life warm and cheerful. (17)a hundred times more beautiful than before. (By K. G. Paustovsky)
(1) Two days later, the antique dealer did not appear. (2) On the fifth day, Anna Vyacheslavovna called him herself. (3) "I'm on a business trip, not in Moscow —" the young man replied. - (4) I will come in two days — and immediately to you with a book." (5) A week passed after this conversation. (1) С возвращением Барберена Реми с ужас: (1) With the return of Barberin, Remy is horrified to learn that he is not his own son, but an adopted one. (2) One day Barberin found a five-month-old child in the street with marks cut off on his clothes. (3) Barberin offered to take the boy in until his parents were found. (4) Judging by the clothes, the child was from a rich family and Barberin was counting on a good reward. (5) Then the Barberin family had a son of their own, and Barberin's wife was able to feed two. (6) But the Barberens ' son soon died, and the woman became attached to Remy, forgetting that he was not her own child. (7) Now Remy becomes a burden and Barberin demands that his wife give him to an orphanage. (8) Barberin succumbs to the persuasions of his wife, decides to ask the village administration for an allowance for Remy. (9) But he meets the wandering artist Vitalis, who wanders with a monkey and three dogs, earning his living from circus performances. (10) vitalis offers to buy remy from barberin, in order to make him his assistant. (11) Before the boy can say goodbye to the woman he loves as his own mother, Barberin sells Remy.
\"(1) В далекие времена жили по соседств: "(1) in ancient times, a rooster and a peacock lived next door. (2) The rooster was much more beautiful than the peacock. (3) His golden-yellow feathers glittered in the sun, all shimmering. (4) all the birds were jealous of the rooster's outfit. (5) They sat on the top of a tree and complained that they did not have such a beautiful outfit. (6) The cock was very proud of the dress and was only friends with the peacock, and was not friends with anyone else. (7) The rooster was pacing back and forth, gravely pecking at the seeds. (8) One day the peacock was going to visit distant countries. (9) He began to regret that his clothes were too poor for the guests. (10) " Who am I going to be in this outfit at a party? (11) Maybe I should ask for an outfit from a rooster? (12) Will he give it or not? " he doubted. (13) After thinking about it, he went to ask the rooster: "Give me your outfit until tomorrow." (14) The rooster, after reflecting, said: (15) The peacock answers him: "If I do not come at dawn, then you call me, I will come to your call without fail. (16) If I do not come in the morning, then shout at noon, if I do not come at noon, then shout in the evening. (17) I will certainly arrive in the evening.""
(1) Основатель Tesla Motors Илон Маск за: (1) The founder of Tesla Motors, Elon Musk, said that he does not consider Apple as a competitor, despite rumors about the electric car being developed by its specialists, reports the German newspaper Handelsblatt. (2) In an interview with the publication, Musk explained his point of view, noting that Apple accepts engineers dismissed from Tesla Motors. (3) " We always jokingly call Apple the Tesla graveyard. (4) Those who have failed to work in our company, go to them. (5) I'm not kidding," he said. (6) At the same time, Musk praised Apple for its commitment to electric vehicles. (7)" It is logical for them to move in this direction if they want to present something truly revolutionary, " he stressed. (8) In his opinion, to retain the title of innovator, Apple is no longer enough for a new pencil or a larger iPad. (9) But, as Musk noted, cars are much more complicated than smartphones and watches. (10) The head of Tesla Motors considers Chinese companies to be serious competitors. (11) He explained that there are four electric car startups in the United States alone, valued at over a billion dollars and funded by Chinese businessmen. (12) Officially, Apple has not yet confirmed that it is developing the car, but the media reported that the novelty, codenamed Titan, will be put into production by 2019. (13) It is reported that the company does not plan to make its first electric car fully autonomous. (14) Apple has hired several experts on self-driving cars, but the possibility of implementing such a project is part of the long-term plans.
(1) Подозреваемый по делу о перестрелке: (1) The suspect in the case of the shooting in a bar in Hanover, which resulted in the death of two people, has surrendered to the authorities. (2) This is reported by The Local. (3) According to the newspaper, 42-year-old German citizen Holger B. (Holger B.) surrendered to the authorities of the Spanish island of Majorca, where he left after the incident on Tuesday, July 6. (4) The suspect is currently in custody in the capital of the island province of Palma. (5) The incident occurred on July 5 in a bar in Hanover. (6) Visitors to the venue had an argument about the performances of their favorite teams at the World Cup and other football championships. (7) After an argument, one of the visitors ran out into the street, but soon returned with a gun and opened fire on his interlocutors. (8) The victims were Italian citizens, 47-year-old Franco Siccu and 49-year-old Giuseppe Longhitano. (9) Initially, only one of the men was reported dead, but it soon became known that both died from their injuries. (10) It was also not confirmed that the suspect in the murder was detained by the German police immediately after the incident. (11) According to Hanover Police officials, investigators immediately assumed that the suspect had fled to Majorca, a popular holiday destination among Germans. (12) Up to four million German citizens visit the island every year. (13) The Hanover Prosecutor's Office is confident that there will be no problems with the extradition of Holger B. to Germany.
(1) Молодой лейтенант Джованни Дрого, ис: (1) Young lieutenant Giovanni Drogo, filled with bright hopes for the future, is assigned to the fortress of Bastiani, located next to the boundless Tatar desert, from where, according to legend, the enemies came. (2) Or did not come. (3) After much wandering, the lieutenant finally finds his way to the Fortress. (4) During the journey, Drogo's enthusiasm for his first assignment fades, and the sight of the bare, yellowish walls of the fort is absolutely depressing. (5) Major Matti, understanding the mood of the young officer, says that he can file a report on his transfer to another place. (6) In the end, the confused Drogo decides to stay in the Fortress for four months, At Drogo's request, Lieutenant Morel leads Drogo to the wall, beyond which stretches a plain framed by rocks. (7) beyond the rocks is the unknown north, the mysterious tatar desert. (8) They say that there are "solid stones". (9) The horizon there is usually covered with fog, but it is claimed that they saw white towers, a smoking volcano, or "some oblong black spot"... (10) All night Drogo can not sleep: water squelches behind his wall, and nothing can be done about it. (11) Soon Drogo takes over the first watch and observes the changing of the guard, performed under the command of senior sergeant Tronk, who has served in the Fortress for twenty-two years and knows by heart all the subtleties of the fortress regulations. (12) The Tronk Soldier does not leave the Fortress even during his vacation,
(1) В крупном университетском городе, в: (1) In a large university city, in the family of Sarah and David Shapiro, a university applicant Gersh Rabinovich rents a room for a rather large price. (2) Sarah is surprised that the young man does not understand a word of Hebrew, hears for the first time that a Jew should have the right to reside in the city, does not know Jewish customs and traditions. (3) But nevertheless, making fun of Hersh, Sarah is pleased with her lodger. (4) a friendly, cheerful young man is engaged for free with his younger son semka and with his older daughter betty. (5) Sarah dreams that Semka will get a gold medal. (6) At the university, Gersh Rabinowitz meets Jewish youths who are trying to enroll. (7) He meets the applicants Tumarkin and Lapidus. (8) Tumarkin is outraged by the cowardly Lapidus, who is ready to please the oppressors. (9) Lapidus, in turn, hates those who resent Jews who have converted to Orthodoxy. (10) He has a dependent mother and sister, for whom he is the only support. (11) Lapidus hopes to go to university and become a doctor.
\"(1) В Новокузнецке Кемеровской области: "(1) In Novokuznetsk, Kemerovo region, a 16-year-old schoolgirl who killed her stepfather was sentenced to three years in an educational colony. (6) Before the court Bagolino left at large under recognizance not to leave. (7) After that, she moved from her mother's and stepfather's house to her own father's house. (8) Bagolini claims that the stepfather drank constantly, was making her do all the chores and beat her. (9) According to the girl, her mother supported her stepfather in all quarrels. (10) After the murder, the woman also sided with the cohabitant. (11) She stated that her daughter spent time in a dysfunctional company, and stepfather tried to resist. (12) the Mother claims that stepfather never beat a Margarita and always treated her just like their own children. (13) the Case of Bagolino caused a wide resonance. (14) According to the local "channel 10", is under house arrest, the girl performed on a TV show, talking about the abuse that she allegedly was subjected to a stepfather."
(1) ЦСКА проиграл «Динамо» в матче 22-го: (1) CSKA lost to Dynamo in the match of the 22nd round of the Russian Football Championship. \"(1) Американская знаменитость Пэрис Хи: "(1) American celebrity Paris Hilton was not detained by the South African police on suspicion of possession and use of drugs. (2) The girl wrote about this on Friday in her microblog. (3) "I just want you all to know the truth. (4) I wasn't charged or arrested because I didn't do anything. (5) I assisted the police in their investigations and answered their questions. (6) Everyone was incredibly nice and friendly, " Hilton said. (7) According to the updated data provided by the website TMZ.com Someone from Hilton's entourage was caught smoking marijuana at the Nelson Mandela Bay stadium, where the quarterfinal match between Brazil and the Netherlands was taking place. (8) The attacker has already pleaded guilty, paid a small fine and was released. (9) A spokeswoman for Hilton confirmed to the Associated Press that the incident was a misunderstanding. (10) The" socialite " was suspected of smoking marijuana, but in reality someone else was using drugs. (11)" The lawsuit against Paris has been withdrawn, no charges will be filed, " the spokeswoman said. (12) Recall that in 2007, Hilton was sentenced to 45 days in prison for reckless driving while intoxicated. \"(1) Обвиняемые в убийстве бывшего депу: "(1) The defendants in the murder of former State Duma deputy Ruslan Yamadayev refused to admit their guilt, Interfax reports. (2) The defendant Aslanbek Dadayev denied all charges, the defendant Elimpasha Hatsuev confessed only to illegal possession of weapons. (3) The trial of Yamadaev began on July 5 in the Moscow City Court. (4) The case is combined with the case of the attempted murder of the Chairman of the Board of Converse Bank, Alexander Antonov. (5) Dadayev and the defendant Timur Isayev, who also refused to admit guilt, are accused of this crime. (6) The Court decided to extend the period of arrest of the accused until 24 December. (7) The younger brother of the deceased, Isa Yamadaev, arrived in the courtroom for the first hearing of the case on the merits. (8) It was guarded by two armed special forces soldiers in masks and bulletproof vests. (9) Several more riot policemen in lighter uniforms were on duty at the exit of the meeting hall, the correspondent of the news agency reports. (10) The car in which Ruslan Yamadaev and former military commander of Chechnya Sergey Kizyun were traveling was opened on September 24, 2008 on Smolenskaya Embankment in Moscow. (11) Yamadaev was killed on the spot, Kizyun was injured and was hospitalized. (12) The investigation believes that Dadaev shot and Hatsuev was driving the BMW car in which the criminals fled. (13) The Dubai police also named Hatsuev as a suspect in the case of the attempted murder of Russian Hero Sulim Yamadaev, who was allegedly killed in the UAE six months after his older brother. (14) The perpetrators of the murder of Ruslan Yamadayev have not been identified, and their case has been separated into separate proceedings."
\"(1) Картина Кузьмы Петрова-Водкина \"В: "(1) Kuzma Petrov-Vodkin's painting Vasya was sold for 1.8 million pounds ($2.6 million) at Christie's Russian auction on June 8, the auction house said in a press release. (2) In this way, a record was set for the value of the artist's paintings. (3) "Vasya" repeatedly blocked the estimate: the picture was estimated at only 250-300 thousand pounds. (4) The second most expensive painting at the London auction was "Still Life with Roses and Apples" by Konstantin Korovin (1917). (5) The work, estimated at 100-150 thousand pounds, was sold for 937 thousand (1.4 million dollars). (6) "Animal farm on the river bank" by Michael Klodt (1858) sold for 769 thousand pounds ($1.1 million). (7) "Portrait of a Man" (1920) by Boris Grigoriev was sold for 657 thousand pounds (about 950 thousand dollars), "Lying naked" by Zinaida Serebryakova - for 577 thousand pounds (832 thousand dollars). (8) In addition, records were set for the works of Mikhail Zichy (457 thousand pounds) and Nikolai Kalmakov (313 thousand). (9) At the first section of the Russian auction Chrisie's lots were 57 paintings; during the auction, 8 million pounds (11.6 million dollars) were raised. (10) The second section will feature works of decorative and applied art. (11) On June 7, the Russian auction was already held at Sotheby's, they brought 10.44 million pounds (15.07 million dollars). (12) Most paid for the painting by Alexander Yakovlev "Titi and Narange, daughters of the chief Eki Bondo" - 2.5 million pounds (3.6 million dollars)."
\"(1) Бывший мэр Москвы Юрий Лужков заня: "(1) Former Moscow Mayor Yuri Luzhkov took over the management of his wife Elena Baturina's agricultural projects. (2) he himself said this in an interview with the vedomosti newspaper published on february 2. (3) In particular, Luzhkov is engaged in the restoration of the old stud farm "Veedern". (4) the Company grows various crops, including oats, wheat and barley. (5) As luzhkov Said, he sows three thousand hectares. (6) Part of the crop goes to feed the horses, and the other part is sold. (7) The stud farm now houses 150 horses for equestrian sports. (8) On the website "Weedery" the catalog of horses for sale. (9) Yuri Luzhkov Plans to expand the farm in the kaliningrad region. (10) He intends to start a farm for breeding dairy cattle for 500 heads, and subsequently lease about 1,500 hectares of land, where the former mayor is going to test his scientific developments. (11) In particular, Luzhkov is going to produce a super-compost from manure. (12) According to the former mayor of the capital, he is engaged in agriculture for the soul. (1) Посадив медвежонка в мешок и связав: (1) After putting the bear cub in a bag and tying it to the puppy with a rope, the Challoner floats on a shuttle across the lake. (2) During the voyage, Miki, sympathizing with the bear, tries to make friends with him, but he misses his mother. (3)During one of these attempts, the shuttle passes through a dangerous place, and the bear cub and the puppy fall into a rapid. (4) Challoner can do nothing to help them and is sure that they are dead. (5) But due to its mass and fat, Neeva is unsinkable. (6) It becomes a life belt for the puppy tied to it. (7) Finally, the bear cub manages to cling to a snag that carries them safely through the rapids. (8) When Neeva and Miki reach the shore, they find themselves in the forest, which is the bear's home. (9) But Miki is afraid of unfamiliar terrain, especially since he, like a domestic dog, cannot get food in the forest, unlike Neeva, who feeds on wasps and ants. (10) For Mika, there are dangers lurking in the forest at every turn. (11) By sticking together, the animals help each other out and gain experience of survival. (12) Finally, having settled in, they lead a serene life.
(1) Пока командор отсутствует, Лауренсья: (1) While the commander is away, Laurencia and Frondoso decide to get married — to the delight of their parents and the entire village, which has long been waiting for this event. (2) In the midst of the wedding and general merriment, the commander returns: irritated by the military failure and remembering his resentment against the inhabitants of the village, he orders the capture of Frondoso and take him to prison. (3) Laurencia, who dares to raise her voice in defense of the bridegroom, is also taken into custody. (4) The inhabitants of the village gather for a gathering, and opinions are divided: some are ready to go to the commander's house at least now and deal with the cruel ruler, others prefer to be cowardly silent. (5) In the midst of a dispute, Laurencia comes running. (6) her appearance is terrible: her hair is disheveled, she is covered with bruises. (7) the girl's agitated account of the humiliations and tortures to which she was subjected, and of the fact that frondoso was about to be killed, makes a strong impression on the audience. (8) Laurencia's last argument — if there are no men in the village, then the women will be able to defend their own honor — decides the matter: the whole village rushes to storm the commander's house. (9) he at first does not believe that the inhabitants of fuente ovejuna could have rebelled, then, realizing that this is true, decides to release frondoso. (1) Кто такие шакалы, Коля узнаёт на сле: (1) Kolya will find out who the jackals are the next day. (2) In order not to meet the "smooth ones", he comes to the dining room later and is just finishing dinner when a strange boy with a yellow face appears in front of him and asks Kolya for the remains of the hated oatmeal soup. (3) Dumbfounded, he gives the soup, and an older girl shares her portion with the boy's younger sister. (4) Kolya understands that these are the jackals-starving children who beg in school canteens. (5) The next day, Kolya comes to the eighth canteen early because of the canceled physical education. (6) He has in his briefcase a piece of bread that the boy stole from the buffet the night before. (7) In the longest queue, right in front of Kolya, a company of impudent and tall boys, led by a nosy guy, is wedged in. (8) The gang reeks of tobacco and "some kind of brute and evil force that even adults preferred not to mess with." (9) I did not envy such gangs, there were many of them then, almost in every court or even class — there were unrighteous laws, evil and injustice. (10) Kolya begins to look out for the yellow-faced boy, but sees other jackals, more brazen — they steal food from trays. (11) A neighbor at the table tells Kolya that such jackals can take away not only bread, but also a plate of soup or a cutlet. (12) At this moment, Kolya sees a yellow-faced man. (13) This time he also takes bread without permission. (14) The robbed girl begins to roar, a hubbub rises, and the yellow-faced man manages to jump out into the street.
(1) Это было несколько лет тому назад. (: (1) This was several years ago. (2) Everyone was preparing Christmas trees and gifts when they were going to celebrate Christmas. (H)the Windows of shops and Windows of houses glowed with festive lights. (4) Garlands and huge colored balls were hung everywhere. (5) A crowd of citizens, motley, noisy, and gay, filled the streets. (6) And I, a homeless wanderer, was alone in a strange land — no family, no friend, and it seemed to me that I was abandoned and forgotten by all. (7) There was only emptiness and no love: a distant city, strangers, cold hearts. (8) One day, in my melancholy and despondency, I suddenly remembered a bundle of old letters that I had managed to save through all the trials of the dark days. (9) I took it out of my suitcase for the first time in the past year, untied it... (10) Then opened the first of the letters — it was a letter from my mother, written twenty-seven years ago. (11) " My dear child, Nikolenka! (12) You complain to me about your loneliness, and if you only knew how sad and painful your words make me. (13) With what joy I would come to you and convince you that you are not alone and can not be alone! (14) But you, of course, know that I can not leave my father, because he is very suffering and constantly needs my care. (15) And you need to prepare for exams in order to successfully graduate from the university. (16) Well, let me at least tell you why I never feel alone. (17) you see, son, a man Is lonely when he loves no one. (18) And if he loves, it does not occur to him to think about whether he is alone or not. (19) In love, a person forgets himself, he lives in others. (20) And this is happiness." (by i. a. ilyin)
(1) Пришла зима. (2) Тяп-Ляп с удовольст: (1) Winter has come. (2) Tyap-Lyap ate his food with pleasure, but his joy did not last long. (1) Руководство детского лагеря «Артек»: (1) The leadership of the children's camp "Artek" called the chairman of the Central Election Commission Vladimir Churov to the election of the president of the camp and the children's parliament. (2) This was told by the general director of the children's center Alexey Kasprzhak, Interfax reports. (3) "The elections will be held with the support of the Federation Council, the State Duma and the CEC. (4) And, of course, we invited Vladimir Yevgenyevich Churov," the head of the camp explained. (5) According to him, participation in elections will help children get acquainted with electoral technologies. (6) Voting will take place during the shift, which will last from June 23 to July 13 as part of the business game "Elections". (7) The territory of the camp will be divided into six "federal districts", and each of the detachments will represent its own Russian region. (8) Children will also be offered training in the schools of a young politician, strategist, entrepreneur and journalist. (9) Artek camp opened in 1925. (10) Then it served as a sanatorium for children with tuberculosis intoxication. (11) During the Great Patriotic War, the camp was evacuated to the Altai, from where it returned to the Crimea in 1944. (12) In the spring of 2014, after the Crimea became part of Russia, the authorities of the republic nationalized the camp. (13) In the summer of the same year, the Russian government approved the allocation of 895 million rubles for the development of the international children's center.
(1)С перебитой ногой я лежал у окна сани: (1) With a broken leg, I lay at the window of the ambulance train with my back to the traffic. (2)The outgoing terrain opened up in front of me, and so I saw these three tanks when we had already passed them. (3)The tankers opened their hatches and looked at us. (4) they were without helmets, and we took them for our own. (5)then the hatches were closed, and it was the last minute when it was still impossible to assume that the ambulance train, which was probably at least a thousand wounded, other, healthy people can shoot guns. (6) but that's exactly what happened. (7)The carriages moved with an iron grating, I was thrown up, and I involuntarily groaned, leaning on my wounded leg. (8) i could see through the window how the first wounded people jumped out of the heat-cars, ran and fell, because the tanks were shooting shrapnel at them. (9)somehow i slid off the bed, and the crowd of wounded carried me out on the platform. (10)i lay down under the car, helpless, sick with rage and pain. (11)someone took my hand firmly. (12)It was the nurse. – (13)I'm not going anywhere! – (14)leave me! (15)I have a gun, and they won't get me alive. (16) But two nurses grabbed me, and the three of us rolled down the embankment. (17)Romashov flashed somewhere ahead at that moment. (18)We managed to get across the swamp and lay down in a small aspen grove: the girls, myself, Romashov, and two lightly wounded soldiers who had joined us on the way. (19)I sent these men to investigate, and when they returned, they reported that the Germans were standing in different directions.)You can leave, of course, but since the captain can't move on his own, it's better to use a trolley. (By V. A. Kaverin*)

\"(1) В Мосгорсуде присяжные признали ви: "(1) In the Moscow City Court, the jury found guilty the former head of the Moscow Department of the Ministry of Property of the Russian Federation Tatyana Naidenova and her deputy Vladimir Polyutov, accused of exceeding their powers during the privatization of FSUE Stankoimport. (11) According to investigators, in 2005-2006, foreign assets purchased by Stankoimport during the Soviet era were sold at low prices. (12) During the sale, the organization was headed by Sagadat Khabirov. (13) Recently, journalists learned that Khabirov, born in 1964, is no longer alive. (14) The circumstances and date of his death are unknown."

(1) Министр сельского развития Индии Гоп: (1) India's Rural Development Minister Gopinath Munde was involved in an accident and later died of cardiac arrest, according to Reuters. (2) the incident occurred when the 64-year-old politician was on his way to delhi airport to fly to mumbai. (3) the car in which the minister was traveling collided with another car. (4) at first, munde did not appear to have suffered any serious injuries as a result of the accident. (5) however, he asked the driver to take him to the hospital. (6) on the way to the medical facility, the official lost consciousness. (7) as transport minister nitin gadkari later reported, munde's heart stopped because of the shock. (8) For an hour, doctors tried to resuscitate the politician, but could not. (9) After the accident, the Minister's driver was arrested. (10) an investigation has been launched into the accident. (11) As the new head of government stated, "the death of Munde is a great loss for the state." (12) Gopinath Munde was appointed Minister of Rural Development just a week ago. (13) He was described as one of the key allies of Narendra Modi, who was elected Prime Minister of India at the end of May. (14) India ranks first in the world in terms of the number of road accident victims. (15) in the past few years, gopinath munde has become the third indian politician to die in a car accident.

\"(1)На другой послеконцертный день мы с: "(1) On the next day after the concert, Kozlovsky and I separated from the rest of the group and went to the Yuriev Monastery. (2) Once the richest, flourishing under the golden protective rain of Orlova-Chesmenskaya, patronized, in turn, by Archimandrite Photius, the Yuriev monastery was now inactive, empty. (3) No fabulous treasures (for example, the icon "The Sign" carved on a huge emerald), no monastic rank, no monastic meals, no large litanies, no loud deacons, no bell ringing, spreading over the Ilmen Lake for not twenty versts... (4) Now there was only a smooth green grass, and on it a white-stone building. (5)The monastery wall with towers, in the middle of the grandiose, second after the Novgorod Sofia, St. George's Cathedral. (6) So the dead man still retains for the living, who look at him, the features of similarity, and everything seems to remain the same: both the nose, and the chin, and the hands, but why should we deceive ourselves, the man is dead and cold, and the external likeness of him is the most blatant lie. (7)an elderly woman, rattling her keys, opened st. george's cathedral for us, and we entered a cold, stagnant space, bounded high above by a painted dome, and to our right by an iconostasis as high as an eight-story building?(8)The housekeeper remained at the bottom, and we went up the narrow spiral staircase to the choir. (9)They probably corresponded to the fourth or even fifth floor, but there was still a lot of height above them: a good half of the iconostasis, against which we stood, and above the iconostasis a dome, and above the dome an empty drum, one of which would have been enough for a small church. (10)We stood alone in the choir, and there was not a soul or a living spirit in the whole cathedral. (11)The housekeeper was also supposed to remain below, but we did not see her, and she did not seem to exist for us. (12)We were each silent about our own things, but we must assume that in many places our silence coincided, and the silence of the cathedral contributed to it and even, who knows, directed it in the right direction. (13)And now the silence burst like a strained string, but only without a broken string sound, but immediately another lively and strong string sounded and instantly filled the whole huge cathedral with sound. (14)delight flowed from my heart to my eyes and throat. (15)Rachmaninoff's version of the famous chant was taken at once and in full force. (16)Whether the acoustics of the cathedral contributed to the impression, whether the extraordinary moment itself, the extraordinary spiritual mood, but perhaps Kozlovsky had never sung so beautifully and inspiringly in his life. (17) If it is true that the audience inspires, then what kind of audience was the singer holding now before his half-closed eyes?(18) His voice flowed with a golden, dazzling light, and the stones of the cathedral, awakened and revived, resonated to him with every grain of sand. (19) Below, the old woman with the keys was crying and threw herself at the singer's feet, but Kozlovsky picked her up and soothed her, patting her on the shoulder: Nothing, nothing, granny, lock up after us, thank you, we'll go.... (20)That's how life gave me one of its best impressions, of those impressions that lie in the memory like golden grains and which, in fact, do not accumulate so much in a lifetime. (by v. a. soloukhin*)"
\"(1) Премьер-министр Владимир Путин дал: "(1) Prime Minister Vladimir Putin instructed the Governor of the Moscow Region, Boris Gromov, to eliminate the landfill near Sheremetyevo Airport. (2) On July 9, the Vedomosti newspaper writes about this with reference to the press secretary of the head of government Dmitry Peskov. (5) Among the airport managers present at the meeting was Sheremetyevo CEO Mikhail Vasilenko. (6) He told the Prime Minister about the landfill, where garbage has been taken for ten years. (7) According to Vasilenko, over the years there have been 21 collisions of aircraft with birds on the territory of Sheremetyevo. (8) Another 141 such incidents were recorded in the airport's airspace. (9) Birds are attracted to this area by garbage from the landfill. (10) Mikhail Vasilenko also wrote on his blog that this topic was raised at a meeting with the Prime Minister. (11) According to Vedomosti, the landfill near the airport belongs to Solnechnogorsk NGO Iskra. (12) The management of Sheremetyevo for several years proved the illegality of the existence of this dump. (13) In June, local residents passed a resolution demanding that it be closed."

(1) Радж и Говард по-прежнему в ссоре, и: (1) Raj and Howard are still at odds, and Howard doesn't invite Raj to Hallie's birthday party. (1) Берг собирал ягоды шиповника и пахуч: (1) Berg collected rosehip berries and fragrant juniper, carefully examined the autumn leaves. (2)At sunsets, flocks of cranes flew southward over the lake, purring. (3)Berg felt a foolish resentment for the first time: the cranes seemed to him to be traitors. (4) they abandoned without regret this desolate, wooded, and solemn region, full of nameless lakes and impenetrable thickets. (5) It rained in September. (6)Yartsev was about to leave. (7)Berg was angry. (8) How was it possible to leave in the midst of this extraordinary autumn? (9)Berg now felt Yartsev's desire to leave as he had once felt the departure of the cranes-it was treason. (10)What? (11)Berg could hardly answer this question. (12)Treason to the forests, lakes, autumn, and finally to the warm sky, which drizzled with frequent rain – - (13)I'm staying, " Berg said sharply.)I want to write this fall. (15)Yartsev left. (16)The next day Berg woke up to the sun. (17)The light shadows of the branches trembled on the clean floor, and a quiet blue spread out beyond the door. (18)Berg had only ever seen the word "radiance" in the books of poets, and he considered it pathetic and devoid of clear meaning. (19)But now he realized how accurately this word conveys the special light that comes from the September sky and the sun. (20)Berg took paints and paper and went to the lake. (By K. G. Paustovsky)
\"(1) Генеральный директор московского ф: "(1) The General Director of the Moscow football club "Spartak" Valery Karpin called the decision of the Russian Football Union (RFU) to soften the limit on foreign players in Russian football lawlessness. (2) This is reported by the website of the publication "Soviet Sport". (1) Суд поместил под арест зампредседате: (1) The Court placed under arrest the Deputy chairman of the Committee on Culture and Information Policy of the Legislative Assembly of the Krasnodar Territory Sergey Zirinov, suspected of organizing the attempted murder of the koshevoi ataman of the Anapa department of the Kuban Cossack Army Nikolai Nesterenko. (2) The Kommersant newspaper writes about this on April 4. (3) Zirinov was detained on April 3 in a hotel in Krasnodar. (4) He had recently returned to Russia from the United Arab Emirates. (5) According to Kommersant sources, in the UAE, the deputy tried to "resolve the issue" with a criminal case by phone. (6) Earlier, three employees of the Anapa PSC controlled by Zirinov were detained on suspicion of the attempted murder of Nesterenko and the murder of his driver Viktor Zhuk. (7) They were reached through eyewitness accounts and checking mobile phone connections from the crime scene. (8) The detainees admitted their guilt and showed the reservoir in which they had drowned their weapons. (9) They stated that Zirinov had ordered the attack. (10) The attempt on Nesterenko's life was made on the morning of February 22. (11) The ataman was fired upon as he was getting into a car outside his house. (12) Zhuk was killed and Nesterenko was injured. (13) In the first reports of the assassination attempt, Nesterenko was called a candidate for mayor of Anapa, but then this information was not confirmed. (14) according to the organization "environmental watch for the north caucasus", zirinov is called "the shadow master of anapa". (15) it is claimed that he maintained close relations with the last two mayors: anatoly pakhomov and tatyana evsikova.

\"(1)Её звали Александра Ивановна. (2)Он: "(1) Her name was Alexandra Ivanovna. (2) she was the head teacher of our huge five-story school and for some reason always went with a huge bunch of school keys. (3)It was a puny-looking creature of small stature, withered, wrinkled, and not at all pretty. (4)We didn't even think of her as a woman... something of the middle kind. (5)shura (as we called a. i. among ourselves)taught a history lesson in our class. (6)Our Shura had a surprisingly tinned throat, and when necessary, her deafening voice, like the roar of a fire siren, covered all other sounds in the school and was heard, in my opinion, far beyond its borders. (7) Her hair, which was as thin as down, and "arranged" in an unthinkable way on her head in a sort of coiffure that rather resembled a bird's nest, was the constant object of our retaliatory exercises in slandering Shurani. (8) Feeling a clear antipathy on our part, she did not remain in debt and paid us in the same coin. (9)At the big break, Shuranya flew into our class and, as always, told us out of the blue who we really are, and that we should all be "filthy broom"...and so on. (10)Enraged and offended by Shurani's insults, the 9th " B " went to ram. (11)immediately found a clean sheet of paper, laid the table (and in five minutes was supposed to start a history lesson) and one of the most desperate bold pencil wrote across the table: "shura-fool"!!! (12)They wrote and froze themselves from such an unheard-of own audacity and outright rudeness. (13)But the job was already done, the flywheel spun, and events rushed with speed.. (14)Oh, it's a shame to remember everything that happened next ... (15)The bell rang, and Shuranya flew into the classroom, already pretty screwed up and angry by someone. (16) Even from the threshold, she saw a blank sheet of paper on the table, and her look gave a little slack: it even seemed to us that Shura could smile. (17)Something like a faint smile barely touched her eyes, but the next moment, as she approached the table, a sickly shadow appeared on her face, it suddenly turned gray and lifeless. (18) Her eyes read our "message"to her. (19) She did not even throw her bunch of keys, as usual, but stood in silence for a few minutes, maybe seconds, and quietly and slowly left the classroom. (20)I will never forget this May 8th as long as I live! (According to L. Klochkova-Zarutskaya*)"
(1) Чикагский пожар 7 октября 1871 года: (1) The Chicago fire of October 7, 1871, momentarily destroys Cowperwood's financial well-being. (10) The old Irishman is momentarily overcome by hatred for Frank. (11) butler decides to drown the scoundrel, taking advantage of the impending threat of cowperwood's bankruptcy.
(1) Режиссёрский дуэт Кристофера Миллера: (1) The directing duo of Christopher Miller and Phil Lord, known for the films "Macho and Nerd" and " Lego. (1)Был осенний серенький день в конце ли: (1) It was a gray autumn day at the end of leaf fall. (2) And a gray mood. (3) I came to Timiryazevsky Park for a walk. (4) The park was deserted and quiet. (5) And suddenly a hare came out of the forest across the road five paces from me. (6)He didn't run, but hopped slowly past me, giving me only a sidelong glance. (7) Not far from me, he stopped, scratched behind his ear with a long hind leg, and quietly and peacefully jumped into the bushes. (8)eco event, you say. (9) However, my mood immediately changed. (10)I walked, whistling, remembering the hare, imagining what he was doing now. (11)at home, over tea, i remembered the hare again. (12)and my heart felt good and warm. (13) this phenomenon is common. (14)you go with a backpack outside the city and, if you haven't seen anything alive during the day, you return, although satisfied with walking, but still with the feeling that something important wasn't there. (15)this important can be a duck, with a crack and quack, flying up from under the feet of a small pond. (16)it can be fascinating, exciting scenes of a duel between two flyers-a light-winged dragonfly and a long-tailed magpie. (17) or suddenly i saw through binoculars: a hardworking woodpecker drags the chicks into the hollow not larvae,but ripe strawberries. (18)All life, closely intertwined with many connections, is a miracle called Life, very possibly the only one in the boundless Universe. (19)Every manifestation of life gives a sense of the joy of being. (20) Of all human values, the most important value is life itself, with the sunrise, the clouds, the singing of birds, the croaking of frogs, the chirping of crickets, and the rustling of grasses. (By V. M. Peskov)
(1) Современное общество озабочено тем,: (1) Modern society is concerned that language has begun to change. (2) Especially noticeable is the expansion of written speech, which displaces oral from different spheres. (H) If earlier we communicated, talked first of all orally, and written speech still served for storing, for transmitting information at a distance, through time, today written speech, displacing oral from some areas of dialogue, acquires a certain verbality. (4) There are different ways of reviving written speech, making it oral. (5) In fact, this is its current changes. (7) I think not. (8) I think that, of course, there are people who go completely online, and this is not normal. (9) But for many it is salvation, because there are people who are still not adapted for oral communication, who are too shy. (10) And here they may well feel confident; someone is lonely, and on the Internet you can always find someone to talk to. (11) And what is significant: the Russian language, as we know, came out on the Internet, broke out in second place. (12) In fact, it is about on par with the German language, very much behind the English, but nevertheless... (13) And the more Russian is present on the Internet, the more it is under pressure from the new conditions of communication. (14) But I think the younger generation is finding some reasonable balance. (15) Of course, if we look at, say, a fifty-year-old and a twenty-year-old, we see that their attitudes to social media are different. (16) For a fifty-year-old or a sixty-year-old, there is a question: to start functioning in social networks or not to start? (17) And for a twenty-year-old, this question does not exist in principle. (18) That is, he will be a black sheep if he does not start. (19) So in this sense the world has changed. (20) there is more written speech, it has become more oral, but still people are not numb, just a little disturbed the existing balance-for us it is unusual, but so far, i think, there is no way back. (by m. a. krongauz)
(1) Стой! (2) Какою я теперь тебя вижу –: (1) Stop! (2) As I now see you – remain forever so in my memory! (3) The last inspired sound escaped from your lips – your eyes do not shine or sparkle – they fade, burdened with happiness, blissful consciousness of the beauty that you have managed to express, the beauty after which you seem to stretch out your triumphant, your exhausted hands! (4) What light, finer and purer than the sunlight, has spread over all your limbs, over the smallest folds of your clothing? (5) What god, with his gentle breath, has brushed back your scattered curls? (6) His kiss burns on your pale brow like marble! (7) Here it is – an open secret, the secret of poetry, life, love! (8) Here it is, here it is, immortality! (9) There is no other immortality – and it is not necessary. (10) At this moment, you are immortal. (11) it will pass – and you are again a pinch of ashes, a woman, a child... (12) but what does it matter to you! (13) in this moment – you have become higher, you have become beyond all transitory, temporary. (14) This moment of yours will never end. (15) Stand! (16) And let me be a participant in your immortality, drop into my soul the reflection of your eternity!

(1) В мартовском и апрельском номерах жу: (1) In the March and April 2004 issues of the Ural magazine, Marina Golubitskaya's novel "That's All Love" was published. \"(1) Хамовнический суд Москвы, где прох: "(1) The Khamovnichesky court of Moscow, where the Pussy Riot case is being held, was evacuated due to a bomb call, the correspondent of "Lenta.<url>". \" (1)Природа никогда не создаёт шума. (: " (1)nature never makes noise. (2) It teaches man greatness in silence. (3) The sun is silent. (4) The starry sky silently unfolds before us. (5) Little and rarely do we hear anything from the heart of the earth." (b) Graciously and blissfully rest the royal mountains. (7) Even the sea is capable of "deep silence." (8) The greatest thing in nature, that which determines and decides our fate as such, happens noiselessly... (9) And man makes noise. (10)He makes noise early and late, intentionally and unintentionally, working and having fun. (11) And this noise does not correspond in any way to the result achieved through it. (12)I would like to say that noise is a" privilege " of man in the world, because all that nature gives to our ears is a mysterious and meaningful sound, and not an annoying and empty noise. (13)Startled and captured, we stand when thunder, a volcano, or a hurricane raises its voice, and listen to this voice that intends to tell us something majestic. (14)The roar of the Rhine falls or the sea, the mountain landslides avalanches, the whisper of the forest, the babbling brook, the singing of the Nightingale we hear as noise, but as a speech or a song related to us, but mysterious forces. (15)The rumble of trams, the crackle and hiss of factories, the roar of motorcycles, the screech of braking cars, the slapping of whips, the beating of scythes, the harsh sounds of garbage trucks and, ah, so often... the roar of the radio is a noise, an annoying noise, so insignificant in the spiritual sense. (16)Noise is present wherever sound means little or nothing, where rumbling, whistling,buzzing, humming, roaring, penetrating a person, give him little. (17)The noise is audacious and disappointing, arrogant and empty, self-confident and shallow, merciless and deceitful. (18)You can get used to the noise, but you can never enjoy it. (19)he does not conceal anything spiritual in himself, he "speaks" without having anything to say. (20)Therefore, every bad art, every stupid speech, every empty book is noise. (according to i. ilyin)"
(1) Мужчины со злорадством рассуждают: с: (1) Men gloat: Empedocles has passed, and it serves him right. (2) He thought too much of himself, revealed to the rabble divine secrets that should have remained the property of the priests alone. (3) His influence on the people was harmful — all these bold speeches about a new life that should replace the old, familiar way of life, appeals not to submit to the original customs and traditional beliefs. (4) A man should not break the limits laid down for him, rebellion turned out to be a defeat for Empedocles. (5) As he had withdrawn from all, it was said that the gods had taken him alive to heaven. (6) The people are accustomed to consider Empedocles a prophet, a sorcerer, a demigod, it is necessary to overthrow him from his pedestal, to expel him from the city. (7) Let his fellow-citizens see him broken in spirit, having lost his former eloquence and extraordinary abilities, then it will cost nothing to restore them against Empedocles. (8) Empedocles is tormented-it seems that pride destroyed him, the immortals did not forgive him for trying to become on a par with them, turned away from him. (9) He feels powerless and desolate — he has subdued nature, having mastered its secrets, but after that the visible world has lost its beauty and charm in his eyes, everything in it now seems petty and unworthy of attention. (10) Moreover, he remains misunderstood by his countrymen, even though they worship him. (11) he never succeeded in raising them to the height of his thought.
(1) Полиция, мстя за убийство капитана,: (1) The police, in revenge for the murder of the captain, shall suspend profitable activities that are committed in violation of the law. (1) Клаас Керстинг (Klaas Kersting), осн: (1) Klaas Kersting, founder and former CEO of Gameforge, has created a mobile game development studio, writes VentureBeat. (2) Kersting's new company was named flaregames. (3) It was created a few months ago, but until recently it existed in secret mode. (4) by information Pocketgamer.biz flaregames studio is currently working on its first game for ios devices. (5) It will be presented in the second half of August at Gamescom, which will be held in Cologne. (6) In addition to Kersting, there are 15 other people in the studio. (7) The Creative Director of flaregames is Andreas Suika. (8) He was involved in the creation of several games from the Settlers franchise and was the lead designer of The Settlers: Rise of an Empire. (9) The position of Technical Director of flaregames was taken over by Matthias Schindler. (10) He used to work for EA, Acclaim, and Infogrames. (11) His portfolio includes projects such as Spellforce 2 and Boulder Dash Rocks. (12) Gameforge, which Klaas Kersting left in the spring of 2010, is one of the leading European online game development studios. (13) Gameforge specializes in browser-based projects. (14) The company owns the games OGame, BattleKnight, Ikariam, Nox Mortis and others.
(1) В городе Оленегорск Мурманской облас: (1) Vladimir Doronin, a defendant in the case of embezzlement in housing and communal services, died in the city of Olenegorsk, Murmansk region. (2) This was reported on September 2 by the Flash Nord agency. (3) Doronin was admitted to the city hospital on August 30, and died on the morning of September 2. (4) The cause of death is not disclosed. (5) Lawyer Vasily Ananyev said only that the relatives of the deceased will seek his posthumous rehabilitation in court. (6) Doronin was the general director of the management company "Housing and Communal Services Olenegorsk". (7) According to the investigation, he did not transfer to the municipal enterprise "Olenegorsk Heating Networks" the heating fee for the period from September 6, 2012 to January 20, 2013. (8) As a result, the company suffered damage in the amount of 49 million rubles. (9) Doronin was charged with abuse of power in February. (10) He was under house arrest. (11) The second person involved in the case was the director of LLC "UK zhilkomfort" Elena Parkhomchuk detained, the investigation will apply for her arrest. (12) It is assumed that her firm did not transfer money to energy companies from October 30, 2012 to January 20, 2013. (13) According to the investigation, "Housing and Communal Services Olenegorsk" and "UK zhilkomfort" are affiliated with companies controlled by the former adviser to the Governor of the Murmansk region, the former head of the company "Kolenergosbyt" Gennady Shubin. (14) He was arrested in the fall of 2013 on suspicion of embezzlement of 430 million rubles. (15) In total, about ten cases were initiated on the fact of embezzlement in the Murmansk housing and utilities system.

\"(1) Социальный новостной агрегатор Dig: "(1) Social news aggregator Digg has cut 10 percent of its employees. (4) rose expressed confidence that the reduction of staff in the future will benefit the company. (5) he noted that the company will invest more effort in the development and development of the service. (6) so, despite the layoffs, the company is still looking for new developers. (7) kevin rose took over as chief executive of digg in early april. (8) he replaced jay adelson, who served in this capacity for five years.
