(1) Британский бренд Paul Smith обновил: (1) British brand Paul Smith has updated its 531 line designed for cycling, according to highsnobiety. (2) The new collection includes T-shirts, leggings, shorts and jackets made of ultra-light breathable materials. (3) The priority in the creation of clothing was to provide air access to the skin of athletes and reduce sweating. (4) Items of clothing have a bright color of natural shades and, according to the comments of the brand representatives, are perfectly combined with each other both aesthetically and from the point of view of hygiene and comfort. (5) Prices for the collection range from $ 150 for a tank top to $ 640 for a waterproof jacket. (6) British fashion designer Paul Smith opened his first store in Nottingham in 1970. (7) Initially, it only produced things for men. (8) In 1998, the first women's collection by Paul Smith was released, later-the children's line. (9) The brand's assortment includes clothing, shoes, accessories, and household items. (10) The 531 cycling line has been produced by the brand since 2014. (11) In 2000, Queen Elizabeth II awarded Paul Smith a knighthood. (12) In September 2015, the fashion designer opened a branded boutique in Moscow.
(1) Прошли годы, Волшебная страна раздел: (1) As the years passed, the Fairyland was divided into warring parts. (2) In one of the States Prince Bopara planned to overthrow the throne of his father king Naranu. (3) The plot was discovered, and the father imprisoned the son forever with his family, with all the conspirators and their families in the dungeon. (4) This is how the land of underground miners came into being. (5) Its inhabitants tamed the terrible monsters with six legs and dragons that lived in the dungeon. (6) Gradually, these people became unaccustomed to sunlight and only came to the surface at night to exchange the precious stones they had mined underground for food. (7) Prince Boforo had seven sons. (8) In order not to offend anyone, Boforo decreed that each heir should rule the country in turn, for a month. (9) the heirs lived in a palace divided into parts, each of which was painted with one of the colors of the rainbow. (10) Each king had his own ministers, and they made their own laws. (11) The common people worked hard to satisfy the whims of the rulers. (12) Since there was no change of day and night in the underworld, time was known by the hourglass, which was watched by the Time Keeper.
(1) Первый президент СССР Михаил Горбачё: (1) The first President of the USSR, Mikhail Gorbachev, said that he was not going to leave Russia under any circumstances. (2) on the air of the tv channel "russia 24", he expressed the opinion that" the russian person has grounds for patriotism, " ria novosti reports. (3) "No matter what happens to me, I'm not going to run anywhere, although I could. (4) I think this is the last case," Gorbachev said. (5) He clarified that if a person loves the land on which he grew up, then he loves everything that happens there. (6) At the same time, the first president of the USSR stressed that attempts by a number of states to own the world alone do not pass. (7) In particular, he mentioned the United States, noting that he had repeatedly expressed the idea — including during trips to this country — that the United States needs its own "perestroika". (8) Gorbachev has previously spoken out about Russia's policy and the US's desire for world leadership. (9) In late December 2014, he said that the main merit of Russian leader Vladimir Putin is that he saved the country from collapse. (10) In his opinion, the head of state "did a historic thing". (11) In September of the same year, the first president of the USSR called the United States "the main fever" in the world. (12) He compared the rhetoric of US President Barack Obama to an expletive far removed from political dialogue. (13) "To offend, provoke, and most importantly, to keep up the strife in Europe. (14) Because they have a claim to monopoly. (15) Ukraine and other things are all reasons, " Gorbachev said.
(1) По возвращении из краёв далёких заса: (1)On my return from distant lands, I planted my garden in the village with all sorts of tree varieties, mountain ash and viburnum. (2) One rowan tree, nestling near the side of a modern concrete road, was crushed by the wheels of cars on a steep drift, scratched, mashed. (Z)I decided to dig it up and take it to my wild garden. (4) In the autumn it was. (5) A few dusty leaves and two crumpled rosettes of berries have survived on the rowan tree. (7) And every summer, every autumn, she was decorated with one or two rosettes, and she became so bright, so elegant and confident — you can't take your eyes off her! (8) And if the autumn was warm, the mountain ash tried to bloom a second time. (9) Two years later, seedlings were brought from the city nursery, and I planted four more rowan trees in an empty place. (10) These have expanded. (11) Hardly one or two rosettes of berries will be forced out, but the greenery is lush on them, but the leaves are swarms, such imposing young ladies from the city grounds. (12) And my dichka is quite grown up and cheerful. (13) One autumn, a particularly bright berry grew on it. (14) And suddenly a flock of waxwings fell on her from above, and the birds began to eat berries together. (15) And they talk and talk: this is the rowan tree we have found, this is the delicious food that the summer has prepared for us. (16) In ten minutes crested elegant workers cleaned the tree, and those from the nursery, did not even sit down. (17) i thought, later, when there is less food left in the forests and gardens, the birds will certainly come. (18) no, they did not come. (19) in the following autumn, if the waxwings happened to fly into my overgrown forest in the garden, they were already accustomed to sit on the rowan-wild and still on those nursery trees, lazily forcing a few rosettes, never once did they covet. (by v. astafyev)
(1)Когда я вошёл в новую пустую квартиру: (1) When I entered the new empty apartment, the only one who met me was an old snow — covered poplar tree outside the window, it remained from the village estate that was on this place, and now, looking into the second floor, it seemed to say to me: "Hello", and from its white beautiful branches light poured into the room, pure, immaculate, incorruptible. (2)Then spring came, and one morning, after a warm night's rain, something green, smoky, indeterminate looked in at the window. (3) Every spring the same thing is repeated, and each time it is like a miracle, a miracle of renewal, and you can not get used to it. (4) I stood and looked for a long time and could not get enough. (5) Now it was as if someone living had taken up residence outside the window, making a noise and suddenly falling silent, and tapping softly and gently on the window during the wind. (6)He lived with all his leaves, thousands of thousands of leaves, exposing them to the sun, the moon, the wind, the rain. (7) He enjoyed life with all his might, every minute, every second of his existence. (8) And I, reflecting on my life, would like to learn from him this constant joy in the wild under heaven. (9)Birds flew to its branches, they whistled, sang their short city songs, maybe the poplar told them about me, and they looked in the window and grinned. (10)What a long, wonderful summer it was that first year of living in a new room, with a live poplar tree at the window, what endless sunsets, and bright nights, and light dreams!(11)Only sometimes I suddenly dreamed that for some reason I had lost my new room and was living again in the old one, dark and smoky, with a bare electric light bulb on a long cord. (12)But I would wake up, and the poplar tree would look into a room with clean, fresh walls, and the pre-dawn green noise would merge with the feeling of a happy awakening. (13)then autumn came, the leaves turned yellow, and the room became quiet and sad. (14)Autumn showers and storms began, and at night the poplar creaked, groaned, and beat its branches against the wall, as if asking for protection from the weather. (15)Gradually the leaves fell from its branches, first from the upper ones, then from the lower ones. (16)The leaves flowed in streams, covering the balcony, and some stuck to the windows and looked in horror into the room, waiting for something. (17)And now there was not a single leaf left on the poplar, it stood naked, black, as if burned, and against the blue sky every black twig, every vein was visible, it was solemnly quiet and sad in nature, the sun was not warming in summer. (18) And, as always, I remembered my childhood and thought: Who are you? (19)What is the meaning of life? (20)Then it was spring again, and it was all over again, and life seemed endless. (According to B. Yampolsky*)
\"(1) Джон Малкович поставит спектакль,: "(1) John Malkovich will put on a performance based on critical reviews of the production with his participation "Infernal Comedy: Confessions of a Serial Killer" (The Infernal Comedy: Confessions of a Serial Killer), according to the website contactmusic. (1) В Пакистане при посадке потерпел ава: (1) A United Nations helicopter crashed on landing in Pakistan, Agence France-Presse reports, citing statements from UN officials and Pakistani authorities. (4) It was involved in activities to deliver food to victims of the August 2010 floods. (7) At the same time, the Associated Press reports 13 helicopter passengers. (8) as a result of the accident, several people received various injuries. (9) The exact number of victims is not known. (10) According to RIA Novosti, five of the crew members on board are Russians. (11) This was stated to the agency by the official representative of the UN Jackie Dent. (13) The Russian diplomatic mission does not yet have accurate information about the nationality of the helicopter pilots. (14) According to the attache of the Russian Consulate General in Pakistan, Tural Jamalov, we may be talking about Russian-speaking citizens of other countries.

(1) Действие происходит в течение нескол: (1) The action takes place over a few days in January 1947 in the town of Olinger, Pennsylvania. (1) Урсула с беспокойством наблюдает за: (1) Ursula observes with concern the extravagances of posterity. (1) Задержанные ФСБ подозреваемые, возмо: (1) The suspects detained by the FSB may have been preparing terrorist attacks against the participants of the Victory Day campaign "Immortal Regiment". (1) Так он движется по кругам своего про: (1) So he moves through the circles of his process, getting sucked into a funnel of strange and faceless procedures, and the more he tries to protect himself, the more likely he is to harm his own cause. (2) One day, a relative — an uncle who came from the province-comes to his service. (3) As expected, my uncle has also heard about the trial and is terribly concerned. (4) He insistently drags K. to his familiar lawyer, who is supposed to help. (5) The lawyer turns out to be ill, he receives his uncle and K. in bed. (6) He, of course, is also more than aware of the disaster that has befallen K. (7) The lawyer is looked after by a lively young nurse named Leni. (8) When K. leaves the room during a long and boring conversation, Leni drags him into the study and seduces him right there on the carpet. (9) The uncle indignantly reprimands his nephew when after a while he and K. leave the lawyer's house — again K. has hurt himself, because it was impossible not to guess the reason for his long absence from the room. (10) However, the lawyer does not refuse to defend K. (11) And he still comes to him many times and meets with Laziness waiting for him — she willingly gives K. her caresses, but this does not become closer to the hero. (12) Like the other women in this novel — including the cheeky little nymphets who pop up in one episode — she is sly, fickle, and irritatingly, wearily vicious.

\"(1) Футболист сборной Англии Эшли Коул: "(1) England footballer Ashley Cole refused to shake hands with head coach Fabio Capello. (4) The Chelsea defender later said he had not seen Capello. (5) According to Cole, he stumbled on the way to the award ceremony, so he looked at his feet and did not notice the coach of the national team. (6) In the match for the FA Super Cup, Chelsea were defeated by a score of 1:3. (7) In addition, after the game, Capello spoke with Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick, asking about his health. (8) Last week, United manager Sir Alex Ferguson said that Carrick was out of action for two weeks and Capello did not call the midfielder for the friendly match against Hungary (August 11). (9) However, for the game against Chelsea, Carrick was in the starting line-up. (10) When the player went to the award ceremony, he was stopped by Capello. (11) Carrick told the coach that he was healthy, and Capello noticed that the player could have called and reported it earlier. (12) Ferguson apologized to the coach. (13) According to Alex, he was confident that Carrick will be sidelined for two weeks, but then the player himself approached the coach and said he was ready to play."

\"(1) Члены южноафриканской организации: "(1) members of the south african organization against cruelty to animals (spca) have released a python that was used by a local sorcerer (sangoma) as a medium to communicate with spirits. (2) sangoma took money from football fans, promising to ensure the success of their team at the world cup, according to bbc news. (3) During the World Cup, the sorcerer specially brought a python named 2010 to Cape Town from the city of Natal. (4) Sangoma told the fans that with the help of the python, he could contact the spirits of the ancestors and ask them to ensure the success of the national team. (5) It is not specified which teams the sorcerer promised to lead to success. (6) According to SPCA spokeswoman Sarah Scarth, the python was kept in "totally unacceptable conditions." (7) The reptile was found to have pneumonia, oral disease, as well as underweight and dehydration. (8) The python (its length is 2.8 meters) has already been transferred to the veterinary center for treatment, and it should recover. (9) Scarth added that no charges have been brought against the sorcerer, but the SPCA is investigating how the python was transported from Natal to Cape Town. (10) In South Africa, a special permit is required for the transport of such animals. (11) The rescued python in the scientific classification is called the dark tiger python or Burmese python. (12) It is a subspecies of the tiger python. (13) as noted by bbc news, ancestral worship is widespread in south africa. (14) sometimes animals are sacrificed to appease spirits, and sometimes sangoms use animals as mediums (intermediaries) to communicate with spirits."

\"(1) Компания Blind Wink, принадлежащая: "(1) The company Blind Wink, owned by director Gore Verbinski (Gore Verbinski) has entered into an agreement with Microsoft, writes Eurogamer. (1) Прокуратура Черногории сняла обвинен: (1) The Prosecutor's Office of Montenegro has dropped charges of electricity theft against the former financial director of an aluminum plant in Podgorica, Dmitry Potrubach. (1) Дэвид Боумен решает сесть на Япет в: (1) David Bowman decides to land on Iapetus in a capsule, and its approach awakens the powers contained in the Stargate. (5) As an example, Bolov cited the Fukushima accident: "Russian rescuers also took part in the elimination of the consequences of the Fukushima disaster. (6) they could have joined the operation earlier, if not for the contradictions in the regulatory framework of the two countries." (7) Efforts are proposed to focus primarily on the Pacific region. (8) Bolov referred to the fact that the United States and Russia have "certain achievements"in this direction. (9) He also noted that there has been an increase in the number of strong earthquakes in recent years. (10) Bolov also said that Russia and the United States should cooperate on issues of asteroid danger. (11)" Monitoring of large and medium - sized asteroids is now well established. (12) The most vulnerable link is monitoring of small asteroids, which can cause big problems on earth. (13) For example, if an asteroid with a diameter of about a hundred meters falls into the ocean, it can cause a powerful destructive tsunami with catastrophic consequences, " RIA Novosti quotes Bolov as saying."
(1) Редакция французского сатирического: (1) The editorial staff of the French satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo, which survived the terrorist attack that killed 12 people, decided to take a break from work. (2) This is stated in the message posted on the journal's website. (3) "Dear readers, the entire Charlie Hebdo team would like to thank each and every one of you for the tremendous support and sympathy we have received in recent weeks. (4) We don't forget you, and will be back at newsstands in the coming weeks," the message reads. (5) The attack on the Charlie Hebdo editorial office in Paris was carried out on January 7. (6) Three armed men shot 12 people, including the editor-in-chief. (7) The main defendants in the attack, the brothers Said and Cherif Kouachi, were later eliminated by the French police. (8) Another suspect, Hamid Murad, surrendered to the police. (9) The reason for the attack was the publication of cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad in the magazine. (10) On January 14, the first issue of Charlie Hebdo magazine was published after the terrorist attack. (11) Its cover features a cartoon of the weeping Prophet Muhammad holding a placard that reads "I am Charlie." (12) At the top is signed Tout est pardonné ("All is forgiven").The publication of the new cartoons sparked protests in the Muslim world. (13) Demonstrations against the Prophet's cartoons were held in Algeria, Mali, Senegal, Mauritania, the Gaza Strip, Niger and the Philippines, among others. (14) The meeting in Grozny was attended, according to various sources, from several hundred thousand to one million people.
\"(1) Питерский хоккейный клуб СКА начал: "(1) SKA St. Petersburg Hockey Club has started negotiations with goaltender Ilya Bryzgalov, who plays in the NHL for the Phoenix Coyotes. (4) The details of the SKA offer are not specified. (5) If Bryzgalov will offer SKA, the team will leave Czech goalkeeper Jakub Stepanek, who was the main goalkeeper in the 2010/11 season. (6) If the tie fails to agree with Bryzgalova, a team can strengthen Russia's goalkeeper Konstantin Barulin, who in the 2010-11 season played for Moscow Atlant. (7) "Phoenix" due to financial difficulties in the off-season may move to Winnipeg, Canada (in the past, the team was based in this city, and moved to Phoenix in 1996). (8) Bryzgalov told the North American media that he did not want to play in Winnipeg. (9) According to the goalkeeper, the Canadian city is cold, too few residents and there is no entertainment other than hockey. (10) Bryzgalov played 68 games for Phoenix in the 2010-11 NHL regular season. (11) The goaltender hit 92.1 percent of shots, missing 2.48 goals on average per game. (12) In four playoff games, Bryzgalov hit only 87.9 percent of shots and allowed an average of 4.36 goals per game."
\"(1) В Кемеровской области направлено в: "(1) In the Kemerovo region, the case of a man who calls himself a wandering monk has been sent to court. (2) this was reported on october 3 by the kuzbass law enforcement portal. (3) according to the investigation, the defendant alexey konovalov met a student on the train from novokuznetsk to tomsk. (4) konovalov introduced himself as "father alexey" and said that he was going to siberia to worship the shrines. (5) then the monk offered the student a drink for the acquaintance and took out a bottle with some drink. (6) after drinking, the student fell fast asleep. (7) the monk took his laptop and went out to the furnace station. (8) At the station, Konovalov approached the police, told a story about the shrines and complained that he had fallen behind the train. (9) the police began to explain how to get to the destination by bus. (10) But soon the interlocutor seemed suspicious to them, and they decided to check him on the databases. (11) It turned out that the monk was on the federal wanted list (for what crime, it is not specified). (12) In the past, he had already served a short sentence for concealing a murder (initially he was accused of complicity in the murder, but the accomplice took all the blame). (13) During the search, Konovalov's laptop was found. (14) From the contents of the files on the laptop, it became clear that the owner's name was Dmitry, not Alexey. (15) A case of theft was initiated. (16) A student who woke up soon turned to the police."
(1) Проснувшись утром, он решил попросит: (1) When he woke up in the morning, he decided to ask for one last bag of ducats and began to think about who to sell the devil to. (1) Вскоре в библиотеке происходит сканд: (1) Soon there is a scandal in the library. (2) One of the servants of the library, who has long followed the Self-taught Man, catches him when he is sitting in the company of two boys and pats one of them on the hand, accuses him of baseness, of molesting children, and, giving him a punch in the nose, ignominiously throws him out of the library, threatening to call the police. (3) on Saturday Roquentin comes to Paris and meets up with Annie. (4) For six years, Annie has grown very plump, she looks tired. (5) It has changed not only externally, but also internally. (6) She is no longer obsessed with" perfect moments " because she has realized that there will always be someone who will spoil them. (7) Previously, she believed that there are certain emotions, states: Love, Hate, Death, which give rise to "winning situations" - the building material for "perfect moments", and now she realized that these feelings are inside her. (8) Now she remembers the events of her life and builds them, with some adjustments, into a chain of"perfect moments". (11) He is still tormented by a sense of the absurdity of his existence, the consciousness that he is "superfluous".

(1) Действие — в Тавриде перед храмом Ар: (1) Action — in Tauris in front of the temple of Artemis. (2) Iphigenia goes out to the audience and tells them who she is, how she was saved in Aulis, and how she now serves Artemis in this Scythian kingdom. (3) The service is heavy: all strangers who are brought here by the sea are sacrificed here to Artemis, and she, Iphigenia, must prepare them for death. (4) What about her father, mother, brother, she does not know. (5) And now she had a prophetic dream: the palace of Argos has collapsed, there is only one column among the ruins, and she dresses this column as strangers are dressed here before the sacrifice. (6) Of course, this column is Orestes; and the death rite can only mean that he is dead. (7) she wants to mourn him and goes to call her servants for this purpose. (8) while the stage is empty, orestes and pylades enter it. (9) Orestes is alive, and he is in Tauris; they are appointed to steal the idol from this temple, and they are watching how to get there. (10) They will do this at night, and wait out the day in a cave by the sea, where their ship is hidden. (11) Thither they go, and Iphigenia returns to the stage with a chorus of attendants; with them she mourns Orestes, the evil fate of her ancestors, and her bitter fate in a foreign land.

(1) В те отдалённые прежние времена приб: (1) In those remote former times, at about the same level of disintegration of civilizations as we are now witnessing, harsh denouncing prophets were born in the peoples, and then barefoot, bare-headed ideas angrily, with a sword and a torch in their hands, burst into reality to make the necessary sanitary cleaning. (2) Nature has spent too much hope and effort on man to let him die so easily and like a dog. (Z)For the last century, the machine of civilization has been operating at critical speeds with the risk of fatal overload. (4) The dust of moral wear and tear, suspended in the air, burned the breath more and more. (5) It would seem that our contemporaries have no grounds for special pessimism. (6) After all, everything is so systematically moving around. (7) Progress is in good health and rushes forward at full gallop. (8) Shop windows overflowing with goods sparkle, streams of passers-by, tourists, and all sorts of modern cars move through the streets. (9) airliners cover distances that took Marco Polo and Afanasy Nikitin three years each to cover in a day. (10) The whole world is covered with fascinating posters, calling for the use of various means to pass away the boredom of life unnoticed. (11) Museums are no longer sufficient for advanced works of art, and inquisitive sciences with an extraordinary efficiency are probing the surrounding unknown in order to extract from it benefits for further pleasure. (12) each holding strange devices allowing them to communicate almost from the North pole, which would have put fear in our nothing smyslovsky in the technique of their ancestors. (13) But we'll see how shaking the arrows of pressure gauges, determining spiritual well-being in the world, spreading the burnt fumes from overheated feet, strained wire, it burns the face excessively hot air which suspicious drones crawling on the ground, not only from the awakening of the continents or of the origin of innovative ideas, but also from something else... (14) Something similar experience in a dream, when, having crept to the door, you hear her hidden, hidden breath of some unspeakable creature just waiting for the moment to insert the knee just slightly open a small gap, and rush to you in a warm, habitable housing. (15) It seems that humanity is approaching the end of its modest eternity. (16) And science, having made its way through the zero phase of time and physical existence, will break into another, not yet mastered mathematical space with the transfer of the intellectual capital of the universe there. (17) The now obvious collapse of yesterday's era will end with the inevitable revision of the sadly defaulted pair of Good and Evil. (18) 3Now helps to look into the abyss, but does not contain instructions on how not to fall into it. (19) The progress itself should be likened to the gorenje of a Bickford cord: our happiness consists in the fact that it is not visible how little is left before the charge. (By L. M. Leonov)
\"(1) Вице-премьер Ольга Голодец предлож: "(1) Deputy Prime Minister Olga Golodets proposed to rename the action"Total Dictation". (5) Golodets believes that a more appropriate name for the action will be "united" or "All-Russian" dictation. (6) At the same time, the Deputy Prime Minister proposed to conduct oral tests on the knowledge of the Russian language for all school teachers. (7) " We need to make certain tests on how the teacher speaks Russian, and conduct testing. (8) Further-individual trajectory. (9) It is necessary to understand which of the subject students says what," Golodets added. (10) "Total Dictation" has been held since 2004. (11) The action on mass literacy testing, which involves Russians and Russian-speaking residents of other countries, was invented by students of Novosibirsk State University. (12) This year the action was held on April 18, it was attended by about 94 thousand people in 58 countries of the world. (13) The author of the text was literary critic and prose writer Evgeny Vodolazkin. (14) In different years, texts for dictation were written by Boris Strugatsky, Dmitry Bykov, Dina Rubina, Zakhar Prilepin and Alexey Ivanov."
(1) Три портрета королей династии Тюдоро: (1) Three portraits of Tudor kings from the British National Portrait Gallery will be sent for restoration. (2) this is reported by the daily telegraph. (3) among the paintings that are awaiting work with restorers is a portrait of elizabeth i, created around 1575. (4) This is one of two large portraits of the Queen that are believed to have been painted by the English artist Nicholas Hilliard (circa 1547-1619). (5) the large-scale canvas is an important work in the work of hilliard, who became famous mainly because of the portrait miniatures of the court of the monarch. (6) The portrait of Elizabeth I, covered with varnish, significantly yellowed, as a result of which the color of the paint layer was distorted. (7) during the restoration, the painting must be restored to its original appearance. (8) Together with the portrait of the Queen, two paintings depicting Edward VI, the son of Henry VIII, will be restored. (9) Both paintings belong to the brush of an unknown artist. (10) According to the publication, one of them shows Edward together with his dying father, pointing to his heir. (11) this painting was painted during the reign of elizabeth i (1558-1603). (12) How much will be spent on restoration, not reported. (13) However, we know that funding for work will send a Bank of America Merrill Lynch, which conducts large-scale project for the restoration of works of art art Conservation Project. (14) The collaboration with the National Portrait Gallery is one of the bank's 24 restoration projects, which will be implemented in 16 countries this year.
(1) Житель Северной Каролины Эрнесто Род: (1) north carolina resident ernesto rodriguez took his dog to a tattoo artist's session, wghp reported. (2) a four-month-old american bulldog was tattooed on his stomach. (3) According to the owner of the animal named Duchess, during the procedure, his pet was asleep, and she was not in pain. (4) rodriguez stated that the tattoo is a distinctive feature of his favorite's appearance. (5) His second dog, Duke, also got a tattoo. (6) As the American explained, the tattoos were made "just in case": if something happens to the dogs, for example, they get lost, they will be easy to identify and return to the owner. (7) When the Duchess got a tattoo, her owner posted photos of the result of visiting the salon on his Facebook. (8) Most of those who saw these pictures criticized Rodriguez and accused him of being cruel to the dog. (9) He stated, however, that he did not consider the tattoo to be cruel. (10) According to a North Carolina resident, tattooing, even on a dog, is an art. (11) The owner of the Duchess also stressed that he loves his dogs very much and treats them as carefully and reverently as his own children. (12) He does not intend to give up the practice of tattooing dogs in the future. (13) According to Rodriguez, he will also give tattoos to his future pets. (14) Animal welfare organizations have not commented on the situation.
\"(1)В письме к жене 18 мая 1836 года Пу: "(1)In a letter to his wife on May 18, 1836, Pushkin wondered: where did these prudent young people come from," who are spat in the eyes, and they wipe themselves " instead of defending their honor? (2)sometimes it seems that we came out of the greatcoats of these people. (3) the sound of elastic steel is no longer heard in the word honor. (4)Let us open Dahl's dictionary to recall what was at stake in the name of a life full of great hopes and brilliant plans. (5) So, "honor is the inner moral dignity of a person, valor, honesty, nobility of soul and a clear conscience." (6) And here are examples: "A man of unblemished honor. Honestly... I assure you on my honor. An act incompatible with honor... you should know the honor... Field of honor... My honor demands blood... " (7)Duel! "only this discharge of murderous power could rapidly restore the moral balance. (8) The scoundrel knew that his meanness could be punished, not by a fine in a year's time on the verdict of the court, but tonight. (9)tomorrow morning at the latest. (10)the vulgar man did not speak ambiguities aloud, fearing immediate retribution. (11)The gossip had to be careful. (12)in the menacing light of the dueling rules, the word quickly turned to lead. (13)And what about Pushkin? (14)What an irreparable and senseless death... (15)Yes, irreparable, but not senseless. (16)Yes, "a slave of honor", but after all of honor! (17) 3a year before the duel, Pushkin wrote to Count Repnin: "As a nobleman and father of a family, I must preserve the honor and name that I will leave to my children." (18) That's all that remains for children: honor and name. (19)They don't need anything else, and nothing else matters. (20)Obviously, we still have a lot to go through and change our minds to get back to understanding this truth. (according to d. shevarov)"
(1) Певец Мэрилин Мэнсон подвергся напад: (1) Singer Marilyn Manson was attacked by a man in a cafe in the Canadian province of Alberta, reports NME. (2) The musician was hit in the face. (3) according to manson's official spokesman, the incident was unprovoked. (4) As the publication clarifies, when the singer was having dinner in a cafe, two girls approached him and asked him to take a picture with him. (5) at this time, an unknown person first pushed manson, and then hit him and shouted that he would try to disrupt his next concert. (6) Witnesses confirmed that the musician was calm and friendly and did not give any reason for aggressive actions in his address. (7) They also added that Manson was bleeding after the blow. (8) The singer himself did not comment on the incident. (9) Marilyn Manson is an American rock musician, showman and artist. (10) His stage name is a combination of the names of two iconic figures-actress Marilyn Monroe and murderer Charles Manson. (11) The musician's previous album Pale Emperor was released in January 2015. (12) Manson's work is often viewed negatively. (13) For example, in June last year, a concert of a musician in Novosibirsk was canceled after 400 local residents spoke at a rally. (14) The townspeople claimed that Manson's lyrics were "a mixture of obscenities, drug propaganda, sexual perversions, and insults to the Christian faith." (15) The musician's performance was also disrupted in Moscow.
(1) Правоохранительные органы Турции пре: (1) turkish law enforcement authorities prevented a terrorist attack at istanbul's ataturk airport by detaining a suspected suicide bomber. (2) On Thursday, September 8, Sabah reports. (3) Intelligence agencies have received information that Ebru Firat, a woman close to one of the leaders of the Kurdistan Workers ' Party (PKK, considered a terrorist organization in Turkey) Murat Karayilan, is heading to Istanbul from Diyarbakir. (4) Firat was detained, whether she had a suicide belt is not specified. (5) Security measures have been strengthened at the airport. (6) More than 30 people were killed in the Istanbul airport bombings. (7) On June 28, three terrorists opened fire with automatic weapons near the Istanbul airport, after which two of them detonated explosive devices inside the terminal, the third-at the entrance to the building. (8) 43 people were killed and more than 200 injured. (9) The Turkish leadership said that the Islamic State group was behind the attack. (10) The police detained 13 suspects of involvement in the terrorist attack. (11) Among them — three foreigners. (12) Akhmed Chatayev, a native of Chechnya, who has been on the federal wanted list since 2008, is suspected of organizing the terrorist attack. (13) According to law enforcement agencies, he emigrated to Europe a few years ago. (14) chatayev allegedly worked for the leader of the caucasus emirate group, doku umarov, and after the latter's death joined the islamic state (both groups are banned in russia).
\"(1) В Москве вечером в воскресенье, 31: "(1) in moscow on sunday evening, january 31, the winners of the sixth international viola competition, initiated by yuri bashmet, were announced. (2) this is reported by itar-tass. (3) the first prize of the viola competition was shared by russian alexander akimov and chinese peijun xu. (4) The second prize was awarded to the representative of Russia Irina Sopova and Elias Goldstein from the United States. (5) Finally, the third prize was awarded to Russian Armen Nazaryan. (6) according to the agency, the first prize winner akimov - a graduate of the moscow conservatory and a soloist of the russian national orchestra - has performed at several prestigious music forums, including the moscow easter festival and the "december evenings of svyatoslav richter". (7) At the viola competition in 2006, Akimov was awarded the second prize. (8) The Sixth Moscow International Viola Competition opened on January 24 - Yuri Bashmet's birthday. (9) About forty performers from all over the world took part in the competition. (10) within the framework of the competition, the jury of which was headed by bashmet, three rounds and the final were held. (11) In the first round, the portal notes Classica.FM, the contestants performed the obligatory works of Bach and Mozart. (12) The second was presented by contemporary music, and the third was dedicated to composers representing the Romantic era - Brahms and Schumann. (13) In the final, the contenders for the prize performed a concert symphony for violin and viola by Mozart, as well as one of the concertos by Bartok, Walton and Schnittke. (14) The concert of the winners of the Viola competition will take place in the Great Hall of the Conservatory on February 1."
(1) Прометей предлагает в награду за осв: (1) prometheus offers to reveal the future to zeus as a reward for his liberation. (2) He, doubting at first the prophetic gift of the titan, immediately gives up: Prometheus accurately guesses that Zeus is going to meet Thetis — nereid, one of the sea goddesses. (3) And he warns Zeus: if Nereid bears him a son, he will overthrow the father from the Olympian throne. (4) convinced and even slightly moved by this prediction, zeus refuses the fateful rendezvous and orders the blacksmith god hephaestus to release prometheus. (5) Called to account for his cruel tricks, Eros asks Zeus to pardon him, because he is, they say, still a child. (6) " are you a child?!— exclaims the indignant Zeus. (7) for you, eros, are much older than ialet. (8) Because you do not have a beard and gray hair, you want to be considered a child, even though you are an old man, and a scoundrel at that!" (9) As a punishment for numerous bullying, Zeus intends to bind Eros. (10) For it was by his grace that he was forced, in order to win the love of women, to turn into a bull, an eagle, a swan, a satyr, and could not appear to them in his true form.
(1) Экшн Watch Dogs можно будет пройти п: (1) Watch Dogs action game can be completed with almost no kills. (2) This was stated by Dominique Guet, Senior director of the game, in an interview with Polygon. (3) According to him, the stealth walkthrough, in which the main character will not need to kill anyone, will be available in about 95 percent of all missions in the game. (4) The number of tasks in which you still have to commit murders is very limited. (5) Thus, in most cases, how exactly to pass a particular episode — to kill everyone in a row or not to attract attention — depends entirely on the player. (6) Watch Dogs is an open-world action game set in Chicago. (7) Its main character is a hacker named Aidan Pierce, who has connected to the city's control system and can thus manipulate city objects. (8) So, the Pier is able to change the mode of switching colors at traffic lights, suspend the movement of trains in the subway, as well as turn off and turn back on electricity. (9) The hero is also able to learn personal information about the ordinary inhabitants of the city and gain access to their funds. (10) He can also find places where a crime will occur in the near future and prevent it. (11) With the help of his skills, Pierce will try to take revenge on the people who, in his opinion, are to blame for the tragedy that happened to his family. (12) Watch Dogs will be released in November. (13) The game will be released on PS3, Xbox 360, PC, Wii U and the next-generation Xbox One and PS4 consoles.
\"(1) Президент России Владимир Путин за: "(1) Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the United States put pressure on France to force it to abandon the supply of Mistral helicopter carriers. Putin said at a meeting of Russian ambassadors and permanent representatives. (6) However, the president said that Russia is not going to end relations with the United States. (7) "We are not going to close our relations with the United States at all. (8) Bilateral relations are not in the best shape right now, it's true. (1) Флешмоб с хештегом #ForceForDaniel (: (1) A flash mob with the hashtag # forcefordaniel (#siladdaniel) has been launched on social media, The Telegraph reports. Abrams and the film's producers have not yet responded to the flash mob. (9) Abrams has faced a similar situation before. (1) Под Цюрихом, в психиатрической лечеб: (1) Dr. Domler's friend and colleague Franz Gregorovius works in the psychiatric hospital near Zurich. (2) For three years now, the daughter of an American millionaire, Nicole Warren, has been in this hospital; she lost her mind when she became her own father's mistress at the age of sixteen. (3) The program of her recovery included correspondence with the Diver. (4) In three years, Nicole's health has improved so much that she is going to be discharged. (5) After seeing her correspondent, Nicole falls in love with him. (6) Dick is in a difficult position: on the one hand, he knows that this feeling was partly provoked for medicinal purposes; on the other hand, he, who "collected her personality from pieces", understands more than anyone else that if this feeling is taken away from her, then her soul will remain empty. (7) And besides, Nicole is very beautiful, and he is not only a doctor, but also a man. (8) Contrary to the arguments of reason and the advice of Franz and Domler, Dick marries Nicole. (9) He is aware that relapses of the disease are inevitable — he is ready for this. (10) He sees a much bigger problem in Nicole's wealth — after all, he is not marrying her money (as Nicole's sister Baby thinks), but rather in spite of it — but this does not stop him. (11) They love each other, and in spite of everything, they are happy.
(1) Но в один прекрасный день он забрал: (1) But one day he took his wife's five-year-old son, whom the doctors considered mentally retarded, and together with the child began to live as a recluse in a shelter. (2) He himself appointed himself the confidant of those whom he loved most in this world, the trees and the whales. (3) He changed his name to emphasize his new identity, and began calling himself Ooki ("mighty tree») Isana ("brave fish"). (4) He is engaged in looking at photos of whales, watching the trees growing outside with binoculars. (5) To be closer to nature, he has made a hole in the floor of the bunker 30×30 centimeters and plunges into reflection, putting his bare feet on the real ground. (6) Isana recorded the voices of various birds on tape, and his son Jin learned to recognize them unmistakably: it turned out that the boy has an unusually sharp hearing. (7) One day, an incident occurs in a swampy lowland that is visible from the windows of the shelter. (8) A young girl seduces a police agent, and her friends attack him and take the gun. (9) In order to escape, the agent chooses the smallest of the attackers and, having contrived, puts a handcuff on his hand, while he snaps the second handcuff on his hand. (10) The teenagers beat up the agent, and the boy tries to cut off his arm to escape. (11) The police agent unfastens the handcuff and runs away, and the teenagers run after him for a long time with screams.
(1) Британец Бен Хупер, пытающийся перес: (1) Briton Ben Hooper, trying to cross the Atlantic Ocean by swimming, covered only 67 nautical miles (about 124 kilometers) in the first 18 days. (2) The Daily Mail notes that at this rate, it will not reach the goal until 2018. (3) A 38-year-old man, formerly a police officer in Gloucestershire, started swimming on 13 November in Senegal. (4) According to The Guardian, he plans to spend 10 hours a day in the water and reach the Brazilian city of Natal by March. (5) On the way, he is accompanied by a ship with 10 people on board, including a representative of the Guinness Book of Records. (6) Hooper attributed the delay to unforeseen difficulties. (7) The special repellent with which he hoped to repel jellyfish does not work. (8) There are sharks swimming around, and big waves keep turning the swimmer over. (9) To top it all off, a pegasus fish got into his ear. (10) "Jellyfish sting me constantly and we've seen sharks twice," Hooper wrote on Facebook. (11) He also assured readers that neither he nor his team had consumed alcohol during the expedition. (12) The first swimmer to cross the Atlantic Ocean was Frenchman Benoit Lecomte. (13) In 1988, he sailed from Massachusetts in the United States to France in 73 days. (14) the guinness book of world records did not count the record because a swimmer spent a week in the azores due to seasickness. (15) In October, it was reported that a resident of the state of Colorado (USA) swam a record distance of 132 kilometers without stopping. (16) The marathon swim lasted 56 hours.
\"(1) ДНК-экспертиза подтвердила подлинн: "(1) DNA testing has confirmed the authenticity of the remains recovered from the grave of Romanian dictator Nicolae Ceausescu. (2) This was reported on November 3 by Agence France-Presse. (3) According to the agency, the DNA samples extracted from the remains matched the materials taken from Ceausescu's brother and son. (4) Thus, the ownership of the remains of the dictator is proved almost certainly. (5) Experts say that full confidence could only be achieved if they had any genetic material taken from Ceausescu during his lifetime. (6) The examination of the remains, presumably belonging to Ceausesco's wife Elena, has not yet been completed. (7) Nicolae Ceausescu has led Romania since 1965. (8) In December 1989, the dictator was overthrown. (9) Ceausescu and his wife were found guilty of genocide and sentenced to death. (10) The brief trial was broadcast on television. (11) The sentence was carried out immediately after the end of the broadcast. (12) First, the bodies of the executed were taken to the Steaua Stadium. (13) The new authorities then announced that the dictator and his wife were buried in the Gencha cemetery, located next to the stadium. (14) In the summer of 2010, Ceausescu's relatives, who doubted the official version of the dictator's burial site, obtained the exhumation of the remains in order to identify them."
\"(1) В интернете были опубликованы перв: "(1) The first footage from Steven Spielberg's The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn has been published on the Internet. (8) "If we were just shooting live actors, they wouldn't look like characters drawn by Hergé. (9) And computer graphics will preserve caricature faces and other features of the artist's works. (11)" The Adventures of Tintin "features actors such as Daniel Craig, Andy Serkis, Nick Frost and Simon Pegg. (12)" The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn " is scheduled to premiere in late 2011."

(1) Сирийские повстанцы утром 8 августа: (1) Syrian rebels fired rockets at President Bashar al-Assad's motorcade on the morning of August 8. (1) В Краснодарском крае вынесен пригово: (1) In the Krasnodar Territory, a verdict was passed in the case of a riot in the Belorechensk juvenile colony. \"(1) Московский футбольный клуб \"Спарт: "(1) Moscow football club "Spartak" will buy the goalkeeper of Kazan "Rubin" Sergey Ryzhikov for ten million euros, reports "Soviet Sport". \"(1) В городе Аугсбург на юге Германии: "(1) In the city of Augsburg in southern Germany, Mitek (Mieczyslaw) Pemper, the compiler of the famous Schindler list, died at the age of 91, Agence France-Presse reports. (2) The individuals on this list, 1,200 Jews, were saved from death in Nazi concentration camps during World War II. (3) Pemper died on Tuesday, June 7. (4) His death was announced on 9 June by the city of Augsburg. (5) Pemper was born to a Jewish family in Krakow in 1920. (6) After the occupation of Poland, he was sent to the Plaszow concentration camp, built near the city, where he worked as the commandant's machinist. (7) While working in the camp, he met the German industrialist Oskar Schindler and, at his request, compiled a list of 1,200 prisoners of the camp, who then went to work in his factories. (8) During the war years, Schindler used various tricks, including bribes, to save these people from the Nazis. (9) Oskar Schindler died in Germany in 1974. (10) His activities during the war formed the basis of the book on which Steven Spielberg in 1993 shot "Schindler's List", which won seven Academy Awards. (11) Mitek Pemper worked as a consultant during the filming of the film.Pemper has lived in Augsburg since 1958. (12) In 2003, he received the Medal of Merit, and in 2007 became an honorary citizen of the city. (13) Pemper will be buried in the Jewish cemetery of Augsburg on Friday, June 10."
(1) Спикер парламента Новороссии Олег Ца: (1) Speaker of the Parliament of Novorossiya Oleg Tsarev in an interview with the newspaper "Kommersant" spoke about how the elections to the parliaments of the DPR and LPR will be held. (2) According to Tsarev, the elections will be held according to the proportional system, registered public associations will be able to nominate their lists. (3) " 100 deputies will be in the donetsk parliament, 50 — in lugansk, 60 will be in the parliament of novorossiya-30 from the republic. (4) The elections to the parliaments of the DPR and LPR will be direct, and then they will form the parliament of Novorossiya," the deputy of the Verkhovna Rada added. (5) At the same time, he found it difficult to say how many residents of Donbass will be able to take part in the vote. (6) "It is difficult to count potential voters: during the year 4.3 million Ukrainians crossed the border with Russia, 3 million returned, about 1 million remain in Russia, a significant part of them are refugees from Novorossiya. (7) in the republics, the census was not conducted, more than half of the population left donetsk. (8) the number of residents can be estimated only by the consumption of bread and electricity," tsarev said. (9) "the elections are a new step in legitimizing the independent status of novorossiya. (10) The first step was a referendum. (11) the second is elections. (12) the third will be their recognition," tsarev summed up. (13) elections to the parliaments of the dpr and lpr should be held on november 2. (14) A few days before that, elections to the Verkhovna Rada will be held, which representatives of the people's republics of Donbass have decided to ignore. (15) The Donetsk People's Republic and the Luhansk People's Republic were formed in the spring of 2014 by supporters of the separation of Donbass.
\"(1) Президент ФРГ Кристиан Вульф заяви: "(1) German President Christian Wulff stated that Germany was faced with the task of a new unification. (1) Спустя какое-то время везение прекра: (1) After some time, luck stops. (2) The editors are vying to cheat Martin. (3) It is not easy to get money from them for publications. (4) Ruth insists that Martin get a job with her father, she does not believe that he will become a writer. (5) By chance, at the Morse's, Martin meets Rass Brissenden and gets close to him. (6) Brissenden is sick with consumption, he is not afraid of death, but passionately loves life in all its manifestations. (7) Brissenden introduces Martin to "real people" who are obsessed with literature and philosophy. (8) With his new comrade, Martin attends a meeting of socialists, where he argues with the speaker, but thanks to a quick and unscrupulous reporter, he gets on the pages of newspapers as a socialist and a subverter of the existing system. (9) A newspaper publication leads to sad consequences — Ruth sends Martin a letter informing him of the breakup of the engagement. (10) Martin continues to live by inertia, and he is not even happy with the receipts coming from magazines — almost everything written by Martin is now published. (11) brissenden commits suicide, and his poem "ephemeris", which martin published, causes a storm of vulgar criticism and makes martin glad that his friend does not see it.
(1) «Я уже слышу твоё возражение, что сч: (1) "I already hear your objection that happiness is not only to love, but also to be loved. (2) But he who really loves does not expect or beg: what will my love bring me?.. (3) Is reciprocity waiting for me? (4) Or maybe I love more and I am loved less? (5) The person who measures and weighs does not love. (6) let your love go free, let its rays shine and warm in all directions. (7) And you will soon feel that streams of reciprocal love are flowing to you from everywhere. (8) Why? (9) Because your immediate, unintentional kindness, your unselfish love, will imperceptibly evoke kindness and love in people in return. (10) And then you will perceive this return flow not as a hard-won happiness that had to be demanded and sought, but as an undeserved earthly bliss." (11) I finished reading my mother's letter with tears in my eyes. (12) From the distance of the past years, I again heard her warm voice, which brought me love and comfort, as "undeserved earthly bliss." (13) And then I thought that our love is the thread that binds us to the person we love. (1) He who loves, his heart blooms and smells sweet, and he gives his love as a flower gives its smell. (15) Such a person does not feel alone. (by i. a. ilyin)
(1) К этому времени автор повествования: (1) by this time, the author of the story is already familiar with marusya tatarovich. (2) she lives in a rented empty apartment, almost always without money. \"(1) Нижняя палата парламента Великобри: "(1) The Lower House of the UK Parliament (House of Commons) supported Brexit. (2) This is reported by The Daily Mail. (3) After a six-hour debate, MPs approved Prime Minister Theresa May's decision to start the process of leaving the European Union by the end of March 2017. (9) But the only thing we need now is a plan laid out on paper." (10) On November 8, it became known that the head of the British government is going to start official negotiations with the European Union on Brexit at the end of March 2017. (11) The referendum on the country's withdrawal from the EU was held on June 23. (12) More than half of the British people who took part in the plebiscite voted for Brexit. (13) After that, Prime Minister David Cameron resigned, and Theresa May took his place."
(1) Зверолов уходит из дома, чтобы умере: (1) The hunter leaves home to die alone. (1)Человек создан на столетия, если суди: (1)Man is created for centuries, if we judge by the huge, incomparable waste of energy. (2)A lion, having killed an antelope, rests for a day in a well-fed slumber. (3)The mighty elk, after an hour-long battle with an opponent, defends itself for half a day in the thicket, convulsively moving its sunken sides. (4)Aitmatov's Karanar saved up his strength for a year to rampage, rage and triumph for half a month. (5) For a man, such feats are the brilliance of the moment, for which he pays so little of his reserves that he does not need to rest at all. (6) The goal of the beast is to live out the time allotted by nature. (7) The amount of energy stored in it is correlated with this period, and the living being spends not as much as it wants, but as much as it needs, as if it has some kind of dosing device: the beast does not know the desire, it exists according to the law of necessity. (8) Is it not because the beasts do not suspect that life is finite? (9)The life of animals is time from birth to death: animals live in absolute time, not knowing that there is also relative time, in this relative time only man can exist. (10)His life never fits into the dates on the tombstone. (11)It is larger, it contains the seconds known only to him, which dragged on like hours, and the days that flew by like moments. (12) And the higher the spiritual structure of a person, the more opportunities he has to live not only in absolute, but also in relative time. (13)For me, the global super-task of art is its ability to prolong human life, to saturate it with meaning, to teach people to actively exist in relative time, that is, to doubt, feel and suffer. (14)This is about spirituality, but even in ordinary, physical life, a person is released" fuel " obviously more than necessary in order to live according to the laws of nature. (15)Why, for what purpose? (16)after all, everything in nature is reasonable, everything is verified, tested for millions of years, and even the appendix, as it turned out, is still needed for something. (17)And a huge supply of energy that is many times greater than the needs of a person is given for what? (18) I asked this question in the fifth or sixth grade, when I got to elementary physics, and decided that it explains everything. (19)She really explained everything to me then-except the man. (20)I couldn't explain it. (According to B. L. Vasiliev*)
(1) В Санкт-Петербурге направлено в суд: (1) In St. Petersburg, the case of police officer Denis Gribkov, who is accused of pedophilia, has been sent to court. (2) This was reported on February 2 on the website of the St. Petersburg Department of the UPC of the Russian Federation. (3) According to the investigation, in 2006-2008, Gribkov committed three sexual acts of violence against 11-15-year-old boys and three more times unsuccessfully attempted such acts. (4) Gribkov attacked children in various districts of St. Petersburg, as well as in the metro. (5) At the same time, he was wearing a police uniform. (6) In 2008, Gribkov and his colleague Yuri Korotkov were detained on suspicion of murdering the detainee. (7) Policemen shot one of the participants in a mass brawl in the head. (8) During the investigation of the incident, it became clear that in the past, these policemen had repeatedly beaten detainees. (9) In August 2009, Korotkov was sentenced to five years in prison, and Gribkov to 3.5 years. (10) However, the prosecution appealed the sentence as too lenient, and the case was sent for a new trial in November. (11) Gribkov was suspected of pedophilia shortly after the start of the investigation into the murder and beatings. (12) Investigators drew attention to the fact that after Gribkov's detention, the St. Petersburg police stopped receiving statements from teenagers who had suffered from the actions of a maniac in a police uniform. (13) So the detainee became a person involved in the second criminal case.

(1) Когда дело кончено, один из налётчик: (1) When the case is over, one of the robbers throws off the cape, it is a Caballero Swindler who pays off the improvised stolen items. (1) Звонил Зильберович по поручению Сим: (1) Called Dilberovic on behalf of SIM Simich Karnavalov. (2) At one time, it was Leo who discovered Karnavalov as a writer. (3) Sim Simych, a former convict, then worked as a stoker in a kindergarten, led an ascetic lifestyle and wrote from morning to night. (4) He conceived the fundamental work "The Great Zone" in sixty volumes, which the author himself called "blocks". (5) Soon after Karnavalov was "discovered" in Moscow, he began to be published abroad and instantly gained fame. (6) The entire Soviet power — the police, the KGB, the Writers ' Union — entered into a struggle with him. (7) But they could not arrest him, and they could not expel him: remembering the story of Solzhenitsyn, Karnavalov appealed to the whole world not to accept him if the "swallowers" (as he called the Communists) forced him out. (8) Then the authorities had no choice but to simply push him out of the plane that was flying over Holland. (9) Eventually Sim Simych settled in Canada on his own estate, called Otradnoye, where everything was set up in the Russian way: they ate cabbage soup, porridge, women wore sundresses and headscarves. (10) The owner himself memorized Dahl's dictionary at night, and in the morning he rehearsed the solemn entry to Moscow on a white horse. (11) Kartsev Karnavalov instructed to take to Moscow thirty-six ready-made "blocks" of the "Big Zone" and a letter to the "Future rulers of Russia".
(1) В день премьеры спектакля, в котором: (1) On the day of the premiere of the play in which Avice Crichton was cast, Julia accidentally runs into Tom and enjoys the fact that Tom no longer causes her any feelings. (2) but avice will be destroyed. (3) And here comes Julia's finest hour. (4) Played at half-strength in rehearsals, at the premiere she unfolds at the full power of her talent and skill, and the only big mise en scene of Avice turns into a triumphant performance of the great Julia Lambert. (5) She has been summoned ten times; a crowd of three hundred people is raging at the service exit; Dolly is giving a grand reception in her honor; Tom, forgetting about Avice, is again at her feet; Michael is genuinely delighted — Julia is pleased with herself. (6) "I will never have another moment like this in my life. (7) I'm not going to share it with anyone," she says, and, slipping away from everyone, goes to a restaurant and orders beer, steak with onions and fried potatoes, which she hasn't eaten for ten years. (8) What is love compared to a steak? (9) How wonderful that her heart belongs to her alone! (10) Unrecognized, from under the brim of a hat that hides her face, Julia looks at the restaurant's customers and thinks that Roger is wrong, because the actors and their roles are symbols of that disorderly, aimless struggle that is called life, and only the symbol is real. (11) Its "pretence" is the only reality...
(1) Изжелта-серый, сверху рыхлый, исподн: (1) Yellow-gray, loose from above, hard from below, skrypuchy sand... sand without end, wherever you look! (2) And over this sandy desert, over this sea of dead dust, the huge head of the Egyptian sphinx rises. (3) What do these large, protruding lips, these motionless, dilated, upturned nostrils-and these eyes, these long, half – asleep, half-attentive eyes under the double arch of high eyebrows mean? (4) And they want to say something! (5) They even speak – but only Oedipus can solve the riddle and understand their silent speech. (6) bah! Yes, I recognize these features... (7) There is nothing Egyptian about them anymore. (8) White low forehead, prominent cheekbones, nose short and straight, beautiful white teeth mouth, soft mustache and beard curly and these widely spaced small eyes... and on his head the cap of hair cut parted... (9) Yes, it's you, Karp, Sidor, Semyon, Yaroslavl, Ryazan peasant, saatchis my Russian bone! (10) how Long have you got to the sphinxes? (11) Or and you also want something to say? It is not enough to put on a murmur to become your Oedipus, O All-Russian Sphinx!
\"(1) Бывший президент СССР Михаил Горба: "(1) Former Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev announced his readiness to lead the League of Voters," Interfax reports. (2)" Yes, I would agree to lead the 'League of Voters', " the agency quotes Gorbachev as saying in response to a question during a lecture at the International University in Moscow. (3) The" League of Voters " appeared after mass civil protests against the falsification of the results of the State Duma elections. (4) It was created on the initiative of Leonid Parfenov and Boris Akunin in January 2012. (5) It is positioned as a general civil movement for fair elections and fair relations between the state and citizens and does not plan to become a political party. (6) In particular, members of the "League of Voters" hope to receive mandates from presidential candidates to monitor the elections. (7) The League does not have a formal leader, and the 16 founders of the movement include public figures, journalists and TV presenters. (8) Gorbachev is not among them. (9) The former president of the USSR, in a lecture at the International University, also said that, in his opinion, Vladimir Putin has done a lot of useful things, but now he has "exhausted himself". (10) " Most likely, Putin will go to the president. (11) But if he cannot overcome himself, otherwise he will lead the case, then everyone will go out into the square. (12) This cannot be allowed. (13) They will take to the squares if the situation does not change after the presidential election," Gorbachev said. (14) Gorbachev in December 2011 already called on Putin to leave politics, and in January 2012 proposed to hold a referendum for the abolition of "autocracy"."
\"(1) В Донецке пропал журналист и опера: "(1) Journalist and operator of the NTN TV channel Alexander Osadchy disappeared in Donetsk. (2) This was reported on his Facebook page by his colleague Sergey Vedin. (3) The latter assumes that the correspondent was abducted by the militia. (4) According to Vedin, Osadchy left the house on August 2, went for a bike ride and has not yet returned. (5) He was carrying a passport, 200 hryvnias (660 rubles), an iPhone and a spare Nokia phone. (6) " At about 14: 00, representatives of the DPR showed up at the address of Sasha's common-law wife, who asked her for an iPhone charger. (7) Questions about where he is being held, health status, etc.were answered in a streamlined manner. (8) " Don't worry! (9) Your husband is doing well, eating and working. (10) will be back home in a week, " Vedin wrote. (11) The Donetsk City Council later posted information about the journalist's disappearance on its website. (12) Gorlovka.ua writes that Osadchy may have been forced to dig trenches and build fortifications. (13) Earlier, the network repeatedly reported the disappearance or capture of journalists in Ukraine. (14) A number of Russian journalists, including employees of the Zvezda TV channel and the ANNA news agency, were detained by Ukrainian security forces. (15) Ukrainian journalist Anton Skiba, who collaborates with CNN, and Russian correspondent of Novaya Gazeta Pavel Kanygin were held captive by the militia at various times."
(1) Дон Кихот решил спуститься в пещеру: (1) Don Quixote decided to go down to the cave of Montesinos. (2) Sancho and the student guide tied a rope around him, and he began to descend. (3) When all the hundred braces of the rope were unwound, they waited for half an hour and began to pull the rope, which was as easy as if there was no weight on it, and only the last twenty braces were heavy to pull. (4)When they took out Don Quixote, his eyes were closed and they had difficulty in shaking him. (5) Don Quixote said that he saw many wonders in the cave, saw the heroes of the old romances of Montesinos and Durandarte, and also the enchanted Dulcinea, who even asked him for a loan of six reals. (6) This time his story seemed improbable even to Sancho, who well knew what kind of wizard had bewitched Dulcinea, but Don Quixote stood firm. (7) When they reached the inn, which Don Quixote, contrary to his usual custom, did not consider a castle, Maese Pedro appeared there with the diviner monkey and raik. (8) The monkey recognized Don Quixote and Sancho Panza and told them all about them, and when the performance began, Don Quixote, feeling sorry for the noble heroes, rushed with his sword at their pursuers and killed all the dolls. (9) However, he later paid Pedro handsomely for the destroyed paradise, so that he was not offended. (10) In fact, it was Hines de Pasamonte, who was hiding from the authorities and engaged in the trade of a raeshnik — so he knew everything about Don Quixote and Sancho, but usually, before entering the village, he asked around about its inhabitants and for a small bribe "guessed" the past.
\"(1) Госсекретарь США Джон Керри заявил: "(1) US Secretary of State John Kerry said that he considers his current post to be the last in his political career. (2) He said this in an interview with CNN. (3) When asked if he plans to run for president in 2016, Kerry said that he has no such plans. (4) " This is (the work of the Secretary of State — approx. "Of the tape.roo") my final stop, " he said, stressing that after serving the current term, "he will move on." (5) John Kerry has been the head of the US State Department since 2013, when Hillary Clinton left the post. (8) As Secretary of State, Kerry succeeded in getting the Palestinian-Israeli talks to resume. (9) He also met with his Iranian counterpart, Mohammad Javad Zarif. (10) Negotiations between Iran and the United States at such a high level have not been held before for more than six years. (1) При взрыве в больнице пакистанского: (1) An explosion at a hospital in the Pakistani city of Quetta killed 53 people. (2) According to The International News, another 50 people were injured. (3) An explosive device went off in the intensive care unit of a Quetta hospital during a farewell ceremony for lawyer Bilal Anwar Kasi, who was killed by unknown assailants a few hours ago. (4) After the explosion, shooting started in the department. (5) The hospital is now cordoned off by border guards (the city, the capital of Balochistan province, is located near the border with Afghanistan) and police officers. (6) Security measures have been strengthened in all medical facilities in Quetta. (7) Journalists, police officers and lawyers were among the dead. (8) No one has yet claimed responsibility for the attack. (9) Bilal Anwar Kasi, president of the Balochistan Bar Association, was shot by two unknown assailants. (10) They ambushed his car in one of the city streets. (11) This is the second attack on lawyers in Quetta in recent months. (12) In June, the rector of the Balochistan University College of Law, Amanullah Achakzai, was fatally shot by two motorcyclists. (13) They were never found, and Achakzai later died in hospital. (14) In protest at the indecisive actions of the police, the lawyers of Balochistan declared a boycott and refused to participate in all judicial proceedings in the province.
\"(1) Режиссёр Даррен Аронофски заявил,: "(1) Director Darren Aronofsky said that he conceived the films "Wrestler" and" Black Swan " as a single project, according to the website Collider with reference to the MTV channel. (2) "I once worked on a project that centered on a romance between a ballerina and a wrestler. (3) And then this project broke up into two films," Aronofsky said. (4) He also stated that he sees many similarities between wrestling matches and ballet. (5) From the point of view of the director, both are art. (6) Aronofsky expressed the hope that viewers will also be able to find common features in the films "Wrestler" and "Black Swan", and some cinema will show the films at a double screening. (7) The drama "Wrestler" was released in 2008. (8) The main role in the film was played by Mickey Rourke. (9) The film won Aronofsky the Golden Lion, the main award of the Venice Film Festival. (10) "Black Swan" is Aronofsky's last directorial work to date. (11) This is a psychological thriller about the conflict between two ballerinas. (12) The film features Natalie Portman, Vincent Cassel, Mila Kunis and Winona Ryder. (13) The 67th Venice Film Festival opens on Wednesday, September 1."
(1) 10 июня профессор Немур и доктор Штр: (1) On June 10, Professor Nemur and Dr. Strauss fly to a medical symposium in Chicago. \"(1) Руководителем градостроительного к: "(1) Alexander Kosovan, Acting Head of the Department of Urban Construction, has been appointed head of the Moscow urban development complex, RIA Novosti reports. (2) This position was previously held by Vladimir Resin, now acting Mayor. (3) Resin appointed Acting First Deputy Mayor Pyotr Biryukov to be responsible for road and bridge construction and engineering communications, a source in the Moscow government told the news agency. (4) In addition, Andrey Kupriyanov became the head of Moscow Control. (5) This position was previously held by Alexander Ryabinin, but he resigned on September 29. (6) Ryabinin is under investigation for corruption and is prohibited from leaving the Russian Federation. (7) According to Kommersant, he may be charged as early as October 5. (8) On September 28, Moscow Mayor Yuri Luzhkov was dismissed, and Resin was appointed Acting mayor. (9) The next day, the entire government - about 250 officials - was dismissed in accordance with the city's legislation. (10) At the same time, dismissed officials will perform their duties until the formation of a new composition of the metropolitan administration. (11) Representatives of United Russia, which holds the majority of seats in the Moscow City Duma, reported that a list of seven candidates for the post of mayor has already been formed. (12) It is expected to be presented to Russian President Dmitry Medvedev in the coming days. (13) On October 1, Prime Minister Vladimir Putin will discuss the candidates with representatives of the party, the press secretary of the head of government Dmitry Peskov said."
(1) В придорожном кабачке Кмициц случайн: (1) In a roadside tavern, Kmita accidentally hears the Czech Vzheschovich, who is in the service of the enemy, declare that the Yasnogorsky Monastery will soon be occupied and plundered by the Swedes. (2) Kmita hurries to Czestochowa, prostrates himself before the miraculous icon — and his heart is filled with joy and hope. (3) He tells the abbot of the monastery, Priest Kordetsky, about the plans of the Swedes. (4) The Poles will not tolerate the desecration of the shrine, they will come to their senses and expel the enemy!  this holy man exclaims. (5) He absolves Kmita of his sins, and the happy Andrzej, humbling his pride, heroically fights the enemy who besieged the monastery. (6) The traitor Kuklinovsky, who came to the monastery for negotiations — an impudent, autocrat, bandit and libertine — lures Kmita to the Swedes and receives a strong slap and a kick in the ass for this. (9) kuklinovsky, burning with a thirst for revenge, tortures the prisoner with fire, but andrzej is repulsed by the kemlics. (10) having finished off the traitor, kmita and the kemlics go to silesia, to jan casimir.
(1) Главный тренер мюнхенской «Баварии»: (1) The head coach of Bayern Munich, Josep Guardiola, was involved in an accident, reports The Daily Mirror. (2) The accident occurred on Monday, March 2, but it became known only now. (3) The team coach was driving an Audi RS6 official car in Munich. (4) At some point, the 44-year-old coach lost control and crashed into the car in front. (5) Guardiola himself and the other driver were not injured.Soon the police arrived at the scene of the accident. (6) The Spanish coach, keeping a friendly tone, gave them the necessary explanations. (7) Eyewitnesses also claim that Guardiola tried to settle the conflict without the intervention of the police, but this information has not yet been confirmed. (8) Guardiola has been coaching Bayern since 2013. (9) He has won the German League, the National Cup, the World Club Championship and the 2013 UEFA Super Cup with Munich. (10) The Spaniard is also the most decorated coach in the history of Catalan FC Barcelona. (11) In his four years in charge, the Blue Garnet team won 14 trophies, including two Champions League cups and three Spanish championships. (12) In 2009 and 2011, Josep was recognized as the best club coach in the world.
(1) Дочь участника группы The Beatles По: (1) The daughter of Beatles member Paul McCartney, British designer Stella McCartney, has launched a new winter clothing collection with adidas. \"(1) Жители Санкт-Петербурга обнаружили: "(1) Residents of St. Petersburg found in one of the courtyards on Nevsky Prospekt the figure of a double-headed eagle from the fence of the Alexander Column, according to the official website of the Hermitage Museum. (2) The figure of an eagle was discovered on May 31 in the courtyard of the house number 11 on Nevsky Prospekt, which is known as the Bird's Yard. (3) Roman Zaitsev and Osama Lubani recognized the figure as an element of the fence of the monument in front of the Hermitage and returned it to the museum. (4) The eagle was brought to Nevsky Prospekt by a random passerby who decided that the figure would fit into the design of the courtyard. (5) The Hermitage suggests that the eagle figure was stolen in the winter of 2007, when a skating rink was built on Palace Square. (6) The case with the return of the details of the design of the fence of the monument on Palace Square was already the second. (7) During the restoration, the found figures will be returned to their place. (8) The Alexander Column, also known as the Pillar of Alexandria, was erected on Palace Square in front of the Hermitage building in 1834. (9) The column is surrounded by a fence designed by Auguste Montferrand. (10) The fence was originally decorated with 136 double-headed eagles. (8) 80 small eagles and two large ones were lost. (11) In 2003, the fence was recreated according to the original design. (12) Interfax notes that since the transfer of the Alexander Column to the Hermitage, four eagles have been stolen from the fence. (13) Currently, the museum notes, the fence is under round-the-clock video surveillance, and cases of vandalism are suppressed."
\"(1) В северо-восточном мексиканском шт: "(1) In the northeastern Mexican state of Tamaulipas on Monday, July 4, soldiers engaged in a firefight with militants. (2) as reported by agence france-presse, 13 attackers were killed as a result. (3) According to the agency, the first fire was opened by militants who were holed up in a house near the city of Rio Bravo. (4) After the shootout ended, the military arrested one person and also confiscated several cars. (5) Whether there were losses among them is not specified. (6) It is also unknown to which group the militants belonged. (7) Military personnel have been patrolling the State of Tamaulipas since June 25. (8) at that time, 1,800 soldiers were brought into the region to temporarily replace the local police. (9) during this period, the authorities plan to investigate police corruption links with drug cartels whose members are particularly active in this state. (10) In particular, the Zetas and Golfo Cartel groups operate in Tamaulipas. (11) One of the most high-profile episodes in which Zetas representatives are suspected was the murder of more than 200 immigrants in the state. (12) In this case, the Mexican police have already arrested at least two cartel leaders who, according to investigators, are involved in the murders. (13) We are talking about Martin Estrada Luna and Abraham Barrios Caporal. (14) The state of Tamaulipas is also one of the transit points through which drugs are transported to the United States. (15) The confrontation between the drug cartels and the Mexican authorities escalated after President Felipe Calderon came to power in 2006, who declared war on the gangsters."
\"(1) Заместитель председателя комиссии: "(1) Pavel Sychev, Deputy Chairman of the Commission for Family, Children and Motherhood Support of the Public Chamber of Russia, in an interview with Lenta.ru " spoke in favor of limiting the speed limit on highways after an accident with 12 dead in Ugra. (1) Неаполитанский клуб «Наполи» со счет: (1) Napoli of Naples won 3-1 over Fiorentina of Florence and won the Italian Cup for the fifth time. (4) The start of the match was delayed by 45 minutes due to a conflict between the fans of the teams. (5) The car of the Napoli fans was shelled, injuring four people, including a police officer. (6) While waiting for the referee's first whistle, fans threw flares on the pitch.
