(1) Придя снова в отдел образования, Фер: (1) When Feride came back to the education department, she met a person to whom she had a letter of recommendation. (1) Солнышко светило уже высоко, уж полд: (1) The sun was already high, and it was almost noon. (2) The hedgehog was hurrying to his burrow, on his back he carried a whole bunch of porcini mushrooms. (3) As he ran past the vegetable garden, he saw that there were still rabbits there. (4) They tried to snatch the carrot from each other's paws, and it was already going to a fight. (5) - Stop fooling around, you garden thieves!"You're wasting your time and energy!" the hedgehog shouted at them. (6) Now all the mushrooms will be sorted out, you will be left with nothing! (7) But the rabbits again paid no attention to the hedgehog. (8) The hedgehog took the mushrooms to the burrow, had lunch, rested, and again gathered for mushrooms. (9) Looking into the garden, he saw that there was a fight going on. (10) Rabbits rolled head over heels in the beds, taking carrots from each other. (11) the hedgehog said nothing, only waved his paw, and went on his way.
(1) Здесь, близ подножья Везувия, — вход: (1) Here, near the foot of Mount Vesuvius — is the entrance to the realm of the dead, and here the aged prophetess Sibyl waits for Aeneas. (2) With the magic golden branch in his hands, Aeneas descends into the earth: as Odysseus asked the shadow of Tiresias about his future, so Aeneas wants to ask the shadow of his father Anchises about the future of his descendants. (3) He crosses the River Styx of Hades, because of which there is no return for people. (4) He sees a reminder of Troy-the shadow of a friend maimed by the Greeks. (5) He sees a reminder of Carthage — the shadow of Dido with a wound in her chest; he speaks: "against your Will, queen, I left the Shore!" - but she is silent. (6) To his left is Tartarus, where sinners are tormented: God — fighters, parricides, perjurers, traitors. (7) To his right are the fields of the Blessed, where his father Anchises awaits him. (8) In the middle is the river of Summer's oblivion, and above it whirls the souls that are destined to be cleansed and born in it. (9) Among these souls, Anchises points out to his son the heroes of the future Rome: Romulus, the founder of the city, and Augustus, its regenerator, and the legislators, and the tyrant-fighters, and all who will establish the power of Rome over the whole world. (10) Each nation has its own gift and duty: to the Greeks-thought and beauty, to the Romans-justice and order: "Let others forge better animated copper, / I believe; let the living faces be made of marble, / They will speak more beautifully in courts, the movements of the sky / Will determine with compasses, call the rising stars; / Your duty, Roman, is to rule the peoples completely! (11) / These are your arts: to prescribe laws to the world, / to spare the overthrown, and to overthrow the disobedient."
(1) В столице Сирии Дамаске в субботу, 4: (1) In the Syrian capital of Damascus on Saturday, August 4, 48 Iranian pilgrims were abducted, reports Agence France-Presse, citing Iranian state television. (2) In Syria, the Iranians visited a holy place for Shiites-the Syed Zeinab Mosque in Damascus. (3) On the way to the airport of the Syrian capital, their bus was stopped by armed men. (4) Nothing is known about the fate of the pilgrims. (5) At the same time, Reuters, citing the IRNA news agency, reports that the Iranian Embassy in Damascus has established the location of the pilgrims and is taking steps to free them. (6) No group operating in Syria has yet claimed responsibility for the abduction. (7) The Syed Zeinab Mosque in Damascus is visited by hundreds of thousands of Iranians every year. (8) Several dozen Iranian pilgrims and specialists were abducted in Syria in December 2011 and January 2012. (9) they were later released. (10) Tehran is one of the few allies of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in the region. (11) Since March 2011, Assad's forces have been engaged in an armed struggle against the opposition. (12) most of the rebels, as well as most of the inhabitants of syria, are sunnis, while assad himself and his family are alawites, who consider themselves to be the shiite branch of islam. (13) In June 2012, the conflict was declared a civil war. (14) Assad refuses to voluntarily resign as head of state, which is actively called for by most Western countries, as well as the Arab League. (15) According to the Syrian President, government forces are fighting armed terrorists.
\"(1) Казахский режиссёр Еркин Ракишев с: "(1) kazakh director yerkin rakishev will shoot the film" my brother borat", which will give" a worthy answer to the british actor and director sacha baron cohen", reports"kazakhstanskaya pravda". (2) The plot of the film is built around an American named John, who, after watching Borat, decides to go to Kazakhstan to look at everything described in the film with his own eyes. (3) Upon arriving in the country, he is "very surprised, because everything here is not like in the film." (4) So he goes in search of the brother Borat mentioned in the film, who is being treated in a mental hospital, and his hometown - Kusek. (5) "We want to' ride 'on the success of 'Borat'. (6) Taking advantage of the popularity of the film in the West, we will show the true Kazakhstan, not invented by Sacha Baron Cohen, to the foreign audience on this wave," the director promised. (7) He added that a Hollywood company has already become interested in the new film, the name of which he can not yet tell. (8) Filming is scheduled to begin in the fall of 2010, and the film will be released in the spring of 2011. (9) the Main roles are played by young actors Almaty Anton Mitov and Roman Chikalov. (10) The project is financed by the private film studio "Ashina Film". (11) It is noteworthy that Rakishev already shot his answer to "Borat" two years ago for only 30 thousand dollars, but due to the poor quality of the material received, he decided not to release the picture. (12) The film "Borat" was released in 2006. (13) With a budget of $ 18 million, this film has collected more than 260 million worldwide."
\"(1) Осьминог Пауль, живущий в океанари: "(1) octopus paul, who lives in the aquarium of the german city of oberhausen, predicted the defeat of the german national football team in the world cup semi-final with spain, ria novosti reports. (2) paul had previously made predictions for all five german matches at the 2010 world cup and never made a mistake. (3) germany - spain game will be held on july 7 in durban. (4) Before the German team matches, two plastic containers are lowered into the aquarium where the octopus lives, each of which contains a shell. (5) One of the containers is marked with the flag of the German national team, and the other with the flag of the rival German team. (6) paul is said to predict the victory of the team from whose container he pulls the shell. (7) In this way, the mollusk predicted German victories over Australia, Ghana, England and Argentina, as well as defeat by Serbia. (8) on tuesday, july 6, paul chose a container with the flag of spain. (9) As RIA Novosti notes, this procedure was broadcast live on several TV channels. (10) A recording of Paul's prediction is posted, in particular, on the Sky News website. (11) The octopus, who was born in the UK but lives in Germany, began predicting the results of football matches in 2008 during the European Championship. (12) Then he predicted the results of the games of the German national team with an accuracy of 80 percent. (13) The semi-final of the 2010 World Cup Germany - Spain will be held on July 7, will begin at 22:30 Moscow time and will be shown live on the channel "Russia 1". (14) In the other semi-final on July 6, the teams of Uruguay and the Netherlands will play."
(1) После ухода матери Жака и его брата: (1) After the departure of Jacques ' mother and his brother, Valentine appears in the room. (3) Gaston does not want to become a traitor to his own brother twice, he is not at all sure that he is Jacques and that he will stay in this house. (4) Then valentine points out to him an irrefutable Proof: Jacques has a small scar under his shoulder blade that the doctors didn't notice. (5) This trace was left by Valentina herself, with a hatpin, to Jacques, when she decided that he was cheating on her. (6) When she leaves, Gaston discovers this scar and sobs bitterly. (7) The next morning, the other four families claiming kinship with Gaston arrive at the Renaud house. (7) Among them is a boy who came from England with his lawyer, Master Pickwick. (8) A boy, wandering about the house, accidentally enters Gaston's room. (9) He tells him that he is Gaston's supposed uncle, that all his relatives and friends sank with the ship Neptunia when he was still an infant. (10) After talking with the boy's lawyer, Gaston informs the duchess that he is the boy's wanted nephew, and leaves the Renaud house forever, because he does not want to start a new life with the baggage of old sins and constantly be surrounded by countless relatives who will remind him of them every minute.

(1) Нет сомнения — человечество найдёт п: (1) There is no doubt that humanity will find ways to renew, deepen and inspire its culture. (2) but to do this, it must learn gratitude in order to build its spiritual life on it. (3) Modern humanity does not appreciate what is given to it; it does not see its natural and spiritual wealth; it does not extract from its inner world what is inherent in it. (4) It values not the inner strength of the spirit, but the external power — technical and state. (5) It does not want to create, create and improve, but to own. (6) to Dispose of and enjoy. (7) And therefore it is always not enough for him and everything is not enough: it is always counting its "losses" and grumbling. (8) It is obsessed with greed and envy, and knows nothing about gratitude. (9) And so each of us must first learn gratitude. (10) If we only open our spiritual eye and look at life, we will see that every moment tests us, as it were, whether we are ripe for gratitude and whether we know how to give thanks. (11) And he who stands this test turns out to be the man of the future: it aims to create a new world and culture, he already wears them. (12) He is creative; but he who does not stand this test, is possessed with spiritual blindness and envy, it is a decomposition of a dying culture, he is a man of obsolescent past. (13) This is the criterion of spirituality, this is the law and measure, which few people think about, but by which it is necessary to distinguish people. (14) What is gratitude? (15) This is the response of a living, loving heart to a boon bestowed upon it. (16) It responds with love to love, with joy to kindness, with radiance to light and warmth, with faithful service to grace bestowed. (17) Gratitude does not need to be expressed verbally, and sometimes it is better for a person to experience and express it wordlessly. (18) Gratitude is not a mere recognition of another's good deed, for an embittered heart accompanies such recognition with a sense of resentment, humiliation, or even a desire for revenge. (19) No, real gratitude is joy and love, and in the future-the need to respond with good to good. (20) And the future of humanity belongs precisely to grateful hearts. (according to i. ilyin)
(1) Слепой лежал тихо, сложив на груди р: (1) The blind man lay still, arms folded, smiling. (2) Protecting Rabid's nerves, the professor did not tell him that the operation was a success, that he would certainly become sighted again. (3) A ten-thousandth chance of failure could turn everything into a tragedy. (4) In the midst of agonizing suspense, suspense, and speculation, Rabid heard the voice of Daisy Garan approaching him. (5) This was a girl who served in the clinic; often in difficult moments Rabid asked her to put her hand on his forehead. (6) And now he expected with pleasure that this little friendly hand would cling lightly to his head, which was numb from immobility. (7) when she withdrew her hand, he, who had so long looked within himself and had learned to understand the movements of his heart unmistakably, realized once more that his chief fear of late had been the fear of never seeing daisy. (8) even when he was brought here and heard the rapid female voice directing the patient's device, a pleasant feeling of a delicate and slender being, drawn by the sound of this voice, stirred in him. (9) It was the warm, cheerful, and soul-pleasing sound of young life, rich in melodious hues, clear as a warm morning. (10) Gradually, her image clearly emerged in him, arbitrary, like all our ideas about the invisible, but necessary for him. (11) Having spoken to her alone for three weeks, and submitted to her easy and persistent care, Rabid knew that he had begun to love her from the first days; now he was anxious to recover first for her sake. (12) And he was quite unaware that this girl, whose voice made him so happy, thought of his recovery with fear and sadness, because she was not beautiful. (13) He was blind, and she could look at herself calmly with his inner image of her, which he expressed not in words, but in his whole attitude, and she knew that he loved her. (14) The hour of trial came. (15) In no time the blindfold was removed. (16) Rabid realized that he had received his sight. (17) Now he waited impatiently for all the people who had restored his sight to leave, so that he could call Daisy and tell her all the most important things. (18) When Daisy learned that the operation was a brilliant success, she went out with a smile on her face and an execution in her soul to the door, behind which everything had changed so extraordinarily. (19) and as she recalled with all the rapidity of the last few minutes many little details of their meetings and conversations, she realized that he certainly loved her. (By A. Green)

\"(1) Президентский центр Бориса Ельцина: "(1) The Boris Yeltsin Presidential Center has installed round-the-clock security at the monument to the first president of the Russian Federation in Yekaterinburg. (13) according to drozdov, because of this, it was necessary to cut the budget of some programs, although in general "in the scale of the fund's work, this amount is not killer."The media reported on the detention of several suspects in the damage to the monument, but this news was not developed."

\"(1) Казанский \"Ак Барс\" выиграл у уф: "(1) Ak Bars Kazan beat Salavat Yulaev Ufa on the road in the first match of the semi - final series of the Gagarin Cup-playoffs of the Kontinental Hockey League (KHL). (1) Министерство обороны России подписал: (1) The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation has signed a contract with the Kazan enterprise "Enix" for the supply of reconnaissance unmanned aerial vehicles "Aileron-3SV". (2) This, as reported by RIA Novosti, said the chief designer of "Enix" Valery Begimov. (3) According to him, the value of the contract was more than one hundred million rubles. (4) Under the terms of the agreement, the Kazan enterprise will have to supply the Russian military department with 17 complexes, each of which includes two Aileron-3SV drones. (5) Production and transfer of unmanned systems to the military will be completed by the end of 2014. (6) According to Begimov, the cost of the UAV "Aileron-3SV" is five times less than that of the devices "Zastava" (a licensed version of the UAV Bird Eye 400 of the Israeli company IAI). (7) On the preparation of a contract for the supply of drones to the Russian military Department, Begimov first spoke at the MAKS-2013 air show in Zhukovsky near Moscow in August 2013. (8) At the same time, he noted that deliveries of the first devices could begin as early as the first quarter of 2014. (9) The maximum take-off weight of the Aileron-3SV is 5.3 kilograms. (10) The vehicle can carry a payload of up to a kilogram. (11) the device is capable of reaching speeds of up to 130 kilometers per hour and rising to a height of up to four thousand meters. (12) The wingspan of the Aileron-3SV is 1.47 meters, and the length is 0.64 meters. (13) The device is designed according to a modular scheme, thanks to which it is possible to quickly replace the payload.
(1) Один маленький зайчонок не любил ест: (1) One little hare did not like to eat. (2) The mother hare often persuaded him to eat at least something, but the son refused everything. (3) - Well, please, eat at least a piece!  Mom was worried. (4) - Look how thin you've already become! (5) Like a feather! (6) But the hare continued to refuse to eat. (7) He himself did not notice that he had become quite thin and weak. (8) One day the little hare went for a walk in the forest with his mother. (9) As soon as they were out of the house, a strong wind came upon them, picked up the hare like a feather, and carried it away. (10) The little hare was very frightened, and began to cry out, but the wind carried him very fast, and soon he was far from his home. (11) The bunny flew over the dense dark forest, and now evening has come, and the wind began to subside slowly. (12) When the hare landed, he looked around cautiously. (13) There was only a dark and terrible forest around.
(1) С глазами, полными слёз, Иван глядел: (1) With eyes full of tears, Ivan looked into the snow below him: the end of his fairy tale was approaching. (2) True, a good half of the Oblog stood untouched, but in the boy's mind the forest ceased to exist at the same time as the death of the mighty coniferous old woman that overshadowed the Kalinova roof. (4) "Now give yourself a little," Knyshev said in a dull voice. (5) - Dakos and I warm up a little! (6) Unexpectedly for everyone, he threw off his jacket and remained in a white shirt, belted with a Caucasian strap with a silver set. (7) A dozen hands held out saws to him; he selected an axe from the nearest one, weighed it, tested it approvingly, touched the blade with his fingernail, which rang like a string, and stamped on the snowball where it interfered, listened to the riding rustle of the forest, and slowly, as if on a scaffold, looked at his victim from the top to the heel. (8) She was incredibly beautiful now, the old mother of Oblog, in her ancient beauty, straight as a ray, and without a single flaw; the snow, like a rosy dream, rested on her heavy branches. (9) While still not in full force, Knyshev swung and with a pull on himself, as if teasingly, hit the very bottom, on the resinous zatek at the coml, where, like veins, the roots ran up the trunk, and the boy Ivan almost gasped with surprise that the blood did not splatter his hands. (10) - That's how to put it on, – said Zolotukhin instructively. (11) - Take into account! (12) And although Knyshev acted without a break, everyone understood that he was slightly stretching his pleasure, which ordinary people never forgave even real executioners. (13) - Went-and... – someone whispered strangled over Ivan's head. (14) A barely noticeable movement was born in the branches, something busily crunched at the bottom and a small tremor echoed in the top. (15) There is nothing slower and more painful on earth than the fall of a tree, under whose shadow the vague dreams of childhood visited you! (16) Without waiting for the end, all shuddering, Ivan went to wander through the bare space. (17) He returned after a fit of despair had passed. (18) It is not clear, after so many years, where the quiet peasant boy got such a rage, but one thing must be allowed for understanding all that follows: the vocation from a young age leads a person through the artfully chosen spectacles of life, in order to educate him in the skill and will to realize his historical goals. (19) One can only wonder what miracle Ivan had a slingshot, who put a stone in his hand in the middle of winter. (20) Knyshev managed to let out the first cloud of smoke when Ivan's gift hit him on the cheek. (By L. M. Leonov)
(1) 11880 год, 13-ый год эпохи Мэйдзи по: (1) Year 11880, the 13th year of the Meiji Era in Japanese chronology. (2) The narrator recalls his student life in Kamijou's dorm, where he met Okada, a medical student who gave the impression of being a handsome young man of strong build with a healthy complexion. (3) He was not a crammer, but at the same time he studied well and found time to relax, loved hiking and rowing. (4) Okada quickly gained credibility in the boarding house. (5) They came together with the narrator because of their interest in books. (6) In September, while walking down Muenzaka Hill near the milliner's house, Okada saw a young woman, and their eyes met. (7) The next time he passed her house, Okada saw the girl's smiling face in the window. (8) He felt friendly towards her, and from that day on he began to greet her. (9) Okada read Chinese stories. (10) He was attracted to the type of heroine who valued her beauty above all else. (11) The woman must be the embodiment of love and admiration. (12) Okada guessed from her appearance that the girl was a kept woman. (13) The story of "the woman in the window" follows, which became known to the narrator later.
(1) В больницу приходит бывшая жена трет: (1)The ex-wife of the third physicist, Johann Wilhelm Moebius, who married the missionary Rose, comes to the hospital and now wants to say goodbye to her first husband with her three sons, since Rose is leaving for the Mariana Islands with the missionary. (2) One of the sons tells his father that he wants to become a priest, the second — a philosopher, and the third — a physicist. (3) Mobius is strongly opposed to one of his sons becoming a physicist. (4) If he had not become a physicist himself, he would not have ended up in a madhouse. (5) For King Solomon appears to him. (6) The boys want to play flutes to their father. (7) At the very beginning of the game, Mobius jumps up and asks them not to play. (8) He turns the table over, sits down in it, and begins to read the fantastic psalms of King Solomon, then drives away the Rose family, who leave terrified and crying, parting forever from Mobius. (9) Sister Monica, his nurse, who has been caring for him for two years, sees that he is pretending to be a madman. (10) She confesses her love for him and asks him to leave the madhouse with her, since Fraulein von Tsang does not consider him dangerous. (11) Moebius also admits that he loves Monica more than life, but he can't leave with her, he can't betray King Solomon. (12) Monica does not give up, she insists. (13) Then Moebius strangles her with a curtain cord.

(1) Тургенев в одном письме раздраженно: (1) turgenev in one letter irritably polemics with tolstoy's method. (2) he says: tolstoy describes how napoleon's boots shone, and it seems to the reader that tolstoy knows everything about napoleon. (3) He doesn't really know a damn thing about it. (4) napoleon is tolstoy's ideological enemy. (5) according to tolstoy, humanity can be renewed only if a person, by educating himself, frees himself from within. (6) This is what Tolstoy did all his life. (7) according to tolstoy, this was the only way to conquer humanity. (8) and tolstoy, like a new kutuzov, banishes napoleon from the realm of the spirit. (9) Therefore, according to Tolstoy, Napoleon is a huge soldier and there is no need to judge him above the boot. (10) Tolstoy does not intend to use his own powerful psychological apparatus even for the negative characterization of Napoleon. (11) He is afraid to overdo it. (12) According to Tolstoy, the complexity of evil is a contrived complexity. (13) There is no charm in Tolstoy's Napoleon. (14) As if anticipating the tragic events of the twentieth century, he tries to keep a person from being carried away by a strong personality, from even more bloody triumphants. (by fazil iskander)
(1) Основатель Центра современного искус: (1) The founder of the Center for Contemporary Art "Vinzavod" Sofia Trotsenko told the gallery owner Marat Gelman that the letter of eviction of his gallery "Cultural Alliance" will be withdrawn. (4) Earlier on September 6, Gelman published in his LiveJournal a letter from the owner of the premises, LLC "MVK Estate", which stated that the contract with the tenant was being terminated, and that the "Cultural Alliance" should move out before September 10. (5) On the evening of September 6, the gallery opens a photo exhibition " Urban Counter-Revolution. moscow 2010-2013. New losses", which was collected by the urban protection movement "Archnadzor". (6) It is dedicated to 43 historic Moscow buildings that were destroyed or threatened with destruction under Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin. (7) "Archnadzor" reported that eight sites refused to allow the exhibition. (8) According to Gelman, on September 3, the exhibition was supposed to open at the Museum of Architecture, but on the last day the museum refused it. (9) the gallery owner, in his own words, decided to let her into his gallery in gratitude for the city protection activities, thanks to which many buildings were saved. (10) The Cultural Alliance opened at Vinzavod in the fall of 2012. (11) Its purpose is to support cultural processes in the regions of Russia. (12) Previously, the previous gallery of Marat Gelman, which has been engaged in exhibition activities and the art market since 1990, was located on the same site.

(1)С глазами, полными слёз, Иван глядел: (1)With eyes full of tears, Ivan looked into the snow below him: the end of his fairy tale was approaching. (2)True, a good half of the Oblog stood untouched, but in the boy's mind the forest ceased to exist at the same time as the death of the mighty coniferous old woman that overshadowed the Kalinova roof. (3) There is nothing slower and more painful on earth than the fall of a tree, under whose shadow the vague dreams of childhood visited you! (4)without waiting for the end, all shuddering, ivan went to wander around the bare space. (5)He came back when the fit of despair had passed. (6) It is not clear, after so many years, where the quiet peasant boy got such a rage, but one thing must be allowed for understanding all that follows: the vocation from a young age leads a person through the artfully chosen spectacles of life, in order to educate him in the skill and will to realize his historical goals. (7) One can only wonder what miracle Ivan had a slingshot, who put a stone in his hand in the middle of winter. (8)Knyshev managed to let out the first cloud of smoke when Ivan's gift hit him on the cheek. (9)There was confusion, foul language broke out. (10)Knyshev's assistant Titka, who came to the rescue, threw himself like a dog at the offender, who set off for the forest on the snow-covered virgin land. (11)It was easier for the young man to jump over the rubble, but on one of them Ivan's felt boots slipped off, and he cut his leg with all his might on a branch hidden under a snowdrift. (12)No more than a dozen steps separated them, and Ivan – the future Professor Vikhrov – would have walked for a century with a torn ear, if that saving, sloping birch tree had not turned up. (13)The boy immediately ran up to the fork and sat there as if in the saddle, baring his teeth, terrible in his unchildishness, while Titka paced below, licking the snow from his palm with a long tongue, threatening with a finger, until Knyshev himself arrived in all his equipment.)Rotten master!  the little one repeated, as if he knew that for Knyshev, who was proud of his health and Plebeian origin, there was no nickname more offensive. (16)Then titka got down to business: "watch him, and we'll pick him up with the pole of otted!" (17)Knyshev squinted at the little boy, at his sparkling eyes under the ragged hat, at his bare foot, slightly blue with blood. (18)Something had changed in his intentions: he hardly pitied the ragged human animal, but he was probably surprised that in a whole decade of his villainous activity, only this peasant boy in all of Russia with fists stood up for the Russian forests. – (19)Get out of here, you fool! – ordered Knyshev Take. – (20)No, wait, you'll find him a felt boot first ...(According to L. M. Leonov)

\"(1) Глава думского комитета по информа: "(1) the head of the duma committee on information policy, information technologies and communications, alexey mitrofanov, said that no one is going to close youtube in russia. (7) he noted that "some amendments will be made" and" endless movement, as now " in the runet will not be. (1) Двое друзей, Леандр и Криспин, прихо: (1) Two friends, Leander and Crispin, come to an unfamiliar town. (2) Their position is rather difficult, since they are completely without money. (3) Crispin, more resourceful and resilient than Leander, is determined to get money and even get rich, for which he offers an audacious plan. (4) Leander must pass himself off as a rich and distinguished man who has come to the city on important state business, and Crispin will take care of the rest under the guise of his servant. (5) Leander does not like this idea very much: he is afraid of the possible consequences of such a deception, but he gives up before the insistence of his friend, realizing that the situation is hopeless. (6) Friends knock on the door of the hotel and ask for better rooms and a rich dinner. (7) The landlord is suspicious of them at first, but Crispin's arrogance and assertiveness convince the innkeeper that they are important gentlemen. (8) Soon Harlequin, the local poet, and his Friend the Captain arrive. (9)More than once they have eaten on loan at this hotel and hope to have dinner here today. (10) However, the innkeeper's patience has run out, and he refuses to feed them. (11) The quick-witted Crispin decides to draw Harlequin and the Captain to his side, pretending that he knows the brilliant poems of Harlequin and the bold exploits of the Captain. (12) He immediately orders the Harlequin and the Captain to be given supper at Leander's expense, and the innkeeper does not dare to refuse: he has already learned that these noble gentlemen can not be contradicted in anything.

(1) В шесть часов утра мы, помогая друг: (1) At six o'clock in the morning, we helped each other, shifting buckets of cherries from hand to hand, dragged ourselves to the airfield. (2)On a bare field there was a trailer and a couple of green "cornhuskers" spent the night. (3) We climbed into the belly of the plane, put the buckets under our feet, and after a short run, with a terrible rattle, we took off into the air. (4) We did not rise above the clouds, but even from the height of a couple of hundred meters at which the flight took place, it took my breath away. (5) the green earth hung below us, rounded at the edges and swaying from side to side like a huge Christmas tree toy — a ball on a string. (6) Fields and meadows ran below us until we saw the chimneys and houses of a large city below. (7) With a whistle in our ears, holding buckets of cherries in our shaking hands, we stepped onto the concrete field of the airfield. (8) The end of our business project was inglorious: it turned out that here in the central market, cherries are sold at the same price as in our bazaar. (9) Now it seems to me that this was my mother's most successful venture, the most successful undertaking: the money invested in this project turned into feelings. (10) my mom knitted case, which touched the worlds of adults and children and due to which I can now feel her character, her: I also love to read and dream about great things, and then just jump in and go to storm the sky in search of a better life on the market today. (11) Except that I don't sell cherries... (12) But I only began to understand this now, having grown up. (13) When I remember this story, I feel a desire to be in my childhood, to find my mother there and say to her what I never said, what was not customary to say in our family, but what was meant like the air around us: — Thank you, mother, I love you. (14) Now I can only say this in a dream, and as I climb up, as if on a "cornfield", I again see the ground below me, which sways and curves around the edges... (15) Next to me, my mother, we exchange glances. (40) We are on a plane, we are full of bright plans. (16) For two we have three buckets of heavenly cherries.(by Yu. nechiporenko)
(1) До второй мировой войны, в середине: (1) Before World War II, in the mid-thirties, Faber dated a girl named Ganna. (2) They were bound by a strong feeling in those years, they were happy. (3) Ganna became pregnant, but for personal reasons and, to a certain extent, because of the unstable political situation in Europe, she told Faber that she would not give birth. (4) Faber's doctor friend Joachim had to perform an operation to terminate Ganna's pregnancy. (5) Shortly thereafter, Ganna fled from the city hall, where she had to register her marriage with Faber. (6) Faber left Switzerland and went alone to work in Baghdad, on a long business trip. (7) This happened in 1936. (8) In the future, he did not know anything about the fate of Hannah. (9) Herbert reports that after Faber's departure, Joachim married Hannah and they had a child. (10) However, they divorced a few years later. (11) Faber makes some calculations and comes to the conclusion that the child born to them is not his. (12) Faber decides to join Herbert and visit his old friend in Guatemala.
