(1) Во Франции отдали под суд 35-летнюю: (1) In France, 35-year-old Bouchra Bagour was put on trial for dressing her three-year-old son in a T-shirt glorifying terrorism, writes BBC News. (2) Her brother Zeyad Bagour, who gave the child a T-shirt, is also being tried in this case. (3) Their trial began in Avignon on March 6, writes Le Figaro. (4) The child at the center of the scandal is called Jihad. (5) On September 25, 2012, his mother brought him to kindergarten wearing a T – shirt with "I am a bomb" written on the front and "Jihad born on September 11"written on the back. (6) She was sued in September 2012 by a teacher from a kindergarten where the child goes. (7) Both persons involved in the case deny their guilt. (8) Bushra Bagur claims that she dressed the child in a T-shirt without even thinking about the inscriptions on it. (9) She insists that the focus was not on terrorism, but on the date of birth of her son, who was actually born on September 11. (10) Zayad Bagur also claims that he gave the shirt exclusively on the occasion of his birthday. (11) The prosecutor's office was not convinced by the assurances of the Bagur family. (12) The representative of the state Prosecution insists that the inscriptions on the T-shirt directly refer to the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001 in the United States. (13) He called on the court to sentence the boy's mother to a fine of one thousand euros and his uncle to three thousand euros.
(1) Правоохранительные органы установили: (1) Law enforcement agencies have identified the suicide bomber who staged a terrorist attack on the Central Market of Vladikavkaz. (2) This was reported on September 9 by RIA Novosti. (3) It turned out that a man named Archiev was driving the car that exploded. (4) The owner of the car was a man named Dobriev. (5) 20 minutes before the attack, this car crossed the border of North Ossetia and Ingushetia. (6) the attack occurred near the main entrance to the central market in the late morning of september 9. (7) A suicide bomber blew up a car packed with 30-40 kilograms of explosives. (8) According to the latest data, 15 people were killed and about 80 people were injured. (9) there are four children among the wounded, two of them in serious condition. (10) a criminal case has been opened in connection with the terrorist attack. (11) Experts fear that terrorists will soon arrange new explosions in Vladikavkaz. (12) All law enforcement agencies and law enforcement agencies of the city have been transferred to an enhanced mode of service. (13) Students of all schools have been dismissed to their homes. (14) Reports on the terrorist attack were read to Russian President Dmitry Medvedev by the Director of the FSB of the Russian Federation Alexander Bortnikov, the head of North Ossetia Taimuraz Mamsurov and the Plenipotentiary in the North Caucasus Federal District Alexander Khloponin. (15) The President ordered the latter to go to North Ossetia in person.
(1) Во время бала-маскарада султан выслу: (1) During the masquerade ball, the sultan listens to the treasures of the townspeople: some want pleasure, others want money. (2) And after the ball, two officers almost kill each other: Amina, Alibeg's mistress, gave hope to Nasses! (3) But the treasure of Amina admits that it was not Nasses who gave hope, but his stately lackey. (4) How stupid men are! (5) They think that such trifles as ranks and titles can deceive a woman's treasure! (6) The officers recoil in horror from Amina, and the sultan listens to the treasure of Cypria, a dried — up person who wants to be considered a blonde. (7) In her youth she danced in the Moroccan theatre; landlord — Mehemet Tripathy brought her to Paris and dropped, but the court was swayed by the Moroccan, and she earned a lot of money. (8) However, great talents need a big stage. (9) Cypria worked hard in London, Vienna, Rome, Spain and India, visited Constantinople — but she did not like the country where treasures are kept under lock and key, although Muslims are distinguished by the lightness of the French, the ardor of the English, the strength of the Germans, the endurance of the Spaniards and a touch of Italian refinement. (10) Then Kypria did a good job in the Congo, and when she became good for nothing, she picked up a noble and rich good-natured husband. (11) The treasure traveler talks about his adventures in English, Italian, Spanish and Latin, but the author does not recommend translating these obscenities to the ladies.
(1) В Германии грабитель несуществующего: (1) In Germany, a robber of a non-existent bank received seven years in prison. (2) The incident that gave rise to the trial in the Osnabrueck Land Court occurred in May 2011. (3) 57-year-old Siegfried K. from Gelsenkirchen, who has 22 previous convictions, came to rob a bank in Walchum, not knowing that it had closed there in 1994. (4) Only two ATMs and a sign remain from the bank's branch. (5) But Siegfried K., not knowing this, was going to rob the cash register for ten thousand euros. (6) He arrived at the bank in a stolen Volkswagen Caddy and parked it next to the building. (7) On the way, he took 52-year-old Elke L., who was passing by, hostage and, threatening her with a weapon, dragged her inside. (8) It was not until he was in the building that he found no cash register and realized that the bank had closed. (9) Then he left the hostage alone, abandoned the car, and fled the scene. (10) At the same time, he left a toy gun in the car, which he threatened the woman with. (11) His fingerprints were left on it - the police used them to trace him.
(1) Пока идут длительные переговоры межд: (1) While the long negotiations between the women and the Tetaiti are going on, Purcell indulges in bitter reflections: not wanting to shed blood, he has ruined his friends. (2) If he had sided with the Tahitians after the first murder, he could have saved Baker, Jones, Hunt — perhaps even Johnson and White. (3) Tetaichi promises not to kill Purcell, but demands that he leave the island, as he no longer wants to deal with the deceitful, treacherous "peritani". (4) Purcell requests a delay until the child is born. (5) Soon, little Ropati is born, and this becomes a huge event for the entire colony — even Tetaiti comes to admire the baby. (6) And women hypocritically pity the "old" leader: he is already thirty years old — he will break with his wives. (7) Having exhausted the theme of the inevitable death of Tetaiti, the women start another song: the Tahitians are too black, the Peritani are too pale, and only the Ropati have the right skin — if Adamo leaves, no one will have golden children. (8) Tamaiti listens calmly, but in the end did not stand up and offers Parsely to try out the boat. (9) they go out to sea together. (10) The Tahitian asks what Adamo will do if the Peritani land on the island. (11) Purcell answers without hesitation that he will defend freedom with arms in his hands.
(1) После этого страшного первого утра д: (1) After that dreadful first morning, Gregor began to live a humbled, monotonous life in prison, to which he slowly became accustomed. (2) He gradually adapted to his ugly and clumsy body, to his thin tentacled legs. (3) He found that he could crawl on walls and ceilings, and even liked to hang there for long periods. (4) in this terrible new form, gregor remained the same as he was — a loving son and brother, who endured all the family worries and suffered because he had brought so much grief into the lives of his loved ones. (5) from his imprisonment, he silently eavesdropped on the conversations of his relatives. (6) He was tormented by shame and despair, because now the family was without funds and the old father, sick mother and young sister had to think about earning money. (7) He was painfully aware of the disgust felt by those closest to him. (8) The mother and father could not bring themselves to enter his room for the first two weeks. (9) Only Greta, overcome with fear, came here to quickly clean up or put a bowl of food. (10) However, Gregor was becoming less and less suited to ordinary food, and he often left the plates untouched, although he was tormented by hunger. (11) He knew that the sight of him was unbearable for his sister, and so he tried to hide under the sofa behind a sheet when she came to clean.
(1) Вице-губернатор по строительству и ж: (1) The Vice-Governor for Construction and Housing and Communal Complex of the Volgograd region, Igor Pikalov, resigned in connection with the wildfires that occurred in the region in early September. (2) This is reported by RIA Novosti. (3) Pikalov combined the position of deputy head of the Volgograd administration with the post of chairman of the regional emergency commission. (4) In addition to him, the head of the Kotovsky Municipal District, Alexander Kazachkov, and the head of the Rudnyansky Municipal District, Viktor Morozov, the heads of the districts most affected by the fire, also resigned. (5) Fires in the Volgograd region occurred on September 2. (6) Due to strong winds, the fire quickly spread to a large area, including settlements, which was facilitated by hot, dry weather. (7) In total, 13 out of 33 districts of the region were affected by the fire, more than 500 houses were burned, and more than 900 people were left homeless. (8) Eight people were killed. (9) By the weekend, the fires were extinguished. (10) meanwhile, the upc has opened two criminal cases under the article negligence in connection with the incident. (11) russian president dmitry medvedev demanded that prosecutor general yuri chaika conduct inspections and, if necessary, bring officials to justice. (12) It is assumed that some of the fires were caused by power line breaks, and some were caused by careless handling of the fire. (13) One billion rubles have been allocated for the elimination of the consequences of fires. (14) In addition to the Volgograd region, major wildfires also occurred in the Saratov, Samara and Penza regions in early September.
(1) Курсанта Омского танкового инженерно: (1) A cadet of the Omsk Tank Engineering Institute was sentenced to eight years in a high-security penal colony for taking hostages. (2) This was reported on August 5 by RIA Novosti. (3) Cadet Denis Gaponenko was found guilty of taking hostages, illegal deprivation of liberty, hooliganism, attempted murder, as well as theft and illegal carrying of weapons and ammunition. (4) Gaponenko himself admitted his guilt in part. (5) During the investigation, he voluntarily compensated his ex-girlfriend for moral damage in the amount of 50 thousand rubles, paid 30 thousand rubles each to two other victims, and also paid for the repair of an apartment damaged by machine gun shots. (6) On December 18, 2009, Gaponenko learned that his girlfriend was going to work in Italy for three months. (7) He was so outraged by this news that he voluntarily left the post, taking a submachine gun with him. (8) The cadet caught a taxi and broke into the apartment of three friends of his girlfriend. (9) He forced them to trick her into entering the apartment, after which he forcibly held all four hostages in the room. (10) The offender did not make any clear demands. (11) Father Gaponenko was called to the scene. (12) After negotiations with him, the cadet agreed to release the hostages and surrendered. (13) None of the hostages were injured.
(1) Мартин Иден становится наконец знаме: (1) Martin Eden is finally becoming famous, but all this is deeply indifferent to him. (2) He receives invitations from people who previously ridiculed him and considered him a slacker, and sometimes even accepts them. (3) He is comforted by the idea of going to the Marquesas Islands and living there in a reed hut. (4) He generously distributes money to his relatives and people with whom his fate has bound him, but nothing can touch him anymore. (5) Neither the sincere and ardent love of the young worker Lizzie Conolly, nor the unexpected arrival of Ruth, now ready to ignore the voice of rumor and stay with Martin. (6) Martin sails to the islands on the Mariposa, and by the time he leaves, the Pacific Ocean seems no better than anything else. (7) He understands that there is no way out for him. (8) And after several days of swimming, he slips out into the sea through the porthole. (9) To deceive the will to live, he takes a deep breath and dives to a great depth. (10) when all the air is exhausted, it is no longer able to rise to the surface. (11) he sees a bright, white light and feels that he is flying into a dark abyss, and then consciousness leaves him forever.
(1) Тем временем донья Сирена, знатная,: (1) Meanwhile, Dona Sirena, a noble but impoverished widow, is about to give a ball. (2) The chief guest should be Polichinelle, the richest man in the city. (3) He has a daughter — a bride of marriageable age, whose hand is hunted by many young men, attracted primarily by the wealth of her father. (4) Counting on the help and protection of Dona Sirena, each of these fortune-seekers promised her a considerable sum as soon as he married the daughter of Polichinel. (5) Therefore, the upcoming evening is very important for Dona Sirena. (6) But her faithful servant Columbine brings sad news: no one else wants to believe her mistress in debt — neither the tailor, nor the cooks, nor the musicians, which means that the ball will have to be canceled. (7) Dona Sirena is in despair, but Crispin appears with the message that his master will take all the expenses for the organization of the ball, if Dona Sirena helps him to win the favor of Polichinel's daughter. (8) After Crispin comes Leander, whose courteous manner makes the most favorable impression on Dona Serena. (9) Gradually, guests gather, excited by rumors about the arrival of an important person in the city. (10) And only Polishinel is completely indifferent to this news — he is only concerned that his beloved daughter reads too many novels and refuses to marry some rich merchant. (11) the daughter's point of view is fully shared by her mother, madame POLICHINELLE.
(1)Трудное и запутанное дело — писательс: (1)Writing is a difficult and confusing business. (2)The writer should not observe life, but live in life, observing it not from the outside, but from the inside. (3) Meanwhile, the usual story of a writer's life is as follows: he succeeded in a thing, drew attention to himself — and quits his previous job, and becomes a professional. (4) And so a man sits down to write, not when he has something to say, but when he has to pay his rent, sew his wife's coat. (5) And before the eyes of the fresh sprout of talent turns yellow, dries. (6)And there is no writer. (7)An aspiring writer, if he respects and values his talent, should not "live" in literature. (8) Earn a living by anything but writing. (9)The time will come, and the same writing will begin to feed you by gravity with works written before. (10)Not to mention this, but the writer, becoming a professional, pulls himself out of life. (11)His usual environment now is fellow writers, section meetings, restaurants, and the writers ' club. (12)Cooking in its own juice. (13)And then he goes somewhere, goes with a notebook and "types material". (14)You need to live and work in life — as an engineer, a doctor, a teacher, a worker. (15) - Well, when then to write?- you ask. (16) - After work. (17)On days of rest. (18)In a month of vacation — - I will answer. (19) - How much will you write then?(20) - And it is very good that a little: everything that will be written then will be fully necessary. (By V. Veresaev)
(1) Школенко посидел с полчаса, вскинул: (1) Shkolenko sat for half an hour, raised his gun and went back in the same direction as in the morning. (2) Now he took the right of the village and closer to the river, hiding in the bushes that grew along the roadside. (3) We had to walk along a long ravine, making our way through thick hazel bushes that scratched our hands and faces, through shallow woodlands. (4)near a large bush, three mortars were clearly visible, standing in a beam. (5)shkolenko lay down flat and pulled out a paper on which he had previously decided to draw exactly where the mortars were located. (6) But at the moment when he made this decision, the seven Germans who were standing by the mortars approached each other and sat down at the mortar closest to Shkolenko, only eight meters away from him. (7) The decision was born instantly, perhaps so instantly, because only today, in exactly the same situation, he had already been lucky once. (8)The explosion was very strong, and the Germans lay dead. (9)Suddenly, two dozen paces away, there was a great rustling in the bushes. (10)Holding a submachine gun to his stomach, Shkolenko fired a long burst of fire with a fan, but instead of the Germans, his good friend Satarov, a soldier of the 2nd battalion, who had been captured a few days ago, jumped out of the bushes. (11) After him, sixteen more people came out of the bushes. (12)Three were bloodied, and one of them was supported in his arms – - (13)Did You shoot?" – satarov asked. –– (14)Here, I hurt them, " Satarov pointed to the bloodied people. –– (15)Where is everyone? – (16)And I'm alone, " Shkolenko replied. –– (17)What are you doing here? – (18)We were digging our own grave, "said Satarov," two gunmen were guarding us, and when they heard the explosion, they ran away. (19) Shkolenko looked at the mortars. (20) - Rather take mortars, now we will go to our own. (By K. M. Simonov)
(1) Пользователь Twitter под ником korow: (1) a twitter user under the nickname korowin drew attention to the instagram account of the girl elena smirnova, whose photos no one liked. (2) The microblogger invited its subscribers to support the child with likes. (3) according to the user, he came to smirnova's profile thanks to a comment she left under one of the posts of moscow mayor sergei sobyanin. (4) the girl wished the mayor good night. (5) Smirnova started an Instagram account in June. (6) All summer she posted selfies and photos from her vacation in the country. (7) At the time of writing the news, almost every photo of the girl has collected more than a hundred likes, and the last published selfie — almost 400. (8) In the comments, in addition to words of support, users argue about whether it is right to pay extra attention to the fact that they came to her page from Twitter. (9) There are also offensive comments under the girl's posts. (10) Their author does not comment on the entries. (11) In the spring of 2016, the hero of the Runet was eleven-year-old Stepan, whose mother asked him to support his page in VKontakte. (12) Peers made fun of his passion for dinosaurs, and a friend ridiculed him for having few likes on the page. (13) As a result, tens of thousands of "like"marks appeared under the student's records. (14) Stepa was supported by famous people, the boy became the hero of the plots of several TV channels and appeared on the air of the show "Evening Urgant".
(1) Между отцом и матерью шла постоянная: (1) There was a constant, relentless war between father and mother. (2) Different temperaments, different attitudes provoked constant skirmishes. (3) In 1904, when the World's Fair opened in St. Louis, Eliza insisted on going there, renting a house and renting rooms to visitors from Altamont. (4) Gant had a hard time accepting his wife's business: his pride suffered — the neighbors might think that he was unable to support his family. (5) But Eliza felt that this trip should be the beginning of something more for her. (6) The children, except the older ones, went with her. (7) For little Eugene, life in the "fair" city seemed like a vivid, unreal nightmare, especially since his stay there was overshadowed by the death of twelve-year — old Grover, the saddest and most tender of the Gant children. (8) But life went on. (9) The family was in the prime and fullness of life together. (10) Gant poured out his abuse, his tenderness, and his abundance of food on the household. (11) The children listened with delight to his eloquent philippics directed against his wife: his father's eloquence, thanks to daily practice, acquired the harmony and expressiveness of classical rhetoric,
(1) Гарри вынужден идти на противозаконн: (1) Harry is forced to make an illegal deal: for a thousand dollars, he agrees to illegally export several Chinese people from Cuba. (2) The intermediary makes it clear that the Chinese should not be brought to the mainland at all, but simply slapped on the road. (3) Morgan prefers to kill the rogue middleman himself, and lands the Chinese on the Cuban coast, not far from where he took them on board. (4) The Chinese, not realizing that they have escaped certain death, are dissatisfied that they have been cheated, but they do not openly complain. (5) Bad luck-the beginning. (6) Harry, who has to feed his family, becomes a smuggler-transporting whiskey from Cuba to Key West. (7) One day, when Harry, along with a black assistant, is making an ordinary flight with a cargo of whiskey, they are overtaken by a marine police boat. (8) They are ordered to stop. (9) When the guards see that they are on the motorboat and do not think to obey the order, they open fire and injure Harry and the Negro. (10) Those, however, manage to escape from the pursuit, but the Negro is completely limp, and Harry barely drops anchor in the waters near Key West. (11) Stormy weather. (12) Harry is afraid that the middlemen won't come for the dangerous cargo.
\"(1) В Саратовской области неизвестные: "(1) In the Saratov region unknown have ripped a few banners "Fair Russia" with the image of a local leader provorotov Alexei polshikova, reported on the website of the regional branch of the party. (2) one poster was torn down in the city of yershov and three more in saratov. (3) One billboard was taken away with the pole. (4) A total of 180 banners with portraits of Poleshchikov and party leader Sergei Mironov were placed in the region. (5) In addition to those torn down by unknown persons, the party lost another 30 posters. (6) As told in conversation with "Interfax" Polemikos, one advertising company dismantled 30 party banners. (7) "They said,' I'm sorry, I'm sorry, the hit-and-run is such that we can't.' (8) And where the stalwarts turned out, hooligan tricks went: they tear down banners at night," said the leader of the Saratov spravorosov (9).According to polshikova, with the elimination of the banners is "United Russia". (10) Spravorosy prepare to apply to law enforcement agencies. (11) Earlier it became known that in Novosibirsk and Yekaterinburg banners lost the leader of the "Right Cause" Mikhail Prokhorov, who was depicted on the posters. (12) In Novosibirsk, unknown people removed more than 170 posters with a portrait of the politician. (13) In Yekaterinburg, a banner measuring 70 by 20 meters was cut into pieces. (14) The Ministry of Internal Affairs stated that it was removed because the advertising company considered the image of Prokhorov as political propaganda. (15) Political campaigning is prohibited by law before the start of the election campaign. (16) Therefore, parties place their banners as social advertising."
\"(1) Президент США Барак Обама ответит: "(1) US President Barack Obama will answer questions from Twitter users. (2) The President's communication with microbloggers is scheduled for the evening of July 6, Moscow time. (3) Obama's responses, as reported by USA Today, will not be limited to the usual 140 characters for the service. (4) The forum will be moderated by Jack Dorsey, Executive Chairman of Twitter and one of its founders. (5) Dorsey will handle entries marked with the hashtag #askobama and refer specific questions to the President. (6) the fact that the head of the united states will communicate with twitter users, representatives of the white house announced on june 30. (7) the main topics of the session will be the economy and the labor market in the united states. (8) But, according to the publication, users will be able to discuss with the president any issues-from the legalization of marijuana to the quality of food in school canteens. (9) Macon Phillips, the White House Director of New Media, said the main goal of the event is to find new ways to connect with Americans. (10) The President of America has previously held similar forums on Facebook and YouTube. (11) Barack Obama's Twitter account was created in 2007, but it was only launched permanently in 2009. (12) At the moment, he has almost 9 million subscribers. (13) In the summer of 2011, it was announced that the president's Twitter account was going into "pre-election mode", so it will be mainly run by his staff team. (14) However, Barack Obama himself did not refuse to maintain Twitter: he periodically adds entries signed by BO."
(1) Димка Сомов тоже примыкал к этой ком: (1) Dimka Somov also joined this company, but Mironova did not obey. (2) The smartest boy in the class, he kept himself independent, and even in the "slaves" of Shmakova did not get. (3) Lenka sat down next to him. (4) She liked Dima — he looked like a sculpture in a local park called "Sleeping Boy". (5) Besides, he was the only one who stood up for her. (6) Their classmate Margarita Ivanovna was getting married at that time, was in love and did not notice anything around her. (7) On that day, Margarita Ivanovna announced that the class would go on an excursion to Moscow, and she would go with them — her fiance lived in Moscow. (8) Here Dimka also thought up not to take money from parents, and to earn on excursion. (9) The class took up the idea, and the children began to earn extra money-picking apples, sweeping the streets, and even gluing toys at a local factory. (10) Now Dimka Somov was in charge of the group. (11) He got a huge porcelain piggy bank somewhere and put the money he earned there. (12) Lenka was allowed to join the group, she even made friends with Dimka.
\"(1) Американский актёр Морган Фримен с: "(1) American actor Morgan Freeman became a participant in the election campaign of the Republican politician B. J. Lawson (B. J. Lawson) without his consent. (2) The voice of the actor was heard behind the scenes of a television video shot in support of a candidate for US Congress from the state of North Carolina. (3) The Guardian writes about this. (4) The appearance of this ad caused confusion to the actor, known for his democratic views. (5) Freeman categorically denied his involvement in the creation of the video, according to the portal Contactmusic.com (6) according to the portal, the republican first insisted that it was freeman who voiced the ad. (7) However, Lawson later explained that such information was provided to him by the MEI Political agency, to which the politician paid $ 4,500 for "radio advertising with Morgan Freeman." (8) According to The Guardian, the ad may have featured another person's voice, similar to that of Morgan Freeman. (9) As it became known, Lawson apologized to the actor. (10) The advertising video disappeared from the official website of the politician. (11) On November 2, the United States held gubernatorial elections. (12) Representatives of the Republican Party won elections in 25 of the 37 states."
(1) Позже Гофолия посылает к Иосавеф Мат: (1) Later, Athaliah sends Matthew to Jehoshaphat to say that for the right to pray to their God in the temple, Jehoiada and the Levites must give her the foundling Eliakim. (2) If they refuse, they will confirm the suspicions and rumors that the child is from a well-born family and is being raised for a hidden purpose. (3) Jehoshaphat passes on the words of Matthew to Jehoiada, and offers to run away with the child into the wilderness. (4) However, the high priest accuses her of cowardice and decides that it is time to act and it is no longer possible to hide Eliakim — he must appear in a royal headdress and crown. (5) A choir of virgins sings the glory of the Lord. (6) This choir and the Levites are the only protection of the heir to the throne of David, there is no one else in the temple, but Jehoiada believes that the Lord will give such strength to this army that no one will break them. (7) In the temple, the ceremony of enthronement is being prepared, and Jehoshaphat tries on Joash (Eliakim) the royal crown. (8) He does not yet understand what is the matter, and believes that he will only help to perform the rite of Jehoiada, whom he honors as a father. (9) Jehoiada asks if the boy is ready to follow David's example in life, and David replies that he is ready. (10) Then Jehoiada kneels before him and declares that he is honoring his new king. (11) Other priests also take an oath of allegiance to him.
(1) Найденный в коробке у дороги в Сан-Х: (1) A kitten named Smurf, whose fur was dyed purple, found in a box on a road in San Jose, California, has become friends with a blind cat, Wanda. (2) On Thursday, January 7, Mashable reports. (3) The animals met at the Nine Lives Foundation shelter in Redwood City. (4) Between them, the publication writes, a truly close relationship has been established, they regularly lick each other. (5) The couple spends so much time together that some of Wanda's fur has already turned purple. (6) Smurf, who is now two months old, entered the shelter on December 28. (7) When he was discovered, in addition to his purple fur, he had bite wounds and cuts, and weighed less than a kilogram. (8) Dr. Monica Rudiger, quoted by ABC News, believes that the Smurf was mutilated for fun. (9) "I think the kitten was used as a chewing toy for the dog," she said. (10) Rudiger added that the animal's front and hind legs were damaged. (11) The kitten underwent surgery, after which he went on the mend. (12) The foundation noted that the Smurf will receive all necessary medical care until full recovery. (13) It will not be possible to take it from the shelter until the purple paint comes off. (14) This, according to Rudiger, will take months.
\"(1) Хроника Первомая: на митинг ЛДПР н: "(1) Chronicle of May Day: about one and a half thousand people gathered for the LDPR rally on Pushkin Square on May 1. (2) This is reported by RIA Novosti with reference to the press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs in Moscow. (3) Party leader Vladimir Zhirinovsky claimed from the stage that at least two thousand people were present at the rally. (4) The central event of the event was Zhirinovsky's speech, in which he promised not to allow any wars or revolutions in Russia. (5) He also noted several times that the LDPR has been waging a political struggle for more than 20 years and criticized the new parties that are now only being registered. (6) The broadcast from Pushkin Square was conducted by the TV channel "Russia 24". (7) Earlier it was reported that Zhirinovsky planned to celebrate his birthday on the square. (8) From the stage, the leader of the LDPR said only that all those gathered at the exit were waiting for gifts (according to Interfax, the gifts were bottles of cologne "Zhirinovsky"). (9) At the end of his speech, Zhirinovsky called on his supporters to come to the rally on November 4. (10) In parallel with the rally on Pushkin Square, a rally of nationalists took place near the Shchukinskaya metro station. (11) Nationalists in the number of approximately 400 people marched from Oktyabrsky Field to Shchukinskaya, where a rally was held. (12) Several other demonstrations took place earlier in Moscow. (13) The largest of them was a march of trade unions led by Prime Minister Vladimir Putin and President Dmitry Medvedev. (14) In addition, Communists traditionally held rallies in the capital on May 1."
(1)Больше всех украшает наш замкнутый зе: (1) Most of all adorns our closed earthly world a certain tall plant with lush white flowers. (2)That is, each flower individually is very small and would be completely invisible, but the flowers gathered on the stem in countless numbers and form a lush, white, slightly yellowish cap of the plant. (3) And since its stalks never grow singly, the luxuriant caps merge, and now, as it were, a white cloud slumbers among the motionless forest grass. (4) I see these flowers every time, and I do not just see them, but I distinguish them from all other flowers. (5) But ask me what they are called – I don't know, for some reason I have never heard their names from other people who also grew up here. (6)Dandelion, chamomile, cornflower, plantain, bell, lily of the valley – we still have enough for this. (7) These plants we can still call by name. (8)However, why generalize at once – - perhaps I alone do not know? (9)No, no matter who I asked in the village, showing white flowers, everyone threw up their hands: - Who knows! (12)there are plenty of them growing: both on the river and in the forest ravines. (11)And what are they called?.. (12)(13)Flowers and flowers, they are not to be reaped, not to be threshed. (14)You can sniff without a name. (15)We are actually, I would say, a little indifferent to everything that surrounds us on earth. (16)No, no, of course, we often say that we love nature: these woods, and hills, and springs, and fire, half the sky, summer warm sunsets. (17)Well, and collect a bouquet of flowers, and, of course, listen to the singing of birds, to their chirping in the golden forest tops at a time when the forest itself is still full of dark green, black almost cool. (18)Well, go for mushrooms, well, and fish, and just lie on the grass, looking up at the floating clouds. (19) And what is the name of the grass on which you now lie so thoughtlessly and so blissfully? (20)In the place that you have occupied with your body, there are about two dozen different herbs growing, and each of them is interesting in some way: either a way of life, or healing properties for a person. (By V. A. Soloukhin*)
(1) Узнав о решении Басилио отдать корон: (1) Upon learning of Basilio's decision to give the crown of Poland to the Prince of Muscovy, the people revolt and release Sehismundo from prison. (2) People do not want to see a stranger on the throne, and word of where the crown prince is hidden has already spread around the kingdom; Sehismundo is leading a popular revolt. (3) The troops under his leadership defeat the supporters of Basilio, and the king has already prepared for death, putting himself at the mercy of Sehismundo. (4) But the prince changed: he changed his mind A great deal, and the nobility of his nature prevailed over cruelty and rudeness. (5) Segismundo he crouches at the feet of Basilio as a loyal subject and dutiful son. (6) Sehismundo makes another effort and goes over his love for Rosaura for the sake of the feeling that the woman has for Astolfo. (7) The Prince of Muscovy tries to refer to the difference in their origin, but then the noble Clotaldo enters the conversation: he says that Rosaura is his daughter, he recognized her by the sword that he once gave to her mother. (8) Thus, Rosaura and Astolfo are equal in their position and there are no more barriers between them, and justice prevails — Astolfo calls Rosaura his wife. (9) Estrella's hand goes to Sehismundo. (10) Sehismundo is friendly and fair to everyone, explaining his transformation by saying that he is afraid to wake up again in prison and wants to use happiness as if it were a dream.
(1) Жительница дагестанского села Темирг: (1) Sagibat Islammagomedova, a resident of the Dagestan village of Temirgoe, killed about 80 snakes that crawled on her plot with a shovel. (2) She accidentally discovered a reptile nest while planting potatoes in the garden, RIA KCR reports. (3) Several reptiles managed to escape. (4) Information about this case got into the media after the woman's son posted photos of his mother with snakes on the Internet. (5) As noted by Komsomolskaya Pravda in Stavropol, fellow villagers called her act brave and asked the district administration to award Islammagomedov for courage. (6) at the same time, the massacre of snakes interested zoologists. (7) According to experts, murder can turn into an environmental disaster. (8) " the woman killed harmless yellow-bellied skids and grass snakes. (9) These snakes do not pose any danger, even benefit from eating rodents. (10) Would bask in the sun, and spread out, " - said the head of the Department of Zoology and Physiology of the DSU Lyudmila Mazanaeva. (11) Zoologists intend to conduct an explanatory conversation with local residents so that such an incident does not happen again. (12) In February, in the Kemerovo region, rescuers caught a snake in the apartment of one of the residents of the city of Yurga. (13) The woman reported that she found the reptile in the hallway when she woke up in the morning. (14) At the same time, it remains a mystery how the snake got into her home on the third floor.
(1) Священник Йорик, друг семьи, давно с: (1) The priest Yorick, a family friend who has long served in the area, visits Father Shandy, who complains that Tristram has difficulty performing religious rites. (2) They discuss the question of the basis of the relationship between father and son, according to which the father acquires the right and authority over him, and the problem of further education of Tristram. (3) Uncle Toby recommends young Lefebvre as a tutor and tells his story. (4) One evening Uncle Toby was sitting at supper, when the landlord of the village inn suddenly entered the room. (5) He asked for a glass or two of wine for a poor gentleman, Lieutenant Lefebvre, who had been taken ill a few days before. (6) With Lefebvre was a son of eleven or twelve years old. (7) Uncle Toby went to see the gentleman, and found that he had been in the same regiment with him. (8) When Lefebvre died, Uncle Toby buried him with military honors and took custody of the boy. (9) He sent him to a public school, and then, when the young Aefebr asked permission to try his luck in the war with the Turks, he handed him his father's sword and parted with him as his own son. (10) But the young man began to suffer setbacks, he lost both his health and his service — everything except his sword, and returned to his uncle Toby. (11) This happened just as Tristram was being sought for a tutor.
(1) Вторым грешником был тот самый Пелоп: (1) The second sinner was Pelops, the son of Tantalus. (2) From Asia Minor, he came to Southern Greece and recaptured it from the evil king, who forced strangers to compete with him in a chariot race, and killed the vanquished. (3) Pelops defeated him by trickery: he bribed the king's charioteer, who took out the hub that held the wheel on the axle, the chariot broke, and the king was killed. (4) But Pelop wanted to hide his deceit; instead of a reward, he pushed the king's charioteer into the sea, and he fell down and cursed Pelop and all his descendants for their treachery. (5) In the third generation, Atreus and Fiestes, the sons of Pelops, became sinners. (6) They began to argue for power over Argos. (7) In the Pelopian herd there was a golden — haired ram, a sign of royal power; Atreus inherited it, but Fiestes seduced Atreus ' wife and stole the ram. (8) quarrels, Parties were exiled and lived bedstuy in poverty. (9) the kingdom fell to atreus, but this was not enough for him: he wanted to take revenge on his brother for seducing his wife. (10) He remembered the Tantalus cannibal feast: he decided to slaughter the Fiesta children and feed the Fiesta with their meat. (11) So he did; the gods were horrified, the Sun itself turned away from the heavenly path, so as not to see the terrible meal. (12) This is what Seneca wrote his bloody tragedy about.
(1)Софья Ивановна была одной из тех редк: (1)Sofya Ivanovna was one of those rare middle-aged women, born for family life, to whom fate has denied this happiness, and who, as a result of this refusal, suddenly decide to pour out all the store of love that has been kept for so long, growing and growing strong in their hearts for their children and their husband. (2) and this stock of old girls of this kind is so inexhaustible that, despite the fact that there are many chosen ones, there is still a lot of love that they pour out on all those around them, on all the good and evil people who only encounter them in life. (3) There are three kinds of love: beautiful love, selfless love, and active love. (4) I am speaking of love for man, which, according to the greater or lesser strength of the soul, is concentrated on one, on some, or is poured out on many. (5)About love to mother, to father, to brother, to children, to friend, to girlfriend, to the nation, about the love of man. (6)The love of beauty consists in the love of the beauty of the feeling itself and its expression. (7)People who love with a beautiful love care very little about reciprocity as a circumstance that has no influence on the beauty and pleasantness of the feeling. (8) They often change the objects of their love, since their main purpose is only to keep the pleasant feeling of love constantly aroused. (9) in order to maintain this pleasant feeling in themselves, they constantly speak of their love in the most elegant terms, both to the object itself and to all those who do not even care about this love. (10)to people who are so fond, the object they love is as amiable as it excites that pleasant feeling, the consciousness and expression of which they enjoy. (11)The second kind of love is self-sacrificing love, it consists in loving the process of sacrificing oneself for the beloved object, while not paying attention to whether these sacrifices are worse or better for the beloved object. (12) People who love in this way never believe in reciprocity. (13)They do not care whether you have eaten well, slept well, whether you are happy, or whether you are healthy, and they will do nothing to give you these comforts, if they are in their power. (14)But to be shot, to throw themselves into the water, into the fire, to wither away from love-they are always ready for this, if only they meet the opportunity. (15)In addition, people tend to love selflessly, are always proud of his love, exacting, jealous, distrustful, and, strange to say, want their subjects of the danger, to deliver them from misery to comfort, and even vices, to correct them. (16)the Third kind of love is active, it is the desire to satisfy all needs, all desires, whims, even the vices of the beloved one. (17)People who love like this, love for life. (18)their Love is rarely expressed, and if expressed, not only smug, beautiful, but shamefacedly, awkwardly, because they always fear that love is not enough... (19) And here was this active love for her nephew, niece, sister shone in his eyes, in every word and movement, of Sophia Ivanovna. (20)Only years later that I appreciated quite Sofya Ivanovna, but then I came up with the question: why Dmitry, trying to understand love very differently than commonly young people, and had always before his eyes a sweet, loving Sophia Ivanovna, suddenly fell passionately in love with the strange Love of Sergeevna and only admit that his aunt also have a good quality. (By l. N. Tolstoy)
(1) Президент России Владимир Путин заяв: (1) Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the country's citizens have proven their ability to solve problems in difficult conditions. (2) He said this in his address to the Federal Assembly. (3)The words of the Russian leader are quoted by the correspondent of <url>. (4) " We will discuss our tasks in the economy, social sphere, foreign and domestic policy. (5) This time we will pay more attention to the economy, social issues and domestic policy. (6) We have to solve these problems in difficult, extraordinary conditions, as it has happened more than once in history," Putin said. (7) As the head of state emphasized, "the Russian people have once again convincingly proved that they are capable of responding to difficult challenges, defending and defending national interests, sovereignty and the independent course of the country." (8) Putin also thanked the citizens for uniting around patriotic values. (9) " They have united (...) not because everyone is happy, that everything suits them. (10) No, there are enough difficulties and problems now. (11) But there is an understanding of their causes. (12) And most importantly, the confidence that we will definitely overcome them together. (13) Willingness to work for Russia, heartfelt, sincere concern for it — that is what lies at the heart of this association," the President stressed.
\"(1) За день до гибели Борис Немцов нап: "(1) The day before his death, Boris Nemtsov wrote a letter to his colleague in RPR-Parnas, Olga Shorina, in which he outlined the details of his investigation into Ukraine. (2)The text was reviewed by Reuters. (3) She said that the politician was preparing a report on the participation of Russian troops in the conflict in Ukraine. (4) " Paratroopers from Ivanovo came to me. (5) 17 killed, no money given. (6) But so far they are afraid to speak," the note says. (7) According to Shorina, Nemtsov was referring to the soldiers of the 98th Guards Airborne Division, which is stationed in the Ivanovo region as well. (8) She did not disclose how the politician had been in contact with them. (9) Nemtsov, Shorina said, did not want to say anything out loud to her, fearing wiretapping, so he reported everything on paper. (10) The Agency was unable to confirm the authenticity of the letter. (11) She also reported that the report entitled " Putin.War " the politician planned to publish in a million copies. (12) In it, he was not going to make any sensational conclusions, since he took information from open sources, as well as from the words of relatives of Russian soldiers who allegedly fought in the east of Ukraine. (13) Ilya Yashin, a member of the bureau of the federal Political Council "RPR-Parnas", said that he had previously posted this note on his Twitter. (14) We are looking for materials that Nemtsov prepared for the report "Putin and the war". (15) Managed to collect some notes in his handwriting."
(1) В Западной Африке от лихорадки Эбола: (1) In West Africa, Ebola has already killed 887 people, according to Reuters, citing the World Health Organization (WHO). (2) The African Development Bank pledged on Monday, August 4, to immediately allocate $ 50 million to Sierra Leone, Liberia and Guinea to fight the epidemic. (3) The World Bank will issue up to $ 200 million to these countries. (4) According to RIA Novosti, WHO Director-General Margaret Chan has already expressed the idea that the consequences of the spread of fever can be catastrophic. (5) According to her, a meeting of the WHO emergency committee is to be held on August 6, at which it will be decided whether the spread of the deadly Ebola virus is a global threat. (6) Earlier it was reported that the virus was first infected by US citizens. (7) Two American doctors, Kent Brantly and Nancy Writebol, contracted the Ebola virus while on a mission to fight the disease in Liberia. (8) They will be held in isolation at Emory Research University Hospital in Atlanta for a year, where they will be treated for fever. (9) The first infection was recorded in 1976 in Zaire on the banks of the Ebola River. (10) Hence the name of the virus. (11) Then more than 300 people became victims of the fever. (12)The current outbreak is the first in western Africa. (13) Previously, the deadly virus was only rampant in the center of the Black Continent. (14) The disease is transmitted through tactile contact, and its lethality is 90 percent.
\"(1) Британская компания Future Films э: "(1) The British company Future Films will screen the book by Alan K. Barker" Dyatlov Pass " (Dyatlov Pass), reports The Hollywood Reporter. (2) Barker's work is based on real events. (3) In January 1959, a group of students and graduates of the Ural Polytechnic Institute went on a hike. (4) The tourists were led by a fifth-year student Igor Dyatlov. (5) Nine participants of the campaign died in the mountains, and their bodies were found only a few months later. (6) According to the results of the investigation, on the night of February 1 to 2, the tourists left the tent (having opened one of its walls) and began to descend down the slope of the mountain on which the camp was located. (7) At the same time, they left their outer clothing and shoes in the tent. (8) Six people died of hypothermia, and three others died due to their injuries. (9) Traces of radiation were found on the clothing of some tourists. (10) It is still not known what exactly caused the strange behavior of the participants of the campaign. (11) There are many versions, but Alan K. Barker in his book pays close attention to the paranormal version of what happened. (12) The screenplay for the film adaptation of Barker's book will be written by Andy Briggs, who previously worked mainly on television projects. (13) The director of "Dyatlov's Pass" will be Simon Fellows, known for the film "Malisa in Wonderland"."
(1) Диего, молодому врачу, неважно, о чё: (1) Diego, a young doctor, no matter what the comet warns about, the main thing is not to be afraid. (2) He loves the judge's daughter Victoria, and is going to marry her. (3) Meanwhile, the governor decides to pretend that nothing has happened, because "a good governor is a governor in whose reign nothing happens," and the townspeople are forbidden even the slightest mention of a cosmic sign. (4) Nada quips that lying is "not stupid, it's political." (5) And now the market square is full of life, someone praises their wares, while remembering the morning comet, someone accidentally recalls the sign in conversation, and lovers Diego and Victoria coo. (6) But suddenly someone in the crowd suddenly falls to the ground. (7) after examining the patient, diego with considerable effort utters a disappointing diagnosis for the whole city-the plague. (8) In the palace of the judge, the governor is informed of the growth of the epidemic, he is upset that it happened just when he was going to hunt. (9) At the same time, in the church, people confess and atone for their sins. (10) Diego, not sparing himself, helps the sick. (11) Victoria wants to see him, but he is full of fear of illness, of death.
(1) К гуляющему вблизи султанского дворц: (1) A novice from the monastery, sent by the patriarch, who wants to find out the reason for Saladin's mercy, approaches a templar walking near the Sultan's palace. (2) The templar knows nothing but rumors, and the novice passes on to him the patriarch's opinion: the almighty must have saved the templar for "great things." (3) The Templar ironically observes that the rescue of a Jewish woman from the fire is certainly one of these things. (4) However, the patriarch has an important assignment for him-to transfer Saladin's military calculations to the camp of the sultan's opponent — the Crusaders. (5) The young man refuses, because he owes his life to Saladin, and his duty as a Templar of the order is to fight, not to serve as "spies". (6) The novice approves of the templar's decision not to become an "ungrateful scoundrel." (7) Saladin plays chess with his sister Zitta. (8) Both understand that a war they don't want is inevitable. (9) Zitta resents Christians who exalt their Christian pride instead of honoring and following the common human virtues. (10) saladin defends christians, he believes that all evil is in the order of the templars, that is, in the organization, and not in the faith. (11) In the interests of chivalry, they have turned themselves into "stupid monks" and, in a blind calculation of luck, break the truce.
(1) Российский пилот «Формулы-1» Даниил: (1) Russian Formula 1 driver Daniil Kvyat, who plays for Red Bull, will leave the team at the end of the 2016 season. (2) This was announced on Monday, May 2 by commentator and journalist James Allen. (3) His words are quoted by Eurosport. (4) " at the end of the season, red bull will give a place in the team to max verstappen, and he will most likely take kvyat's place. (5) This became clear at the beginning of the season. (6) Sources claim that the decision has already been made. (7) He [Verstappen] is a better driver than Kvyat," Allen said. (8) At the Formula 1 Grand Prix in Sochi, which was held on May 1, Kvyat caused an accident, as a result of which German driver Sebastian Vettel went off the course. (9) The Russian finished 15th in the race. (10) In the current season, the 22-year-old Kvyat once got into the top three winners at the Formula 1 stages, taking third place at the Chinese Grand Prix. (11)The Russian is ranked 8th overall with 21 points. (12) 18-year — old Verstappen plays for the Toro Rosso team. (13) The driver's highest place this season is sixth at the Bahrain Grand Prix. (14) In Sochi, Verstappen finished 19th. (15) The Dutchman is in 10th place overall (13 points).
(1) Когда при Берге произносили слово «Р: (1) When the word "Homeland" was uttered under Berg, he grinned. (2) He didn't understand what it meant. (3) The homeland, the land of the fathers, the country where he was born – it is not so important where a person was born. (4) The land of the fathers! (5) Berg felt no attachment either to his childhood or to the small town where he was born. - (6) Eh, Berg, a dry soul! - (7) What kind of artist are you when you don't love your native land, you crank! (8) Maybe that's why Berg couldn't do landscapes. (9) He preferred a portrait, a poster. (10) He tried to find the style of his time, but these attempts were full of failures and ambiguities. (11) One day Berg received a letter from the artist Yartsev. (12) He invited him to come to the Murom forests, where he spent the summer. (13) August was hot and windless. (14) Yartsev lived far from the deserted station, in the forest, on the shore of a deep lake with black water. (15) He rented a hut from a forester. (16) Berg was taken to the lake by the forester's son Vanya Zotov, a stooped and shy boy. (17) Berg lived on the lake for about a month. (18) He did not intend to work and did not take oil paints with him. (19) He brought only a small box of watercolors. (20) For whole days he lay in the glades and looked curiously at the flowers and herbs. (By K. G. Paustovsky*)
(1) Гек находит пещеру в самой высокой т: (1) Huck finds a cave at the highest point of the island, and he and Jim get along well. (2) Soon a terrible thunderstorm begins with heavy rain, the Mississippi overflows its banks and floods the island, but the water does not reach the cave. (3) huck and jim catch a link from a raft with a solid deck in the river. (4) then a whole house floats past their island. (5) huck and jim search it, find a lot of useful things, money and the corpse of a man, to which the negro boy does not allow. (6) so the days passed by, and the river again fell asleep and entered the banks. (7) huck decides to visit the city and find out the latest news. (8) Having changed into a woman's dress, he knocks at the house on the outskirts, where people who have recently moved to the town live. (9) A strange woman tells Huck that at first his father Finn was suspected of killing him, who disappeared to no one knows where. (10) Now the murderer is believed to be the fugitive Negro Jim, and they are looking for him all over the district. (11) The woman notices smoke over the island and sends her husband there to see if there is a Negro hiding there. (12) She quickly realizes that Huck is not a girl, but lets him go, believing a new lie.
(1) Перебрав все строительные бригады по: (1) After going through all the construction teams of the village, Polushkin got into the handymen, but he did not stay here for long either. (2) One warm May day, Polushkin was assigned to dig a trench under a sewer pipe. (3) Yegor worked happily. (4) The trench was straight as an arrow until an ant hill came in its way. (5) Polushkin pitied the hard-working goosebumps, let the trench go around, but did not realize that there are no crooked sewer pipes. (6) This incident became known to the whole village, and finally strengthened Polushkin's reputation as a bed-bearer. (7) Kolka began to come home from school covered in bruises. (8) Yegor's next place of work was a boat station. (9) She stood by a small lake that had appeared on the site of a dammed river. (10) The station served tourists who were drawn to this lively corner not only from the district center, but also from Moscow itself. (11) Yegor's golden hands came in handy here. (12) The head of the boat station, "an elderly, very tired of life" peasant Yakov Prokopych Sazanov, was satisfied with Yegorova's work and diligence, and Polushkin himself liked the work.
\"(1) По меньшей мере два взрыва произош: "(1) At least two explosions occurred in the Afghan capital Kabul on the morning of May 2 - a few hours after US President Barack Obama left the country, reports Agence France-Presse. (2) One of the explosions was carried out by a suicide car bomber. (3) According to the police, the attacker's target was a hotel for foreigners. (4) At least six people were killed. (5) 17 people were injured. (6) The Afghan branch of the Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident. (7) a taliban statement said that one of their supporters detonated a bomb near a "military base" and that other taliban members allegedly managed to get inside. (8) however, the ministry of internal affairs of afghanistan denied information about the number of terrorists. (9) According to the Ministry, there was only one suicide bomber. (10) The U.S. Embassy in Kabul issued an alert and urged its staff not to leave the embassy grounds and to stay away from windows. (11) Barack Obama arrived on an unannounced visit to Afghanistan late on May 1. (12) During the visit, he and Afghan President Hamid Karzai signed a strategic partnership agreement that will regulate relations between the two countries after the withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan. (13) Later, Obama visited the Bagram air base, from where he made a televised address to US citizens. (14) obama, in particular, said that he sees the taliban as participants in the political life of afghanistan, but only if the taliban sever all ties with the al-qaeda terrorist network."
\"(1) Деревню, где снимали вышедший неда: "(1) The village where the recently released film "Hunger Games" was filmed was put up for sale for $ 1.4 million, according to the Associated Press. (2) The village appears in the film as District 12. (3) It is located in North Carolina and is actually called Henry River Mill Village. (4) It is 72 acres (about 0.3 square kilometers) of land with about 20 abandoned houses and a former store building, the Daily Mail said. (5) The shop located in the village is featured in the film as the Mellark family bakery. (6) of the attractions in the village, there is also a house where the main character katniss everdeen, whose role was played by jennifer lawrence, lived in the plot. (7) henry river mill village fell into disrepair after 1977, when the mill where most of the villagers worked burned down. (8) The owner of the land, 83-year-old Wade Shepherd (Wade Shepherd) complains about the annoying fans of the film: "Day and night they come here, take pictures, go out, walk. (9) They just torment me." (10) Shepherd also admitted that he had not read the book by Susan Collins, on which the film was based. (11) Whether he watched the movie is not specified. (12) The village really became a place of pilgrimage for fans of the "Hunger Games". (13) So, Time magazine reports that the North Carolina travel portal VisitNC.com already offers fans of the film a four-day tour of the filming locations. (14) the hunger games was released in the united states on march 23, 2012 and has already grossed almost $ 300 million in the country. (15) two sequels are planned for the future."
\"(1) Бывший трейдер банка Societe Gener: "(1) Former Societe Generale trader Jerome Kerviel, who was sentenced on October 5 to three years in prison and a fine of 4.9 billion euros, compared himself to a murdered soldier in his first interview after the verdict. (2) This is reported by AFP. (3) "I have a feeling that they decided to make me pay for all at once to save Societe Generale, and so they decided to kill a simple soldier Kerviel," the former trader said in an interview with Europe 1 radio station. (4) Kerviel admitted that he was "crushed" by the weight of the court decision. (5) He added that his first thought after the verdict was about his mother and father. (6) A former SocGen employee is going to appeal the verdict. (7) The day before, his lawyer, Olivier Metzner, called the court's decision "meaningless" and " excessive." (8) On October 5, Kerviel was found guilty of all charges, including forgery of documents, breach of trustee's obligations, unauthorized use of the bank's computer systems. (9) The prosecution demanded that he be jailed for four years. (10) kerviel pleaded not guilty and repeatedly stated that the management of socgen knew about his machinations and turned a blind eye to them as long as they brought income to the bank. (11) Due to Kerviel's illegal exchange operations, which SocGen announced in early 2008, the bank suffered losses of almost five billion euros. (12) The investigation of the former trader lasted a year and ended in January 2009. (13) Kerviel's trial took place in June of this year."

(1) Сомс посещает Ирэн, чтобы форсироват: (1) Soames visits Irene to force a divorce case, and is forced to admit that the woman still excites him. (2) He leaves her house confused, confused, with pain in his heart, with vague anxiety. (3) His next visit is timed to coincide with the thirty-seventh anniversary of Irene's birth, bringing a diamond brooch as a gift. (4) He agrees to forget everything, asks her to come back and give him a son. (5) How does the whip strike sound?: "I'd rather die." (6) In an effort to get rid of the harassment of her ex-husband, Irene goes abroad. (7) Soames applies to the detective agency with a request to establish surveillance of her. (8) He justifies himself by saying that he cannot continue to remain in the web, and in order to break it, it is necessary to resort to such a vile method. (1) Где-то, когда-то, давно-давно тому н: (1) Somewhere, once, a long time ago, I read a poem. (2) It was soon forgotten by me... (3) but the first verse remained in my memory: How beautiful, how fresh were the roses... (4) Now it is winter; the frost has blown out the windows; in a dark room one candle is burning. (5) I sit huddled in a corner, and my head keeps ringing and ringing: How good, how fresh were the roses ... (6) and i see myself in front of the low window of a russian country house. (7) The summer evening softly melts and passes into night, the warm air smells of mignonette and linden; and on the window, leaning on an erect arm and bowing her head to one shoulder, sits a girl – and silently and intently looks at the sky, as if waiting for the first stars to appear. (8) How ingenuously inspired brooding eyes as touchingly innocent open, questioning lips, how smooth breathing hasn't quite blossomed, yet no agitated breast, as pure and delicate image of the young face! (9) I do not dare to speak to her – but how dear she is to me, how my heart beats! (10) How beautiful, how fresh were the roses... (11) And in the room it gets darker and darker... (12) The burnt candle crackles, fleeting shadows waver on the low ceiling, the frost sneaks and gets angry behind the wall – and it seems boring, senile whisper…

(1) Еретическая космогония Хакима основы: (1) hakim's heretical cosmogony was based on the existence of a ghostly god who had neither name nor form. (2) from him come the nine shadows that inhabited and headed the first heaven. (3) From the first demiurgic crown came the second, also with angels, powers, and thrones, and these in turn founded another heaven, which is below. (4) The second holy assembly was reflected in the third, then in the next, and so on until 999. (5) They are ruled by the lord of the primordial sky — the shadow of the shadows of other shadows. (6) The land we live on is just a mistake, an inept parody. (7) Mirrors and procreation are abominable, for they multiply and strengthen this error. (8) The basic virtue is aversion. (9) Hakim's heaven and hell were no less dreary. (10) "In this life," Hakim promises, "you suffer the torments of one body; but in spirit and in retribution, in innumerable bodies."(11) Paradise seems to be a place where it is always dark and there are stone bowls of holy water everywhere, and the bliss of this paradise is " the special bliss of parting, renunciation, and those who sleep."

(1) Лидер Корейской народной демократиче: (1) For the first time in 19 years, the Leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea made a New Year's television address to the citizens. (4) The next leader, his son Kim Jong Il, did not support this tradition and rarely spoke publicly at all. (5) Kim Jong-un (son of Kim Jong-il and grandson of Kim Il-sung), who has led the country since 2011, has decided to renew the tradition. (6) in his speech, kim jong-un said that north and south korea need to reunite. (7) he stressed that disagreements lead to wars. (10) In addition to the televised address, Kim Jong-un's speech was published in three major North Korean newspapers. (11) The North Korean media also reported how the leader met the New Year - he went to a musical performance with his wife. (12) In December 2012, Kim Jong-un received a chance to become the person of the year according to the American Time magazine. (13) He became the leader of the reader vote. (14) However, the editors eventually chose US President Barack Obama as the person of the year. (15) Kim Jong-un's leadership was explained by a hacker attack, but the DPRK did not agree with this version.
(1) В комнате тихо, полутемно; мамаша си: (1) The room is quiet, half-dark; my mother is sitting next to me; I can hear her voice. (2)All this makes me jump up, throw my arms around her neck, and press my head against her chest. (3)She kisses me even more gently. (4)After that, as you used to come upstairs and start packing in your cotton dressing gown, what a wonderful feeling you have when you say, "I love my father and mother." (5)I remember wrapping myself up in a blanket; my heart is light, light, and pleasant; some dreams drive others away, but what are they about? (6)They are elusive, but filled with pure love and hopes for bright happiness. (7)You will remember your favorite porcelain toy – a bunny or a dog – you will bury it in the corner of the down pillow and admire how nice, warm and cozy it is to lie there. (8) If you still think about making everyone happy, making everyone happy, and having good weather for walking tomorrow, you will turn over on your other side, your thoughts and dreams will get mixed up, and you will fall asleep quietly, calmly. (9)Will the freshness, carelessness, need for love and power of faith that you had as a child ever return? (10)What time could be better than that when the two best virtues – innocent gaiety and the boundless need for love-were the only motives in life? (by l. N. tolstoy*)
(1) Роскошная, пышно освещенная зала; мн: (1)A sumptuous, luxuriously lighted hall; many gentlemen and ladies. (2) All the faces are animated, the speeches are brisk... (3) And there is a crackling conversation about a famous singer. (4) She is called divine, immortal... (5) Oh, how well she let out her last trill yesterday! (6) And suddenly-as if by a magic wand-from all heads and from all faces the thin husk of skin flew off and instantly the dead whiteness of skulls came out, the naked gums and cheekbones shone with a bluish tin. (7) I watched with horror how these gums and cheekbones moved and moved, how these knobby, bony balls turned, glistening in the light of lamps and candles, and how other, smaller balls – balls of meaningless eyes-turned in them. (8) I didn't dare touch my own face, I didn't dare look at myself in the mirror. (9) And the skulls turned as before... (10) And with the same crackle, flashing red patches from behind bared teeth, nimble tongues babbled about how amazing, how inimitable the immortal... yes, the immortal singer let out her last trill!

(1) Альберт идёт к дому Анны и видит, чт: (1) Albert goes to Anna's house and sees that all the lights are out and only a ray of light comes through her window. (2) How do I know what's wrong with it? (3) The saving thought occurs to him that in the event of her illness, he can find out about her health through a messenger, and the messenger does not need to know who gave him the order. (4) So he learns that Anna is seriously ill with typhoid fever and her illness is very dangerous. (5) Albert suffers unbearably at the thought that Anna may be dying now, and he cannot see her before she dies. (6) But he does not dare to rush upstairs to his beloved even now, fearing to harm her and himself by the publicity of their affair. (7) Heartbroken, half-asleep, Albert wanders around the house of his beloved, not daring to go to her to say goodbye. (8) A week has passed since their last date. (9) Early in the morning, Albert runs to Anna's house, and the servant informs him that Anna died half an hour ago. (10) Now the painful hours of waiting for Anna seem to him the happiest in his life. (11) And again the hero lacks the courage to enter the rooms, and returns an hour later, hoping to blend in with the crowd and remain unnoticed. (12) On the stairs, he encounters strange grieving people, and they only thank him for his visit and attention.
\"(1) Продажи путёвок за рубеж по всем н: "(1) Sales of travel packages abroad in all directions have almost stopped in travel agencies due to the accident of the A321 passenger airliner in Egypt. (1)Как художник создаёт пейзажную картин: (1) as an artist creates a landscape picture, so a whole nation gradually, unwittingly even, perhaps, stroke by stroke, over the centuries, creates the landscape and landscape of its country. (2) the face of old, pre — revolutionary russia was determined, for example, to a large extent by the hundreds of thousands of churches and bell towers that were placed throughout its expanses on elevated places and that defined the silhouette of each city-from the largest to the smallest, as well as hundreds of monasteries, countless windmills and water mills. (3)tens of thousands of landlords ' estates with their parks and pond systems also contributed a considerable share to the landscape and landscape of the country. (4)but, of course, first of all, small villages and villages with vetlami, wells, sheds, baths, paths, gardens, vegetable gardens, pledges, spinning wheels, carved platbands, skates, porches, fairs, sundresses, round dances, mowing, shepherd's horns, sickles, flails, thatched roofs, small individual fields, horses on plowing... (5)the face of the country changed when all these factors, defining landscape, disappeared. (6) Just as a landscape painter puts a part of his soul into his work and creates a landscape, in essence, in his own image and likeness, so the soul of the people and the idea of beauty that lives in the soul of a particular people is embedded in the landscape of any country. (7) it is bad if the soul is asleep, if it is distracted, drowned out by side circumstances, interests, noises, self-interest or other considerations, if it is dead or, more precisely, lethargic. (8) Then the spiritualization goes out of the landscape. (9)The landscape remains a landscape, but it seems to be empty, the form remains in the absence of content, it blows with cold, alienation, indifference and just emptiness. (10)It becomes indifferent to the individual and the whole nation: what will it look like?(11)What will the house, the village, the river, the valley, the hills, the country as a whole look like?(12)What will be the face of the country?(13)There are departments for the development and extraction of minerals, for the construction of roads, for agriculture, for electrification, for light, heavy and automotive industries, but there is no department for the appearance of the country (land), for its neatness, tidiness, spirituality... (14)We think about the strength of structures, about the nature and volume of earthworks, about the amount of wood, about centners and tons, about cubic meters and square meters, but we do not think about what it will look like?(15)How it will look not only in itself, but in combination with the environment, with the terrain, in accordance with traditions and with a projection into the future. (16)The landscape in all its complexity and totality is not just the face of the earth, the face of the country, but also the face of this society. (17)3 a littered forest, broken roads with bogged-down cars, shallow rivers, green meadows streaked with tractor tracks, half-abandoned villages, agricultural machines rusting in the open air, standard houses, fields infested with weeds, say as much about the inhabitants of this or that village, this or that area, as an unsightly and neglected apartment about its residents. (By V. Soloukhin*)

(1) Наступил сентябрь. (2)Вадим должен б: (1) September has arrived. (2)Vadim would have to finish the tenth grade this year. (3)but there were no classes. (4) He joined the youth fire brigade and worked for two months: at night he was on duty, put out lighters, caught rocket men, and during the day he worked with the whole team in a wood warehouse, at various railway stations, most often on the river − unloading barges with ammunition. (5) I had little sleep. (6)Standing autumn night from the garret window in any house in the Meadow or Cow's shaft, looking for flashes of anti-aircraft guns in the sky, and instantly the pink threads of tracer bullets, Vadim, imbued with a new sense: he was a pillar not only of family but of his entire street, the entire district of tens, hundreds of families, invisible sleeping or awake in the pitch darkness of the darkened city. (7)He was responsible for the lives of thousands of people, for the integrity of their homes. (8)Later, at the front, this sense of responsibility was further strengthened in him, and it seemed to him that not the street, not the city, but the whole country stood behind him, and he was its support and responsible for its fate. (9)Vadim came to the front in that great year, when crushing blows drove the enemy further and further to the west. (According To Yu. V. Trifonov)
(1) В молодости я считал себя человеком: (1) When I was young, I considered myself a well-bred person. (2) When meeting friends, he was able to say hello politely. (4) In a dispute, even the most heated, never shouted, and even more so did not use rude words. (5) There was never a time when I accidentally pushed someone and did not apologize or go through the door first, without giving way to my companion. (7) But it only seemed so. (8) And it turned out quite unexpectedly. (9) Once, during a student internship, I had to live for two weeks with an artel of loggers. (10) And one evening I accidentally overheard a conversation that I will always remember. (12) It was about me.- (13) He's a good guy, - said the cook, - literate, but it's too gray! (14) There is no education.— (15) And what? The headman was interested.— (16) Yes, he does everything not in a human way. (17) When he begins to wash — the whole floor will be flooded, then wipe after him. (18) He will sit down to the table — no, to first slurp the liquid, immediately, without a command, he begins to drag the meat from the bottom. (By A. Dorokhov All The Best For)
(1) В Новосибирске судья отпустил по амн: (1) In Novosibirsk, a judge granted amnesty to a man who in December last year beat the editor-in-chief of the information website "Taiga.info" Eugene Myzdrikova. (1) Самый первый «остров» Архипелага воз: (1) The very first "island" of the Archipelago appeared in 1923 on the site of the Solovetsky Monastery. (2) Then there were tones — special purpose prisons and stages. (3) People came to the Archipelago in various ways: in wagons, on barges, steamboats and on foot stages. (4) Prisoners were taken to prisons in "funnels" — black vans. (5) The role of ports of the Archipelago was played by transfers, temporary camps consisting of tents, dugouts, barracks or open-air plots of land. (6) On all transfers, specially selected urks, or "socially close" ones, helped to keep the "political"in check. (7) Solzhenitsyn visited the Krasnaya Presnya crossing in 1945. (8) Emigrants, peasants and "small nations" were transported in red trains. (9) Most often, such trains stopped in an empty place, in the middle of the steppe or taiga, and the convicts themselves built a camp. (10) Particularly important prisoners, mostly scientists, were transported by special convoy. (11) Solzhenitsyn was also transported in this way. (12) He called himself a nuclear physicist, and after Krasnaya Presnya he was transported to Butyrki.

(1)Над письменным столом висит фотографи: (1)above the desk hangs a photograph of my father: he is without a hat, his gray hair curls exuberantly and youngly over a broad forehead, and his eyes are slightly narrowed, smiling mockingly and shrewdly, seeing everything, understanding everything... (4)Masterpieces of brush and chisel, thought and imagination! (5) Masterpieces of poetry! (6)Each masterpiece contains something that can never be seen-the perfection of the human spirit, the power of human feeling, instant responsiveness to everything that surrounds us both outside and in our inner world. (7)the desire to reach ever higher limits, the desire for perfection, drives life. (8) and gives birth to masterpieces. (9) i write all this on an autumn night. (10)Autumn is not visible outside the window, it is flooded with darkness. (11)but as soon as you go out on the porch, autumn will surround you and begin to breathe insistently in your face with the cold freshness of its mysterious black spaces, the bitter smell of the first thin ice that bound the still waters to night, will begin to whisper with the last leaves that fly continuously day and night. (12) and will flash with the unexpected light of a star breaking through the undulating night mists. (13)And all this will seem to you a great masterpiece of nature, a healing gift, reminding you that life around is full of meaning and meaning. (By K. G. Paustovsky*)
\"(1) Глава фонда \"Сколково\" Виктор Ве: "(1) The head of the Skolkovo Foundation, Viktor Vekselberg, compared the Innograd project with the concept of" death valley "in the venture business, Interfax reports. (5) According to Vekselberg, Innograd managed to create a balanced system of public administration. (6) The State provides funds for the project in the format of a subsidy agreement. (7) vekselberg added that the most" bottleneck " of innograd is the commercialization of its projects. (8) in order to achieve this goal, he considers it extremely important to involve large corporations in skolkovo's activities. (14) According to Vekselberg, the financing of the Skolkovo project will require 180-200 billion rubles over three years."

(1) На норвежском острове Утойя, где в 2: (1) a youth camp has reopened on the norwegian island of utoya, where terrorist anders breivik staged a massacre in 2011, the associated press reports. (2) More than a thousand students plan to visit it within three days.
