(6) Now it is even more important than before," the head of the North Atlantic Alliance said. (7) According to Stoltenberg, Utoya will always be a reminder of sorrow and joy, death and life. (8)" We must learn to accept this duality, " he added. (9) Some of the buildings were renovated before the students arrived. (10) The exception was the cafeteria, where 13 people were shot. (11) It was decided to leave bullet marks on the walls of the building. (12) "Utoya will always be for us a place where we remember our comrades, where we learn and participate in political discussions," said the president of the youth group, Mani Hussaini. (1) Полковник Най-Турс к 10 декабря зака: (1) Colonel Nai-Tours completes the formation of the second division of the first squad by December 10. (3) On the morning of December 14, Petliura attacks the City; Nai-Tours receives orders to guard the Polytechnic Highway and, in case of an enemy, to take the fight. (4) Nai-Tours, having engaged the enemy's advanced detachments, sends three junkers to find out where the Hetman's units are. (5) The messengers return with the message that there are no units anywhere, machine — gun fire is in the rear, and the enemy's cavalry is entering the City. (6) Nye realizes that they are trapped. An hour earlier, Nikolai Turbin, a corporal in the third division of the first infantry squad, receives orders to lead the team along the route. (10) Shocked, Nikolka, leaving Nay-Turs, makes his way to the house through courtyards and alleys.

(1) Однажды я ехал в электричке. (2) Сид: (1) i was on the train once. (2) Sitting next to me at the window, a modestly dressed, reserved woman opened a volume of Chekhov. (3) The road was long, I didn't bring any books, the people around me were strangers, and I began to think about work. (4) And in the same tone as the question is asked, for example: "Do you know how soon we will arrive?" – I suddenly asked her for myself and especially for the neighbor: - I'm sorry, you do not know what happiness is? (5) A woman with a volume of Chekhov in her hands was a wonderful conversationalist. (6) She did not ask me why I asked such a strange question, did not immediately answer, she closed the book and was silent for a long time, looking out of the window, thinking. (7) Finally, when I thought she had forgotten about the question, she turned to me... (8) It turned out that she was a researcher, a specialist in the field of protein chemistry. (9) After thinking about my question for a long time, she said: (10) – I can not give a definition of happiness. (11) Here is a scientist! (12) A scientist is not one who knows everything, but one who knows exactly what he does not know. (13) But maybe so? (14) A person has spiritual aspirations: when they are satisfied, he feels happy. (15) Does it sound like the truth? (By S. L. Soloveitchik*)
(1) С согласия госпожи де Франваль Вальм: (1) With Madame de Franval's consent, Valmont takes Eugenie away, but Franval catches up with them and kills Valmont. \"(1) Полиция Канады принесла официальны: "(1) the canadian police have issued a formal apology to the family of a polish man killed at vancouver airport in 2007. (1) Федеральная антимонопольная служба (: (1)the federal antimonopoly service (fas) plans to make the same price for air tickets for equal distances. (5) The service's initiative drew sharp criticism from air carriers. (6) Thus, a source close to Aeroflot considers the FAS proposal incorrect. (9) For example, the maintenance of airports located in the northern regions requires the purchase of snow removal equipment, which increases the cost of their maintenance. (10) In addition, a tax of 18 percent is imposed on domestic flights, which also affects the final cost of tickets. (11) The representative of Transaero also noted that the price also depends on the workload of flights. (12) " No airline wants to fly at a loss. (13) If we feel that tickets are too expensive for buyers, we start selling out," he said.
(1) Магазин расположен на первом этаже д: (1) The store is located on the first floor of the Torrens ' home, and so the return of Jab from the hospital is seen by customers who are there at that moment. (1) Заинтригованная Ник принимает у себя: (1) Intrigued, Nick hosts Poirot and Hastings. (2) The Endhouse turns out to be a gloomy, old, redecorated house. \"(1) Бывший виолончелист и один из осно: "(1) Former cellist and founding member of the British Electric Light Orchestra, Mike Edwards, has died in a freak accident. \"(1) Убийство дагестанского мирового су: "(1) The murder of Dagestani justice of the Peace Abdurakhman Gamzatov was committed by mistake, writes Kommersant. \"(1) Бывший городской прокурор Клина Эд: "(1) the former city prosecutor of klin, eduard kaplun, who was hiding from the investigation outside russia, on thursday, august 9, appeared for questioning in the ic of the russian federation. (6) Kaplun, who left Russia, was put on the international wanted list. (7) In addition to him, the most high - ranking person involved in the "gambling case" - the former first deputy prosecutor of the Moscow region, Alexander Ignatenko, was hiding outside the country. (9) Kaplun and Ignatenko were among the employees of the prosecutor's office dismissed because of the case of patronage of underground casinos in the Moscow region. (11) In addition, businessman Ivan Nazarov is a suspect in this case. (1) В Стамбуле Пуаро останавливается в о: (1) In Istanbul, Poirot stays at a hotel. (2) There he notices an elderly American, Mr. Ratchett, who is accompanied by his secretary, Mr. McQueen. \"(1) В Нью-Йорке на 48-м году жизни уме: "(1) In New York at the 48th year of life, the co-founder and member of the hip-hop group Beastie Boys Adam Yauch (Adam Yauch), known under the pseudonym MCA, died, reports on Friday, May 4, the Associated Press. (1) Министерство культуры Великобритании: (1) The UK Department of Culture has authorized News Corp. media mogul Rupert Murdoch to buy out BSkyB in full. (2) As reported by Reuters, Murdoch will lose control of the influential TV channel Sky News (now part of BSkyB), which will be separated into a separate company. (3) Sky News shares will be redistributed to the current shareholders of BSkyB in accordance with their shares. (4) thus, news corp. 39.1 percent of Sky News will remain. (5) The BSkyB buyout is expected to cost News Corp. at $ 14 billion. (6) The company's profit, which includes several paid satellite TV channels, is steadily growing. (7) At the same time, Sky News incurs losses, but is considered one of the most influential media outlets in the UK. (8) News Corp. Will fund Sky news for 10 Years. (9) In addition, the channel will be able to use its current brand under license for seven years. (10) The majority of Sky News ' board of directors will be independent directors, with only an independent director being able to become chairman. (11) Murdoch's plans to buy out BSkyB are causing protests from many in the UK media market. (12) They express concerns that the media mogul will gain too much influence on the market and on public opinion. (1) Да, странные чудеса сопутствуют Лени: (1) Yes, strange miracles accompany Leni Pfeiffer... (1) Павлик воспринял это как предательст: (1) Pavlik took this as a betrayal and did not speak to Yura for a whole year. (8) his mother seemed to be a woman who "did not know that printing was invented," although her brothers, a chemist and a biologist, were great scientists. \"(1) Элис Купер объявил конкурс, победи: "(1) Alice Cooper announced a competition, the winners of which will be able to participate in two concerts of the musician. (2) The official website of Cooper informs that video applications for participation in the competition will be accepted until August 7. (3) Cooper doesn't need musicians, but "entertainment performers and freaks." (4) The authors of the most successful issues will be invited to the final round of the competition, which will be held in London on August 9. (5) The jury, headed by Alice himself, will select the performers of the "wildest" numbers. (6) Winners will be able to participate in two Cooper shows dedicated to the Halloween celebration. (7) The concerts will take place on 31 October and 1 November 2010 at The Roundhouse in London. (8) "London is full of freaks, and I would like people to know about it. (9) Unfortunately, Halloween is not as popular in the UK as it is in the US. (10) And I would like this holiday to be as big as Christmas," Cooper said. (11) In his nearly 50-year career, Alice Cooper has released 25 studio albums. (12) The last of them, "Along Came a Spider", went on sale in July 2008. (13) It is assumed that the musician is currently working on his next record, which will be called "The Night Shift"."
\"(1) Парламент Нижней Саксонии избрал п: "(1) The Parliament of Lower Saxony has elected 39-year-old David McAllister as Chairman of the Land Government. (2) This is reported by The Local. (3) McAllister will become the youngest Prime minister in the history of the German lands, as well as the first head of a regional government with British citizenship. (4) half scottish on his father's side, he has dual citizenship, but from the point of view of german law, this is not an obstacle to holding public office. (5) David McAllister, a member of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU), received 80 out of 148 votes in the parliamentary vote. (6) As Prime Minister of Lower Saxony, he will succeed Christian Wulff, who was elected President of Germany on June 30. (7) Like Wolfe, McAllister is a representative of the German ruling coalition, which includes the CDU/CSU and the Free Democrats. (8) As Prime Minister, he is expected to continue the policies of his predecessor and do without changes in the composition of the Land Government. (9) David McAllister, often referred to simply as " Mac " in Germany, was born in 1971 in West Berlin. (10) His father is a Scottish soldier, his mother is a German music teacher. (11) McAllister spent most of his life in Germany. (12) He studied law at the University of Hanover and served two years in the German armed forces. (13) McAllister was first elected to the Parliament of Lower Saxony in 1998. (14) In 2002, he became secretary of the local CDU branch, and since 2003 has been the party's leader in Lower Saxony."
\"(1) В интернете появилось видеообращен: "(1) A video message appeared on the Internet on behalf of journalist Ankhar Kochneva, who disappeared in Syria in early October. (2) In particular, on November 7, the video was posted by one of the YouTube users from Ukraine. (3) The woman in the video says in Arabic: "My name is Ankhar. (4) I am in the city of Homs. (5) I ask the Ukrainian and Russian embassies, as well as the Syrian government, to comply with the kidnappers ' demands." (6) The video is only 15 seconds long. (7) The video does not contain any information about the content of the kidnappers ' demands, nor has it been reported in the media. (8) Who kidnapped the journalist is also unknown. (9) According to the assumption of Kochneva's acquaintances, she is being held by Syrian rebels, as she has repeatedly spoken on local television in defense of the government of Bashar al-Assad. (10) previously, kochneva had already contacted relatives - on october 14, the journalist's ex-husband received a message from kochneva's mobile phone number, which said: (11) " i hope everything will be fine soon. Do not write. "(12) Recall that Kochneva left the last entry in her blog on October 8, writing: (13) " Do not look for a couple of days. I'm leaving. " (14) According to her friends, the journalist was last seen in the city of Tartus, from where she was supposed to leave for Homs. (15) Kochneva is a citizen of Ukraine, but cooperates with many Russian media, including NTV, REN TV and Russia Today, RIA Novosti reminds. (16) She also accompanied Russian journalists visiting Syria."
(1) Ты не забыта мною, моя далекая родин: (1) You are not forgotten by me, my distant homeland, Siberia, rich in gold, dense forests, frosts and wonderful natural phenomena! (2) Like the first dreams of youth, like the favorite games of childhood, I remember your age-old cedars, your silent deserts, the cliffs broken by centuries in the gorges of mountains and your immense, blue as the eyes of a Siberian maiden, bright as a block of ice, the Angara, on the banks of which the days of my childhood passed carelessly, merrily and quickly. (3) the Siberia! (4) How far you are, and how near to my soul! (5) All that was once impressed on my young memory, I remember everything, even the roar of the wind through the pine forests, when, crossing from the mossy tundra, in your wilds he walks, the powerful son of the Arctic Sea, and carries the mists, and nature, and passions that encircle the sky here in Russia, and dim in my eyes and magnificent buildings, and velvet meadows, and blooming fields, warmed by the sun, dotted with rainbows of flowers and devoured An envious person. (6) Whether looking at the local naked fields, I forget your vast, untouched steppes, Siberia-the golden bottom! (7) forgive the memories of the past, my friends! (8) Marvel at the strangeness of the human heart: I have seen much since the last time I looked with hopes, with dreams for the future — still young, still full of life — at Irkutsk, over which the sun rose magnificently and gilded with its rays the blue waters of the Angara and the green shores of Irkut.. (9) A long time has passed; my soul has experienced much sorrow and joy; many of those with whom it has shared have completed the path of life forever and are resting under the grave turf.. (10) But wherever I was — on the peaks of the Urals, and near the Caucasus and Taurida, and on the shores of the Sea of Azov, and on the granite — lined shores of the Baltic Sea, and on the luxurious pastures of Ukraine-nowhere, no, nowhere was my soul so agitated, my heart beat so hard, my head burned so fiercely, as there, in my wild homeland! (11) it was a world of enchantments, a world that passed by in an instant's sleep. (12) If any of you, my friends, will be in Irkutsk — let him go outside the city, to the place where near the old, ruined mill flows into the Angara Ushakovka. (13) Here the winding course of this river will lead him to the place where Ushakovka is divided by islands, where opposite him on the meadow side will be the old Admiralty — here my father lived; here were the limits of my first world; here I dreamed, wept for Plutarch, thought to be a great man, like the great people he described he walked proudly through the meadow, retreating into the shade of the trees, inspired by the first love, sharing the first feelings of friendship.. (14) There, they say, everything has changed: the old father's house does not exist; the good people who once gathered in it were blown away by the storm of life, and I — a careless young man-was taken away by fate far from my homeland.. (15) And now Siberia is still sparsely populated, and now its forests are still wild; but before it was even more sparsely populated, its forests were even wilder. (16) there Was a time that the Governor sent from Moscow, two years traveled to Irkutsk, resting in solitary prison and the cabin from the road is endless. (17) Now everywhere I see human footprints: cut through forests, swamps with bridges, mountains ebrity. (18) Often you go, and now you do not meet a living human being; but immediately you see that the man was already in these places, cut down, dug, paved, and went away. (19) Before, you would have sought him in vain. (According to N. Polevoy *)
(1) Американец разыграл перед женой собс: (1) An American faked his own abduction in front of his wife to go to a bachelor party. (2) The incident occurred in Edinburgh, Texas. (3) This is reported by the Metro newspaper on Wednesday, October 9. (4) Rogelio Andaverde persuaded his friends to break into his house, stage a kidnapping, and take him to a party. (5) The friends, wearing masks on their faces, with weapons in their hands (it is not specified whether they were real or fake), grabbed Rogelio in front of his wife and pushed him into the luggage compartment of the van. (6) The spouse called the police, but the "criminals" managed to escape before the arrival of the law enforcement officers. (7) When Rogelio Andaverde returned home in the early morning, he explained to his wife that his captors had released him. (8) However, the police did not believe the man's story and charged him with perjury. (9) "The situation is anecdotal, but it's very serious," said Guadalupe Trevino, the county sheriff. (10) — We have people who have given false statements to the police, and they are all in prison. (11) Although no one did this, of course, for the sake of a party with friends." (12) How Rogelio Andaverde's wife reacted to the truth about his adventures is not specified. (13) This is not the first time that, not daring to tell the truth to his beloved, men go to the stage of their own abduction. (14) In May 2013, New Yorker Ramell Pettaway organized his abduction after not appearing in the eyes of his girlfriend for two weeks. (15) He was charged with perjury.
(1) Эдмон пылает страстью к госпоже Пара: (1) Edmond is infatuated with Madame Parangon. (2) The unfortunate woman, whose heart has long been filled with love for the impudent villager, tries to resist their mutual attraction. (3)" It is easier for me to die than to lose respect for you... " she writes to Edmond. (4) Gaudet cynically advises his ward to master the "charming nedotroga": in his opinion, victory over her will drive out of his heart the absurd reverence for female virtue and drain his "village drooling"; having defeated Madame Parangon, he will become "the most charming moth fluttering in the flowers of love." (5) And now Edmond, enraged, commits violence against Madame Parangon. (6) For several days the unfortunate victim is between life and death. (7) When she finally comes to her senses, she irrevocably removes Edmond from her. (8) At the appointed hour, her daughter, Edmee — Colette, is born. (9) a letter Arrives from Mrs. Kanon — Ursule kidnapped! (10) She "has not lost his chastity, but lost innocence..." (11) Edmond rushes to Paris, causing the offender-the Marquis to a duel, wounds him, but, having quenched his thirst for vengeance, immediately bandaging the wound of his opponent. (12) While Edmond is hiding, Mrs. Parangan acts as his intercessor before the family of the Marquis. (13) as a result of the old Earl Edmon promises her protection, taking it in the light, and ladies, admiring its beauty, rush to make him their portraits.
(1) Бывший работник Louis Vuitton подал: (1) A former Louis Vuitton employee sued the manager of a London fashion brand boutique after hearing a racist remark from him. (2) This is reported by The Daily Mirror. (3) The man resigned after an incident in which the boss called him a "slave". (4) in his lawsuit, the african oliver koffi (oliver koffi) accused the manager(his name is not reported) of racial discrimination. (5) coffey quoted the abuser as saying, " black people are slaves who eat dirt off the floor." (6) It is not specified on what occasion the manager uttered words offensive to the employee. (7) In his defense, the defendant in the claim stated that his remark was a joke. (8) Coffey, in turn, expressed doubts about the veracity of such a statement. (9) The African noted that this and other insulting remarks about him were made by the manager of the boutique in a "cold and calm" tone. (10) Coffey stressed that he was forced to resign because the work environment had become "hostile and intimidating"for him. (11) According to the man, the abuser had previously made racist remarks about other Africans and Asians. (12) He called Louis Vuitton products a rude word, citing the fact that the brand's products are made in China as proof. (13) Representatives of Louis Vuitton confirmed the filing of the lawsuit and reported that they had conducted an internal investigation into the incident. \"(1) Канцлер Германии Ангела Меркель за: "(1) German Chancellor Angela Merkel launched on February 1 a new online project dedicated to the future of Germany. (2) On the website entitled "Discussion about Germany", the Head of Government is going to discuss with the population key issues about the development of the country for the next ten years. (3) According to Merkel, citizens ' proposals will be discussed at the federal level, writes Spiegel. (4) Three main topics are proposed for discussion: "How do we want to live?", " At the expense of what do we want to live?" and "How do we want to learn new things?". (5) All Internet users can leave their suggestions on the site. (6) Following the discussion, the authors of the top ten comments will be invited to a personal conversation with Merkel. (7) The proposals will be evaluated by about 120 experts from different fields. (8) In addition, during the project, Merkel will meet three times with hundreds of citizens selected by experts from the project participants. (9) In the Chancellor's administration, this project is called a political experiment. (10) Meanwhile, the opposition expressed dissatisfaction with such an initiative. (11) The head of the SPD faction, Thomas Oppermann, said in an interview with the Esslinger Zeitung that the party will ensure that this government project does not turn into a campaign work of the CDU in the run-up to the parliamentary elections, on which taxpayers ' money is spent. (12) Angela Merkel is the leader of the CDU, which, along with the CSU and FDP, is part of the ruling coalition. (13) In 2013, Germany will hold elections to the Bundestag."
\"(1) Музыка, мелодия, красота музыкальн: "(1) Music, melody, the beauty of musical sounds is an important means of moral and mental education of a person, a source of nobility of heart and purity of soul. (2) Music opens people's eyes to the beauty of nature, moral relations, and work. (3) Thanks to music, a person awakens the idea of the sublime, majestic, beautiful not only in the world around him, but also in himself. (4) On winter days, when snow covered all our paths, we sat in the school room, listening to the melodies of P. Tchaikovsky, E. Grieg, F. Schubert, R. Schumann. (5) If in early childhood the beauty of a piece of music is brought to the heart, if in the sounds the child feels the many-sided shades of human feelings, he will rise to a level of culture that cannot be achieved by any other means. (6) By developing a child's sensitivity to music, we ennoble his thoughts and aspirations. (7) The task is that a musical melody opens in every heart a life-giving spring of human feelings. (8) But melody − this language of human feelings-brings to the child's soul not only the beauty of the world: it reveals to people human greatness and dignity. (9) The spontaneous, unorganized influence of music on children does not contribute to, but rather harms, proper aesthetic education: the child becomes a hostage to musical noise, he is overwhelmed by the accumulation of sounds, he is not able to distinguish beauty from ugliness. (10) So he will go into the world, confused, unsure of himself. (11) you can't just take a child and force him to listen to music, no, the child must be a Teacher who will help him in the music education. (12) I picked them up for hearing tunes, in which vivid images, child-friendly, passed the sounds that they hear around them: the chirping of birds, rustling of leaves, the rumble of thunder, the murmur of the brook, the howling of the wind. (13) I used two songs in a month, but before exploring each tune held a great educational work, which aims to awaken in children the desire again and again to listen to the music, to ensure that every time the guys opened the work in beauty. (14) Early in the fall, when the clear air is heard clearly every sound, I offered to listen to the tune of "Flight of the bumblebee" from the Opera "Tale about Tsar Saltan" of N. Rimsky-Korsakov. (15) music has found an emotional response in children. (16) The little ones said: (17)" The bumblebee is now approaching, now moving away. (18) You can hear the chirping of small birds... " (19) The children want to hear the melody again. (20) In what had hitherto seemed ordinary to them, beauty was revealed − such is the power of music. (by v. a. sukhomlinsky)"
\"(1) Российский гроссмейстер Сергей Кар: "(1) Russian grandmaster Sergey Karjakin, who lost the World Chess Championship match to Norwegian Magnus Carlsen, said that he treated his opponent too respectfully. (2) The words of the athlete are quoted by "Soviet Sport". (3) Before the tenth game, Karjakin was ahead, but lost to Carlsen and allowed to equalize the score in the match. (4)" Karjakin got nervous and lost his freshness, " Anatoly Karpov said of the key aspect of the World Cup match between Carlsen and Karjakin. (5) "Magnus Carlsen in that game was obliged to play to win, it was his penultimate white. (6)And there was a psychological trap. (7) The obvious sacrifice of the piece, the knight's move on f2, we both saw, but I was sure that Magnus would not "yawn" so primitively. (8) So I didn't really count this move. (9) Maybe I was too respectful to Carlsen, and I should have behaved more brazenly," Karjakin said. (10) The meeting was held in New York from November 11 to 30. (11) Out of the 12 main games, 10 opponents drew. (12) they also won one victory each. (13) the fate of the title was decided on a tie-break, where carlsen was stronger. (14) Later, the Russian grandmaster announced his intention to fight for the chess crown in 2018. (15) The twelfth World chess champion Anatoly Karpov cited Karlsen's superior speed of thinking as the reason for Karjakin's defeat. (16) According to the grandmaster, the Russian "became nervous and lost the freshness that is necessary for fights of this level.""
(1) Актёр Крис Пратт, сыгравший главную: (1) Actor Chris Pratt, who played the main role in the highest-grossing film of the year at the moment "Jurassic World", chose his favorite meme from the many samples of Internet humor dedicated to the picture, reports Cinemablend. (1) Художник Андрей Кузькин показал перф: (1) Artist Andrey Kuzkin showed a performance in the framework of his project "Natural phenomenon, or 99 landscapes with a tree" in Voronezh. (2) The author undressed and buried himself upside down in a snowdrift in the center of the city. (3) this is reported by the voronezh newspaper "moe!" (4) andrey kuzkin presented a photo from the performance on february 2 at the local gallery "h. l. a. m.", where his personal exhibition "attachments"is taking place. (5) The author said that he was inspired by the work of his father, the artist Alexander Kuzkin, "99 landscapes with a tree". (6) in addition, according to kuzkin jr., in his youth he composed a poem: "i want to fall from the floor and stick my head in the asphalt, so that then i can swing my legs like trees with branches." (7) in the framework of the project "natural phenomenon, or 99 landscapes with a tree", naked kuzkin or other volunteers are buried in the ground up to their shoulders in different parts of the world. (8) Thus, according to the author, the body becomes like a tree. (9) Voronezh was the 36th city where Kuzkin showed his performance. (10) Before that, the artist's work was seen, in particular, by residents of Cape Town, Berlin, Kiev, Moscow, New York, London, Krasnoyarsk. (11) andrey kuzkin was born in moscow in 1979. (12) he first drew attention to himself in 2008, when during the youth biennale "stop! Who goes? "showed several works at once, including the installation "A Place where no one bothers" and the performance "In a Circle", during which Kuzkin kneaded cement with his feet until it solidified. (13) For this work Kuzkin received the state prize in the field of contemporary art "Innovation".
\"(1) Заместителю начальника Московского: "(1) Grigory Dymovets, Deputy Head of the Moscow Investigation Department for Transport of the UPC of the Russian Federation, has been charged with taking a particularly large bribe involving extortion. (5) While receiving 500 thousand on May 25, he was caught red-handed. (6) In total, the investigator extorted $ 4 million, the prosecution alleges. (7) Dymovets himself does not plead guilty and claims that he was framed by the persons involved in the smuggling case. (8) On May 27, the Basmanny Court arrested the investigator, and his lawyer has already filed a complaint against this decision. (9) Earlier media reported that Dumovec investigated the case on the import into Russia of meat on fake documents. (10) The organizer of the smuggling was a US citizen Mikhail Greenberg, who fraudulently obtained licenses for preferential import of meat from the Ministry of Economic Development. (11) Five employees of the Federal Customs Service assisted him in the deliveries. (12) The criminal case was initiated in February 2010. \"(1) Фильм Алексея Учителя \"Край\" пол: "(1) Alexey Uchitel's film" Edge "won the main film award" Nika " for 2010. \"(1) Дефицит инвестпрограммы РЖД в ближ: "(1) The deficit of the Russian Railways investment program in the next five years will amount to 710 billion rubles. (2) This was stated by the president of the monopoly Vladimir Yakunin, Vedomosti writes. (3) Yakunin did not specify how such a figure was formed. (4) according to vadim morozov, vice-president of russian railways, the company's domestic transportation is declining, and it will not return to the pre-crisis level until 2013, which makes it difficult for the company to find internal resources for investment. (5) The amount of underinvested funds since 2001 is estimated at 2 trillion rubles. (6) The total volume of the Russian Railways investment program until 2015 is unknown. (7) In 2009-2011, it was planned to invest 1.8 trillion rubles, but due to the crisis, the plan was halved. (8) In 2010, the size of the investment program is 270.5 billion rubles. (9) At the same time, in February, Vladimir Yakunin reported that the company needs state support in the amount of 400 billion rubles in the next five years. (10) It is still not clear what kind of state aid Russian Railways wants. (11) As the publication notes, railway workers can ask not only for direct subsidies, but also for additional indexation of tariffs. (12) According to Yakunin, however, the company has no such plans. (13) It is expected that the indexation of tariffs in 2011 will be 9.2 percent. (14) Russian Railways is the operator of railway infrastructure in Russia and one of the largest transport companies in the world. (15) The company is fully owned by the state and produces about 2.5 percent of Russia's GDP."
(1) Варавва, мальтийский еврей, сидит в: (1) Barabbas, a Maltese Jew, sits in his office in front of a pile of gold and waits for the arrival of ships with goods. (2) He reflects aloud that everyone hates him for his good fortune, but honors him for his wealth: "So let it be better / Everyone hates the rich Jew more than the poor Jew! " (3) He sees in Christians only malice, lies and pride, which do not fit in with their teaching, and those Christians who have a conscience live in poverty. (4) He rejoices that the Jews have captured more wealth than the Christians. (5) When Barabbas learns that the Turkish fleet has approached the coast of Malta, he is not worried: neither peace nor war touches him, only his own life, the life of his daughter and the goods he has acquired are important to him. (6) Malta has long been paying tribute to the Turks, and Barabbas suggests that the Turks have increased it so much that the Maltese have nothing to pay, so the Turks are going to take the city. (7) but barabbas took precautions and hid his treasures, so that he was not afraid of the coming of the turks. (8) the son of the turkish sultan kalimat and the pasha demand payment of tribute for ten years. (9) The Governor of Malta, Farnese, does not know where to get so much money, and confers with his confidants. (10) they ask for a delay to collect money from all residents of malta. (11) Kalimat gives them a month's respite. (12) Farnese decides to collect tribute from the Jews: everyone must give half of their property; whoever refuses will be immediately baptized, and whoever refuses to give half of their property and be baptized will lose all their goods.

(1)Не бывает абсолютно одинаковых и совс: (1) There are no absolutely identical and completely incompetent people!(2)everyone is born with the stamp of some talent. (3)the need for creativity is as natural as the need to drink or eat; it lingers in each of us, even in the most incredibly difficult conditions. (4) Each person is talented and unique in his own way. (5)people who are absolutely bad inwardly and outwardly, fortunately, do not exist. (6) That the need for creativity is inherent in everyone is evident at least from the fact that in childhood, even in infancy, the child has a need for play. (7)Every child wants to play, that is, to live creatively. (8) Why does creativity gradually disappear from our lives over the years, why is the creative principle not preserved and developed in each of us?(9)Roughly speaking, because we either did not do our job (did not find ourselves, our face, our talent), or did not learn to live and work (did not develop talent). (10)The second often depends on the first, but the first is not always free from the second. (11)If you do not learn to work, you will never know what nature has given you. (12) If the spiritual potential is weak, then the personality is erased, leveled, and quickly loses individual, inherent in it one feature. (13)Harmonious ascent, creative emancipation of the individual can prevent any mental, family, social or world discord, any turmoil, which, by the way, are different. (14)For example, it is one thing when there are no shoes to go to school (or even the school itself), and quite another when you are forced to learn musical literacy. (15)Of course, the second case is preferable, but discord is discord. (16)Therefore, we see that social orientation is by no means always infallible, and that fashion is generally harmful in such a matter as the matter of finding oneself. (17)Why, in fact, is only the life of an artist or artist considered creative?(18)After all, you can be an artist and an artist in any business. (By V. Belov*)
(1) Народный артист Украины, певец Иво Б: (1) People's Artist of Ukraine, singer Ivo Bobul said that Kiev should have fought for the Crimea. (2) This was announced on Wednesday, August 3, according to the Apostrophe portal. (3) "I think at least it was possible to try. (4) I understand what I am talking about, I understand what was then, what state everything was in. (5) But still not so easy to take raised their hands and passed. (6) I don't know. (7) Maybe I'm talking some nonsense now, but it seems to me that it would be possible to do something differently," the artist said in response to a question whether he believes that Ukraine should have fought for the peninsula in 2014. (8) Bobul added that Crimea "has always been drawn to Russia", but at the same time, in his opinion, has never been Russian. (9)" People were hammered into their heads, they wrote a song, " — this is how the artist explained the desire of the inhabitants of Crimea to be citizens of the Russian Federation. (10) He was referring to the song "Legendary Sevastopol", written in 1954 by Vano Muradeli and Pyotr Gradov and which became the national anthem of Sevastopol in 1994. (11) Ivo Bobul is 63 years old. (12) He started as a restaurant artist, in his youth he sang in VIA Cheremosh and Zhiva Voda. (13) In 2004, the Kharkiv group "Tanok na Maidan Kono" released an ironic song dedicated to the singer "Ivo Bobul", after which the artist became a cult figure in Ukraine. (14) Crimea became part of Russia in March 2014 after a referendum in which a majority of those who voted supported this decision. (15) Kiev refused to recognize the results of the plebiscite. (16) Moscow emphasizes that the procedure for the annexation of Crimea was in accordance with international law.
(1) Во время прогулки Алька встретила св: (1) during the walk, alka met her friends: her neighbor, peka kamenny, who did not immediately recognize her, in a car that he had long dreamed of; she played her teacher evlampia nikiforovna, went to the almost completed new club, where she liked everything very much. (2) I met my friends, helped them mow the hay, and then fun and screeching bathed in the river. (3) Alka was very happy to return to her native village atmosphere. (4) at home, at dinner, alya discussed everything with the old women gathered in her aunt's house: pensions, icons, berries, the benefits of living water... (5) then they went with anisya for berries. (6) In the forest, a special smell of leaves reminded Ale of her late mother and made her sad... (7) But when she went out on the road, she met Peka again and, having talked with him, was distracted from the memories of her mother. (8) returning from a walk, alka met the old woman khristoforovna. (9) She said that the path to the river was renamed Paladin's Path in honor of Alina's mother. (10) She was still a hard worker — no one has walked this path as much as she has. (11) When she reached the bakery where her mother worked, Alka was sad again, because this bakery brought her mother to the grave. (12) She stood and waited for her mother to appear in the window. (13) But this did not happen, and Alya went to the local store.
\"(1) В американском штате Огайо задержа: "(1) In the US state of Ohio, a man was detained who tried to bring weapons, knives and ammunition to the evening screening of the Batman movie. (8) According to police, the detainee-37-year-old Scott Smith (Scott Smith) - does not have a permit to carry a weapon. (9) smith's reasons for bringing the gun to the movie theater are not reported. (10) It is known that after the arrest of the man, the police searched his house. (11) There is no information on the results of the search. (15) He is charged with 142 counts."
(1) В то время как художник работал над: (1) While the artist was working on the painting, his daughter became sadder and sadder. (2) The inhabitants of the palace wondered whether the reason for her sadness was in mournful thoughts about her father or in love's longing. (3) It was soon rumored that His Lordship was seeking her love. (4) One night, as the narrator was walking along the gallery, Yoshihide the monkey suddenly ran up to her and began to pull at the hem of her skirt. (5) The narrator went in the direction in which the monkey was pulling her, and opened the door to the room from which the voices were heard. (6) yoshihide's half-dressed daughter rushed out of the room, and the sound of retreating footsteps was heard in the background. (7) The girl was in tears, but did not name the person who wanted to dishonor her. (8) About twenty days after this incident, Yoshihide came to the palace and asked for an audience with His Lordship. (9) he complained that he could not finish the picture of the torments of hell. 10 He wanted to depict in the middle of the screen, as a carriage falls from above, and in it, a graceful court lady writhing in agony, her black hair caught in flames. (11) But an artist cannot draw something he has never seen, so Yoshihide asked His Lordship to burn the carriage in front of him.
(1) Эля не унывает и решает заняться про: (1) Elya is not discouraged and decides to start producing ink. (2) Smeared like hell, the whole family produced so much ink that there is no place to put furniture, as the whole house is occupied with bottles, as if there was an ink famine. (3) Motl sees his mother laughing for the first time. (4) but the ink is going badly, and the money is mostly invested in bottles, and ale decides to sell the bottles. (5) To do this, he pours ink at night, accidentally pouring stockings that a neighbor hung on the fence. (6) The Motla family must now pay damages. (7) The next batch of ink Ale pours into the river. (8) But now it is impossible to wash in the river, and horses cannot drink water from it. Elya decides to take up the production of a powder that removes rats, mice and all other evil spirits. (9) At first, customers come, but Motl accidentally spills a bag of powder, and everyone in the neighborhood starts sneezing. (10) Comrade Eli, the short-sighted and absent-minded Pinya, whose tie is always on his back, one leg is pulled up, and who steps on his own feet when walking, burns the book.
(1) Детство у меня было замечательным. (: (1) I had a wonderful childhood. (2) As a child, there was no money, there was no interesting work, but all this is a matter of profit. (Z)But in childhood there was a father and mother. (4) In our family, the father has always reigned with his unquestionable authority. (5) There was no place for a mother in boys ' games. (6) Of course, without her breakfasts, lunches and dinners, I could not live, but it was so ordinary that it was unnoticeable... (7) Tenderness was not accepted in our family. (8) We did not kiss my mother before going to bed and did not speak in a fit of emotion:— I love you... (9) Did I say this to her at least once? (10) Life was so full of important things that there was no room for the usual: I ran home for a minute, had a snack — and again to where friends, games and passions are. (11) I was ninety percent of my mother's worries, but I didn't notice them, just as we don't feel or see the air we breathe at all. (12) My mother and I lived side by side, but as if in different worlds. (13) These worlds came into contact only once, when there was a story that turned out to be more interesting than all the adventures and adventures: playing football, shooting with a samopal and launching rockets. (14) Usually my mother spent time at the stove, in the bathroom or on the couch — reading books, I remember crying over Dostoevsky's "Poor People". (15) But sometimes she would suddenly jump up from the sofa, full of energy and ready for feats. (16) She was attracted to business activity, her mother was full of the most daring business plans. (17) She liked to say: "We lived poorly-enough!" (18) But her business was usually limited to dreams and laughter: she shared her plans with her relatives, and they made fun of her. (19) And yet one day my mother was able to captivate me with her plan: it was about flying on an airplane! (20) I was assigned the role of assistant: in the morning she bought three buckets of cherries at our bazaar, we boarded the plane and in half an hour we were already in the regional center, where the same cherries could be sold with considerable profit! (by Yu. nechiporenko)
(1) Трейлер первого художественного филь: (1) The trailer for the first feature film about American musician Jimi Hendrix All Is by My Side is published on the xlrator Media multiplatform. (2) The film was first shown in 2013 at the Toronto Film Festival, but it will be presented to the general public in September 2014. (3) The role of the musician in this film was performed by a member of the hip-hop duo Outkast Andre Benjamin, also known as Andre 3000. (4) The film tells about the early stage in the work of Hendrix-performances in New York clubs, life in London, relationships with friends Linda Keats and Katie Etchingham and the preparation of the first album Are You Experienced. (5) Since the project was not approved by Experience Hendrix, which owns the rights to Hendrix's musical legacy, no original songs by the guitarist were included in the film. (6) Instead, the tape features covers of songs by The Beatles and Muddy Waters. (7)Attempts have already Been Made To remove the Biography Of the musician. (8) In particular, eddie murphy and will smith wanted to play hendrix. (9) Director Paul Greengrass also showed interest in the project. (10) However, the Greengrass tape was never put into production.In 2009, Time magazine named Hendrix the greatest guitarist of all time. (11) Experts call the musician one of the most inventive and virtuosic guitarists in the history of rock. (12) His name is on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
\"(1) Заместитель начальника одного из о: "(1) the deputy head of one of the departments of the criminal investigation department of the ministry of internal affairs of russia, dmitry maksimov, was found guilty of aiding and abetting the murder of lawyer sergei biryukov. (1) Определился первый финалист Открытог: (1) The first finalist of the French Open Tennis Championship (Roland Garros) in men's singles was determined. (5) Sederling's match with Berdych lasted three and a half hours. (6) The Swedish tennis player lost in games with a score of 1: 2, but turned the tide of the match and won in five sets. (7) Final score of the meeting - 6:3, 3:6, 5:7, 6:3, 6:3. (8) In the final, Söderling will play the winner of the second semi-final, which will meet Spaniard Rafael Nadal and Austrian Jurgen Melzer. (13) Italy's Francesca Schiavone and Australia's Samantha Stosur will compete in the women's singles final at Roland Garros. (14) Their match will take place on June 5.
\"(1) Участник митинга оппозиции в Петер: "(1) A participant of the opposition rally in St. Petersburg, who was injured on July 31 by the actions of the police, identified the so-called "pearl ensign". (1) Итальянский журналист Доменико Кирик: (1) Italian journalist Domenico Quirico, who was abducted in Syria in April, has been released. (2) this was reported on september 8 by reuters with reference to the italian authorities. (3) The Belgian teacher and writer Pierre Piccinin, who was kidnapped along with Kiriko, was also released. (4) Both men, according to Agence France-Presse, have already flown to Rome. (5) Chirico and Puchinin, which together came to Syria, was kidnapped in early April. (6) In June, Kiriko, according to BBC News, was able to contact his wife by phone and report that he was alive. (7) No group has yet claimed responsibility for the abduction. (8) For 62-year-old Domenico Chirico, a well-known Italian military journalist for the newspaper La Stampa, this abduction was not the first. (9) The last time he was abducted, along with three other Italian journalists, was in Libya in August 2011. (10) The abductees then spent about a day in an apartment in Tripoli, after which they were released. (11) Who exactly was behind the abduction was also not reported. (12) According to the Committee to Protect Journalists, Syria has recently become the most dangerous place in the world for media workers. (13) In 2012 alone, 39 correspondents were killed and 21 journalists abducted in the country. (14) Both government forces and insurgents are behind the attacks. (15) The Syrian civil war has been going on since March 2011. (16) During this time, more than 100 thousand people were killed during the confrontation between supporters and opponents of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in the country.
\"(1) Арбитражный суд Москвы 28 февраля: "(1) The Moscow Arbitration Court on February 28 ruled that NTV should pay actress Tatyana Vasilyeva compensation in the amount of 50 thousand rubles. (14) the fees of the film "new year's tariff" in the cis amounted to four million dollars. (15) product placement (hidden advertising) cost mts 11.3 million rubles."
(1) Прежде всего Берлах приказывает держ: (1) First of all, Berlach orders to keep the story of the murder a secret, despite the disagreement of his chief Lutz. (1) Спецподразделения Воздушно-десантных: (1) The special forces of the Airborne Forces have adopted more than 30 sniper rifles manufactured by the Austrian company Steyr Mannlicher. (2) This, as reported by RIA Novosti, was stated by the representative of the Russian Ministry of Defense for the Airborne Forces, Colonel Alexander Kucherenko. (3) According to him, the Mannlicher rifles were the first such foreign-made weapons to enter the Airborne Forces. (4) The purchase of Austrian small arms has been carried out since the end of 2010. (5) The supply of new sniper rifles to the special forces and reconnaissance units of the Airborne Forces will continue in the future. (6) The military has already been retrained for new weapons at interregional training centers and at the Ministry of Defense sniper courses. (7) Which rifles were adopted by the special forces of the Airborne Forces, Kucherenko did not specify. (8) According to the Steyr Mannlicher product catalog, the Austrian company currently produces SSG 04, SSG 08, SSG 69, SSG Elite and HS.80 sniper rifles. (9) Currently, the Airborne Forces generally use SVD, SDS and VSS sniper rifles. (10) Speaking about the supply of other types of weapons and military equipment, Kucherenko spoke about the renewal of the fleet of unmanned aerial vehicles. (11) What kind of vehicles entered the service of the military is not specified. (12) In addition, the paratroopers received 20 sets of radar reconnaissance stations, 35 laser reconnaissance devices and several sets of new portable ground reconnaissance stations.
(1) Парфюмерно-косметическая компания Es: (1) Perfume and cosmetics company Estée Lauder has released a new collection of lip polishes Pure Color Envy Sculpting Lacquer. (2) The line consists of three shades of nail polish, which can be used both independently and in combination with lipstick. (6) In addition to the complex with hyaluronic acid, the varnish contains polymer compounds that retain moisture and form a barrier that protects the lips from discoloration or tarnish for six hours. (7) In addition to nail polish, the new Pure Color Envy collection includes lip glosses Pure Color Envy Sculpting Gloss (13 creamy and shimmering shades). (8) estée lauder was founded in 1946 in the united states by estée lauder and her husband joseph lauder. (9) specializes in the production of perfumes and cosmetics for women and men. (10) in 1968, the company launched the clinique brand, specializing in hypoallergenic products. (11) Estée Lauder currently owns the brands M. A. C, Aveda, Darphin, etc. (12) Estée Lauder retired in 1995, but her descendants are involved in the management of the company.
(1) Украинский спортсмен Вадим Титушко,: (1) ukrainian athlete vadim titushko, convicted of beating two journalists in kiev, will compete at the world cup in mixed martial arts. (1) Это было давным – давно, когда много: (1) It was a long time ago, when many things in our world were different. (2) The rivers flowed in a different direction, the mountains were in a different place, and the tigers were quite different. (3) they had the same claws , the same teeth, but the skin was not the same. (4) The skin of the tigers was a bright, fiery red, one of the most beautiful skins among all animals. (5) But the use of such a beautiful skin was very little. (6) The tiger was visible both day and night, in the bushes and on the plain, everywhere it was given out by a bright color. (7) It has been a long time since he had a good hunt. (8) And one day the tiger, meeting a zebra, began a conversation with her: - Tell me zebra, why do you walk on the plain calmly and are not afraid of me?  asked the tiger. (9) - I see you from afar, and I know that I can easily hide from you behind the branches by jumping into the bushes. (10) After all, I do not just go all in stripes. (1)Я знала замечательную писательницу. (: (1) i knew a wonderful writer. (2)her name WAS tamara g. gabbe. (3)she told me once: – there are Many trials in Life, You can Not List Them. (4) but here are three, they are common. (5)the first is The test of need. (6)The second is prosperity, glory. (7) And the third test is fear. (8) And not only by the fear that a man learns in war, but by the fear that overtakes him in ordinary, peaceful life. (9) What is this fear that threatens neither death nor injury? (10)is it not an invention? (11)No, not fiction: fear is many-sided, sometimes it strikes the fearless. (12)"An amazing thing," wrote the Decembrist poet Ryleev, "we are not afraid to die on the battlefields, but we are afraid to say a word in favor of justice." (13)Many years have passed since these words were written, but there are persistent diseases of the soul. (14)A man went through the war like a hero: he went to intelligence, where every step threatened him with death, fought in the air and under water, did not run from danger, fearlessly went to meet it. (15)And now the war was over, a man returned home to his family, to his peaceful work, worked as well as he fought: with passion giving all the strength, not sparing health. (16)But when his friend, a man whom he knew as himself, and of whose innocence he was convinced as of his own, was removed from the work of a slanderer, he did not intercede... (17)Courage is One thing. (18)It requires that a person be able to overcome the monkey in himself always: in battle, on the street, at a meeting. (19)After all, the word "courage" does not have a plural. (20)It is one in all conditions. (For The F. A. Vigdorova)

(1)Позвольте напомнить известное изречен: (1) Let me remind you of a well-known saying: "Where is our wisdom lost in knowledge? Where is our knowledge lost in information? " (2)The highest thing a person can achieve is wisdom. (3) It should be a school subject, wisdom should be taught. (4)More precisely, wisdom should be taught — as to the caution of judgments, refraining from insufficiently substantiated statements, the ability to take into account many factors, based on what is born of a variety of historical experience. (5)it's more than knowledge. (b)It is also intuition, and an aversion to self-deception. (7)A wise man is never presumptuous: he does not consider the results of his reflections to be final, he admits their fallacy, comparing them with directly opposite statements and finding gaps in what seemed indisputable. (8)Wisdom needs knowledge, but it is not limited to it. (9)someone may know, for example, all the varieties of butterflies and do not understand anything about environmental problems. (10)not even interested in them. (11)In this case, the person loses sight of the connection of a single butterfly with the structure of the world. (12) 3knaniya answer the question " Why?", and information-only to the questions " What? Where? When? how? " (13)Knowledge consists of "understandings" and is the property of science. (14)Knowledge needs information, but it is not limited to it — it is higher, because it knows how to verify the accuracy of information. (15)Knowledge in the European and now in the global scientific tradition has always been opposed to opinion. (16)Opinion is only a certain relation to something, and knowledge is, I repeat, an understanding of a pattern. (17)It is important not so much to defend your opinion by all means, but to think about how it should be proved, even if it aspires to become knowledge. (18)The desire to encourage baseless opinions as an end in itself is very dangerous for a growing person. (19)It is not enough to think independently — you still need to think correctly. (20) it turns out that one's own thought requires a long and painful argument with oneself, an internal strict requirement of checks and rechecks, building long chains of reasoning — this is serious work. (By B. Bim-Badu*)

(4) The Statue of Liberty was polished and a new torch was returned to replace the old one stolen in 2011. (5) According to the museum management, the restored sculpture will be better preserved in the museum. (6) A replica of the American Statue of Liberty was created in 1889 by French sculptor Frederic Auguste Bartholdi. (7) He also made the original sculpture three years earlier, given to the United States by France. (8) A bronze French statue about three meters high is a smaller copy of the original, which is 46 meters high. (9) Since the statue was installed in the Luxembourg Gardens, the Musee d'Orsay in Paris has been fighting for the right to include it in its collection. (10) However, the Senate did not agree to move the sculpture for many years. (11)It was only after the statue's torch was stolen in September 2011 that the Senate allowed the museum to'Orsay included it in his collection. (12) There are four copies of the Statue of Liberty in Paris. (13) A second, larger copy is located on the Swan Island near the Eiffel Tower. (14) A third copy is kept in the Museum of Arts and Crafts, and another is located on a barge standing on the right bank of the Seine.

(7)The antiquary turned out to be a relatively young man of pleasant appearance, lively, sociable and endearing. (8)" Well, show me what you have here, " he looked around in a masterly manner. (9)Anna Vyacheslavovna showed the statuette. (10)"What's this?» "What is it?" he continued, shoveling more and more objects out of the slide. (11)Anna Vyacheslavovna stammered that she was not going to sell anything else, she would only live to retire. (12) " And before the next pension, call me again? (13)Let's create a reserve so that you have a small capital for a rainy day," the young man sounded convincing. (14) there was no strength to resist. (15)After all, she thought, her son would still sell and give away everything after her death, and he wouldn't take it to Leningrad. (16) The young man was calculating something on a calculator, checking the dishes for cracks. (17)"That's all for this-fifteen thousand three hundred rubles," he said. (18) From the amount mentioned, Anna Vyacheslavovna felt slightly dizzy. (19)To gain some time for reflection, she offered the young man some tea. (20)While they drank tea, she told the young man her life. (According To N. S. Lytvynets'*)

\"(1) 24 члена правительства Москвы пода: "(1) 24 members of the Moscow government filed a lawsuit against the leader of the LDPR, Deputy Speaker of the State Duma Vladimir Zhirinovsky and the VGTRK TV company, ITAR-TASS reports. \"(1) Канадский порноактер Лука Рокко Ма: "(1) Canadian porn actor Luca Rocco Magnotta, who was detained in Berlin on suspicion of murdering and dismembering a lover, appeared before a judge, reports Agence France-Presse, citing the German prosecutor's office. (1) На полках лаборатории Лоуренс-Беркли: (1) On the shelves of the Lawrence Berkeley laboratory found forgotten in 1970 test tubes with lunar dust. (2) Three grams of lunar dust distributed in 20 test tubes were considered lost during the experiments. (3) Details of this story are provided by the Washington Post. (4) The test tubes were found in a storage room in April 2013. (5) They were dated "July 24, 1970" and next to them was a scientific paper on the properties of lunar dust. (6) earlier, in 1969, the dust was collected and delivered by the crew of apollo 11, after which part of it was sent for analysis to the laboratory of the 1961 nobel laureate in chemistry malvin calvin. (7) Out of 68 grams of dust, 50 were returned to NASA, and 18 were, until recently, assumed to have been irretrievably spent during experiments to search for carbon compounds. (8) It is already difficult to reconstruct the events of 1970, but researchers suggest that there was no malicious intent in the actions of Calvin and his colleagues. (9) Valuable material was not hidden from other scientific groups, but simply forgotten. (10) the employee of the archive, karen nelson, who discovered the test tubes, has already handed them over to nasa and there the find was recognized as still interesting for science. (11) The dust found on the shelves of the storeroom consists of lunar breccia: this is only 25 percent of the Apollo 11 samples. (12) Geologists call breccia a rock formed by cemented fragments of stones. (13) Most of the lunar dust collected by the astronauts is finely ground basalt. (14) As part of the entire Apollo program, more than three hundredweight of lunar rocks were delivered to Earth.

(1) Повествователь примеряет своему геро: (1) the narrator tries on his hero's stories like dresses. (2) The novel begins with Enderlin being involved in a car accident and nearly running over eleven school children. (3) As he sat behind the wheel, he apparently thought about the invitation to give a few lectures at Harvard that he had received shortly before. (4) He loses the desire to perform in front of friends and all around him in the role of a forty — year-old doctor of philosophy, and he decides to change his image, chooses a new role for himself-the role of a blind man, and names himself Gantenbein. (5) He acquires all the attributes of a blind person: glasses, a wand, a yellow armband and a blind person's certificate, which gives him a legal opportunity to gain a foothold in society in this image. (6) From now on, he sees in people what they would never have allowed him to see if they had not considered him blind. (7) The true nature of all those with whom he communicates, whom he loves, is revealed to him. (8) His dark glasses become an element that splits truth and falsehood. (9) It is convenient for people to communicate with someone in front of whom they do not need to put on a mask, who does not see too much. (10) By pretending to be blind, Gantenbein tries to free himself, in particular, from the vulgar jealousy that was characteristic of him before. (11) After all, the blind man does not see, does not see much: looks, smiles, letters, those who are near his beloved woman. (12) His appearance changes, but does his essence change?
(1) Однажды, когда Кэсс, по обыкновению,: (1) One day, when Cass comes home late, as usual, Richard calls her out for a frank conversation, and the straightforward Cass tells everything as it is: about her doubts about their marriage, and about her relationship with Eric. (2) Cass is shocked by her husband's reaction: there is so much anguish in his eyes that she suddenly has hope — what if their love is not dead? (3) Now they both have a lot to reconsider and change their minds in order to save what is left of the old love, and maybe even revive it. (4) Ida also confesses to Vivaldo that she has been unfaithful, but the confession is harder for her than for Cass. (5) She has an excuse-an attraction to Eric, she respects him, their feelings are at least sincere — but Ida has essentially sold herself. (6) Gritting her teeth, she tells Vivaldo with a stony face what it means to be a black girl in a world dominated by white men. (7) When Rufus committed suicide, Ida decided that she would not go his way, but would be able to resist the world and get what she wanted from it, in any way. (8) When Ellis appeared, Ida realized that after the affair with him, if she behaved wisely, she would mean something in herself. (9) After parting with Ellis, she returned to Vivaldo, hating and despising herself, and, approaching the house, prayed that the beloved was absent. (10) So it went on until the evening when a musician in the orchestra, a friend of her late brother, called her a black litter for whites. (11) And then she decided: everything! (12) Whether Vivaldo stays with her or not, she will not return to Ellis anyway.
(1) Около пятидесяти православных верующ: (1) About fifty Orthodox believers held a procession against the musical "Jesus Christ — Superstar"in Lipetsk on February 6. (2)This is reported on the website of the Lipetsk Time shopping mall. (3) They opposed the rock opera being staged at the local drama theater, calling the musical "God-fighting". (4) The Rock Opera will be staged on February 18 by the St. Petersburg theater "Rock Opera". (5) The protesters intend to go to the rally again on February 10 and 15, as reported to the townspeople in leaflets. (6) In October last year, Orthodox activists in Rostov-on-Don tried to disrupt the theater's tour with the same performance. (7) Dissatisfied believers filed a complaint with the prosecutor's office, saying that the musical offended their feelings. (8) At the same time, the Rostov Diocese opposed the ban on rock opera. (9) Church representatives called the activists ' demands "a drift towards sectarianism." (10) As a result, on October 18, the musical still took place on the stage of the Rostov theater. (11) The rock opera "Jesus Christ is a Superstar" was written in 1970 by Andrew Lloyd Webber. (12) A year later, the musical was performed on stage, with the title role performed by Deep Purple vocalist Ian Gillan. (13) In 1973, the rock opera was adapted into a film directed by Norman Jewison. (14) The Rock Opera Theatre first staged a musical in Russian in 1990 in St. Petersburg. (15) It is worth noting that in the 70s and 80s the opera was banned in the USSR as containing religious propaganda.
(1) Владелец похоронной компании из Ирла: (1) The owner of a funeral company from Ireland, David McGowan, bought a decommissioned Boeing 767 aircraft previously operated by Transaero to turn it into a hotel. (2) This is reported by the Irish Independent. (3) the man spent 20 thousand euros on the purchase of the liner. (4) In the future, he plans to place the aircraft on his site in the village of Enniscron (County Sligo)and make it a hotel. (5) "I have a 15-acre plot in a swampy area, and I've been thinking for a long time about what to do with it. (6) I studied a variety of unusual properties. (7) And I got the idea that I could make a hotel out of an airplane," McGowan said. (8) In search of a suitable airliner, the man contacted three nearby airports. (9) In Dublin and Cork, the entrepreneur did not find anything, but the Shannon Aviation Company (County Clare) agreed to sell him the desired aircraft. (10) It is noted that now the entrepreneur faces a difficult task-to deliver the liner from Shannon to Enniskron. (11) The weight of the aircraft is 70 tons and the length is 55 meters. (12) Initially, McGowan wanted to transport it on public roads, but it turned out that 126 high-voltage wires, 26 traffic lights and other infrastructure objects would prevent the plane from traveling. (13) Now the businessman plans to deliver the Boeing 767 to Sligo by sea. (14) To do this, he needs to wait for the seasonal increase in water levels, which will occur from 21 to 26 March.
\"(1) Группировка наемных убийц в состав: "(1) a group of hired killers consisting of three performers and two intermediaries was neutralized by law enforcement officers of the moscow region. (1) Задумала старая росомаха со своим ст: (1) The old wolverine and her old man decided to look for new places to live. (2) A rumor has passed that there are many animals and more food beyond the river. (3) So they decided to take their chum and all their goods across the river and settle there. (4) Wolverine's husband went into the forest to tear up birch bark to sew a boat. (5) And the old woman put her goods in a bag and sat down on the bank to wait for him. (6) She looks-a boat is floating on the river, and a fox is in it. (7) The fox came to wolverine, found out what was going on, and offered to transport the bags of goods in his boat. (8) The wolverine rejoiced, grabbed the bags and dragged them into the boat. (9) Up to the edges of the luggage was collected. (10) Wolverine wants to sit on the scrip herself. (11) - Wait, - says the fox, - you can drown. (12) First I will move things, and then you. (13) The fox pushed off from the shore with an oar and swam with the current.
(1) Дома Татарский заправил планшетку бу: (1) At home, Tatarsky filled the tablet with paper, laid his hands on it and summoned the spirit of Che Guevara. (2) He wanted to learn something new about advertising from the spirit. (3) The planchette wrote all night and produced a text under the heading "Identialism as the highest stage of dualism." (4) In the text it was said that the dark age has come, the human environment is no longer divided into subjects and objects, as it was before. (5) An object of a different nature appeared — the TV turned on. (6) While watching programs, "a virtual subject of this mental process appears, which for the duration of the TV program exists instead of a person, entering his consciousness like a hand in a rubber glove." (7) Che Guevara compared this to being possessed by a spirit, with the difference that the spirit does not exist. (8) "Object number two, that is, the TV turned on, corresponds to subject number two, that is, the virtual viewer", and subject number two is absolutely unreal. (9) When zapping (fast switching from channel to channel), "the TV turns into a remote control for the viewer", and is "the main way of influencing the advertising and information field on consciousness". (10) Thus, the subject of the second kind (Homo Zapiens, or XZ) itself becomes a TV show.
\"(1) Во вторник, 1 февраля, в Нью-Йорке: "(1) On Tuesday, February 1, the traditional race to the top floor of the famous Empire State Building was held in New York. (2) According to the Associated Press, several hundred people took part in the competition, who had to overcome 1576 steps to reach the 86th floor of the building. (3) The men's event was won by German Thomas Dold from Stuttgart. (4) It showed a result of 10 minutes and 10 seconds. (5) It is noteworthy that a resident of Germany won the vertical race to the 86th floor of the Empire State Building for the sixth time in a row, which was a tournament record. (6) In the women's part of the competition, Alice McNamara, an Australian medical student, won. (7) She climbed 86 flights of stairs in 13 minutes and 3 seconds. (8) For McNamara, participating in the race to the top floor of a New York skyscraper was his debut. (9) "It was just amazing. (10) I hope that I will be able to come and participate in the race next year, " the Australian said. (11) The winner of the 2010 women's race, New Zealand representative Melissa Moon, did not compete in 2011. (12) The oldest participant in the race was 77-year-old Ginette Bedar from Queens. (13) She was able to reach the finish line 22 minutes and 15 seconds after the start of the race. (14) "I decided to run because I knew I could do it. (15) Life is too short to waste, " said the elderly runner."

\"(1) Хроника Первомая: На митинг ЛДПР н: "(1) Chronicle of May Day: About one and a half thousand people gathered for the LDPR rally on Pushkin Square on May 1. (2) This is reported by RIA Novosti with reference to the press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs in Moscow. (3) Party leader Vladimir Zhirinovsky claimed from the stage that at least two thousand people were present at the rally. (4) The central event of the event was Zhirinovsky's speech, in which he promised not to allow any wars or revolutions in Russia. (5) He also noted several times that the LDPR has been waging a political struggle for more than 20 years and criticized the new parties that are now only being registered. (6) The broadcast from Pushkin Square was conducted by the TV channel "Russia 24". (7) Earlier it was reported that Zhirinovsky planned to celebrate his birthday on the square. (8) From the stage, the leader of the LDPR said only that all those gathered at the exit were waiting for gifts (according to Interfax, the gifts were bottles of cologne "Zhirinovsky"). (9) At the end of his speech, Zhirinovsky called on his supporters to come to the rally on November 4. (10) In parallel with the rally on Pushkin Square, a rally of nationalists took place near the Shchukinskaya metro station. (11) Nationalists in the number of approximately 400 people marched from Oktyabrsky Field to Shchukinskaya, where a rally was held. (12) Several other demonstrations took place earlier in Moscow. (13) The largest of them was a march of trade unions led by Prime Minister Vladimir Putin and President Dmitry Medvedev. (14) In addition, Communists traditionally held rallies in the capital on May 1."
(1) Старик встречает гостей, а Старушка,: (1) The old man greets the guests, and the Old Woman, panting, drags out more and more chairs. (3) Finally the bells stop ringing, but the whole stage is already filled with chairs, and the Old Man asks the belated invisibles to sit along the walls so as not to interfere with the others. (5) The old men make small talk with the guests and call to each other through the crowd. Suddenly, from behind the scenes, there is a hum and fanfare — it is the emperor who has arrived. (6) The old man is beside himself with delight: he orders everyone to stand up and only laments that he cannot get closer to His Majesty — court intrigues, what can you do! (7) But he does not give up and, shouting to the crowd, sharing with precious Emperor experienced suffering: enemies feasted, friends betrayed, beaten with a baton, he put a knife, tripped his leg, did not give visas to, never in my life did not send invitations, destroyed the bridge and ruined the Pyrenees... (8) But descended on him insight: it was forty years ago when he came to kiss Daddy before he went to bed. (9) Then they began to laugh at him and married him-they proved that he was big. (10) Now an orator will appear, will present the saving Message, for the Old Man himself — alas! — he can't really talk.
\"(1) Выступая на круглом столе, посвящё: "(1) speaking at a round table devoted to the problems of russian cinema, the director of" ostrov "and" tsar " pavel lungin said that the quality of domestic films has significantly decreased in recent years. (2) This is reported by RIA Novosti. (3) " apparently, the bulk of our films are of very poor quality. (4) what is surprising, of course, is the terrible level of acting and the terrible level of directing. (5) And the people were not ashamed of what they were doing. (6) It seems that the actors do not watch what they do at all," the agency quotes the director as saying. (7) According to Lungin, domestic films "are poorly invented, the writers are terribly inventive, there are very few original ideas: I see that all these ideas are either stolen, or copied, or rewritten somewhere. (8) And it feels like you've seen it 50 times already." (9) In addition, he added that Russian cinema is devoid of humor and self-irony. (10) According to the Russian director, in order to solve these problems, Russian cinema should turn to the experience of European cinema. (11) For example, Pavel Lungin suggested using Romanian, German and French arthouse. (12) At the end of September 2010, answering questions from readers " Tapes.Ru", a similar statement (about the low quality of Russian cinema) did Aleksey Fedorchenko, the Director of "Buntings" - painting, received the prize of the International Federation of film critics FIPRESCI at the Venice film festival. (13) According to Fedorchenko, low quality movie due to the drop in the quality of film education in Russia."
(1) Да, человек грешен, слаб, жалок, он: (1) Yes, man is sinful, weak, pitiful, a slave to his passions and habits. (1) Теперь в семье как можно чаще старал: (1) Now in the family as often as possible tried to show each other signs of attention with gifts, and with Alena often discussed the upcoming gift to relatives or friends. (2) We tried to make the girl see how close people easily, with pleasure, give each other even what they wanted to take for themselves. (3) My grandmother bought a blouse, estimated — and the size fits, and the face is good. (4) And in the evening I offered my daughter-in-law, to whom this blouse suited more. (5) Another time, my mother came in a new scarf, but she put it on my grandmother's coat, saw how the scarf fits well, and gave it to my grandmother. (6) Perhaps someone will respond dismissively: "Theater!". (7) But what of that theater? (8) Where is it said that in family education "theater" is a less worthy means than "lectures"? (9) It is important that the "play" has a noble content. (10) Quite soon it became clear: Alyona stopped being a "spectator", took out into the yard even the most high-ranking representatives of the puppet society and a smart stroller on thick tires. (11) Even chocolate slices were already shared automatically. (12) From a brand-new embroidery kit, she readily "gave out" to her mother or grandmother a skein of thread of some special, at that time scarce tone.(1Z) From its rich collection of scraps gave very valuable exhibits for finishing or repairing. (14) When Alyona came to school, she was one of those who was the first to share a pen, an eraser, a notebook. (15) She was no longer greedy. (16) It has been noted more than once that in response to the question of sociologists and teachers: "What qualities do you try to bring up in children?" — parents call courage, hard work, will, honesty and much less often — kindness. (17) However, in recent years, kindness has been remembered more often — kindness that resists malice, coldness, and cruelty. (18) but the word "good" also has another meaning: "not greedy, generous." (19) The most ordinary and also very necessary meaning for life. (By G. L. Mogilevskaya)
(1) Опять я лежу в постели… опять мне не: (1) Again I'm lying in bed... again I can't sleep. (2) The same early summer morning envelops me on all sides; and again the blackbird sings under my window – and the same wound burns in my heart. (3) but the song of the bird does not bring me relief – and i do not think about my wound. (4) I am tormented by other, innumerable, gaping wounds; from them the native, dear blood flows in crimson streams, flows uselessly, senselessly, like rainwater from high roofs on the dirt and filth of the street. (5) Thousands of my brethren, my brethren, are now dying there, far away, under the impregnable walls of fortresses; thousands of brethren, thrown into the open mouth of death by unskilful leaders. (6) They perish without murmuring; they are destroyed without remorse; they do not regret themselves; nor do those unskilful leaders regret them. (7) There are no rightists here, no guilty ones: either the thresher ruffles the sheaves of ears of corn, whether empty or with grain – time will tell. (8) what do my wounds mean? (9) What is the meaning of my suffering? (10) I dare not even cry. (11) But my head burns and my soul freezes – and I, like a criminal, hide my head in the disgusting pillows. (12) Hot, heavy drops make their way, slide down my cheeks... slide on my lips… What is it? (13) Tears... or blood?
