\"(1) Сын Джулиана Ассанжа, основателя с: "(1) The son of Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, has demanded a fair and apolitical trial against his father. (2) he wrote About this in his Twitter account under the pseudonym somnidea. (3) Daniel Assange, who works as a computer programmer, expressed hope that the arrest of his father in the UK is "not a step towards extradition to the United States." (4) According to Assange Jr., he did not see his father for several years, but now he is forced to demand a fair trial when he was "finally" arrested. (5) Daniel was born when Julian Assange was 18 years old. (6) In 1991, his wife (never named in the press) left him with her son. (7) According to Julian Assange's mother, her son distanced himself from the family for their own safety. (8) According to the WikiLeaks founder's lawyers, his son received death threats. (9) Julian Assange was remanded in custody in the UK on December 7. (10) Sweden is seeking his extradition on suspicion of rape and sexual harassment. (11) The court is due to make a decision on extradition in the next three weeks. (12) The Australian Foreign Ministry, according to the Associated Press, has promised to help Assange. (13) Assange himself denies all charges, claiming that his prosecution is related to the publication of classified materials on WikiLeaks. (14) WikiLeaks published a quarter of a million letters from American diplomats, as well as materials about the armed conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan. (15) For this, he was repeatedly criticized by the American authorities."
(1) Молодежная речь отражает неустойчиво: (1) Youth speech reflects the unstable cultural and linguistic state of society, balancing on the edge of literary language and jargon. (2) The so – called general jargon – an understated style of speech that blurs both the norms of language and the norms of speech etiquette - becomes familiar not only in everyday communication, but also sounds on TV and radio. (3) Young people, being the predominant bearer of jargon, make it an element of pop culture, prestigious and necessary for self-expression. (4) What is the element to fight today? (5) How is the carrier population changing today? (6) everything seems to be clear. (7) The object of the struggle is jargon. (8) Jargon – English slang, French argot-a phenomenon characteristic of language development. (9) In different periods of history, communities of people united by a common cause, common interests, and most of all by a sense of brotherhood and alienation from the rest of society, have also invented their own special ways of communication, oral and written. (10) Youth jargon, unlike the jargon of other associations, is characterized, in addition to aloofness, by an emotional and playful beginning. (11) Why, if young people know how to speak correctly, do they speak incorrectly? (12) Why does he prefer to use condemned forms of speech, knowing prestigious, normative ones? (13) (This is exactly a case of jargon, not colloquialism, when a teenager does not know how to do it correctly). (14) Yes, simply because it has a different system of values, a different prestige, a different norm – the antinorm. (15) And in this antinorm, the main principle is an element of shock, a shake – up to shake the people, and an element of ridicule, so that it is not boring, funny, funny. (16) This is a challenge to a prosperous, prosperous society, and rejection of its norms, its patterns, its decencies. (17) Fly away, otpad!– so today's student can express delight, boring music will be called depressnyak, and an exemplary student-a botanist. (18) Young people often use words and expressions, the meaning of which is not fully comprehended and does not seek to comprehend, playing on the external brightness of the image (I'm a sausage; I'll go pokolbashus). (19) And often it is difficult to comprehend, giving rise to chains of words in speech-"parasites", on the fight against which not so long ago teachers focused their main attention. (by l. l. fedorova)
(1) Глава Службы безопасности Украины (С: (1) The head of the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU), Valentin Nalyvaichenko, announced the destruction of a group of people who conducted the shelling of Mariupol on January 24. (10) On January 25, the head of the SBU, Valentin Nalyvaichenko, reported on the detention of a fire spotter in Mariupol, who turned out to be a resident of this city by the name of Kirsanov, who worked until recently as a traffic police inspector. (1) Начальник метрополитена Алма-Аты Кау: (1) The head of the Almaty metro, Kaut Musabekov, resigned at his own request. (2) This is reported by Tengrinews. (3) Musabekov left his position shortly after his subordinates made accusations against him. (4) The charges were contained in a letter recently circulated by the Metropolitan Workers ' Union. (5) The authors of the letter accused the metro chief of violating the laws, nepotism and incompetence. (6) They claimed, in particular, that Musabekov had obtained the dismissal of several highly qualified specialists through threats. (7) The reproaches also concerned Musabekov's sons, who work in the metro. (8) The letter was sent to the Minister of Labor of Kazakhstan Tamara Duissenova, the head of the administration of Alma-Ata Akhmetzhan Yessimov and the deputy head of the ruling Nur Otan party ("Light of the Fatherland") Baurzhan Baibek. (9) In early April, it became known that the city authorities decided to check the charges addressed to Musabekov. (10) A special commission was established for this purpose. (11) According to the press secretary of the head of the city administration, Daniyar Sikhimbayev, some of the charges have already been confirmed (which ones, he did not specify). (12) Aydin Orazkhanov was appointed acting head of the metro. (13) He previously held the position of chief engineer. (14) The metro in Alma-Ata, as noted in the city administration, is operating normally. (15) the metro in alma-ata was launched at the end of 2011. (16) It currently consists of a single line comprising seven stations.
(1) Царицу встретили в Вавилоне с востор: (1) The queen was received with delight in Babylon, the country became calmer, and the Babylonians announced that Astarte would marry the one whom they would choose as king, and this would be the bravest and wisest of the candidates. (2) Each of the pretenders to the throne will have to endure four battles with spears, and then solve the riddles proposed by the magicians. (3) Zadig's armor is white, and the white king wins the first horizontal bar with brilliance. (4) Zadig's opponent, Ithobad, takes possession of his armor by deception at night, leaving Zadig his green ones. (5) In the morning, in the arena, Zadig, clad in green armor, is showered with insulting taunts. (6) the young man is confused, ready to believe that the world is ruled by a cruel fate. (7) wandering along the banks of the euphrates, full of despair, he meets an angel who gives him hope, insists on his return to babylon and the continuation of the competition. (8) zadig easily solves all the riddles of the sages and, to the cheering of the crowd, informs them that ithobad has stolen his armor. (9) the young man is now ready to demonstrate his courage to everyone. (10) and this time he is the winner. (11) zadig becomes king, the consort of astarte, and he is infinitely happy.

(1) Всё было никак не ощутить эту зиму,: (1)there was no way to feel this winter, to enjoy it. (2) and suddenly i looked out the window and was glad: in our yard, which has long been turned into a parking lot, there is a snow woman! (3) Standing, taking the place of someone's iron horse, but standing! (4) With a cheeky carrot nose, funny charcoal eyes, and even painted lips and cheeks. (5) Beauty! (6) and appeared just like a gift for the new year, just before the end of the old one. (7) and this is a gift not only to me, but to everyone. (8) A symbol, though fragile, of good nature, tolerance, joy! (9) Well, now we must do something good ourselves: not just get off with words. (10) " I will take my clothes to some center that helps those in need!» - I decided. (11) Before continuing to gather, I looked out the window once more to look at my inspirer in the part of good deeds, – and so froze. (12) And where is the woman? (13) It seemed to me, an old man. (14) I went down the stairs, pressed the button, opened the iron door, went out into the yard. (15) No, I was dreaming, apparently, half asleep. (16) It was cold, and I ran back – and was stunned. (17) There is my snow woman, at the second half of the door, which is usually closed on a hook. (18) The main thing is to put it carefully – it means that the soul is still alive in people! (19) And, therefore, there is still hope for the best, that kindness will not run out in a person. (20) even In the age of iron horses. (according to V. G. Popov)
(1) А вот и сам автор — каким он себя ви: (1) And here is the author himself — as he sees himself: "dressed in mourning, with a Nazarene beard under a low black hat, I must look strange on the gray rune of Platero." (2) " crazy! - the wails of mischievous gypsies rush after the pensive poet. "i'm crazy!" (3) the author does not take offense when he is teased. (4) on the contrary, he is seized with a strange tenderness for everything around him. (5) the everyday, backwater andalusia opens up to him in its active natural essence. (6) nature, people, and all living beings are connected, linked in the author's perception by this love for his native land. (7) he sees the surroundings of moger's hometown in an infinitely varied change of colors, smells and sounds, in the succession of seasons — from spring to spring, in a round dance of worldly cares and echoing holidays. (8) He immediately confides all his thoughts and impressions to Platero, who listens to him with touching sympathy. (9) The author believes that the donkey understands everything, but does not speak human language, as we do the language of animals. (10) But it gives its owner a lot of joy and sincere warmth. (11) In his notes, Jimenez stops the moments of fast-flowing life in order to feel its charm in a new way; draws unique portraits of fellow countrymen, tells dramatic or funny stories.
(1) Руку, однако, спасти не удаётся, теп: (1) The arm, however, can not be saved, now Harry's right sleeve is pinned to the shoulder. Maria, Harry's wife, has been restless ever since her husband agreed to this last dangerous proposal. (1) За делами людей следят боги. (2) Юно: (1) The gods watch over the affairs of men. (2) Juno and Venus do not love each other, but here they shake hands: Venus does not want further trials for her son, Juno does not want Rome to rise in Italy, threatening her Carthage - let Aeneas remain in Africa! (3) The love of Dido and Aeneas, two exiles, begins, the most human in all ancient poetry. (4) They unite in a thunderstorm, while hunting, in a mountain cave: they use lightning for torches, and the moans of mountain nymphs for a wedding song. (5) This is not good, because Aeneas has a different fate written, and Jupiter is watching this fate. (6) He sends Mercury to Aeneas in a dream: (7)" Don't you dare delay, Italy is waiting for you, and Rome is waiting for your descendants! " (8) Aeneas suffers painfully. (9) "The gods say - I will not leave you by my own will!" he says to Dido, but for a loving woman these are empty words. (10) She prays, "Stay!"; then, " Pause!"; then: "be afraid! if there is Rome and Carthage, then there will be a terrible war between your descendants and mine! " (11) In vain. (12) She sees from the palace tower the distant sails of the Aenean ships, builds a funeral pyre in the palace, and, mounting it, throws herself on the sword.
(1) Украинские военные возобновили полно: (1) The Ukrainian military has resumed full-scale military operations in the south-east of the country. (2) This statement was made by Deputy Prime Minister of the self-proclaimed DPR Andrey Purgin, RIA Novosti reports. (3) "Now there is a full — scale war... (4) We are being attacked, we are defending ourselves," Purgin announced. (5) According to him, the ceasefire in Ukraine was not observed in most cases. (6) However, fighting is now taking place in areas that were not previously fought. (7) Earlier on Thursday, November 6, the militia reported an attack by Ukrainian security forces on Yasinovataya in the suburbs of Donetsk. (8) according to the militia headquarters, a tank column entered the city. (9) By evening, the attack was repulsed. (10) Civilian casualties are reported. (11) In early September, an agreement was reached on a truce between the security forces and the militia during a meeting of the contact group in Minsk. (12) However, the ceasefire agreement was only partially respected. (13) Following the elections in the Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics on 2 November, the implementation of the Minsk Protocol was called into question. (14) Armed clashes between the Ukrainian army and militia began in April 2014. (15) In July, President Petro Poroshenko announced an offensive against militia positions. (16) Then the Ukrainian military managed to oust the militia from several cities, but they failed to fully take control of the Donbass.
(1) В Денверском университете начались п: (1) The first pre-election debate between President Barack Obama and his Republican opponent Mitt Romney has begun at the University of Denver. (2) A number of American TV channels, as well as YouTube, broadcast the event live. (3) According to the information posted on the website of the Presidential debate Commission, the meeting will last an hour and a half. (4) The main topic of the candidates ' conversation will be US domestic policy. (5) The meeting will be divided into six sections, each of which will open with a question from the moderator. (6) Each participant will receive two minutes to respond, followed by a discussion. (7) As The New York Times suggests, Obama and Romney will mainly discuss economic issues, including the size of the national debt, taxation and health care reform. (8) The meeting is hosted by PBS journalist Jim Lehrer. (9)This debate will be his 12th. (10) In total, Obama and Romney must meet three times. (11) The next debate will take place on October 16 in Hempstead, New York, and on October 22 in Boca Raton, Florida. (12) In addition, on October 11, the vice presidential candidates-Obama's current deputy Joe Biden and Romney's running mate Paul Ryan - will meet in Danville, Kentucky. (13) The presidential election is scheduled for November 6. (14) According to the results of the Gallup poll conducted on September 25 - October 1, 50 percent of respondents are ready to vote for the incumbent president, and 44 percent for Romney.
(1) Оставшись в одиночестве, считая своё: (1) Left alone, considering his situation hopeless, Tom falls into apathy. (2) But gradually the interest in life returns to him. (3) Observing the life and customs of the natives, based on a system of taboos, he comes to the conclusion that the opinion that is held about the islanders is deeply erroneous, but the so — called civilized man, with his diabolical skill in inventing murderous weapons, who everywhere brings with him trouble and ruin, can rightly be considered the most bloodthirsty creature on earth. (4) In the village, Tom is already considered so much his own that he is offered to put a tattoo on his face that is mandatory for members of the tribe — and it costs him a lot of effort to refuse this offer. (5) Treat him with great reverence. (6) In order that he may take the beautiful Fayaway across the lake in a canoe, the strictest taboo against women entering the boats is even temporarily abolished by some ritual contrivance. (7) But the thought of Toby's fate still haunts him. (8) And although Toby's head is not found among the dried human heads that he accidentally found in Marheyo's house, such a discovery does not add to his cheerfulness — especially since one of the heads undoubtedly belonged to a white man. (9) The natives carefully conceal from him anything that may indicate their cannibalism. (10) But you can't hide an awl in a bag: after a skirmish with the Happar neighbors, Tom determines from the remains of the feast that the Typee warriors ate the bodies of their slain enemies.
(1)Прокопия Ивановича привезли в больниц: (1)Prokopiy Ivanovich was taken to the hospital in the dead of night. (2) His wife accompanied him. (3) The patient's sunken eyes called for participation. \"(1) Информагентство РИА Новости и газе: "(1) The RIA Novosti news Agency and the Vremya Novosti newspaper, which are resuming the publication of the Moscow News, will allow readers to participate in the editorial policy. (2) This was announced on October 4 at a press conference dedicated to the relaunch of the newspaper by the agency's editor-in-chief Svetlana Mironyuk. (3) In particular, according to the editor-in-chief of RIA Novosti, readers will be able to participate in the development of ideas for the "Moscow News". (4) The most active of them will be allowed to meet with the editor-in-chief of the newspaper, who became Vladimir Gurevich. (5) According to Mironyuk, in November 2010, a "readers ' club"will be launched on Facebook. (6) In addition, Gurevich will communicate with readers via Twitter. (7) The English-language newspaper The Moscow News has been published in Moscow since 1930. (8) The publication was aimed at foreigners working in the USSR. (9) Moscow News began to be published in Russian in 1980, with Yegor Yakovlev as its editor-in-chief in 1986. (10) The newspaper was discontinued in 2008. (11) In 2008, The Moscow News and The Moscow News brands were acquired by RIA Novosti from the businessman who owned them, Arkady Gaydamak. (12) The Agency has started publishing the newspaper in English and Arabic. (13) Now RIA Novosti, in cooperation with Vremya Novosti, plans to resume publishing the publication in Russian in a paper version, on the Internet, as well as in a version for cell phones and iPads. (14) According to some reports, in 2011 the name "Moscow News" will be assigned to the newspaper "Vremya Novosti"."
(1) Гражданская панихида по актёру Анато: (1) A civil memorial service for actor Anatoly Kuznetsov will be held on March 13 at the Cinema House. (2) This was reported on March 9 on the website of the Union of Cinematographers of Russia. (3) The beginning of the ceremony is scheduled for 12:00. (4) The actor will be buried at the Novodevichy cemetery. (5) it was previously reported that information about the farewell to the actor will appear on march 11. (6) People's Artist of the RSFSR Anatoly Kuznetsov died in Moscow on March 7. (7) The media learned about the actor's death only on March 9. (8) The exact causes of Kuznetsov's death have not yet been reported. (9) As stated in the message on the website of the Union of Cinematographers, the artist died as a result of a long illness. (10) He was 83 years old. (11) Anatoly Kuznetsov is known to the Russian audience primarily for his role as the Red Army soldier Sukhov in the film "White Sun of the Desert" (1969). (12) Kuznetsov made his film debut in 1954 in the film "Dangerous Paths". (13) Among his other works are roles in the films "My Friend, Kolka!", "Give a Plaintive Book", "Liberation", "Hot Snow", "Battle for Moscow", "On the Corner, at the Patriarchs", "Plot", "Turkish Gambit". (14) Anatoly Kuznetsov was a laureate of the State Prize in the field of literature and art, awarded the Order of Honor, the Order of Friendship and the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, IV degree.
(1) В Иране состоялась публичная демонст: (1) A public demonstration of the new Toufan 2 attack helicopter of national design was held in Iran, PressTV reports. (2) Iranian Defense Minister Brigadier General Ahmad Vahidi attended the ceremony. (3) According to him, the helicopter of national development belongs to a new generation of such aircraft; it uses advanced technologies, including high - precision aiming systems. (4) The new Iranian helicopter was named Toufan 2. (5) According to Vahidi, after the start of serial production of Toufan 2 and the delivery of such helicopters to the troops, the combat power of the armed forces will increase significantly. (6) Vahidi did not disclose any technical details about the new helicopter. (7) Judging by the photo of the device, it is a copy of the American AH-1J SeaCobra helicopter. (8) In May 2012, Jane's news agency reported that Iran intends to demonstrate helicopters of its own production, which are copies of the American AH-1 Cobra. (9) In addition, it was reported that Iran has begun to upgrade existing American-made Cobra helicopters. (10) It was about installing new cockpit lights, avionics and sensors. (11) In the 1960s and 1970s, Iran purchased 202 AH-1J helicopters from the United States, 62 of which had anti-tank missile launch systems. (12) Military equipment supplies to Iran ceased in 1979, when the Islamic Revolution occurred in the country. (13) It is not known how many Cobra helicopters are currently in service with Iran.
(1) Приспешники Христиана Шарфа разрабат: (1) Christian Scharf's henchmen are plotting several sabotage raids into the city and setting fire to Martin's lodge. (2) They are, however, unable to carry them out because of the intervention of some person who is aware of their intentions and each time prevents their execution. (3) Not knowing that this person is Peter, the leader of the "Disciples", and mistaking for a traitor his comrade Oskar, who openly speaks about the madness and destructiveness of their goals — the restoration of Nazi Germany — they drown him in the river, disguising the crime as an accident. (4) Peter, who did not see the crime itself, but knows that it was committed by Scharf and Zeke, declares them to the Americans. (5) The Nazis are arrested, but after a few months, without proving their guilt, the German investigative authorities release them. (6) They, having by this time realized that Peter is the traitor in their ranks, set up a death trap for him on the roof. (7) Peter, however, manages not to fall into it. (8) He informs Scharf and Zeke that he has written several copies of the letter about how the attempt was made to kill him, and has placed them in safe hands. (9) If anything happens to him, this letter will be sent to the investigating authorities and the perpetrators will be tried. (10) The Nazis leave Peter alone. (11) Now they have more important goals: their squad is expanding, and seeing how relations between America and Russia are deteriorating, how the Germans are impoverished, they are preparing for a decisive blow.

(1) Ондин Бореид сообщает Маликульмульку: (1) the Ondina of Breed reports Molecularlike that travels the waters of different countries and collects rarities. (2) Sometimes he meets the court of Neptune, who is restless and does not know where to find a quiet place. (3) Neptune had recently chosen a place near the shores of ancient Tauris, and Thetis had given a housewarming feast, but in the midst of the merriment there was a thunderclap over the heads of the guests, and a cannonball broke all the dishes on the table. (4) Thetis fainted. (5) The assembled people looked up and saw a whole floating city above their heads, which was exchanging fire with another similar city (an allusion to the second Russian-Turkish war of 1787-1791). (6) Several wounded Mohammedans fell on the banquet table. (7) When Neptune asked about the reasons for the war, one of them replied that the mufti and the imam had told him that people who lived several thousand miles away and whom he had never seen had mortally offended him and the Prophet Mohammed. (8) The Muslim left his family and went to kill the offenders, confident of an early victory, for in the Alqoran it is said that no one will defeat the Muslims until the last century. (9) But when his galley was blown up, he found himself not in paradise, as he had expected, but on the bottom of the sea, and realized that the mufti and imams were deceiving gullible people in order to get money for a paradise life on earth. (10) Neptune, seeing that the Muslims were becoming more and more numerous, hastened with his court to leave such a troubled place.
(1)В солнечный день я приехал в старинны: (1) on a sunny day, i came to the ancient village of gus-zhelezny to admire the lake, swim and swim in it. (2)i reached the river, climbed a hillock, looked and... (3)oh, the horror! (4) there is no lake. (5)a narrow, dry river meandered through a wide depression bordered by the far edge of the former coastal forest. (6) And the old dam, high, brick, with cast-iron sluices, in the dark casemates of which, according to legend, the robber brothers minted counterfeit money, was also not there. (7)The floodgates that regulated the flow were removed, filled in – and the lake was covered with mud and duckweed. (8) In this place there was now an ordinary road embankment; the road made a sharp turn, skirted a white two-story manor house, like a long barrack, a broken, stunted park, and again broke out into the open. (9) The chief physician of the children's sanatorium located in the manor house showed me old photographs of this disappeared lake, a high brick dam, shopping malls with prehistoric porticos, he led me through the inner chambers of a huge house, newly fenced, adapted for other needs. (10)Alterations and repairs were once hastily made: the floorboards creak and slush underfoot, the doors are warped, a fresh breeze blows through the window frames – - (11)Is there at least one room from a long time ago? "(12)With floors, doors, and windows?" – (13)Floors, doors, etc. – all have parastasie. (14) But the walls and ceiling are preserved in one place. (15)come, i'll show you. (16)He led me into a hall, I think the present dining room, with white, austere pilasters, and a stucco ceiling – - (17)the floors were said to be of composite parquet, the doors were of walnut with bronze inlay, and the chandelier was gilded. "(18)it is a pity – "i say –" that all this has not been preserved. (By B. A. Mozhaev)
(1) Алексей Кондратьевич Саврасов писал: (1) alexey kondratievich savrasov painted nature paintings and taught at the moscow school of painting and sculpture. (2) Kind and condescending to people in life, in matters of art, he became demanding and strict. (3) - Well, what kind of willow is it, young man? (5) Look ten times, then draw. (6) You need to know nature like the back of your hand to paint landscapes. (7) Believe only your eyes, and do not invent nature! (8) Then he went to another study and sighed: (9) - Here everything is correct: both branches, and buds, and young shoots. (10) But is this painting? (11) This is a drawing for a botanical atlas, not a painting. (12) Because few know the nature, we need nature to feel. (13) didn't you notice how sad declines IVA to water their flexible branches? (14) And how fun playing in the spring on birch catkins! (15) They glow in the rays of the sun that is just beginning to warm. (16) And that even though you looked at nature, the main thing I saw. (17) She did not touch you. (18) But if you paint nature with emotion, with feeling, then your picture will also excite the viewer. (19) As it is, you can't hang it in the merchant's hall, let alone in an art gallery. (20) And every year, as soon as classes at the school were over, the artist went "to nature" - to talk face to face with the fields, groves, and copses. (For O. M. Tuberously.)
(1) Следователи расширили список обвинен: (1) Investigators have expanded the list of charges against a resident of the Sverdlovsk region who was detained in June on suspicion of the murders of retired women. (2) this was reported on november 1 on the website of the investigative committee of the russian federation. (3) Previously, a 39-year-old resident of Krasnoufimsk, Irina Gaydamachuk, was officially charged with only one murder of an 80-year-old woman. (4) At the same time, the investigation had data on the involvement of Gaydamachuk in 18 murders, and some journalists even claimed 22 murders. (5) Now a resident of Krasnoufimsk is charged with 17 murders involving robbery, as well as three attempted arson and robbery resulting in serious harm to health. (6) According to investigators, Gaydamachuk attacked elderly residents of Krasnoufimsk, Serov, Yekaterinburg and the village of Achita from 2002 to 2010. (7) The criminal killed the women by hitting them on the head with a hammer, and then robbed them. (8) In three cases, the assailant tried to set fire to the apartments of the victims in order to cover up the murders. (9) However, none of the arson attacks were successful. (10) In the near future, Gaydamachuk will undergo a psychiatric examination at the State Scientific Center for Social and Forensic Psychiatry named after Serbsky. (11) The accused has already admitted her guilt.In 2003, it was already reported about the detention in Krasnoufimsk of a woman suspected of a series of murders of pensioners. (12) However, it was not possible to prove the guilt of the detainee in the end. (13) The name of the suspect was not called.
(1) Следственный комитет РФ возбудил дел: (1) Russia's Investigative Committee opened a case into the death of 45-year-old Andrei Fateev injured in Zelenograd prison number 12. (2) On this February 1 reported on the website of the UK. (3) During the examination, the investigators concluded that the death of the prisoner was violent. (4) The case was initiated under the fourth part of Article 111 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (causing serious harm to health resulting in the death of the victim). (5) Fateev was convicted of eight rapes and robberies. (6) It is established that he met women near night clubs in Pushkino and Ivanteevka near Moscow. (7) Fateev offered to drive the women home in a car, and then drove them to a secluded place, threatened them with a gun, robbed and raped them. (8) After the sentencing, Fateev was not transferred from the pre-trial detention center to the colony. (9) On December 31, 2012, he was taken to the hospital with a closed craniocerebral injury, a brain contusion, a blunt abdominal injury, a broken rib, and a thermal burn in the genital area. (10) The man died soon after. (11) The cellmates stated that Fateev fell from the second tier of the bunk, thus receiving bruises to his head and body. (12) After that, he lay unconscious for a long time at the central heating battery, which caused him to get burned. (13) The management of the pre-trial detention center agreed with the prisoners ' version. (14) "As far as I know, he caused the damage to himself," said the head of the detention center Dmitry Konarev.
(1) Суданская кампания заканчивается, го: (1) The Sudan campaign ends, Dick's head heals. (2) Torpenhow goes to London, and Dick wanders about Cyprus, Alexandria, Izmalia, Port Said, and continues to paint. (3) By the time his money runs out, he receives a telegram from Torpenhow in England, in which a friend calls him to London with the news that the syndicate wants to renew his contract, because his drawings are very popular with the public. (4) Having arrived in England, Dick, at the suggestion of Torpenhow, settles down with his friend. (5) he is soon visited by the head of the central south syndicate, a heavyset old man with a heart condition, whom dick forces to return to him all his drawings made in sudan. (6) The gentleman who does not agree with Dick's demands still has to give in to the pressure of the young artist. (7) Dick independently arranges an exhibition of his work, which is very successful, so that he even manages to sell all his drawings. (8) From now on, he is obsessed with the desire to earn as much money as possible to compensate for the hardships that have fallen to his lot due to their lack. (9) He begins to be arrogant, believes that he can draw what the public likes for the sake of money, hack, and this will not harm his reputation. (10) Friends try to reason with him. (11) Torpenhow even tears up one of his works.
\"(1) Ставропольская городская дума назн: "(1) The Stavropol City Duma has appointed a new city manager. (2) They became Andrey Dzhatdoev, which is from February 2012 was the acting head of administration, informs "Interfax". (3) According to Komsomolskaya Pravda, five other people applied for the post of city manager, but the deputies unanimously supported Jatdoev. (4) the Former city Manager of Stavropol Igor Bestari is under arrest. (5)He is suspected of receiving one bribe and attempting to obtain another. (6) According to investigators, he received two million rubles for renting out 25 acres of municipal property. (7) In addition, he tried to get 50 million for the allocation of another site. (8) the Mediator, in both cases, according to investigators, were made public assistant Leonid Kozlov Bestuzhevo. (9) In mid-June, 75-year-old Kozlov was sentenced to a fine of 100 million rubles. (10)He was tried only for one episode with 50 million rubles. (11) It is not yet known whether he will be brought to justice in another criminal case. (12) Igor Bestuzhy was a member of United Russia before his detention. (13) He was subsequently expelled from the party. (14) Andrey Jatdoev has worked as the first Deputy head of the Stavropol Administration since 2011. (15) Before that, he led the districts of the Stavropol Territory."
\"(1) Белорусская милиция задержала 13 у: "(1) The Belarusian police detained 13 participants of a picnic held on Sunday, May 6, near the village of Zhdanovichi, Minsk district. (2) This is reported by the human rights center "Viasna". (3) There is no information about the reason for the detention. (4) According to Radio Liberty, we are talking about a private concert given by Belarusian bards Dmitry Bartosik and Igor Simbirov. (5) According to the radio station, the police detained all participants of the event (17 people). (6) The bards themselves were taken to the Zhdanovichi police station. (7) They, as well as other detainees, were fingerprinted by law enforcement officers. (8) According to the "Viasna", all detainees, except Igor Simbirow was later released. (9) An administrative report was drawn up against the bard. (10) He was accused of disobeying the police during the detention, in particular, that he swore obscenely and waved his hands. (11) Later it became known that he was taken to Minsk. (12) Igor Simbirov was released on May 6 after 10 days of administrative arrest. (13) On April 26, he was detained at the Chernobyl Way rally in Minsk and convicted of "petty hooliganism"."
\"(1) Сборная России по хоккею победила: "(1) The Russian national ice hockey team defeated the German team in the World Championship match held in Sweden and Finland. (2) The Russians won 2-0. (3) Nikolai Zherdev scored in the 20th minute and Alexey Tereshchenko scored in the 51st minute. (4) The match was broadcast live by Channel One. (5) Zherdev scored nine seconds before the end of the first period. (6) he substituted the stick after a throw by evgeny medvedev, who received the puck after a pass by evgeny malkin on the right flank. (7) In the middle of the third period, the Russians realized a numerical advantage. (8) Tereshchenko, who scored the goal, was assisted by Zherdev and Sergey Shirokov. (9) The victory over the German national team was the third for the Russians at the 2012 World Cup. (10) Earlier, the Russian national team beat Latvia (5: 2) and Norway (4:2). (11) The Russians, who have scored nine points, share the first place in Group B with the Swedish national team. (12) Latvia, which beat Italy (5-0) on May 8, has six points, and the Czech Republic has five points. (13) In Group A on May 8, Belarus beat Kazakhstan (3-2), and Finland beat Switzerland (5-2). (14) The Finns lead Group A. (15) Canada is second with seven points. (16) Switzerland has six points, and the United States has five."
(1) Вечером опять сошлись у Старкиных. (: (1) In the evening they met again at the Starkins'. (2) They talked only about the war. (3) Someone started a rumor that the conscription of recruits this year will be earlier than usual, by the eighteenth of August, and that deferrals to students will be canceled. (4) Therefore, Bubenchikov and Kozovalov were oppressed: if this is true, then they will have to serve their military service not in two years, but today. (5) The young people did not want to fight: Bubenchikov was too fond of his young and, it seemed to him, valuable and beautiful life, and Kozovalov did not like anything around him to become too serious. (6) kozovalov said dejectedly: "i will go to africa. (7) there will be no war. "(8) And I will go to France, "said Bubenchikov," and become a French citizen. (9) Lisa flushed with annoyance. (10) Screamed: - And you are not ashamed! (11) You have to protect us, and you think about where to hide. (12) And you think that you will not be forced to fight in France? (13) Sixteen reserve soldiers were called up from Orgo. (14) The Estonian who was caring for Liza, Paul Sepp, was also called up. (15) When Liza found out about this, she suddenly felt somehow embarrassed, almost ashamed that she had laughed at him. (16) She remembered his clear, childlike eyes. (17) She suddenly clearly imagined a distant battlefield – and he, big, strong, would fall, struck by the enemy's bullet. (18) A tender, pitiful tenderness for this departing one rose in her soul. (19) With fearful surprise, she thought, " He loves me. (20) And I, what am I?" To Sologub*)
\"(1) Российский авиаперевозчик \"Аэрофл: "(1) Russian air carrier Aeroflot will temporarily decommission about 20 percent of Airbus 320 airliners due to a shortage of pilots. (2) This, according to the newspaper "Vedomosti", was announced by the General Director of the company Vitaly Savelyev. (3) According to Savelyev, Aeroflot has a total of 630 pilots who can fly such aircraft. (4) However, 18 of them were sent on leave before the end of the year due to the fact that they have already worked their annual rate of 800 flight hours. (5) At the same time, the CEO clarified that the number of pilots who went on vacation will only grow. (6) At the moment, 8 Airbus 320 airliners have already been decommissioned. (7) It is expected that 4 or 5 more aircraft will be added to them in the near future. (8) In total, the carrier's fleet includes 66 A320 airliners, which make up 65 percent of the total number of Aeroflot aircraft. (9) According to the newspaper, the airline's net loss due to the withdrawal of some aircraft may amount to about $ 10 million, the lost profit - $ 30 million. (10) It is assumed that by the New Year holidays, Aeroflot will resume all flights. (11) Currently, pilots are allowed to fly no more than 800 hours per year. (12) According to Savelyev, in order to avoid such problems in the future, it is necessary to increase the annual rate to 900-1000 hours - so many pilots fly, for example, in Europe and the United States. (13) As the publication notes, in September of this year, the Ministry of Transport prepared amendments proposing to increase the flight time to 900 hours. (14) However, the document was never signed by the Minister of Transport Igor Levitin."
(1) Вскоре Мартона познакомилась с молод: (1) Marthona soon met a young noblewoman who had married a merchant. (2) The society that met in the merchant's house was very amusing and did not differ in nobility, but served the heroine as a good school. (3) The mistress herself generally had criminal intentions to lime her merchant husband. (4) For this purpose, she hired a Little Russian from Marthona's household and persuaded him to prepare poison. (5) For the hapless merchant, everything ended well, since the narrator's servant did not poison him, but only caused temporary insanity with his tincture. (6) For which he was richly rewarded. (7) Suddenly Marthona received a letter from Ahal, in which he said that he wanted to die, because he could not bear to regret the death of a friend and the loss of his beloved. (8) In order to lose his life, Ahal takes poison and dreams of saying goodbye to his beloved Marthona. (9) the narrator and her lover svidal went together to akhal, but only marthona entered the house. (10) She learned that Achal had been driven to despair by remorse, and that he had decided to leave her a deed of sale for an estate purchased with her own money, and had decided to pass away. (11) The mere mention of Svidal's name sent him into a frenzy, and he could not realize that his friend was alive.
(1) Жила когда-то медвежонка Пандочка. (: (1) once upon a time there lived a panda bear. (2) she used to climb trees, because that's what all pandas do. (3) But she was small and did not climb well, so she climbed a tree and sat on it for a long time. (4) sometimes the panda would fall and hurt itself, and sometimes it would fall with the tree. (5) Then she could not climb a tree for a long time, one had too high branches, some were already sitting on other Pandas or squirrels, it does not matter, it is important that somehow the Panda met with a big Grizzly bear, a terrible lover of honey, and therefore excellent climbing trees. (6) and the bear taught the panda how to climb trees more easily and efficiently. (7) Panda joyfully began to climb one tree, then another. (8) Some had delicious young leaves, others were perfect for relaxing, and third, it was convenient to hide from heavy tropical downpours. (9) But all the trees were somehow wrong, unsuitable, some Panda fell, others quickly ran out of delicious leaves, others only from the ground seemed so comfortable and attractive. (10) And then one day the Panda saw a tree that immediately attracted her attention with its perfect crown shape, tight fleshy leaves, so appetizing to look at and many forks in which it is so convenient to rest. (11) The panda immediately climbed this tree and snuggled down there. (12) She decided not to leave it, and so Pandochka began to live in this tree. (13) After a while, she felt that the tree has a very rough bark, which painfully hurt the delicate pink pads on the paws. (14) For a while, the Panda still lived as before, she tried to move carefully so that the paws did not hurt. (15) But once, she stepped on a very sharp twig, broke off and hit the ground painfully.
(1) Пока они пили чай, она рассказывала: (1) While they were drinking tea, she told the young man her life. (2) It was probably unnecessary, but old people sometimes want to tell something and be listened to. (3) Once the poet Simonov came to the Academy, read his poems and told so many interesting things. (4) Alyosha came up to him with a book, he did not part with it in the war, such a shabby one, in the forty-second edition, "Front poems". (5) There and "Wait for me", and "Son of the gunner", and "Do you remember, Alyosha...". (6) The young man was interested: "Can I see Simonov's autograph?" (7) Anna Vyacheslavovna got up and went to the bookshelves, took out a thin old collection on yellow paper, carefully packed in a plastic bag, carefully took out and opened the first page. (8) The young man carefully examined Simonov's autograph, paid attention to the year of publication, turned over several pages. (9) "Add a hundred, a total of sixteen and a half," he said. (10) "you, you, — waved Anna V. — is not for sale." (11) The young man did not press the point. (12) "Yes, you know, I have a small request to make," the young man said. — (13) I have a friend, he is a fan of Simonov, shakes over every line of his.(14) Can I take your little book for a couple of days, show it to a friend, and he will take a picture of your autograph.(15) I will return it in two days." (16)Anna Vyacheslavovna wanted to refuse, but the tongue did not turn. (17) A person really loves Simonov, it is important for him to see this autograph with his own eyes. (According To N. S. Lytvynets')
(1) Так заканчивается первый год жизни Т: (1) Thus ends the first year of Thoreau's life in the forest. (2) The second year is very similar to it, and the author does not describe it. (3) On September 6, 1847, Thoreau finally leaves Walden. (4) He leaves the forest for the same important reasons for which he settled in it. (5) It seems to him that he should live a few more lives, and not go on the already well-trodden road. (6) If a person boldly goes to his dream, then he will have success, which is not given to everyday existence. (7) His life in this case begins to obey the highest laws, and he acquires the highest freedom. (8) The more he simplifies his life, the simpler the universal laws seem to him; loneliness, poverty, and weakness cease to exist for him. (9) It is not necessary even to understand others, because in the general mass of their surroundings there is stupidity and conventionality. (10) Everyone should try to do his own thing, to become what he was born to be. (11) If modern humanity and modern man may seem like pygmies compared to the ancient peoples, then, according to Thoreau, one should try to become "the greatest of pygmies", to study one's own soul and improve it.
\"(1) Фермер из английского графства Хер: "(1) A farmer from the English county of Herefordshire, Andrew Lloyd, went on a walking trip from Yakutia to India. (2) this is reported by the portal "yakutia". (3) the tourist's goal is to visit the coldest places on earth. (4) in addition, he is engaged in charity work. (5) It is noted that in Yakutia, Lloyd visited the capital of the Republic of Yakutsk. (6) In the future, he plans to look at the UNESCO World Heritage site Lena Pillars and go to the area of the northern part of Lake Baikal. (7) From there, Lloyd's journey will continue through Mongolia to China. (8) " then i will reach tibet ("roof of the world") and Nepal, where the stunning Himalayas will be waiting. (9) as soon as i pass them, i will go down to india, to darjeeling," the traveler said. (10) Lloyd noted that Yakutsk is very cold due to the combination of frost and wind. (11) At the same time, he called the residents of the republic "very cool" and noted their hospitality. (12) During the trip, Lloyd plans to raise money for the Ghurka Welfare Trust, which funds the restoration of villages and schools in Nepal. (13) Funds can be donated on the JustGiving website. (14) At the time of writing, the traveler managed to collect 1,160 pounds out of the required 20 thousand. (15) In the summer of 2016, two travelers traveled from Moscow to Mirny (Yakutia) on bicycles. (16) The run took them 111 days, during which time they visited 14 regions of Russia."
\"(1) Президент России Дмитрий Медведев: "(1) Russian President Dmitry Medvedev said that during his vacation in the Sochi residence "Bocharov ruchey" he will work almost every day, but plans to go fishing with Prime Minister Vladimir Putin. (2) The Head of State is quoted by Komsomolskaya Pravda. (3) According to Medvedev, " this vacation is just a transfer of work to the southern residence." (4)" sometimes i only see the sea here in the evening, " the president complained. (5) He also said that because of the heat, he will have to give up cycling, but at the same time he is going to devote more time to yoga classes. (6)On vacation, the Head of State also hopes to read more. (7) He is currently interested in the book "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo"by Swedish writer Stieg Larsson. (8) Medvedev plans to spend several days of his vacation, which will last until the end of August, together with Prime Minister Putin. (9) According to Medvedev, if the situation with forest fires improves, the president and the prime Minister will go fishing in Astrakhan. (10) Taking the opportunity, journalists asked the president about the relations in "tandem" and asked about the forecasts for the 2012 elections. (11) Medvedev said that he could go to the elections himself, Putin could go, and maybe "someone third". (12) "On the one hand, our relations with Putin have not changed at all, on the other hand, they have changed very much. (13) We have relations not only with old friends, but also with former and current presidents. (14) It is impossible not to take this into account," Medvedev said."
(1) Свои дни Том проводит в радости и ве: (1) Tom spends his days in joy and fun, but at night he is exhausted with fear. (2) injun joe fills all his dreams and always looks at him darkly and menacingly. (3) Both Tom and Huck fear Joe's revenge and realize that they will only breathe easy when they see the half-breed's corpse. (4) Tom is attacked by a passionate desire to find the treasure. (5) According to legend, the treasure can be found "in a rotten chest under a dead tree — where the shadow of a twig falls at midnight", or "under the floor in old houses where it is unclean". (6) Tom takes Huck Finn with his idea. (7) break all the ground under a dead tree, friends switch to the local "haunted house". (8) They entered quietly, with their hearts beating fast, talking in whispers, listening with alert ears for the slightest sound, and straining every muscle — in case it should be necessary to retreat. (9) Once they are comfortable, the boys leave their shovels in the corner and climb the rotten stairs to the second floor. (10) Suddenly voices are heard. (11) Through a crack in the floor, Tom and Huck see a disguised Indian Joe enter the house with his accomplice. (12) They are going to hide the stolen money in an abandoned house and accidentally dig up a treasure — a chest of gold. (13) The accomplice offers Joe to take all the money and leave the state, but the half-breed plans revenge and decides to stay.
\"(1) В Мюнстере злоумышленники подожгли: "(1) in munster, attackers set fire to the building of the consulate general of turkey. (2) according to police reports, there is ample evidence to suggest that members of the kurdish community are behind the arson: for many years, the kurds have been demanding that turkey grant them independence. (3) according to dpa, the incident occurred on the night of last sunday, march 7. (4) The attackers threw Molotov cocktails at the Turkish Consulate General. (5) during the investigation of the scene, the police found many other improvised incendiary bombs in the building opposite the school. (6) in addition, two gasoline-drenched car tires were found. (7) as a result of arson, the facade of the building was damaged. (8) no employees of the consulate general were injured. (9) It should be noted that in mid-January, the head of the Kurdistan Workers ' Party in Germany, Hasan Adir, was detained while trying to leave for the Netherlands. (10) Turkey demands Adir's extradition, accusing him of involvement in terrorist activities. (11) Adir's lawyers, for their part, claim that their client is facing torture or even death in Turkey. (12) Since the 80s of the last century, the Kurdish Workers ' Party has been waging an armed struggle for the creation of an independent Kurdish state in the south-east of Turkey. (13) During this time, more than 40 thousand people became victims of the armed confrontation. (14) In Germany and a number of other countries, the PKK is recognized as a terrorist organization."
(1) Памятник поэту-песеннику Льву Ошанин: (1) The monument to the poet-songwriter Lev Oshanin in the Yaroslavl region suffered at the hands of vandals, according to the administration of the city district of Rybinsk. (2) The police are looking for criminals who sawed off part of the sculpture weighing about 10 kilograms. (3) The hem of the bronze cloak of the sculpture was attached to the parapet on the Volga embankment. (4) It was this element of the structure that the attackers cut off and handed over to the non-ferrous metal reception point. (5) His staff reported the incident to the police.The monument, installed in Rybinsk in 2003, is not the first time that vandals have fallen prey to it. (6) In September 2003, the attackers filled it with blue paint, and broke the 130-kilogram raincoat with a crowbar. (7) The poet Lev Oshanin was born in Rybinsk in 1912. (8) He is the author of more than 70 poetry collections, short stories and plays. (9) His songs — "Roads", "The Volga Flows", "Sunny Circle" — are still popular. (10) The poet died in 1996 in Moscow, he is buried at the Vagankovsky cemetery. (11) In October, a monument to the actor Yevgeny Leonov in the image of an Associate Professor from the film "Gentlemen of Fortune" was stolen in Moscow. (12) Soon the police detained the suspects and found the sculpture, but in a sawn-off form. (13) In the Stavropol Territory on the night of November 1, a monument to Lermontov was mutilated. (1) Мы жили в санатории под Парижем. (2): (1) We lived in a sanatorium near Paris. (2)Walking, eating, listening to the radio, playing bridge, gossiping. (12)Here is a crossword puzzle: "What happens in a residential building?", four letters. (13) She was pitied and treated with great sympathy. (14) And one day he crawled out on the terrace earlier than usual. (15)She sat him down for a long time, covered him with blankets, put pillows on him, he winced and angrily pushed her hand away if she did not immediately guess his wishes. (16)She, happily shivering, grabbed the newspaper: - Here, Seryozhenka, today seems to be a very interesting crossword puzzle. (17) He suddenly raised his head, rolled his evil yellow eyes and shook all over: – get the hell out of here with your stupid crossword puzzles! (18)She only swallowed hard, pressed her hands tightly to her chest, and looked around with such pain and despair, as if she were looking for help. (19)But who can take such a ridiculous and stupid grief seriously? (20)Only a small boy, who was sitting at a nearby table and saw this scene, suddenly closed his eyes and began to cry bitterly. (By N. A. Taffy)

(1) Когда я один, совсем и долго один –: (1) When I am alone, completely and for a long time alone, I suddenly begin to imagine that someone else is in the same room, sitting next to me or standing behind my back. (2) When I turn around or suddenly fix my eyes on the place where I think that person is, of course, I don't see anyone. (3) The Very feeling of his nearness disappears... but after a few Moments it returns again. (4) Sometimes i take my head in both hands and start Thinking about Him. (5) who is he? (6) What is it? (7) He is not a stranger to me... he knows me – and I know him... (8) He seems to be akin to me... and there is an abyss between us. (9) No sound, no word from him I did not expect... (10) He's the same there, as motionless... (11) And yet he tells me... says something unclear, strange and familiar. (12) He knows all my secrets. (13) I'm not afraid of him... but I'm uncomfortable with it and would not like to have a witness of my inner life... (14) And the separate existence of others, I do not feel. (15) Are you not my double? (16) Are you not my past self? (17) Yes, and exactly: is there not a whole abyss between the person I remember myself to be and the present me? (18) But he does not come at my bidding – as if he had a will of his own. (19) It is not fun, brother, neither for you nor for me-in the hateful silence of solitude! (20) But wait… When I die, we will merge with you – my former, my present self – and fly away forever to the region of irrevocable shadows.

(1) Когда Рокамадур заболевает и Маге пр: (1) when rocamadour falls ill and maga has to pick up the baby and take care of it, horacio is unable to overcome his annoyance and irritation. (2) The death of the child also leaves him indifferent. (3) Friends who have arranged a kind of court of honor can not forgive Horacio either his "elimination" at a difficult moment for Magi, or his insensitivity in this situation. (4) Maga leaves, and Horacio only now realizes that he loved this girl and, having lost her, lost the life core. (5) He finds himself truly alone and, having broken out of the already familiar circle, seeks "brotherhood" in the society of vagabonds, but ends up in the police and is sentenced to expulsion from the country. (6) And now, many years after leaving his homeland, Horacio finds himself back in Buenos Aires. (7) He ekes out a vegetative existence in a small hotel room and condescendingly tolerates the pathetic philistine solicitude of Hecrepten. (8) He keeps in close contact with his youth friend Traveller and his wife Talita, who work in the circus. (9) Horacio is pleased with their company, but always experiencing a mania for spiritual seizures towards his friends, this time he is seriously afraid of "sowing doubts and disturbing the peace of good people". (10) Talita reminds him of Maga in some way, and he involuntarily reaches out to her. (11) The traveler is somewhat disturbed to notice this, but he cherishes his friendship with Horacio, in whose conversations he finds an outlet after suffering for a long time from a lack of intellectual communication. (12) And yet Horacio almost in passing destroys the happy love of friends.
(1) Перемещаясь во времени, Юрий Ильич о: (1) moving in time, yuri ilyich finds himself in 1993 — in the era called the great reconstruction. (2) It is dangerous to move around Moscow without weapons in the dark, icy wind; the hero's coat, like that of other passers-by, is bulging with Kalashnikov rifles. (3) Tanks are constantly rushing through the middle of Tverskaya Street, explosions are rumbling near Strastnaya Square, and the streets are being raided by fighter detachments of Uglovites — fighters for sobriety. (4) Occasionally, the hero turns on the transistor, saving precious batteries. (5) The radio broadcasts news about the congress in the Kremlin of countless parties whose names sound phantasmagorically — like the Constitutional Party of the United Bukhara and Samarkand Emirates, as well as information from the American Communist newspaper "Washington Post"... Fleeing from another raid, Yuri Ilyich finds himself in the dark entrance of the house where he spent his childhood. (6) Here he meets a woman from Ekaterinoslavl (formerly Dnepropetrovsk), who came to Moscow for boots. (7) Through the back door, they manage to escape from a group of "Afghans" who kill the passengers of an old Mercedes, and from the round-up of the People's Security Commission, which cleans the Moscow houses of bureaucrats. (8) They pass the black ruins of the Peking Hotel, inhabited by Moscow anarchists. (9) Recently, in one of the windows, the corpse of a"metalist" guy, executed by the executioners from Lyubertsy, was hanging on a chain. (10) Near the house with the "bad apartment" described by Bulgakov, pickets of the "retinue of Satan" in cat masks are on duty.
(1) Когда возвращались с вокзала, Вадим: (1) When we were returning from the train station, Vadim took his mother's arm for the first time. (2)He was silent all the way. (3) He thought of his father's words: "You are now the head of the family, the support." (4)So he is no longer a boy, but the head of the family, and his father has entrusted him to protect his mother. (5)Father and before, leaving on a business trip, said Vadim deliberately loud and strict voice: "Look-take care of your mother!" (6)Today he said the same thing quietly and called my mother unusually harsh-mother ... (7)Yes, now a new life will begin for Vadim, full of worries and responsibilities. (8)And Vadim wondered: when and where exactly to start this new life for him? (9) And the next week, the "head of the family" secretly went to the military enlistment office and asked to go to the front. (10)He was refused, as he did not yet have a passport, no one believed his words that he was already seventeen years old. (11) He did not tell anyone about this failed attempt. (According To Yu. V. Trifonov)
(1) Он нёс меня на себе восемь километро: (1) He carried me for eight kilometers. (2) Eight thousand meters on hot ground. (3) I still remember his hot back, the sweat that was like acid eating away at the skin on his hands. (4) And the white distance, like a starched hospital sheet... (5) I remember all this, I remember it in detail, in detail, in colors. (6) But I still can't understand anything. (7) And today, many years later, when I recall that incident, my wisdom, having lost its balance, is helplessly mired in a thick quagmire of perplexity: it seems to me incomprehensible and strange all our life, especially if you try to understand it. (8) We were then thirteen — me and my bosom friend Seryozha Leontiev. (9) We went fishing far away on an old, shallow pond. (10) I suddenly felt the need to refresh myself, and I climbed into the water, but before I could take a step, I cried out from the sharp pain in my leg. (11) Seryozha rushed to me, he dragged me to the shore. (12) I was horrified to see that a fragment of a bottle neck was sticking out of my heel, and thick blood was dripping on the grass. (13) Seryozha carried me for eight kilometers.- (14) Seren, leave me! I whispered through dry lips.— (15) No!(16) I was dizzy from weakness, and suddenly, I don't know why,— (17) Seren, if I die, then give my regards to Galka Korshunova! (18) Tell her that I loved her. (19) He dragged me to the hospital, then, breathing heavily, sat on the couch and watched as the doctor treated my wound. (20) And the next day, when I limped out into the courtyard, everyone already knew that before I died I had asked to give my regards to Galka Korshunova, and I became the laughing stock of the whole school. (According to M. Khudyakov*)
(1) Деньги — это средство распределения: (1) Money is a means of distributing material goods according to labor, and not the purpose of existence, not the basis of the prestige and influence of the individual. (2) However, for all its official role, money is constantly present in our relationships, and issues related to money represent a wide field for the formation of such qualities as honesty, nobility, modesty, delicacy, commitment. (Z)In addition, the education of a correct view of the role of money consists in instilling in children their true meaning, showing their real place in the series of basic life values: knowledge, creative work, spiritual and intellectual communication. (4) Perhaps that is why today parents are very concerned about the influence of the family on the attitude to material values, to money. (5) What should and what can the family do in order to prevent the manifestation of petty-bourgeois self-interest, possessiveness, "materialism"in children? (6) What should and what can the family do to ensure that children who grow up in material prosperity, surrounded by many good and beautiful things, do not find themselves in their spiritual captivity? (7) At first, no one in the family paid any attention to the fact that little Alyonka, when asked to "Give me a toy," invariably responded with a decisive refusal, vigorously pressing a rattle or a rubber animal to her chest. (8) Soon the character of Alenka began to cause some concern: she began to constantly have quarrels with children over toys. (9) Condescending acquaintances gently reassured anxious parents: "Come on, it's a child! (10) The usual childish greed. (11) Don't worry." (12) There is a dubious theory that the so-called child greed belongs to the category of natural, almost mandatory age characteristics. (13) Indeed, many "little greedy" grow up to be quite normal, even kind people. (14) Under the influence of upbringing and environment, sometimes without a special parental "sight" in the emerging character, positive traits — kindness, generosity-prevail. (15) but this is not always the case. (16) Big greed grows, as a rule, from small greed. (17) Alena's greed was decided to declare war — a bloodless and "nerveless"war. (18) Yes, Alyona had no bad examples before her eyes, she could not observe any pettiness or self-interest in her relatives. (19) but, apparently, more illustrative examples of kindness were needed, and not joking, but serious explanations. (20) Now in the family as often as possible tried to give each other courtesies gifts, and Alena and I talked about the upcoming gift to family or friends, tried to let the girl see how close easily and with pleasure yield to each other even then that I wanted to take him. (By G. L. Mogilevskaya)
\"(1) Глава Федеральной антимонопольной: "(1) The head of the Federal Antimonopoly Service (FAS) Igor Artemyev spoke about the mafia structures operating in the Russian dairy market, RIA Novosti reports with reference to an interview with NTV. (2) "We always have a purchase price for dairy products [something is wrong]. (3) They also have their own structures, I would even call them the mafia," he said. (4) Artemyev explained that intermediaries force farmers to sell their products at bargain prices in order to resell them. (5) He clarified that this applies not only to milk, but also to grain and other products. (6) "And they say to them:" If you take them to the elevator yourself, you will not bring your products. We will not accept", — Artemyev revealed the mechanism of influence on agricultural enterprises. (7) Grain interventions, according to the head of the FAS, partly help to fight resellers. (8) The Russian Government is currently developing a similar intervention mechanism for dairy producers in 2017. (9) In November, farmer Oleg Sirota in an interview with Lenta.<url> " said that after the lifting of the food embargo, domestic producers of dairy products will be uncompetitive. (10) According to him, the problem is the cost of dairy raw materials, the production of which in the EU is subsidized by the state. (11) " A liter of milk there costs 12 rubles. (12) Milk comes to me for 40 [rubles]," he said. (13) The second reason is the high cost of loans."
(1) Когда меня не будет, когда всё, что: (1) When I am gone, when all that was me is crumbling to dust-oh, you, my only friend, oh, you, whom I loved so deeply and so tenderly, you, who will probably outlive me-do not go to my grave... (2) You have nothing to do there. (3) Do not forget me... but do not remember me in the midst of daily cares, pleasures and needs... (4) I don't want to interfere with your life, I don't want to interfere with its smooth flow. (5) But in the hours of solitude, when that shy and causeless sadness, so familiar to good hearts, comes upon you, take one of our favorite books and find in it those pages, those lines, those words from which, do you remember?  we both had sweet and silent tears at once. (6) Read, close your eyes, and extend your hand to me... (7) To an absent friend, extend your hand. (8) I will not be able to shake it with my hand – it will lie motionless under the ground... (9) But I am now glad to think that perhaps you will feel a light touch on your hand. (10) And my image will appear to you – and from under the closed eyelids of your eyes will flow tears like those tears that we, touched by Beauty, once shed together with you, O you, my only friend, O you, whom I loved so deeply and so tenderly!
(1) Обрадованная, Роллисон уходит, ксёнд: (1) Overjoyed, Rollison leaves, Father Peter remains. (2) The Senator tells Pelican to take her to her son's prison and lock her in the next cell. (3) The Doctor and the Pelican tell the senator that this matter should be dealt with quickly — Rollison has consumption, the guy is very bad: "Rollison is crazy — he tried to kill himself more than once, he rushes to the window, / And the windows are locked..." (4) However, the senator does not care about the fate of the young man. (5) He guesses that it was the priest who told the widow about her son. (6) He tries to involve the priest in his "plot" as well. (7) The secretary begins to draw up the minutes of the interrogation, and the senator threatens Peter. (8) But the priest does not confess how he learned of the young man's torment. (9) The priest is mocked, and when he asks if the shroud is ready for the senator, Novosiltsev orders to call the executioner. (10) Thanks to the doctor's suggestion, he begins to understand that through the priest, Prince Czartoryski can be attracted to the "plot": "If you approach skillfully, / I will give the prince ten years of trouble." (12) After showering the doctor with favors, the senator sends him away, and then orders the secretary to take Aesculapius into custody: the doctor knows too much and is quite suitable for a "conspiracy". (13) The priest predicts the doctor's imminent death.
(1) Заслуженная артистка России Валерия: (1) Honored Artist of Russia Valeria Kiseleva died on February 1 in St. Petersburg at the age of 63. Komissarzhevskaya. (9) Four years later, Kiselyova moved to the Leningrad Youth Theater, and in 1986 became an actress of the St. Petersburg Comedy Theater. Akimov. (1) Так умный аббат Гитрель стал монсень: (1) as smart Abbot Hytrel became Monsignor Harlem, Bishop turkuensis. (3) M. Bergeret settled in Paris with his sister Zoe and daughter Pauline. 4 he was given a chair at the sorbonne, his article in defence of dreyfus was published in the figaro, and among the honest men of his quarter he earned the reputation of having broken away from his brethren and not followed the defenders of the sabre and the kropil. (5) M. Bergeret hated forgers, which, as he thought, was permissible for a philologist. (6) For this innocent weakness, the newspaper of the right immediately declared him a German Jew and an enemy of the Fatherland. (7) M. Bergeret took this insult philosophically, for he knew that these wretched people had no future. (8) With all his being, this humble and honest man longed for change. (9) He dreamed of a new society in which everyone would receive full price for their work. (10) but, like a true sage, m. bergeret understood that he would not see the kingdom of the future, since all changes in the social order, as well as in the order of nature, occur slowly and almost imperceptibly. (11) therefore, man must work on the creation of the future as carpet-makers work on tapestries-without looking. (12) and his only tool is word and thought, unarmed and naked.
(1) В плену у Овцы Крыса увидел «Горнило: (1) in the captivity of the sheep, the rat saw "the furnace of the universe, in which everything and everything is melted down," divinely beautiful. \"(1) Парламент Молдавии выступил за зап: "(1) the moldovan parliament has called for a ban on advertising in cinemas. (2) the relevant bill, as transmitted by Publika.md, adopted in the first reading. (3) in accordance with the draft law, it is prohibited to show commercials before and after the film. (4) For violation of the ban, as previously reported, a fine of 1,000 to 6,000 lei ($80 to $ 480) is provided. (5) The document was initiated by representatives of the Liberal Party, one of the parties that make up the ruling parliamentary coalition. (6) "cinema-goers are annoyed by the stream of advertising that pours before the show. (7) We do not see advertising before performances in theaters, why should it be here?" - said the representative of the LP Corina Fusu. (8) her colleague valery munteanu, in turn, said that the bill was developed at the request of young people. (9) Representatives of the opposition Social Democratic and Communist parties opposed the ban. (10) They accused the authors of the bill of harassing entrepreneurs. (11) the leader of the social democratic party, viktor shelin (who, as reported, is the owner of the patria cinema chain), said that the introduction of a ban on advertising in the cinema will result in a rise in the price of tickets, reports Vesti.md (12) He previously argued that cinema owners, having lost their advertising revenue, would be forced to sharply raise ticket prices or close cinemas altogether. (13) The bill has already been approved by the government. (14) when it is planned to be adopted in the final reading, it is not specified."
(1) Генерал в отставке Отто Перес Молина: (1) Retired General Otto Perez Molina won the presidential election in Guatemala, Agence France-Presse reported on the morning of November 7. (2) the election was held on sunday, november 6. (3) according to the results of counting almost 90 percent of the ballots, molina has 55.2 percent of the vote, and his rival, businessman manuel baldison, has 44.8 percent. (4) Molina has already declared his victory and thanked the citizens who voted for him. (5) The presidential election in Guatemala was held in two rounds. (6) Molina won the first round with 36 percent of the vote. (7) Baldizon then was supported by just over 23 percent of the electorate. (8) Otto Perez Molina, 61, is the nominee of the Patriotic Party, and Manuel Baldison, 41, is the representative of the Democratic Party for the Revival of Freedom. (9) The main points of Molina's election campaign are the fight against organized crime and poverty in the country. (10) The previous President of the country was Alvaro Colom. (11) The constitution did not allow him to run for a second term. (12) In March 2011, Colom's wife Sandra Torres announced her desire to run for president in order to continue her husband's political line. (13) Since the country's constitution prohibits relatives and family members of the current head of state from fighting for the presidency, the couple filed for divorce. (14) Otto Perez Molina was among those who opposed the nomination of the country's first lady for the highest public office. (15) In June, the Supreme Court of Guatemala removed the country's first lady from the presidential election.
(1) На пути из Аргентины в Чили на коман: (1) On the way from Argentina to Chile, the team of a TV show about Top Gear cars and its accompanying police officers were attacked by outraged Argentines. (2) they threw stones at their cars. (3)in particular, the car in which the host of the show, jeremy clarkson, was driving. (4) One of the Argentine technicians was shot in the head. (5) this is reported by the daily mirror. (6) the cause of the conflict was the license plate of jeremy clarkson's car-h982 fkl, the letters in which are associated with the name of the falkland islands, and the numbers-with the year of the war, which was in 1982. (7) In Argentina, this was considered provocative and offensive. (8) The number caused a strong public outcry, so the Argentine authorities had to ask the Top Gear team to leave ahead of schedule. (9) The British were assigned a police convoy to escort them to the border with Chile. (10) However, this failed to protect Jeremy Clarkson's team from attack. (11) The Falklands War was a conflict between Argentina and Great Britain that occurred in 1982. (12) Both States claimed control of the Islands. (13) The war ended with a decisive victory for Great Britain, which controls them to this day. (14) however, many argentines refer to the islands as malvinas, insisting that they should belong to buenos aires.
(1) Тогда Нича и Лигурио отправляются к: (1) Then Nicha and Ligurio go to Fra Timoteo. (2) To begin with, Ligurio launches a trial balloon: a nun, a relative of Messer Calfucci, has accidentally become pregnant — can't we give the poor girl such a decoction that she will throw it away? (3) fra timoteo willingly agrees to help a rich man — according to him, the lord approves of everything that benefits people. (4) After leaving for a moment, Ligurio returns with the news that there is no need for the decoction, because the girl threw it herself — but there is an opportunity to do another good deed, making Messer Nitsch and his wife happy. (5) Fra Timoteo quickly figures out what the idea promises him, thanks to which you can expect a generous reward from both your lover and your husband — and both will be grateful to him for the rest of their lives. (6) It remains only to persuade Lucretia. (7) And Fra Timoteo easily copes with his task. (8) Lucrezia is kind and simple-minded: the monk assures her that the tramp may not die, but since there is such a danger, it is necessary to protect her husband. (9) And this "sacrament" cannot be called adultery, because it is performed for the benefit of the family and at the command of the spouse, who must be obeyed. (10) It is not the flesh that sins, but the will — for the sake of procreation, the daughters of Lot once copulated with their own father, and no one condemned them for it. (11) Lucrezia does not readily agree with the arguments of the confessor, and Sostrata promises her son-in-law that she will put her daughter to bed herself.
(1) Однажды лесной бурый медведь пошёл н: (1) One day a forest brown bear went north to the sea. (2) At this time, the sea polar bear went over the ice to the south, to the land. (3) At the very edge of the sea they met. (4) The polar bear's fur stood on end. (5) He said: "What are you doing, brown, walking on my land?" (6) The brown one answered, " When did you have it, earth?" (7) Your place is in the sea! (8) your land is an ice floe! (9) The polar bear reared up. (10) The brown bear reared up. (11) They grappled, and the fight began. (12) They fought until noon - no one prevailed. (13) They fought until evening. (14) Both were tired and sat down. (15) Are silent. (16) Brown was the first to speak. (17) He said: - You, white turns out to be stronger. (18) But I am more agile, more agile. (19) therefore, none of us will take the top. (20) and what should we share? after all, we are brothers.
(1) Приморский зоопарк «Садгород» начал: (1) the primorsky zoo "sadgorod" began searching for a female llama named fedor throughout the country and asked for help from both its visitors and other russian zookeepers. (2) this was reported to ria novosti by the director of the institution sergey asmolin. (3) "lama fedor has been living in the zoo for three years, he himself came from holland. (4) Help me find a female llama, preferably two. (5) We have searched, but so far without success. (6) We are ready to pay a good kalym and take a lama from any corner of Russia, " Asmolin said. (7) According to the head, a family of yaks and roe deer live in the neighboring enclosures with a llama, which have been breeding for several years. (8) In the enclosure opposite — a pair of wolves. (9) At first, Fedor just spat on everyone, and then became aggressive. (10) It became difficult for zoo staff to enter his enclosure for cleaning and feeding. (11) In order for the animal to become calmer, it needs to find a mate and produce offspring, zoologists explained. (12) In November 2015, two macaques were married in Barnaul. (13) The male Vasily was specially brought a bride by train from Moscow. (14) In order for him to find a mate, the male staged a riot. (15) How exactly he managed to influence the management of the zoo is unknown.
\"(1) Эмме Уотсон предложили роль в филь: "(1) Emma Watson was offered a role in the film Noah, which is being directed by Darren Aronofsky. (2) This is reported on the Deadline website.
