(1) Встреча с юной и романтичной Кларисс: (1) Meeting the young and romantic Clarissa mcleland knocks the hero out of the rut of his usual existence. (2) For the first time in many years, Montag understands that human communication is more than an exchange of memorized lines. (3) Clarissa stands out sharply from the mass of her peers who are obsessed with high-speed driving, sports, primitive entertainment in "Luna Parks" and endless TV series. (4) She loves nature, is prone to reflection and is clearly lonely. (5) Clarissa's question, "Are you happy?" forces Montag to take a fresh look at the life he leads-and millions of Americans with him. (6) Pretty soon he comes to the conclusion that, of course, this mindless existence cannot be called happy by inertia. (7) He feels the emptiness around him, the absence of warmth, humanity. (8) As if confirming his hunch about mechanical, robotic existence, the accident with his wife Mildred. (9) Returning home from work, Montag finds his wife unconscious. (10) She was poisoned with sleeping pills-not as a result of a desperate desire to lose her life, but mechanically swallowing pill after pill. (11) However, everything quickly falls into place. (12) An ambulance quickly arrives on Montag's call, and the medical technicians promptly perform a blood transfusion using the latest equipment, and then, having received the required fifty dollars, they leave for the next call.

(1) Жила-была в одном лесу большая стара: (1) Once upon a time there was a large old snail in a forest. (2) This snail had a very beautiful glade, it grew a lot of juicy leaves, berries and mushrooms. (3) The snail was very eager to leave her glade as an inheritance to one of her three sons, but could not decide who to choose. (4) After all, she loved all three of her children very much. (5) She thought, thought - and finally came up with it. (6) One day an old snail called her three sons to her and said: "My dear children, I am getting old, I will die soon. (7) I will leave all my glade as an inheritance to the one who first crosses the entire glade from our house to that oak tree, and brings me a leaf from that oak tree. (8) The snail brothers looked at the oak tree, and only opened their mouths. (9) - Why, Mother! - says the elder, - to this oak tree we have three days to crawl without stopping, and this is only in one direction. (10) But the old snail only smiled back. (11) There is nothing to do, each of the brothers wanted to receive such a rich inheritance. (12) So the brothers chose a warm, windless day and lined up in a row at the porch of the house. (13) The woodpecker struck the big stump three times with his beak, and the snails started. (14) Only the two older brothers crawled forward, and the youngest, the weakest and weakest, crawled back.

(1)Во внешней человеческой красоте вопло: (1) External human beauty embodies our ideas about the ideal of beauty. (2)External beauty is not only the anthropological perfection of all the elements of the body, not only health. (3)This is inner spirituality: a rich world of thoughts and feelings, moral dignity, respect for people and for yourself. (4) the higher the moral development and general level of spiritual culture of a person, the more clearly the inner spiritual world is reflected in the external features. (5)This "glow of the soul", as Hegel put it, is increasingly manifested, understood and felt by modern man. (6)The inner beauty is reflected in the outer appearance. (7)The unity of inner and outer beauty is an aesthetic expression of a person's moral dignity. (8) There is nothing shameful in the fact that a person strives to be beautiful. (9) But, it seems to me, it is necessary to have a moral right to this desire. (10)The morality of this aspiration is determined by the extent to which this beauty expresses the creative, active essence of a person. (11)the beauty of a person is most clearly manifested when he is engaged in his favorite activity, which by its nature emphasizes something good in him, characteristic of his personality. (12)At the same time, its external appearance is illuminated by internal inspiration. (13)It is no accident that Myron embodied the beauty of discobolus at the moment when the tension of internal spiritual forces is combined with the tension of physical forces, in this combination – the apotheosis of beauty. (14)External beauty has its own internal, moral origins: favorite creativity makes a person beautiful, transforms facial features – makes them subtle, expressive. (15) Immoral activity disfigures. (16)The habit of lying, hypocrisy, and empty talk creates a wandering look: a person avoids looking into the eyes of other people; it is difficult to see the thought in his eyes, he hides it. (17)Envy, selfishness, suspicion, fear of being "not appreciated" – all these feelings gradually coarsen the features of the face, give it a sullenness, unsociability. (18)To be oneself, to cherish one's dignity, is the living blood of genuine human beauty. (19)The ideal of human beauty is also the ideal of morality. (20)Ultimately, the unity of physical, moral, and aesthetic perfection is the harmony that is so much talked about. (By V. A. Sukhomlinsky*)
(1) Бывший защитник сборной Италии Марко: (1) Former Italy defender Marco Materazzi said that the words spoken to France midfielder Zinedine Zidane during the final match of the 2006 World Cup did not deserve an aggressive reaction. (1)А вообще люди – воспитуемы ли? (2)Это: (1) Are people generally educated? (2)This is one of the most interesting and, it seems, one of the most unsolvable questions of humanity. (3)To answer it, psychologists have long been conducting so – called longitudinal – long-term-studies of the same people, studying twins for years. (4)They try to find out what is natural in a person and what is nurtured. (5) and each time they get ambiguous results that can be interpreted this way and that. (6)But after all, we are all a bit of psychologists, all of us, wading through the thickness of time, unwittingly conduct our own longitudinal research, observing the same people for many years. (7) It is quite difficult to notice your age and the changes associated with it, because the inner self, known only to its owner and no one else, practically does not change. (8) Now, when I come to a more than solid age limit, inside myself I am exactly the same one that my mother took to kindergarten one morning and left there alone-without my mother. (9)I remember that State well, it is in me, it is a part Of me, and it cannot change. (10)I am Me. (11)You are you. (12) no effort can change me or you, reader. (13)Views, speeches, behavior change, but at the same time the person remains himself. (14)Rather, something essential remains unchanged in it. (15)What is it that remains in a person always and with all apparent changes? (16)According to my unscientific observations, every person has an unchangeable level of justice, a level of conscience that does not change throughout his life. (17) i do not know where it comes from or what it depends on (if i knew, it would be an important discovery in pedagogy) – but it is there. (18) It is this level that determines the degree of trust that a person evokes. (19)That there is such a constant level of conscience, everyone will confirm if he remembers his classmates, classmates, colleagues in the old days. (20)However, this poorly proven statement is worth nothing to refute, if you remember those who grow up and grew up before our eyes: "Just think, there was such a robber, and now such a nice person! "(According to S. Soloveitchik)

(1) Ничто не вечно, — говорит Пифагор, —: (1) Nothing is eternal, says Pythagoras, except the soul alone. (2) It lives, unchanging, changing its bodily forms, rejoicing in the new, forgetting about the old. (3) The soul of Pythagoras once lived in the Trojan hero Euphorbus; he, Pythagoras, remembers this, and people usually do not remember. (4)From the bodies of men the soul can pass into the bodies of animals, birds, and again men; therefore the wise will not eat meat. (5) " Like pliable wax, which is molded into new forms, / Does not remain one, does not have a single form, / But remains itself — - so exactly is the soul, remaining / The same, - so I say! "passes into various fleshies." (6) And every flesh, every body, and every substance is changeable. (7) Everything flows: moments, hours, days, seasons, ages of a person change. (8) The earth is thinned into water, water into air, air into fire, and again the fire is thickened into thunderclouds, the clouds are rained down, the rain makes the earth fat. (9) The mountains were the sea, and in them they find sea shells, and the sea floods the once dry plains; rivers dry up and new ones break through, islands break off from the mainland and merge with the mainland. (10) Troy was mighty, but now in the dust, Rome is now small and weak, but will be all-powerful: "In the world nothing stands, but everything is renewed forever."
(1)Дети никогда не запоминают мать молод: (1)Children never remember the mother of a young, beautiful mother, because the understanding of beauty comes later, when the mother's beauty has time to fade. (2) I remember my mother as gray-haired and tired, and they say she was beautiful. (3)large, thoughtful eyes, in which the light of the heart shone. (4)Even dark eyebrows, long eyelashes. (5)Smoky hair fell over his high forehead. (6)I can still hear her soft voice, her slow steps, the gentle touch of her hands, the rough warmth of her dress on her shoulder. (7)It has nothing to do with age, it is eternal. (8)Children never tell their mother of their love for her. (9) They do not even know the name of the feeling that binds them more and more to their mother. (10)In their understanding, this is not a feeling at all, but something natural and obligatory, like breathing, quenching thirst. (11) But the love of a child for its mother has its golden days. (12)I experienced them at an early age, when I first realized that the most necessary person in the world is my mother. (13)Memory retained almost no details of those early days, but I know your feeling, because it's still in me, vanished in the light. (14)And I'm saving it, because without the love of mother's heart, the cold emptiness. (15)I never called my mother mother, mother. (16)I had another word for her – mommy. (17)Even when I got big, I couldn't change that word. (18)I grew a mustache, got a bass. (19)I was embarrassed by this word and in public I said it almost inaudibly. (20)Last time I said it on the wet platform, the red soldiers of the van, in the crush, to the sound of alarming beeps of the engine, under the loud command, "all aboard!" - I didn't know what say goodbye to a mother... (By Yakovlev, Yu. Ya.)

(1) Случившееся землетрясение вынуждает: (1) The earthquake forces Robinson to think about a new place to live — it is not safe under the mountain. (9) and the island is rich in animals — hares (very tasteless), foxes, turtles (these, on the contrary, pleasantly diversify its table) and even penguins that cause confusion in these latitudes. (1)Каждый день перепрыскивали дожди. (2): (1) The rains were sprinkled every day. (2)In the end, the earth was so saturated with water that it did not take in any more moisture. (3) That is why, when a wide, dark hole was formed in the sky and a plentiful, summer-warm water gushed out, our quiet, peaceful river immediately began to swell and swell. (4)In every ravine, in every ditch, streams raced, leaping over the roots of trees, over rocks, as if their only task was to reach the river as quickly as possible and take part in its revelry. (5) I walked along the shore, not thinking about anything, admiring a truly extraordinary sight. (6)Never, with the most amicable melting of the deepest snows, was there such a flood, such a watering place on our river, as now. (7)Tall alder bushes now peeked out of the water with only their tops. (8) A monotonous faint squeak began to reach my ears, so faint that at first, although I heard it, I somehow did not pay attention, somehow it could not "finish squeaking" to me. (9)Maybe he was confused first with the squeaking and chirping of birds, and then he stood out to get attention. (10)I took a few steps along the bank, listened again, and then I saw at the toe of my own rubber boot, which seemed to me huge, a tiny dimple left by a cow's hoof. (11)In the hole, huddled in a ball, floundered tiny creatures, helpless, like all the cubs. (12) The Cubs were the size of adult mice or, better to say, moles, because they looked more like them in the color of their wet coats. (13)There were six of them, each trying to get the upper hand, so that they were all mixed up blindly, trampling and trampling the weakest. (14)I wanted to know whose cubs they were, so I looked around. (15)From behind the top of the alder tree, a muskrat looked at me with its black beads, frantically, continuously raking its paws to stay in one place (the current was carrying it away). (16)When she met my eyes, she swam quickly, fearfully, but the invisible connection with the cow's hoof held her like a thread. (17)Therefore, the muskrat swam not into the distance, but in a circle. (18)She went back to the alder bush and looked at me again, paddling tirelessly in one place, keeping on the water about two meters away from me, which is incredible for this timid animal. (19)It was heroism, it was self-sacrifice of the mother, but it could not have been otherwise: after all, the cubs screamed so anxiously and so invitingly! (20)I finally left, so as not to interfere with the mother doing her eternal job-to save her children. (by v. a. soloukhin)

\"(1) Вратарь омского \"Авангарда\" Кари: "(1) Goalkeeper of Omsk "Avangard" Kari Ramo missed the puck after a shot from the opponent's goal. (3) In the 16th minute of the match, Ramo did not cope with the throw of defender Andrey Kuteikin, who threw the puck out of the zone. (4) The match was broadcast by the channel "Russia 2". (5) When Kuteikin scored a goal, Salavat Yulaev played in the minority. (6) After the defender's throw, the puck passed Ramo between the shields, and the score became 2:1 in favor of the Ufa team. (7) Immediately after this goal, Avangard head coach Raimo Summanen replaced Ramo with Alexey Kuznetsov. (8) As a result, the match ended with a score of 4:3 in favor of Salavat Yulaev. (9) In addition to Kuteikin, Igor Grigorenko scored three goals for Ufa. (10) The goals of Avangard were scored by Sergey Sentyurin, Dmitry Semin and Jaromir Jagr. (11) After defeating Avangard, Salavat Yulaev finished in second place in the Eastern Conference (and the entire KHL). (12) The team scored 23 points in 11 games. (13) Metallurg Magnitogorsk have 26 points in 11 games, and later on October 7, Magnitogorsk will play away to Ugra."
(1) После смерти матери тётя Даша и сосе: (1) After the death of her mother, Aunt Dasha and neighbor Skovorodnikov decide to send Sanya and her sister to an orphanage. (2) Then Sanya and his friend Petya Skovorodnikov flee to Moscow, and from there to Turkestan. (3) "Fight and seek, find and do not give up" — this oath supports them on the way. (4) The boys reach Moscow on foot, but Petka's uncle, on whom they counted, has gone to the front. (5) After three months of almost free work for speculators, they have to hide from inspection. (6) Petka manages to escape, and Sanya goes first to the distribution center for street children, and from there to the commune school. (7) Sana likes school: he reads and sculpts from clay, he has new friends — Valka Zhukov and Chamomile. (8) One day, Sanya helps to carry a bag to an unknown old woman who lives in the apartment of the head of the school, Nikolai Antonovich Tatarinov. (9) here, sanya meets katya, a pretty but somewhat self-interested girl with pigtails and dark, lively eyes. (10) After a while, Sanya again finds himself in the familiar Tatarinovs ' house: Nikolai Antonovich sends him there for a lactometer, a device for checking the composition of milk. (11) But the lactometer explodes. (12) Katya is going to take the blame on herself, but the proud Sanya does not allow her to do this.
(1) Г-н Бержере не ведал грусти, ибо был: (1) M. Bergeret was not sad, for he was at last free. (2) He was absorbed in arranging the new apartment to his liking. (3) The dreaded cowgirl was paid off, and the virtuous Mrs. Bornish took her place. (4) it was she who brought into the house of the latinist a being who became his best friend. (5) One morning, Mrs. Bornish laid a puppy of an indeterminate breed at her master's feet. (6) While Monsieur Bergeret was climbing up on a chair to get a book from the top shelf of the bookcase, the dog was sitting comfortably in the chair. (7) monsieur bergeret fell from a rickety chair, and the dog, despising the comfort and comfort of the chair, rushed to save him from a terrible danger and, in consolation, lick his nose. (8) Thus the Latinist gained a loyal friend. (9) To top it all off, Monsieur Bergeret received the coveted position of ordinary professor. (10) The joy was marred only by the shouts of the crowd under his windows, who, knowing that the professor of Roman law sympathized with the Jew convicted by a military tribunal, demanded the blood of the venerable Latinist. (11) But he was soon delivered from provincial ignorance and fanaticism, for he received a course not anywhere, but at the Sorbonne.
(1) Первым умер от чумы привратник в дом: (1) the porter of the doctor's house was the first to die of the plague. (2) No one in the city yet suspects that the disease that has struck the city is the plague. (3) The number of cases increases every day. (4) dr. rieux orders a serum in paris, which helps the patients, but only slightly, and soon it ends. (5) it becomes obvious to the prefecture of the city that it is necessary to declare a quarantine. (6) Oran becomes a closed city. (7) One evening the doctor is summoned by an old patient of his, an employee of the mayor's office, named Grand, whom the doctor treats free of charge because of his poverty. (8) His neighbor, Cottar, tried to commit suicide. (9) Granu is not clear about the reason for this step, but later he draws the doctor's attention to the strange behavior of his neighbor. (10) After this incident, Cottard begins to show unusual courtesy in dealing with people, although he was previously unsociable. (11) The doctor suspects that Cottard has a guilty conscience, and now he is trying to earn the favor and love of others.
(1) Вместе с Тоней Громеко накануне Рожд: (1) Together with Tonya Gromeko on Christmas Eve, they were driving to the Sventitskys ' Christmas tree along Kamergersky Lane. (2) Recently, Anna Ivanovna, who had been ill for a long time, joined their hands, saying that they were made for each other. (3) Tonya was really close and understanding to him. (4) It was at this moment that she caught his mood and did not prevent him from admiring the frosted, glowing windows from within, in one of which Yuri noticed a black thaw, through which the candle flame was visible, turned to the street almost with the consciousness of a glance. (5) In this moment and born of the row not yet issued the verse: "the Candle was burning on the table, a candle burned..." (6) He did not know that outside of Lara Guichard said at this point, Pasha Antipov, who since childhood, his adoration, what if he loves her and wants to keep from destruction, they should immediately get married. (7) After that, Lara went to the Sventitskys, where Yura and Tonya were having fun in the hall, and where Komarovsky was sitting at cards. (8) About two o'clock in the morning, a shot suddenly rang out in the house. (9) Lara, shooting at Komarovsky, missed, but the bullet grazed a fellow prosecutor of the Moscow court chamber. (1) Лидер ЛДПР Владимир Жириновский в хо: (1) The leader of the LDPR, Vladimir Zhirinovsky, during a visit to the agricultural market in Ryazan, shared with the residents of the city recommendations for choosing watermelons. (4) The politician pointed out that " a good watermelon rings, and there should be a yellow spot on the side, "while"the root is dry and hard." (5) "I am from Central Asia myself. (6) Them (watermelons-approx. "Of the tape.<url>") the time is the end of August, and they were brought to Ryazan at the end of July. (1) Воспалённое состояние Поли, а главно: (1) Paulie's inflamed state, and above all, her confused, ambiguous speech, all suggested the worst guesses, much more terrible than even Rodion's captivity or his fatal wound. (2) –but no, this is completely different, – shuddered polya and, turning to the wall, took out a crumpled, read-out triangle from under the pillow. (3) Subsequently, Varya was ashamed of her initial assumptions. (4) Although rare transit trains did not stay in Moscow, but the train stations were nearby, and Rodion knew Pauline's address. (5) Of course, the command could not allow the soldier to leave the echelon in the Blagoveshchensk cul-de-sac, then why didn't he at least write a postcard to his own, beloved, passing through the active army?.. (6) So this was his first front-line message, more than two weeks late. (7) In any case, now it will be found out with what thoughts he went to war. (8) Varya impatiently unfolded the sheet, which was all pierced with a pencil – it must have been written on her knee. (9) I had to go to the lamp to make out the dim, half-finished lines. (10) Varya immediately came across the main place. (11) "Perhaps the only reason, my dear, why silent all the time, there was no place to settle down – briefly, with unexpected fullness and straightforward, as in confession, wrote the judge. (12) – We retreating the while, day and night retreat, occupied a more advantageous defensive positions, as stated in the reports. (13) I was very ill besides, and now not yet completely recovered: worse than any concussion my illness. (14) The most bitter thing is that I myself am quite healthy, all intact, there is not a single scratch on me yet. (15) Burn this letter, I can tell you about it alone in the whole world – " Varya turned the page. (16) The incident occurred in a Russian village, which our unit was passing in retreat. (17) I was the last in the company... and in front of us on the road stood a local girl of nine years old, just a child, apparently, on the school bench, accustomed to love the Red Army... (18) She ran up to us with wildflowers, and, as it happened, they got to me. (19) She had such inquisitive, questioning eyes – the midday sun is a thousand times easier to look at, but I forced myself to take the bouquet, closed my eyes, and took it from her, abandoned to the mercy of the enemy... (20) Since then I have kept that dried broom constantly with me, on my body, like a fire in my bosom, I will tell it to put it in the grave, if anything happens.
(1) Леон вновь сближается с Калдманами,: (1) Leon again gets close to the Caldmans, visits them at the villa and sings to them in the evenings, leading them to delight. (2) The singer does not believe in love, remembering the treachery of Gabriela, and is not seriously attached to anyone. (3) magda tells the hero the secret of her past, convincing him that love exists. (4) On another visit to Leon's villa with his girlfriend Nicole, Gabriela also rushed there. (1) Граф Монте-Кристо приобретает в Пари: (1) The Count of Monte Cristo acquires several apartments in Paris and a house in Auteuil, 28 Rue Fontaine, formerly owned by the Marquis de Saint-Meran. (2) The Count's steward, Bertuccio, sees their move to this house as an evil fate. (3) Many years ago, he witnessed de Villefort bury a newborn baby in the garden of his father — in — law's house-the illegitimate son of an unknown lady, Bertuccio hurried to dig up the box-the baby was still alive. (4) Bertuccio's daughter-in-law brought up a boy, to whom they gave the name Benedetto. (5) The offspring of famous parents took the wrong path and ended up in prison. (6) But this is only one of the two terrible stories that Bertuccio hid from the Count. (7) In June, 1829, he stopped at the inn of Caderousse — the day after the Abbe Busoni had been there (8) (Bertuccio does not realize that the abbe who rescued him long ago from penal servitude and the Count are the same person). (9) Caderousse sold the Abbe's diamond for 45,000 francs to a reliable jeweller, and that very night he stabbed him to death. (10) Now Caderousse is where Bertuccio also happened to be: in hard labor. (11) The Count is sure that this is not the last drop in the cup that Caderousse must drink; as for Benedetto-if he lives-he will serve as a weapon of God's punishment...
\"(1) Руководитель Федеральной налоговой: "(1) The head of the Federal Tax Service (FTS), Mikhail Mokretsov, may resign in the near future. (2) The newspaper Vedomosti writes about the upcoming change of the chief tax officer. (3) Sources of the publication in the government and the State Duma claim that Mokretsov will leave the Federal Tax Service within a few weeks. (4) He allegedly already managed to gather his subordinates to inform them of the imminent appearance of the government's order for his resignation. (5) The newspaper claims that Mokretsov is going to move to another ministry, because he wanted another job. (6) Recently, businessmen have complained about the Federal Tax Service to President Dmitry Medvedev, calling for easing pressure from inspectors. (7) With the arrival of Mokretsov in 2007, the policy of the Federal Tax Service in relation to companies has become softer, but it is still impossible to call it friendly, the publication notes. (8) In addition, the pressure on business increased again during the crisis. (9) Mikhail Mokretsov was born in 1961 in Udmurtia. (10) Graduated from the Leningrad Institute of Finance and Economics in 1984. (11) Then worked in senior positions in state and commercial organizations in St. Petersburg. (12) In 2000, Mokretsov joined the tax authorities. (13) In 2007, he replaced Anatoly Serdyukov, who was appointed Minister of Defense, as head of the Federal Tax Service. (14) Tax collections, along with customs, form a large part of the Russian budget. (15) In 2009, the Federal Tax Service exceeded the cut-down plan for fees, although it was reported that the tax authorities would not be able to do so."
(1) Бывшему президенту Пакистана Первезу: (1) Former Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf has been charged with involvement in the 2007 murder of radical cleric Abdul Rashid Ghazi. (2) This is reported by Agence France-Presse. (3) Rashid Ghazi was one of about 100 people killed in the July 2007 assault on the Red Mosque in Islamabad. (4) It was taken over by extremist religious students led by this preacher. (5) Islamists barricaded in the mosque demanded that Sharia law be established in Pakistan. (6) This is the third murder charge against Musharraf. (7) On August 20, he was formally charged with the 2007 death of opposition leader Benazir Bhutto in a terrorist attack. (8) The former President was charged with murder, criminal conspiracy to murder and accessory to murder. (9) he was also implicated by the prosecutor's office in the 2006 death of akbar khan bugti, a separatist leader in balochistan province. (10) musharraf was arrested in april 2013 after voluntarily returning to pakistan from london to participate in the parliamentary elections. (11) Islamabad had previously tried unsuccessfully for about five years to get him extradited from the UK. (12) Pervez Musharraf, who came to power in a coup, was Prime Minister and then President of Pakistan from 1999-2008. (13) He left the country because of the threat of impeachment. (14) He is being held under house arrest in preparation for the trial.
(1) Квартирой отчётливо просунулся мне в: (1) the outside world has clearly appeared to me as an apartment; in the first moments of consciousness, there are rooms, corridors, which if you enter, you will not return back; but you will be covered by objects that are not yet clear. (2) There, among the chairs in gray covers, I see my grandmother's face in the tobacco smoke, her bare skull covered with a cap, and something menacing in her appearance. (3) In the dark labyrinths of the corridors there, Doctor Dorionov is stomping towards me — he appears to me as a bull-headed minotaur. (4) The world swarms to me with the swaying of flying lines in the oboi drawings, surrounds me with serpent-footed myths. (5) i am going through a catacomb period; the walls are permeable, and it seems that if they collapse, the desert will appear in the ribs of the pyramids, and there: a lion. (6) I remember distinctly the cry, "The lion is coming," the shaggy mane and snarling mouth, the huge body among the yellowing sands. (7) I was later told that the Lion was a St. Bernard, and that he would approach the children playing on the Dog Playground. (8) But later I thought: it was not a dream and not reality. (9) But the lion was; they shouted: "The lion is coming," and the Lion was coming. Life is growth; in excrescences life becomes, in ugliness the first excrescence was to me an image. (10) The first images are myths: a man-he contacted my grandmother, — an old woman, I saw something of a bird of prey in her, — a bull and a lion....

(1) Но главными были не они. (2) Главным: (1) But they were not the main ones. (2) The Titans were the chief, the twelve sons and daughters of Uranus and Gaia. (3) Uranus was afraid that they would overthrow him, and did not allow them to be born. (4) One by one they swelled the womb of mother Earth, and now it became unbearable for her. (5)" Of gray iron " she forged a magic sickle and gave it to the children; and when Uranus again wanted to unite with her, the youngest and most cunning of the Titans, named Cronus, cut off his child-bearing member. (6) With a curse, Uranus recoiled from the sky, and his severed member fell into the sea, whipped up a white foam, and from this foam came ashore the goddess of love and desire Aphrodite — "Foam". (7) The second kingdom began — the kingdom of the Titans: Cronus and his brothers and sisters. (8) One of them was called Oceanus, and he was related to old Nereus, and from him were born all the streams and rivers in the world. (9) The other was called Hyperion, and from him were born the Sun-Helios, the moon-Selene, and the Dawn-Eos, and from the Dawn — the winds and the stars. (10) The third was called Iapetus, and from him were born the mighty Atlantean, who stands in the west of the earth and holds the sky on his shoulders, and the wise Prometheus, who is chained to a post in the east of the earth, and for what — this will be discussed later. (11) But Cronus was the chief, and his dominion was troubled.

(1) Фанаты иерусалимского «Бейтара» сорв: (1) Fans of Beitar Jerusalem disrupted the team's open pre-season training session. (2) This is reported by Interfax. (3) Hooligans broke through the fence around the field at the training base and started a riot using pyrotechnics. (4) Some players who expressed support for Chechen legionnaires Zaur Sadayev and Dzhabrail Kadiyev at the end of last season were stoned. (5) Seven of the attackers were arrested. (6) They face up to six months in prison. (7) Sadayev and Kadiyev joined Beitar from Terek in the middle of the 2012/2013 season, becoming the first Muslim players in the club's history. (8) the appearance of muslims in the line-up was sharply negatively met by fans who repeatedly held aggressive protests. (9) on february 7, the club office was burned down, and the beitara museum was damaged by fire. (10) during the games, fans insulted sadayev and kadiyev. (11) The owner of the club, Arkady Gaydamak, who invited Chechens to Jerusalem, as well as members of his family, also began to be insulted. (12) In April 2013, Sadayev and Kadiyev left Beitar. (13) At the same time, Gaydamak expressed a desire to sell the team. (14) In June, Gaydamak announced his intention to cede the club to Chechen businessmen, which caused another wave of protests. (15) The team was eventually transferred to Israeli businessman Eli Tabib, who agreed to repay its debts in the amount of 12.5 million shekels ($3.45 million).

(1) Благодаря стараниям Давида Шапиро Ге: (1) Thanks to the efforts of David Shapiro, Gersh is released. (2) David has strange conversations with Gersh: Gersh does not believe that there are streets where Jews cannot settle, believes that Jews have secret institutions. (3) By chance, Sarah learns that Hersh has an account in a large bank. (4) She is surprised that the tenant never says anything about his family. (5) He gives strange answers to questions, and Sarah does not understand how this can happen in a Jewish family. (6) Gersh evasively says that he is an orphan and the only heir of a rich relative. (7) It also surprises Sarah and David that the young man does not say "with us" but "with you"when talking about the Jews. (8) But nevertheless Sarah does not object to Gersh and Betty being destined for each other. (9) Hersh invites Betty to the theater. (10) There he wants to reveal his secret alone with the girl. (11) He is ready for the fact that his family does not recognize marriage with a rootless, and even a Jewish woman, but Betty herself does not recognize such love. (12) Gersh expects that after learning about his title and fortune, the Shapiro family will only be happy.

(11) korney chukovsky said that he composed poetry only in those rare moments when he was truly happy. (12) the storyteller sergei sedov echoes him: "the holiday should be shared! \"(1) Жена Виктора Бута Алла передала в: "(1) viktor bout's wife alla submitted a request to the ministry of justice of the russian federation for his extradition to his homeland. (2) She told Interfax about this on Friday, July 6. (3) after receiving the request, moscow will be able to apply to washington with a formal request for extradition. (4) the united states, according to the 1983 convention, will have to satisfy or reject russia's request as soon as possible. (5)in may 2012, us attorney general eric holder said that he was ready to consider the extradition of a russian citizen if requested. (6) As RIA Novosti notes, in addition to the consent of Russia and the United States, the consent of the convict himself will be required to return Bout to his homeland. (7) Only after he gives it, the US Department of Justice will be able to consider Moscow's request. (8) In this case, must first complete the appeals process in the case of booth. (9) Earlier, representatives of the Russian Foreign Ministry repeatedly promised to do everything possible to facilitate the return of Viktor Bout to Russia. (10) Viktor Bout was arrested in Thailand in 2008 on suspicion of illegal arms trafficking. (11) Six months later, he was extradited to the United States, where in March 2012, the Russian was sentenced to 25 years in prison. (12) He was found guilty of conspiring with a terrorist organization - the Colombian FARC rebels - and of smuggling weapons. (13) Bout pleaded not guilty, and his lawyers are appealing the court's decision. (14) Moscow called the Russian's sentence " unfounded and biased.""
(1)Мальчика звали Халматов Каля, родите: (1) The boy's name was Khalmatov Kala, his parents were killed in an earthquake. (2) Among other orphaned children, he was sent to an orphanage for young children, and what nationality there is — many of them did not even know their last name. (3) Only later did it become clear that he was not a Turkmen — Guzs do not have such faces, such slanted faces, with narrow, long eyes set far apart. (4) And often after school he disappeared for many hours and only appeared in the evening. (5)They asked him — " Where was he?" (6)He answered listlessly: "I went to see Sultan-Sanjar."What were you doing there?" - Yes, so... just walked. (7)Sometimes he dug with the workmen, sometimes he carried water from the camp in light aluminum buckets, and once he was allowed into the stable and was present at the processing of the material. (8) They put him to eat with them, and it was some kind of joyful food, much more joyful than in the orphanage (although they fed him in the orphanage and more calories and more satisfying). (9)He enjoyed listening to them talk about people and objects he didn't know at all, their jokes and nicknames and practical jokes, and even sometimes sharp and rude-looking bickering, which quickly and without malice died down. (10)Kalya knew what anger was, and he was afraid of anger, and he liked these kind, talkative and hardworking people. (11)but he especially liked the professor. (12)the professor was vigorously waving an umbrella over his head on a thin bent cane, saying something quickly and loudly, and the boy listened with amazement to this speech, this strong baritone, words pronounced freely and imperiously, slightly rounded with a slight burr. (13)the boy, however, was surprised that this man then squatted down and dug in the ground for a long time and said something to another, a young man, and the latter dared to argue with him. (14)The boy looked at the disputant with distaste, but then he saw that the professor was not offended, and calmed down. (15)He was surprised that the professor dined with everyone else, right in the field, just like everyone else, drank green tea, burning himself, and ate lean kaurma, dried lamb meat. (16)The professor noticed the boy looking at him intently, and casually asked him — - (17)What are you, a worker? (18) Kalya hesitated, did not know how to answer. (19)The boy thought that the professor would send him away: archaeologists did not like to have strangers standing around and staring at their work, but the professor did not say anything. (20) And he spoke much more about the ancient Guzs, that is, the Turkmens, what their habits, rites, and customs were, and about their system, and about their families. (By V. Amlinsky)
(1) В замке сэр Дэниэл готовится к оборо: (1) In the castle, Sir Daniel prepares for defense — most of all, he fears the "forest brothers". (2) Every moment ready to betray his former supporters, he sends a letter by messenger to his friend, who is a member of the Lancastrian party. (3) Meanwhile, Dick tries to find out the circumstances of his father's death, thereby incurring the wrath of Sir Daniel. (4) He is moved to a room above the chapel, and Dick feels that it is a trap. (5) john suddenly appearing confirms his guesses. (6) Indeed, the murderer is already opening the secret hatch, but he is distracted by the search for some Joanna that has begun in the castle. (7) Dick's friend confesses that he is Joanna, and they vow to join their fates. (8) Through a secret trapdoor, Dick leaves the castle and, after crossing the moat with difficulty, wanders into the forest. (9) There he finds the hanged messenger and takes possession of the letter, after which he surrenders to the robbers. (10) He is taken to the leader. (11) Duckworth greets the boy cordially and vows to take revenge on Sir Daniel for him and for himself. (12) Through the peasants, Dick sends his former guardian a letter warning him against arranging the marriage of his betrothed.
(1) Спросим себя: что такое счастье? (2): (1) Ask yourself: what is happiness? (2)What is behind this word? (3)Each country has its own Main teacher-the people and the Main textbook-the language. (4) I should not explain what happiness is, I should humbly ask our language about it – it has everything, you can understand everything from it, listening to the word in our speech today. (5)Popular thought is contained not only in proverbs and sayings, in folk wisdom, but also in common, ordinary phrases and turns of speech. (6) Let's look for: what other words combine the concept we are interested in, why it is possible to say so, and so it is impossible. (7)It's never random. (8) We say: "lucky share", "lucky chance", "lucky fate", "happiness rolled", "drew a lucky ticket". (9)The most active people, who have achieved everything by their work, say: "I have had happiness, I have been given happiness... "(10)Happiness is fortune, a fate about which we know nothing, and if it is not there, then they say: "This is my fate", " It seems that I was born so." (11)But we will not once again encounter the law of spiritual life: everything that is in man arises from two counter-movements, from two forces: from a movement directed from the world to man, and from man to the world. (12)These opposing forces, meeting at one point, are not destroyed, but add up. (13)But if the meeting does not take place, then both forces seem to have been absent. (14)Suppose a person has no luck in anything, misfortunes haunt him, and perhaps he was born with a heavy share. (15)Not everyone will be able to defeat fate. (16)But a strong man knows how to use the most inconspicuous chance, which, of course, is in everyone's life: he conquers fate. (17)Or rather, not fate, but the difficulties that are sent to him by fate. (18) And if you do not have your own desire to win, the desire for happiness, then at least make it rich – there will be no happiness. (By S. L. Soloveitchik*)
(1)Немцы были изгнаны из Умани, и на ули: (1)The Germans were driven out of Uman, and in the streets of the city there were cars, armored personnel carriers and tanks that they had abandoned in flight. (2) The city still smelled of burning, that animal, stuffy smell that fleeing masses of people leave behind, and the stench of rotting food: there were barrels of cucumbers and cabbage in the trucks. (3)In one of the streets, through a broken window on the ground floor, I saw piles of books piled on the floor. (4) The type of books always excites me, and I went into a room in which I immediately identified the library by the shelves. (5)There seemed to be no one in the room, but when I looked closer, I saw the mournful figures of two middle-aged women sorting books in the next room. (6)Some of the books were already on the shelves. (7) I approached the women and we met: one was a Russian language teacher, Zinaida Ivanovna Valyanskaya, the other was the librarian of the district library, Yulia Alexandrovna Panasevich, and the books lying on the floor were dragged from the underground, where they had survived the entire occupation. (8) i picked up one of the books — it was a textbook of economic geography, but after turning over a few pages, i turned to the title of the book with bewilderment: it did not correspond to the content in any way. (9)"we have a lot of work to do," said one of the women, "because by order of the gebitskommissar opp, we had to destroy all the books on the attached list," and she took out of the drawer a whole bundle of sheets with cramped lines of typewriting: it was a list of books to be destroyed— - (10)We've been pasting the title pages from old textbooks and various other books, and we've managed to salvage almost everything that needed to be destroyed — "the woman added with satisfaction —" so don't be surprised if a volume of Pushkin's works, for example, is called a manual of embroidery. (11)It was true: two courageous women had saved an entire district library by pasting other titles into books to be destroyed or putting them in other bindings. (12) And now they were sorting out their riches, restoring what Kramm, the library director-designate, had ordered them to tear to shreds. (13)in uman, in the premises of the district library, i was convinced of the immortality of the book. (by v. g. lidin*)
(1)Так, наверно, они и дошли бы до тепла: (1) so, probably, they would have reached the heat, if not for this damned wind. (2) the woman decided to take her companion's arm from the other side, so as to block the wind a little, and, therefore, he had to intercept the cane in his left hand. (3) he did so, and now only lyubov vladimirovna noticed his cane — - (4)what have you got?" Are you limping?" — (5)No, just a walking stick — - (6)Fancy Dress? — (7)A beautiful male object, worn for centuries... — (8)probably, and expensive? — (9)not really... but of course, ebony, ivory, work... — (10)throw it into the neva. (11)after two steps, the woman stopped, seeing that the man did not respond to her order in any way, and repeated clearly, clearly and loudly: - (12)Throw it into The neva!- (13)What a fantasy, really... — (14)We won't move from this place until you throw her into the Neva. (15)rather, we will go in different directions — i go home, and you go to the trolley.- (16)this is a whim, my dear lyubov vladimirovna. — (17)Well, let it be a whim. (18)A woman is entitled to a whim. (19)Are the three days that are waiting for you not worth a little whim? (20)After all, I'm not asking you to jump into the Neva yourself. (By v. Soloukhin)
\"(1) Главный тренер московского «Спарта: "(1) Spartak Moscow head coach Massimo Carrera compared the red-whites to Juventus in Turin. (2) On Friday, November 4, itasportpress reports. (3 )" I accepted Spartak because it is the Russian Juventus. (4) This is a strong team with great traditions. (5) I was supposed to work with the defenders, but after Alenichev left, I was asked to take his place for a couple of games," the Italian specialist said. (6)He also noted that the main problem of working in Russia is the cold. (7) "i try to convey to my players my passion for football, my knowledge. (8) Players follow me and give 120 percent. (9) The fans see it, " Carrera said. (10) The Italian took charge of Spartak on August 17 after the resignation of Dmitry Alenichev. (11) The coach was assigned the task of winning the Russian Cup and taking a prize-winning place in the championship. (12) In the RFPL standings, the red and white team occupies the first line, with 28 points to their credit. (13) The team won nine victories, drew once and suffered two defeats. (14) In the Russian Cup, Spartak failed to overcome the stage of the 1/16 final, losing away to SKA-Khabarovsk. (15) The match was held on September 21 and ended with a score of 1:0 in favor of the home team."
(1) Я никогда не называл свою мать матер: (1) I never called my mother mother, mother. (2) I had another word for her – mommy. (3)Even when I got big, I couldn't change that word. (4)I have grown a mustache, a bass voice. (5) I was shy about the word and used it in public in a barely audible voice. (6)The last time I uttered it was on the platform, wet from the rain, by the red soldier's hot car, in the crush, to the sound of the alarm horns of the engine, to the loud command " to the cars!". (7) I didn't know that I was saying goodbye to my mother forever. (8) i whispered "mommy" in her ear and, so that no one could see my man's tears, wiped them on her hair... (9)But when the van started, could not have forgotten that I am a man, soldier, forgot there are people around, a lot of people, and through the roar of wheels, through the eye, the wind cried: - Mommy! (10)And then there were the letters. (11) And the letters from home had one extraordinary property, which everyone discovered for himself and did not admit his discovery to anyone. (12)In the most difficult moments, when it seemed that everything was over or would end in the next moment and there was no longer a single clue to life, we found in letters from home an inviolable supply of life. (13)When my mother's letter came, there was no paper, no envelope with the field mail number, no lines. (14)There was only my mother's voice, which I could hear even in the roar of the guns, and the smoke of the dugout touched my cheek like the smoke of my own home. (15)On New Year's Eve, my mother told me in detail about the Christmas tree in a letter. (16)It turns out that in the closet accidentally found Christmas candles, short, colorful, like sharpened colored pencils. (17) they were lit, and the fragrance of stearin and pine needles spread from the fir branches throughout the room. (18)The room was dark, and only the merry will-o ' - the-wisps faded and flared, and the gilded walnuts glimmered dimly. (19)Then it turned out that all this was a legend that my dying mother had composed for me in the ice house, where all the windows were blown out by the blast wave, and the stoves were dead and people were dying of hunger, cold and shrapnel. (20)And she wrote, from the ice-blockaded city sending me the last drops of her warmth, the last blood. (By Yu. Ya. Yakovlev*)
(1) Жил был богач. (2) Было у него много: (1) There was a rich man. (2) He had many cows and a large, very large bull. (3) When the herd was driven to graze in the forest, the tiger always said: "I would like to eat this bull, it is so fat. (4) I would have been full for many days." (5)There was also a thief. (6) he always said, too: "I wish I could steal that bull. (7) I would sell it and get a lot of money." (8) One day the tiger actually decided to drag the bull away. (9) The thief also planned the same thing. (10) The tiger climbed into the cornfield during the day, hid there and waited. (11)" Let the people go to sleep, "he says to himself," then I will immediately grab the bull and drag it into the forest. "(12) And the thief in the dark came across the tiger and thinks: "The bull came out of the cowshed. (13) I do not have to steal it. (14) He came to me of his own accord." (15) He took a rope and threw it over the tiger. (16) He tied the rope around his neck and pulled him along – he pulls and treats him with a stick. (17) The morning is very near, and he keeps dragging him to the forest and hitting him on the head with all his might, so that the tiger is completely stunned. (18) it began to dawn. (19) The thief looks: mothers, it's a tiger! (20) At once threw the rope and ran without looking back: he himself in one direction, and the tiger – in the other, straight into the forest with all his legs ran.
(1)Дискуссии о состоянии русского языка: (1)Discussions about the state of the Russian language have been going on since the mighty centuries of the past: A. S. Pushkin, F. I. Tyutchev, A. I. Herzen, V. G. Belinsky, F. M. Dostoevsky. (2)Now for us their disputes, reflections on the fate of their native language are high lessons of Russian literature, human thought. (3) As for the "degradation", "weakening", and even the inevitable "death" of the Russian language and literature – this is nothing more than hyperbole, based quite often on a sincere, natural and understandable concern for the fate of their people, especially in times of change and upheaval. (4) The current upheavals and profound changes in Russia are, in my opinion, more in the minds and souls of people. (5) For the Russian language, they do not seem to me very significant, if we recall such tests as the "Mongol invasion" or Peter's "window to Europe". (6) The"East wind" and the "west wind" come and go, unable to shake the mighty tree of the Russian language, rooted in centuries and in wide expanses, only refreshing it, and therefore strengthening it. (7) In such cases, trials, the mighty ocean of the great language (and not only Russian), with its incomparable mass, power, energy, measured and tireless work, will cut and polish other people's words, adapting them to their own needs, sprinkle them with the living keys of their native land, taking into folk speech, writing, fiction. (8) So it was. (9)Apparently, it will be so. (10)Two hundred thousand words of V. I. Dahl's dictionary alone-isn't it an ocean? (11)Someone else's will grind, grind, and dirty with foam will throw away. (12)Ordinary, current, spelling dictionary, and that – a hundred thousand words, each of which is not an old mold, but a living speech, which, of course, is richer than any dictionaries, no wonder they draw generously from it, but the bottom, thank God, is not visible. (13)Russian Russian language not only lives, but gives life! (14) Tolstoy, Turgenev, Sholokhov, Shukshin did not set themselves the task of protecting the Russian language. (15)They did it naturally, because they were born on the Russian land, from which they received a great gift and disposed of it with dignity. (16)That's the whole explanation. (17)For me personally, it is thorough. (18) To the best of my ability and ability, I follow it, understanding my small strength. (19)But on the farm Maloulbinskoe springs are clearing all small kids from elementary school. (20)These springs Yes, the keys are flowing gradually, making the river a Small Blue, Rostoshi, Eraslan and further to the don, its mighty waters. (by b. P. Ekimov)
(1) Провинциальный советник Долбоносов,: (1) The provincial councillor Dolbonosov, being once on business in St. Petersburg, happened to be at Prince Fingalov's house for an evening. (2) At this evening, by the way, to his great surprise, he met a law student, Shchepotkin, who had been his children's tutor about five years ago. (3) He had no acquaintances at the party, and out of boredom he went up to Shchepotkin.— (4) You are it.. tovo.. how did you get here?— What is it? " he asked, yawning into his fist.— (5) Just like you..— (6) That is, let's say, not like me..— Dolbonosov frowned, looking Shepotkina.— (7) Um.. or something.. how are you doing? - (8) So-so.. (9) I finished my course at the university and serve as an official of special assignments under Podokonnikov..— (10) Yes? (11) This is not bad at first.. (12) But.. uh.. I'm sorry for the indiscreet question, how much will your position give you?— (13) eight hundred rubles..— (14) pf!. (15) there is not enough for tobacco..- (16)Of course, for a comfortable life in St. Petersburg, this is not enough, but in addition, I am a secretary in the board of the Ugaro-Rowdy railway.. (17) that gives me fifteen hundred..- (18) Yeah, in that case, of course.. Dolbonosov interrupted, and something like a glow spread over his face.- (19) By the way, my dear fellow, how did you meet the owner of this house?— (20) Very simply, I met him at State Secretary Lodkin's. (By A. P. Chekhov*)
(1) В одном лесу жила-была одна маленька: (1) In one forest there lived a little squirrel. (2) She had a cozy hollow in a tall tree. (3) This tree was the tallest in the forest, and the squirrel was proud of it. (4) The squirrel was very thrifty, all her thoughts were only about making as many supplies as possible. (5) In addition, the squirrel was very economical, so she tried not to eat much, and someone else even more so never got anything from her. (6) Sometimes those wretched animals came to her, whose misfortune had befallen them, and they were left without food for the whole winter. (7) When they heard about Belochka's rich supplies, they came to beg her for a nut, but it was all to no avail, and they only heard in response: "and i'll soon have nothing to eat myself if i give everyone my own supplies." (8) It was better to stock up in the summer, and not to loaf all day. (9) Get out of here! (10) You will get nothing from me!
\"(1) В апреле в нью-йоркском музее Метр: "(1) In April, the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York will open an exhibition of a collection of works by Pablo Picasso, according to the website Broadwayworld.com (2) The exhibition, which runs from April 27 to August 1, will feature 300 works by the artist. (3) The collection owned by the Metropolitan Museum of Art will be displayed in its entirety for the first time. (4) Visitors will be able to see paintings, drawings, sculptures and ceramics related to all periods of Picasso's work. (5) The exhibition will feature both famous paintings (for example, the portrait of Gertrude Stein) and little-known works by the artist. (6) Visitors will also be able to see the "Actor" painting, which was damaged in early 2010. (7) The canvas has already been restored. (8) On the eve of the exhibition, all the exhibits of the collection are not only carefully restored, but also examined. (9) In particular, the use of X-rays allows you to understand how the work on the picture went. (10) At the exhibition, visitors will be told about the discoveries made. (11) In February 2010, an exhibition of works by Picasso opened at the Pushkin Museum in Moscow. (12) The collection of the Paris Museum of the artist was brought to the Russian capital. (13) The exhibition features more than 240 paintings, prints, drawings, sculptures and ceramics. (14) The exhibition can be visited until May 23."
\"(1) Губернатор Астраханской области Ал: "(1) The Governor of the Astrakhan region, Alexander Zhilkin, announced a reward in the amount of 1 million rubles for information about people who committed two attacks on policemen in Astrakhan. (2) This was reported on August 3 by the Interfax news agency. (3) The press service of the governor told reporters that the head of the region decided to announce the award after visiting the wounded police officer Albina Aishuakova in the hospital. (4) Informants are guaranteed anonymity. (5) On the night of July 27, Aishuakova and her partner Nikolai Lidzhiev were patrolling the Bratsk Garden in Astrakhan. (6) The police wanted to check the documents of three suspicious people, but they fired at them and wounded them with knives. (7) Lidzhiev was killed, Aishuakova was hospitalized. (8) On 28 July, police searching for the attackers noticed three people hiding under an overpass over the railway tracks. (9) When the policemen tried to approach, these people opened fire. (10) Three policemen were injured, and the bandits were able to escape. (11) According to investigators, both attacks were committed by the same gang. (12) From the words of the injured policemen, as well as from the video surveillance cameras from the Bratsk Garden, it was possible to make a description of their appearance. (13) All the criminals are unshaven and dressed in black clothes. (14) One of them is an Asian with rotten teeth, the second is a Caucasian with a thin build, and the third is a sloppily dressed Slavic."
(1) Итальянский актёр Рафаэль Шумахер, п: (1) The Italian actor Raphael Schumacher allegedly attempted a real suicide on stage during the performance. (2) About this on Tuesday, February 2, writes the Daily Mail. (3) The victim was taken to the hospital in a coma. (4) The play "Mirages" was performed at the Lux Theatre in Pisa. (5) The play provided for a scene of the hero's suicide. (6) In the author's version, it was assumed that he would shoot himself. (7) Schumacher, who plays this role, on his own initiative proposed to replace the method of suicide by hanging. (8) The actor was saved thanks to the vigilance of one of the spectators who has a medical education. (9) He noticed that the convulsions of the hanged hero were very similar to the real ones. (10) According to preliminary data of the investigation, the fake box on which the actor was supposed to stand, portraying the hanged man, was removed. (11) In addition, the loop had to be false, and among the props there was a safety spar that would support the actor's body. (12) For reasons not yet established, the loop turned out to be real, and there was no insurance. (13) Schumacher did not leave a suicide note. (14) His mother, a resident of the city of Como in northern Italy, believes that her son had no reason to take his own life. (15) According to her, the young man recently broke up with a loved one and lost his father, but has already reconciled to both losses.
(1) Фануччи — гангстер, вымогающий деньг: (1) Fanucci, a gangster who extorts money from shopkeepers, puts his nephew in Vito's place, leaving Vito without a job, and Vito is forced to join his friend Clemenza and his accomplice Tessio, who raid trucks with silk dresses — otherwise his family will starve to death. (2) When Fanucci demands his share of the money raised from this, Vito, having carefully calculated everything, kills him in cold blood. (3) This makes Vito a respected person in the neighborhood. (4) Fanucci's clientele passes to him. (5) Eventually he and his friend Genco Abbandando set up a trading house for the importation of olive oil. (6) Shopkeepers who do not want to stock up on their oil are engaged in Clemenza and Tessio — warehouses are burning, people are dying... (7) During the prohibition period, under the cover of the trading house Vito is engaged in smuggling alcohol, after the abolition of prohibition, he goes to gambling. (8) More and more people work for him, and Vito Corleone provides everyone with a comfortable life and protection from the police. (9) The word "don" is added to his name, and he is respectfully called the Godfather. (10) As time goes on, Corleone already has four children, and Tom Hagen, an orphan waif, is being raised in their family. (11) Sonny starts working for his father at the age of sixteen, first as a bodyguard, then as the commander of one of the armed groups of the mafia, along with Clemenza and Tessio. (12) Later, Freddie and Tom enter the family business.
(1) Затем Добролюбов приходит к определе: (1) Dobrolyubov then comes to define Ostrovsky's plays as a whole as "plays of life": "We want to say that he always has the general situation of life in the foreground. (2) He does not punish either the villain or the victim. (3) You see that their position dominates them, and you only blame them for not showing enough energy to get out of it. (4) And that is why we do not dare to consider unnecessary and superfluous those persons of Ostrovsky's plays who do not directly participate in the intrigue. (5) From our point of view, these persons are as necessary for the play as the main ones: they show us the situation in which the action is performed, draw the position that determines the meaning of the main characters of the play." (6) In "Thunderstorm", the need for "unnecessary" persons (minor and episodic characters) is particularly visible. (7) Bowker analyzes replicas of Pelosi, Glasha, Wild, Curley, Kuligin, etc. (8) the author analyzes the internal state of the characters "the dark Kingdom": "all somehow restless, not good for them. (9) in Addition to them, without asking them, grew another life, with other principles, and although not visible properly, but sends bad vision the dark tyranny of tyrants. (10) And Kabanova is very seriously upset about the future of the old order, with which she has outlived her age. (11) She foresees the end of them, tries to maintain their significance, but already feels that there is no previous respect for them and that they will be abandoned at the first opportunity."
(1)Счастливая, счастливая, невозвратимая: (1)Happy, happy, irrevocable time of childhood! (2)How not to love, not to cherish the memories of her? (3)these memories refresh, elevate my soul and serve as a source of the best pleasures for me ...(4)After you had had enough, you would sit at the tea table, on your high chair. (5)It's late, you've had your evening cup of milk and sugar, sleep closes your eyes, but you don't move, you sit and listen. (6)Maman speaks to someone, and the sounds of her voice are so sweet, so welcoming. (7) These sounds alone speak so much to my heart! (8)I stare at her face with my sleep-dazed eyes, and suddenly she's all small, small-her face is no bigger than a button. (9)But I can still see it clearly: I can see her smile at me. (10)I like to see her so tiny. (11)I narrow my eyes even more, and it becomes even smaller. (12) But I moved – and the charm broke. (13)I narrow my eyes, turn around, try my best to resume it, but in vain. (14)I get up, climb up with my feet and snuggle down on the chair.- (15)You'll fall asleep again, Nikolenka, "Maman says to me," you'd better go upstairs.")I don't want to sleep, maman, " you will answer her, and vague but sweet dreams fill your imagination, a healthy child's sleep closes your eyelids, and in a minute you will forget yourself and sleep until you wake up. (17)I Feel, sometimes, proconco that someone's gentle hand touching you; one touch know her and even in her sleep involuntarily grabbed the hand, and a deep, deep kiss on her lips. (18)Everyone has already gone; one candle is burning in the drawing-room; Maman said she would wake me herself. (19)It was she who sat down on the chair on which I was sleeping, ran her wonderful soft hand through my hair, and a sweet familiar voice sounded in my ear: "Get up, my darling: it's time to go to bed." (20) I do not move, but I kiss her hand even more firmly (According to L. N. Tolstoy)

(1) Точно так же и с работой. (2) Исполн: (1) It is the same with work. (2) The fulfillment of duty brings joy, a sense of satisfaction, and if this is not the case, then something is wrong with the person, he is not brought up correctly, he does not understand life correctly. (3) Learning with passion is the first step to a future responsible, serious life full of meaning and joy. (4) The ability to work with love on any machine, the ability to engage in any necessary and important business with passion, the ability to seek and find interest in it — this property of character can be brought up in yourself. (5) Can all school subjects be interesting? (6) They can! (7) It is easier for each person to get carried away with some subjects, but in order to love others, certain efforts are required. (8) a cultured person teaches himself to treat all subjects creatively, enthusiastically, with respect. (9) He does not allow himself to do any work with boredom. (10) Sometimes they say: "What will happen if a person from childhood gets used to doing only interesting things for him?" (11) But who calls for this? (12) Teaching with passion is not teaching with entertainment at all. (13) The school is not a circus, it cannot entertain, it should not do so. (14) The school gives knowledge in the system, this is its main value, and therefore it cannot choose only what is interesting: no teaching will work. (15) Precisely because school does not entertain and does not give you a choice, studying at school with passion means cultivating a sense of duty and learning to do duty willingly, creatively. (16) But if the reader is so curious that he would still like to get an exact answer to the question "Why study?", then it is best to quote the words of the outstanding teacher Vasily Alexandrovich Sukhomlinsky. (17) Let us think about them, this is one of the most important "central" thoughts. (18) Everyone will be able to prove its truth for himself: A person should learn because he is a person. (By S. L. Soloveitchik)
(1) Любовь – трудная душевная работа, её: (1) Love is a difficult mental work, not everyone can master it. (2) but everyone dreams of it, seeks it. (3) what are we looking for in love? (4) we seek in it an escape from loneliness, a spiritual support. (5) It is important for us to know that everything that happens to us, everything that concerns us, is important and dear to a loving person. (6) And on the other hand, this person needs us, our care, our help, our understanding. (7) friends – even the closest ones-can only love us, and we are looking for someone who will share our life, with whom we will share not only joy, but also pain, and resentment... (8) but when love is born, how to raise it so that it survives? (9) Than to keep yourself than to keep the one you love to remain a single among all women, as the rose of the Little Prince left one in the garden, where there were five thousand of these same roses? (10) Many years ago, when I was a teenager, a middle-aged woman told me her secret: to win the love is easy, it's hard to hold her back. (11) Then I could not understand the worldly wisdom of this secret: I saw something shameful in the word "hold". (12) I read Pushkin: "Who can hold love?" and Blok: "Oh yes, love is free as a bird." (13) But in fact there are, there are secrets and laws of love, and Saint-Exupery was one of those who know these secrets. (14) When the Little Prince first began his journey, he visited the planet where the old king lived. (15) Seeing that his guest was tired and yawning, the ruler was not offended, but... ordered him to yawn. (16) "Everyone should be asked what he can give: the power must be reasonable," said the king. (17) In our youth, we do not think about the limits of our power over the beloved and loving person and very often violate the wise law of the old king: "power must be reasonable." (18) Young wives, yesterday's girls, feeling the ring on their finger – a symbol of absolute power – suddenly begin to demand from the dumbfounded husbands no less than the famous old woman demanded from the goldfish. (19) But the main and indisputable law of love is its voluntary nature: I am standing here, under your windows, not because you ordered me, but because I cannot do otherwise. (20) and from another position: I make you soup and iron your shirts, because I enjoy it. (By N. Dolinina)

\"(1) В Казахстане завершился суд по иск: "(1) In Kazakhstan, the court has ended on the claim of singer Aidos Sagat to the supermarket chain "Rakhmet", which used his song in a commercial without permission. (2) The Court, as reported by the CPC TV channel, recognized the plaintiff's rightness. (3) However, the amount of compensation that the entrepreneurs were obliged to pay was much less than what the executor demanded. (4) The trial in this case began in September. (5) Sagat, the leader of the ethno-pop group "Urker", demanded about 74.5 million tenge (about 500 thousand dollars) from entrepreneurs. (6) The basis for the claim was that a fragment of his song "Nauryz"was used in the commercial. (7) The defendant's representative, Stanislav Govral, in response to the claims stated that the commercial "popularized" the singer. (8)" This is good for the author, and it turns out that we also get a good amount, " he said. (9) Nevertheless, the entrepreneurs were still ready to pay Sagat compensation, but they considered the amount claimed by him too high. (10) The court eventually awarded Sagat compensation of half a million tenge (about $ 3.3 thousand). (11) The defendants were satisfied with this decision. (12) This is the amount they offered the singer before the trial. (13) The plaintiff's representative, for his part, assessed the decision as an example of the fact that the author can defend his rights in court "and get some money". (14) At the same time, the lawyer noted that "so far we can not compare in terms of compensation with world performers.""

(1) Почему-то многие современные эстрадн: (1) For some reason, many modern pop "stars" are particularly happy to talk about how bad they were at school. (2) Someone was reprimanded for hooliganism, someone was left for the second year, someone brought teachers to a fainting state with their mind-blowing hairstyles... (3) You can treat such revelations of our "stars" in different ways: some of these stories about a mischievous childhood lead to emotion, others begin to grumble that today the way to the stage is open only to mediocre and ignorant people. (4) But most of all, the reaction of teenagers is worrying. (5) they have a strong belief that the shortest path to fame lies through the children's room of the police. (6) They take everything at face value. (7) They do not always understand that stories about a "crazy" childhood, when the future "star" struck everyone around her with her exotic originality, are just a stage legend, something like a concert costume that distinguishes an artist from an ordinary person. (8) A teenager does not just perceive information, he actively transforms it. (9) This information becomes the basis for his life program, for developing ways and means to achieve the goal. (10) This is why a person who broadcasts something to a multi-million audience must have a high sense of responsibility. (11) Is he actually expressing his thoughts, or is he unconsciously continuing the stage act and saying what his fans expect him to say? (12) Look: I am "my own", the same as everyone else. (13) Hence the ironically condescending attitude to education, and the flirtatious ernichanie: "Learning is light, and ignorance is a pleasant twilight", and haughty self-love. (14) but the transmission ended. (15) What remained in the souls of those who listened to the artist? (16) What seeds did he sow in trusting hearts? (17) Who did he make better?(18) Who did he send on the path of creative creation? (19) When a young journalist asked a well-known DJ these questions, he simply snorted: fuck you, I'm not for this at all... (20) And in this perplexed indignation of the "pop star" her civic immaturity, her human "lack of education"is manifested. (according to I. Gontsov)

(1) Музей Гуггенхайма в Абу-Даби предста: (1) The Guggenheim Museum in Abu Dhabi will present its collection, The New York Times reports. (2) The exhibition "Looking through the Light: Selected Exhibits from the Guggenheim Abu Dhabi Collection" will open at the Manarat Al-Saadiyat Exhibition Center on November 5, 2014. (3) The exhibition will feature 16 exhibits united by the idea of light. (4) The exhibition will be divided into thematic sections dedicated to different types of light — reflected, celestial, transcendental and others. (5) According to the curators, they chose light as the theme of the exhibition because it is an art object, regardless of time and culture. (6) In support of the Abu Dhabi exhibition, two works from the Guggenheim's main collection will be brought from New York. (7) The Guggenheim Museum's Arabic branch building, designed by Frank Gehry, will be built by 2017 on Saadiyat Island. (8) While only the foundation of the museum is ready, its curators have already managed to collect a significant collection of 250 works of art created since 1960. (9) several major museums are planned to open in the "cultural quarter" of saadiyat island. (10) The buildings of the Paris Louvre branch and the Sheikh Zayed National Museum are under construction, designed by Norman Foster. (11) Both museums have already presented their collections in Manarat al-Saadiyat. (12) The Solomon Guggenheim Museum is one of the largest museums of modern art in the world, named after the founder, a famous American philanthropist. (13) Currently, four branches of the museum are open in the United States and Europe. (14) Four more branches are under construction or are at the design stage.
(1) A man named Joel Keiro comes to see Spade. (2) He is trying to recover a missing item that he believes Spade may have. (1) Премьер-министр Японии Юкио Хатояма: (1) Japanese Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama has appointed Naoto Kan as the country's new finance minister, Bloomberg reports. (2) The former head of the department, 77-year-old Hirohisa Fujii, resigned for health reasons. (3) On December 28, 2009, Fujii was hospitalized due to high blood pressure after several weeks of hard work on the country's budget. (4) He later submitted his resignation, but initially Hatoyama did not grant his subordinate's request. (5) Naoto Kan previously headed the now-ruling Democratic Party of Japan. (6) He served for a time as Minister of Health in the coalition Government of the 1990s. (7) Immediately prior to his appointment, he was Fujiya's deputy in the Ministry. (8) Kang received the post of minister in a situation where the Japanese economy continues to suffer from deflation. (9) Although economic growth has resumed in the country since the second quarter of 2009, the likelihood of a second consecutive recession remains high. (10) One of Kahn's tasks will be to combat uncontrolled growth in public spending. (11) The country's budget for 2010 showed a record deficit. (12) At the same time, the total amount of public debt is approaching 200 percent, which is significantly more than in any other developed country. (13) Prior to Fujiya, the Cabinet of the Minister of Finance was occupied by Seichi Nakagawa, who resigned in early 2009 after being caught in public drunkenness. (14) In the fall of 2009, Nakagawa, 56, was found dead at his home. (15) The circumstances of his death are not known.
(1) На грязи, на вонючей сырой соломе, п: (1) On the mud, on the stinking damp straw, under the awning of a dilapidated barn, hastily turned into a military military hospital, in a ruined Bulgarian village – for more than two weeks she died of typhus. (2) She was unconscious – and not a single doctor even looked at her; the sick soldiers, whom she nursed while she was still able to stand, rose in turn from their infected lairs to bring to her parched lips a few drops of water in the shard of a broken pot. (3) She was young and beautiful; the high society knew her; even the dignitaries inquired about her. (4) The ladies envied her, the men followed her... two or three people secretly and deeply loved her. (5) Life smiled on her; but there are smiles worse than tears. (6) A tender, gentle heart... and such strength, such a thirst for sacrifice! (7) To help those who need help... she did not know any other happiness... did not know – and did not know. (8) every other happiness has passed by. (9) But she was reconciled to this long ago – and all, burning with the fire of unquenchable faith, gave herself up to the service of her neighbors. (10) What treasured treasures she buried there, in the depths of her soul, in her very hiding place, no one ever knew – and now, of course, no one will know. (11) And why? (12) The sacrifice is made... the deed is done. (13) But it is sad to think that no one has said thank you even to her corpse – even though she herself was ashamed and shunned all thanks. (14) Let not her sweet shadow be offended by this late flower, which I dare to lay on her grave!

(10) He informs the gods that soon the people will gather at the drinking house "Hand" for a fist fight.
