(1) Владелице парикмахерской из Норвегии: (1) The owner of a barbershop from Norway, who kicked out a visitor in a hijab, faces six months in prison. (2) On Tuesday, September 6, reports The Independent. (3) As the publication clarifies, in October 2015, 47-year-old Mereta Hodne refused to dye the hair of 24-year-old Malika Bayan and said that she did not want to see "this evil" in her salon. (4) she explained her action on tv2. (5) "i am afraid of hijabs — it is a totalitarian symbol that symbolizes that i should be killed — and therefore it is strange to expect good service from me," khodne explained. (6) She also noted that women wearing hijab hide their hair from men. (7) Since her salon is visited by clients of both sexes to serve a Muslim woman, she would have to ask the men to leave. (8) From her point of view, this would be discrimination. (9) Hodneh stated that Islam preaches evil and the hijab is as much a symbol of this destructive ideology as the swastika is a symbol of Nazism. (10) The TV channel also gave the floor to the injured Muslim woman. (11) " It is sad that she treats people in a free country like this. (12) Norway is my country. (13) Hodne says that Islam suppresses women, but it is she who suppresses me," Bayan said. (14) Similar cases sometimes occur in countries facing a massive influx of migrants. (15) On August 29, in France, the owner of a Michelin — starred restaurant expelled two Muslim women from the hall, because he considers all followers of Islam terrorists.
(1) Решив непременно совершить выдающийс: (1) Determined to perform an outstanding feat, Malone goes to the editor of the "Latest News" department with a request to give him an assignment involving "adventures and dangers". (2) After thinking about it, the editor suggests that Malone expose a "charlatan, a modern Munchausen" and sends the journalist to Professor George Edward Challenger. (3) Some time ago, a professor brought back evidence from South America confirming that prehistoric animals still exist. (4) The scientific community recognized this evidence as falsified, which angered Challenger terribly. (5) Since then, the professor has fiercely attacked anyone who crosses the threshold of his house. (6) Challenger especially hates journalists. (7) Introducing himself as an aspiring naturalist, Malone sends the professor a letter from the address of the journal "Nature", in which he asks for a meeting. (8) Soon a reply letter arrives with an invitation, and Malone goes to Challenger. (9) The professor, a man of small stature with very powerful shoulders, a majestic bearing, a huge head, a low, booming voice and a square blue-black beard, very quickly exposes the imaginary naturalist. (10) There is a fight between him and Malone. (11) The case goes to the police, but the journalist refuses to charge Challenger. (12) Seeing in the behavior of the journalist "some signs of integrity", the professor changes his anger to mercy and shows the evidence he brought from the Amazon.
(1) Когда девушка уходит с балкона, Хрис: (1) When the girl leaves the balcony, Christian-Theodore guesses that his companion was a princess. (2) He wants to continue the conversation, and he half-jokingly turns to his shadow lying at his feet, suggesting that she go to the stranger instead of him and tell him about his love. (3) Suddenly, the shadow separates and dives into the loosely closed door of the adjacent balcony. (4) the scientist becomes ill. (5) Annunziata, running in, notices that the guest no longer has a shadow, which is a bad sign. (6) She runs after the doctor. (7) Her father Pietro advises not to tell anyone about what happened. But everyone in town knows how to eavesdrop. (8) so the journalist caesar borgia, who entered the room, finds out that he is fully aware of the conversation between christian theodore and the girl. (9) both he and pietro are sure that it is a princess, and do not want her to marry a stranger. (10) according to pietro, it is necessary to find the escaped shadow, which, being the complete opposite of its owner, will help prevent the wedding. (11) annunziata is full of anxiety for the future of the young man, as she secretly already loves him.
(1) Гремяченцы позажиточней в колхоз стр: (1) Gremyachinsky prosperous in the farm were not all. (2) Dissatisfied with the authorities secretly gathered to discuss the situation. (3) among them were the middle peasants, and even some of the poor, nikita khoprov, for example, who was blackmailed by the fact that he was for some time in the punitive detachment of the whites. (4) But the offer Ostroumova to participate in the armed uprising of the Chopra refused. (5) it is better for him to inform on himself. (8) Ostrovnov, Polovtsev and the son of the dispossessed, the first village beauty and harmonica player Timofey Ragged, participated in this. (9) The investigator from the district failed to obtain any leads leading to the murder. (10) A week later, the general meeting of collective farmers approved the newcomer Davydov as chairman of the collective farm, and Ostrovnov as head of the farm. (11) Collectivization in Gremyachy was difficult: first, cattle were slaughtered cleanly, so as not to socialize them, then the seed grain was hidden from delivery.
(1) Лёжа на спине, я незаметно уснул. (2: (1) Lying on my back, I fell asleep unnoticed. (2)When I opened my eyes, the fog was lazily wandering through the trees. (3)romashov sat at a distance in his former sleepy-indifferent pose. (4)Everything seems to have been as before, but everything was already completely different. (5)He looked at me sideways, very quickly, and I immediately understood why I was so uncomfortable lying down. (6)He pulled a bag of breadcrumbs out from under my head. I said calmly. – (11)You're going to die Anyway – " he said hurriedly.)You don't need a gun. – (13)Get the gun back if you don't want to go to a field trial. (14)understand?" (15)He began to breathe briefly, quickly: - What a field court there is! (16)We are alone, and no one will know anything. (1) Какое же зеркало жизни наш язык!(2): (1) What a mirror of life is our language!(2) No, he is truly great, remaining free and truthful to this day. (3) he accepts everything, responds to everything like a Pushkin echo, moreover, he will take foreign words and teach them to produce new forms (not to clone!)(4) The only trouble is that all this sometimes goes in an ugly, illiterate mix. (5) So, in a short period of time, such familiar words as "fanatic" and "fan", and now "fan", have managed to Russify and even divide in meaning, and even religious fanaticism takes on a different color. (6)There were once "fans", even "clackers" (fr.)(7) There are also football fans (not "fans"), pop fans. (8) Even the old-fashioned "private", once rarely found in everyday speech, in the dictionary of V. Dahl interpreted as "private", "personal", "special", "home" ("private-docent", "private conversation"), we managed to nationalize so that the word "privatization" even in everyday, always sensitive to shades of language acquired a dismissive sound, becoming "prihvatizatsiey". (9) But it is known that a word, a hero, a phenomenon that has fallen into the popular language, folklore, anecdote, become "our", "own", like witty words from the films of Daneliy, Ryazanov, Gaidai. (10) There are many colors of language everywhere. (11) What a field for linguists, writers, and actors to observe!(12) But how unusual and soulful are the old words that are temporarily gone, but live on the pages of the classics and wait for bright days. (13) In no case should we turn a blind eye to the fact that, in addition to foreign words, we are also overwhelmed by criminal vocabulary. (14) Where did these "cool", "cool", "roofs", "cool"come from?(15) their source is clear. (16) But why do they flourish among quite decent young people, sound from the screen, and show off in print?(17) This conversation can be continued by anyone who cares about our language. (18) He is still " great, mighty, truthful, and free." (19) We only spoil it ourselves, forgetting that it is alive, so do not offend it with vulgarity, someone else's garbage, profanity, clerical frills, incompatible mess. (By T. Zharova*)
(1) Россиянин Дмитрий Михайленко стал об: (1) Russian Dmitry Mikhailenko won the title of champion of North America according to the World Boxing Association (WBA NABA). (2) This is reported by the Sherdog portal. (3) On Saturday, August 8, 29-year-old Mikhailenko defeated Cuban Joan Perez by technical knockout in a fight held in Indio, California. (4) At the beginning of the fight, the Russian received a cut eyebrow, but continued to fight. (5) The Cuban dominated several opening rounds, but then Mikhailenko seized the initiative. (6)In the fifth round, he badly staggered his opponent with a forehand. (7) In the eighth round, the Russian boxer hit Perez in the jaw with a left hook, stunned him and sent him to the ropes. (8) Then Mikhailenko began to finish off the opponent. (9) The referee, who saw that the Cuban was unable to defend himself, stopped the fight. (10) " He caught me a couple of times with his punches, but it wasn't a big problem," Mikhailenko said after the fight. (11) According to the athlete, he has not yet planned the next fights, as he has a sick mother in Russia who needs care. (12) The Russian boxer has 20 wins (nine by knockout) in 20 fights. (13) His opponent suffered a third defeat with 20 wins and one draw. (14) Mikhailenko competes in the welterweight category (up to 66.7 kilograms). (15) He also holds the title of European Champion according to the World Boxing Organization (WBO).
(1) Датский карикатурист Курт Вестергор: (1) Danish cartoonist Kurt Vestergaard announced his retirement from the newspaper Jyllands-Posten. (2) This is reported by AFP with reference to the statement of the artist himself. (3) According to Westergaard, he leaves the newspaper, where he worked for about 20 years, because he does not want to endanger his colleagues. (4) The 75-year-old artist also stated that he wanted to take a break from work and organize exhibitions of his work. (5) Kurt Westergaard published cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad in a newspaper in 2005, which caused a wave of discontent in the Muslim world. (6) numerous protests were held in many countries at that time, demanding that the author of the drawings be punished. (7) a bounty was placed on his head. (8) Both Vestergor and the editorial office of the newspaper where he worked repeatedly received threatening letters. (9) according to the associated press, the artist and the newspaper were attacked at least three times. (10) the Last of these occurred in january 2010. (11) A 28-year-old Somali man broke into the artist's house and tried to attack him with a bladed weapon. (12) Westergor managed to hide from the attacker and report to the police. (13) According to other sources, law enforcement officers arrived at his home after the security alarm went off. (14) As a result, the attacker was arrested. (15) After this incident, Westergaard is under police protection.
(1) Жил-был маленький медвежонок. (2) У: (1) Once upon a time there was a little bear cub. (2) he had parents: mama bear and papa bear. (8) she probably doesn't love me at all. (9) he was very upset and decided to leave home to find another mother.
